jobs.title: Android Software Development Engineer II -comiXology
jobs.content:
Android Development Engineer



ComiXology, has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before.



We are looking for an Android Development Engineer to join our mobile Android development team to help us undergo a refactor of our current Android and Kindle Fire/Fire Phone apps, and thereafter work on integration projects with Amazon’s systems and help to implement innovative consumer features. Our goal is to provide exciting, innovative and diverse work to keep both our staff and consumers engaged. We promise you will not be bored; in fact your efforts will directly impact our millions of users who rave about our products as much as we do.



What You’ll Do:

· Join a team of software engineers responsible for the design, development, and testing of the comiXology Android and Kindle apps, and participate in the design of underlying RESTful APIs

· Help define UI/UX and promote best practices within the Android ecosystem

· Take on daily challenges providing creative problem solving recommendations

· Mentor and contribute knowledge to the rest of the team and the organization

 

Who You Are and What You Do:

- 3+ years experience working with the following technologies:

- Java and the JDK

-Extensive knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

-Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

- Writing multi-threaded apps

- Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

- Application submission/provisioning process

- Debugging and analysis skills using ADB

- Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

- Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control - Git preferred

- Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change -

Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.

- Degree in computer science or equivalent degree



Would Be Great, But Not Required:

· Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

· Have worked with OpenGL or the NDK and high performance graphics code

· Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

· Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop and Amazon Mobile SDK (Kindle Fire, Fire Phone)

· Experience with protocol buffers

· You tell great jokes

· You enjoy Bagel Breakfast Wednesdays

· You have some experience developing for other mobile platforms (iOS, Windows Phone, etc.)

· You’re a fan of comics!

· Are an inspiration for innovation



About Us:

ComiXology, an Amazon.com, Inc. subsidiary (NASDAQ:AMZN), has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before. ComiXology’s Guided View reading technology transforms the comic book medium into an immersive and cinematic experience, helping comiXology become a top ten grossing iPad app in 2011 and 2012 and the top grossing non-game iPad app in 2012 and 2013. Offering the broadest library of comic book content from over 75 publishers - and independent creators as well - comiXology will not stop until everyone on the face of the planet has become a comic book fan.



comiXology is an EEO/AAP employer.

jobs.title: Senior Manager (Customer Service Delivery Experience)
jobs.content:
Amazon is seeking an experienced program leader to own critical components of the post-order customer experience. The Sr. Program Manager, Customer Service Delivery Experience will identify and charter projects that decrease customer effort, reduce costs, and raise the bar on the delivery experience for Amazon customers worldwide. The candidate will innovate new programs that delight customers, lead large scale, high visibility / high impact projects, and set the tempo for customer effort reduction worldwide.

The successful candidate will be able to:

  • Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities.
  • Effectively manage large programs, dependencies and bottlenecks, manage stakeholders, anticipate and make trade-offs, balance the business needs versus technical constraints.
  • Be successful in a delivery-focused environment and determining the right processes to make the team successful.
  • Possess excellent analytical abilities and judgment.
  • This opportunity requires excellent technical, problem solving, and communication skills. The candidate is not just a policy maker/spokesperson but drives to get things done.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 7+ years of experience in program management and leadership
  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects in parallel
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data to back up assumptions and evaluate outcomes.
  • Experience with complex problem solving and analysis using statistical methods, financial modeling, and network optimization modeling
  • Experience with design and operation of complex operating processes
  • Presentation and written communication skills are essential: clear, organized, concise with an ability to adapt to appropriate audience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Masters in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Operations Management or MBA with strong technical background, or equivalent experience
  • Experience in operational excellence and process improvement methodologies like Six Sigma and kaizen
  • Global operations experience (preferably Europe and Asia)
  • Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and analytical thinking skills are critical to success within this position
  • High attention to detail
  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Decisive and able to move with speed to implement ideas
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Directly and indirectly lead cross-functional teams
  • Ability to develop original ideas, approaches, and solutions to typical, unusual, or difficult situations or problems
  • Excellent organization skills and ability to effectively manage multiple projects

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.content:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups, to leading web companies, and Global Fortune 500 companies in across every industry vertical.

AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to create and manage catalogs of IT services that are approved for use on AWS. These IT services can include everything from virtual machine images, servers, software, and databases to complete multi-tier application architectures. AWS Service Catalog allows customers to centrally manage commonly deployed IT services, and helps achieve consistent governance and compliance requirements, while enabling users to quickly deploy only the approved IT services they need.

Would you like to be part of a team focused on changing the way customers catalog and manage the workloads and assets they have running on AWS? Do you have the business savvy and the technical background necessary to help further establish Amazon as the leader in this area for Enterprise and Public Sector customers?

AWS Service Catalog is seeking a Business Development Manager to execute, and manage business development activities across our AWS field, proserv and Consulting Partner teams. As a BD Manager for AWS Service Catalog, you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on our strategy to build mind share and broad use within a defined set of Enterprise customers and verticals, while working with technology and consulting partners to grow AWS Service Catalog adoption. Your responsibilities will include helping to define key market segments to target, while driving the necessary business and technical relationships with partners to establish new business in those markets. Enabling the business development with day-to-day interactions with partners in order to build long-term business growth. You’ll also work closely with the AWS product/service teams to help them evolve the products/services and address issues, concerns, and requests from the field as the voice of the customer.

The ideal candidate will have both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with infrastructure engineers, software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must. Ability to work in an ambiguous environment with minimal supervision is a must.

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Serve as Business Development Manager of the AWS Service Catalog Business Development team in helping to drive AWS market and technical strategy.
  • Identify, define, and execute initiatives to drive adoption of AWS Service Catalog including new and existing features by targeting specific market segments, partner types, and industry verticals.
  • Execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, service teams, legal, support, etc.).
  • Identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their business and use case.
  • Work closely with the partner ecosystem to ensure they are successful using our services, making sure they have the technical and GTM resources required.
  • Understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings for developers.
  • Understand and exploit the use of salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems.
  • Prepare and give regular business reviews to the management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers.
  • Manage customer account relationships, liaison with the legal group and Develop strategic partnerships in support of our key markets.
  • Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market.
  • Scale to grow the business.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • The right person will be technical and analytical, and possess 5+ years of business development, enterprise sales, or program/product management experience.
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as leadership skills. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations is key.
  • Prior working knowledge of IT services catalogs.
  • Experienced with account management (Enterprise, SMB and startup) and solution selling ability.
  • Some relevant technical knowledge, such as: core distributed computing concepts, fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, server technology, Linux and Windows operating systems, database systems etc.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

MBA, Computer Science, and/or Engineering/Math background highly desired; working knowledge of software development practices and data center / infrastructure / networking technologies highly desired.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer, Amazon Flex Android App
jobs.content:
Amazon Flex is a new program at Amazon that supports Prime Now in offering one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers.



Our transportation technology group is responsible for designing and implementing software that makes the delivery of these items possible in one hour or less. Our software has to take into account item, delivery associate, network and environmental constraints to provide a fast delivery experience for our end consumers.



The Amazon Flex Mobile team is looking for Android engineers to help build the next generation of Last Mile delivery experience for our delivery associates. We operate globally to support many region specific use cases and challenges such as varying network connectivity, including no connectivity (offline), performance and latency, varying devices, business complexity, Geo-fencing, real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing and optimizations and many others.



If you're passionate about Android development, want to build one of the most innovative, high performance mobile applications, this team is for you. We are just getting started, are very much in that start-up (It's Day 1) mode! This is your opportunity to get in early on a brand new product and influence the future of where it goes!

Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications.

5+ years of software development experience with the following technologies:

o Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK

o Expert knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

o Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

o Experience writing multi-threaded apps

o Expert knowledge of Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

o Experience with the application submission/provisioning process

o Expert level debugging and analysis skills using ADB



Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control

Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change



Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.



Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.



Experience with databases.



Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop



Experience with protocol buffers



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer - F/M/V/D

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo.



What will you help us create?



The Role:

As a Sr. Software Development Engineer - Cloud, you will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative consumer electronics products. You will work closely with an internal interdisciplinary team and outside partners to drive key aspects of product definition, execution, and test. You must be responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment.



The ideal candidate has current and extensive experience developing and building distributed systems and applications. The ideal candidate:



• Has in-depth expertise working with distributed systems and understands how they are deployed.

• Enjoys working side by side with partners, colleagues and teams on tough problems

• Is highly effective and thrives in a dynamic environment with multiple, changing priorities

• Knows what is important when shipping products to customers and has been through the process from start to finish

• Is comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership and never shies away from a challenge

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

• 7+ years of experience doing hands-on software development

• 7+ years of coding skills in JAVA

• 4+ years of current experience working with Distributed systems or applications.

• 3+ years of experience in REST architecture for web services

• 3+ years of Data analysis and debugging skills

 



• Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field

• Experience with working on AWS services(S3, DynamoDB, EC2).

• Strong communication and interpersonal skills

• Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility tradeoffs

• Proficiency in the tools of the trade, including a variety of modern programming languages (Java, C/C++, Python) and open-source technologies (Linux, Android, OpenGL, Eclipse)



Lab126 is part of the Amazon.com, Inc. group of companies and is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Amazon's eCommerce Services Group is looking for highly motivated web developers to join the Amazon Tax Software team to create new generation of user experience to manage the complexity of indirect tax rules & regulations across the globe. Work for the Tax Software team and get a chance to touch the full spectrum of Amazon technologies!

Web developers in eCSG tackle challenging problems in



  • Scalability: A lot of people shop here!

  • Robustness: If a core service goes down for a minute, so does the world's largest ecommerce site!

  • Latency: Load a page slowly, lose a customer!

  • Security: Customer trust is our most valuable asset!

  • Usability: A small improvement in usability at our scale means many more satisfied customers!


So if you want to stretch your web development muscles, power user experiences that drive customers to the world's largest ecommerce site, touch a wide spectrum of applications and features, and engage your entrepreneurial chops, come join our team!



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 3+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, and problem solving

  • Proficiency with Java or an equivalent OO language

  • Proficiency using modern web development technologies and techniques, including HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Responsive Design, web services, etc.



  • Experience building large-scale web applications

  • 5+ years professional experience in software or web development

  • Experience developing AJAX interfaces with AJAX libraries and frameworks (e.g. ReactJS, JQuery, AngularJS, etc.)

  • Experience with MVC frameworks, Rails or Spring desired

  • Understanding of web services technologies such as REST, SOAP, HTTP, JSON

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and agile development environment and to learn new frameworks/stacks

  • Strong customer focus, ownership, urgency, and drive

  • Passion for building a rich and innovative user experience

jobs.title: Software Development Manager - Metadata and Configuration Platform
jobs.content:
The Metadata and Configuration Platform (MCP) team is responsible for developing technologies that enable Amazon software application teams to:

  • Rapidly evolve data definitions and business rules to adapt to changing business needs;

  • Minimize operational disruptions by enabling dynamic evolution of metadata and configuration data;

  • Discover and leverage metadata across the enterprise to maximize reuse and decrease maintenance costs.


We are part of the Amazon.com e-commerce foundational technology team, which means our software powers one of the largest e-commerce engines in the world. If you want to be part of a team that makes a difference on a large scale, this is it.



We are looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive, and experienced Software Development Manager (SDM) to refine and drive the direction for the metadata and configuration management services, libraries, and tooling. The candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, understands the metadata modeling space, and will help us help the business innovate quickly and safely.



As the manager for the team you will be responsible for understanding the needs of our existing customer base (currently hundreds of internal customers) and what new features we need to build to attract new customers (up to thousands). You will be responsible for defining the strategy and roadmap for our technologies as required to deliver on our mission both in the short and long term. To do this, you will lead a team of engineers to perform cost-benefit analyses to determine the approaches that yield the maximum value for the minimal investment, evaluate the alternatives, and plan and drive the delivery of improvements. You will be responsible for hiring and providing career development for your team.



Successful candidates will have a proven track record of leading teams to develop highly distributed systems using Agile and incremental delivery methods. You will also be responsible for ensuring the ongoing operations of the services that your team builds.


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

  • 7+ years of relevant engineering experience

  • 2+ years people management experience

  • Experience with OOD and object oriented languages

  • Experience managing teams through the entire development, deployment, and operations lifecycle

  • Agile project management experience

  • Experience providing career development to a team of engineers

  • Ability to build high-performance teams




  • Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered incrementally to customers

  • Deep hands-on technical expertise: knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong business and technical vision

  • Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

  • Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions

jobs.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed desktop computing service in the cloud. Amazon WorkSpaces allows customers to easily provision cloud-based desktops that allow end-users to access the documents, applications and resources they need with the device of their choice, including laptops, iPad, Kindle Fire, Android tablets, and zero clients. With a few clicks in the AWS Management Console, customers can provision a high-quality cloud desktop experience for any number of users at a cost that is highly competitive with traditional desktops and half the cost of most virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solutions.

To If you like to work in massively scalable distributed systems, networking protocols for real time presentation remoting and opportunities to work on multiple client technologies then join our team to help build Amazon's Desktop-As-A-Service offering! We aim to bring a desktop experience to modern form factors (mobile, desktop) with a native experience for end-users, and a simple and cost-effective way to provision and manage these desktops for IT administrators, leveraging world’s largest public cloud!



As a member of Workspace development team, you will have opportunities to work on several technology area from Workspace core service that provisions desktops, provides secure access to the provisioned desktops, develop and optimize network protocols for display and IO remoting and client software on IOS, Android and Windows, on various form factors. You will also build functionality that allows admins to scale their fleet, and manage it effectively. You will work on challenges such as reducing the time it takes to provision virtual desktops, enhance the management capabilities of the console while maintaining its simplicity, building internal and external APIs, and building tools for data collection, analysis and monitoring to improve customer experience and smooth operation. From a customer point of view, it is an opportunity to delight our customers in both experience and simplicity. From an engineering perspective, it is a great opportunity to build distributed systems, using industry leading AWS constructs such as EC2, EBS,


  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

  • 8+ years of industry experience managing large scale software application products.

  • The ability to dive deep to understand all layers of a web services technology stack

  • Work experience with project management tools.



Experience building client applications for mobile and desktop environments.

jobs.title: WDE II - AWS Website
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Our team builds and runs the suite of systems powering http://aws.amazon.com/. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.


You will find challenges at AWS to keep you interested and growing. You will contribute rich JavaScript, HTML, and CSS components that simplify content authoring and enable rich presentation. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

So, practically, what does it take? What do you need to know?

jobs.title: Amazon Web Services, Marketing, Sr. Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Computing is moving aggressively into the cloud and this is your chance to help make it happen. Join us as we create the premier website for all users of Amazon Web Services. We obsess over our customers and we want every detail of our site -http://aws.amazon.com - to ooze with that obsession. Walk through our site and ask yourself



  • What could we do better so that every user has a helpful adventure?

  • What do we need to add so that each user is better served?

  • What should we change so that our obsession is front and center?


If you’re brimming with ideas, then we should talk.

You will find the challenges at Amazon to keep you interested and growing. You will move seamlessly between writing efficient code that scales (without bugs) and helping stakeholders see what’s possible. You will actively mentor junior engineers through code and design reviews, and by personally modeling the highest standards. You will calmly and quickly create elegant solutions to difficult problems. You will know when more engineering is necessary and when to stop. You will know the value of shipping and the importance of getting the code right. You will value testing, monitoring, and measuring. And, above all, you will obsess over customers.

jobs.title: CMS Engineer
jobs.content: In AWS marketing we do things big. https://aws.amazon.com has thousands of pages being updated by hundreds authors being translated into a dozen languages. Our goal in engineering is to facilitate the creative, iterative, and data driven creation of content. As a CMS engineer, you will be helping to translate the experimental A/B tested HTML, JS, and CSS into the CMS framework so the experiment can be made big. You’ll need to look and think deep to tease out the similarities between multiple requests so you can be the right kind of lazy, write it once, use it often.

jobs.title: Website Pricing TPM, AWS Marketing
jobs.content:
The AWS Marketing team is responsible for providing a first class web experience for our customers looking to find out more about our services. Every visitor to aws.amazon.com is our customer and it’s our team’s job to build and iterate (and iterate again) on a world-class website that raises the bar. Every member of our team strives to be as innovative and agile in the field of web design and development as AWS products are in the field of cloud computing.


As a Pricing TPM for AWS Marketing, you will be responsible for the overall program of displaying pricing data on our public facing web properties. In this role, you will drive and deliver multiple complex pricing related projects. You will provide project leadership, anticipate bottlenecks, mitigate project risks, quantify the impact of making trade-offs, and balance business needs against technical constraints. You will provide technical leadership that gets software applications built and integrated into the aws.amazon.com ecosystem. You will work closely with stakeholders across various design, software and business teams to identify and drive innovative solutions that achieve business goals and align with long term product roadmaps. You will also work both our internal engineering teams and manage external vendors to build out these solutions with a focus on high operational excellence.


A successful candidate will be well versed in what it takes to take a large scale, high traffic, high impact marketing website to the next level. This role requires having a proven track record in delivering website projects plus excellent problem solving, project management, and communication skills.


Responsibilities:



  • Be a guardian of world-class customer experience for your deliverables: continually raise the bar on functionality, flow, consistency, usability, and simplicity

  • Manage and deliver web marketing projects from inception to launch to maintenance

  • Build and maintain a complete project schedule, make it constantly visible to management and key stakeholders, and drive projects through to completion

  • Act as the technical interface between the business and the software development/web design teams. Understand the product and know the right questions and whom to ask.

  • Run in front of the software development team, helping define user stories, research appropriate technical solutions, and provide guidance to the team regarding architecture, design, and priorities

  • Translate feature requests into technical specifications and influence design and architectural decisions

  • Work with the business to scope technical software projects with an understanding of website operations (maintenance, deployments, analytics)

  • Help make the right feature trade-offs to ship software without compromising customer experience or business relevance

  • Engage with many teams across the company, evangelizing the team and your project, building relationships and helping identify existing components and technologies that can be leveraged to deliver on our goals

  • Represent the technical team and deliverables to senior leadership across the company

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - DevOps focus - Bangkok
jobs.content:
A life less ordinary.

We're not just talking about the location; as Asia's fastest growing ecommerce hotel booking platform and the biggest pure Tech company in Thailand, you'll use every last ounce of your Engineering talent at Agoda!

The Job

We're looking for Full Stack Developers with a passion for DevOps, build and deployment. If you're a Developer who likes to manage their own deployments you've come to the right place. We're looking to build our capability in this area and need your help.

In essence you'll be responsible for the complete scope, design, build and testing of products and features for one of Asia's fastest growing e-commerce websites. As a part of the Agoda .net Engineering team, you will be exposed to numerous innovative technologies in the fields of data-processing, big data, efficient data storage structures, recommender systems / machine learning, natural language processing, and many more. Whichever technology we work with, it must operate at the performance needs of a hyper-scale infrastructure operating at thousands of requests per second.

You'll be involved in the technical stuff, coding, hands-on but also working with design patterns, complex solutions design, implementation, devops, deployment, testing and much more. We're highly scalable and performance driven in our approach and our website is a best in class ecommerce solution that is highly user-centric and customer driven.

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand!

With relocation support and visa sponsorship available we've got you covered, leaving you free to look forward to an amazing new experience!

About You.

Our team structures are pretty flat so when we say that we're a big company operating as a start-up, we mean it. You'll need bags of initiative, but you'll also have experience of building for scalability, reliability and performance. A full-stack developer knows what's under the bonnet, and you're no different.

You may well have worked on a raft of different projects before but you'll have the same enquiring mind and hunger for knowledge and to make things better for the end user.
  • You have Architect-level expertise in solution design but also love to code!
  • 'Hands-on' DevOps expertise is highly desirable e.g. AWS, Amazon Route 53, Cloud Formation, elastic beanstalk, Azure, terraform, octopus, infrastructure as code or others
  • You're a master in either C# .net , Java or other OOP language
  • You have a deep level of Engineering experience through the stack and have touched on many elements that translate well to full e-commerce software architecture
  • You take full ownership of whatever you're building, and see it through to completion
  • You're confident in your ability
  • And passionate about your work (but not afraid to let others in to help too)
  • Your expertise spans the full SDLC thru' concept, design, build, test (automation if poss) and deployment
  • Your natural Engineering-mindset considers problem, solution and alternative in equal measure
  • The end user is at the heart of what you do, as is the commercial value to Agoda
  • You have a progressive outlook - TDD, BDD, Agile are second nature to you
  • You love working in a Change environment with fewer formal processes
  • Your experience will certainly be strong in backend Engineering primarily, ideally with decent frontend expertise to help things along
  • Able and willing to test your own work and create automated tests along the way


Interested?

Get in touch and apply now!

This exciting opportunity is full-time, permanent based in Bangkok, Thailand!

Visa sponsorship available.

jobs.title: Backend Team - Engineer - Asia's Leading OTA
jobs.content:
Overview:

For our rapidly growing IT organization, we are looking for Software Engineers from many different experiences and qualifications to strengthen our teams.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn't just about developing software. It's about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires. If you find yourself frequently pondering how to do things faster and better, how technology could interact, how a new technology would help you to do new things or how a customer would use your products, then Agoda is the right place for you.

Responsibilities:

We expect our engineers to think about the full life cycle of our products, and not just about a single piece of code. From customer requirements, technology selection to coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing. You might call yourself "full stack" or you might consider yourself an expert in a certain field, but you will have a keen interest in how the different systems work together.



Qualifications:

Some of the technologies that we work with:
  • Scala, C# or Java. You might have experience in other languages but are confident you can learn.
  • Frontend technologies like Mocha, SAS and frameworks like Angular and Bootstrap (in addition to HTML and Javascript, of course).
  • Data platforms like SQL, Cassandra or Hadoop. You understand that different applications have different data requirements.
  • Core engineering infrastructure tools like Git for source control, Jenkins for Continuous Integration and Puppet for deployment.




Please get in touch if you are experienced in any of the above technologies (note - we are not looking for you to have them all). We are interested in speaking to persons of any level from junior candidates to experts in their field.

Please apply now and we will tell you all about the numerous projects we currently have on the go!

We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Senior Web Security Engineer
jobs.content:
About Agoda

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Responsibilities:

Working in a fast pace DevOp environment where code change happens at a rapid speed and where it is paramount to control security testing into a continuous deployment/integration flow.

Qualifications:

The successful candidate will possess Penetration Testing, Information Security, Vulnerability Assessment, Application Security, Web Application Security, Security, Vulnerability Management, CEH, Ethical Hacker, Windows, PowerShell experience and qualification.

You will also have extensive experience using tools and methodologies used to perform cyber security analysis and interpretation, strong understanding of cyber threat including current and emerging threat vectors, extensive knowledge of cyber security and/or information security with previous experience of undertaking analysis in support of cyber threats and incidents.

To be considered for the Senior Web Security Engineer (Ethical Hacker) role you MUST possess the following attributes:
  • Penetration Testing
  • Information Security
  • Application Security / Web Application Security
  • Vulnerability Management
  • CEH - Certified Ethical Hacker
  • Windows / Power shell
  • Certification/Experience: 5yrs minimum experience with CISSP (Desirable), CEH (Mandatory), OWASP (Mandatory), GIAC (Preferred)




For those not currently living in Thailand there is a full relocation and visa sponsorship scheme.

jobs.title: Software Developers - Bangkok - Finance IT Development
jobs.content:
Agoda, Asia's Leading OTA (Online Travel Agent) is looking for top talent to relocate to Bangkok, Thailand - full visa and relocation provided.

Overview:


Are you:
  • An application developer with a background in finance?
  • Open to working abroad?
  • Strong technically and hungry to learn new tools, languages and technologies?
  • Looking to work for a fast-paced internet company?
  • Based in Bangkok or interested in moving here?


About Agoda

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a start-up and the capital to make things happen. We love innovation and putting new technologies to work to extend our lead on the competition.

Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe. We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

What's stopping you from getting in touch?


Responsibilities:


Agoda is looking for Software Developers to work on financial payment and reconciliation systems. These systems are the backbone of our company, ensuring that hotels get paid on time for each customer booking. We are currently expanding the team to create and scale these systems, and we're looking for experienced developers to come and join us.


Qualifications:


What we are looking for
  • You have 2+ years' experience under your belt developing financial or other reliability-critical applications that run in a production environment.
  • You write code that is well designed, testable and maintainable.
  • You are passionate about the craft of software development and constantly work to improve your knowledge and skills.
  • You have deep experience in one or more of C#, C++ or Java.
  • You have experience working with SQL and large data sets.
  • You have great written and spoken English communication skills, and are happy working with developers, QA and business users.


If you have any experience or interest in the following it would be useful:

- The .NET/Microsoft development ecosystem

- NoSQL and caching solutions

- Web development frameworks

- Tools such as Git, Puppet and Jenkins

What we can offer
  • Work for a profitable business with the atmosphere of a start-up.
  • Work on interesting problems with a high degree of autonomy.
  • Work as part of a team of experienced Scrum developers.
  • Competitive salary and benefits.


This is a full time position working on site in our offices in downtown Bangkok, Thailand.





We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Scala, C# or Java - Bangkok
jobs.content:
For our rapidly growing IT organization, we are looking for Software Engineers from many different experiences and qualifications to strengthen our teams.

Being a software engineer at Agoda isn't just about developing software. It's about being a center piece of the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires. If you find yourself frequently pondering how to do things faster and better, how technology could interact, how a new technology would help you to do new things or how a customer would use your products, then Agoda is the right place for you.

Responsibilities:

We expect our engineers to think about the full life cycle of our products, and not just about a single piece of code. From customer requirements, technology selection to coding standards, agile development, unit and application testing. You might call yourself "full stack" or you might consider yourself an expert in a certain field, but you will have a keen interest in how the different systems work together.

Qualifications:

Some of the technologies that we work with:
  • Scala, C# or Java. You might have experience in other languages but are confident you can learn.
  • Frontend technologies like Mocha, SAS and frameworks like Angular and Bootstrap (in addition to HTML and Javascript, of course).
  • Data platforms like SQL, Cassandra or Hadoop. You understand that different applications have different data requirements.
  • Core engineering infrastructure tools like Git for source control, Jenkins for Continuous Integration and Puppet for deployment.


Please get in touch if you are experienced in any of the above technologies (note - we are not looking for you to have them all). We are interested in speaking to persons of any level from junior candidates to experts in their field.

Please apply now and we will tell you all about the numerous projects we currently have on the go!

We are happy to receive CV from both international & local candidates as we offer relocation assistance and visa sponsorship for eligible candidates.

jobs.title: Back end Team Engineer - Data Architecture
jobs.content:
Agoda Overview:


Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. Being part of Priceline group, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. Although we are in hotel booking business, we see ourselves as an IT company where major focus is on engineering highly scalable, high performance solutions with goal of being the best on the market. In addition of being large company with enough capital to make things happen, we are start-up at heart, with flat hierarchy and ability to move very fast to react on market demands. We are achieving this by being KPI oriented and organized in SCRUM teams for maximum flexibility and efficiency.

We are looking for highly skilled engineers to join our multinational group and help us further push the boundaries of innovation and creativity. Join us and work side by side with amazing people from all over the world and directly impact experience of our customers on global level!

Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of experience in software development
  • experience and high programming skills in at least one of following languages: Scala, Java, Python or C#
  • strong problem solving skills
  • strong background in object oriented programming, understanding data structures and design patterns
  • exposure to big data
  • ability to communicate in English clearly and concisely in both written and verbal form
  • being able to debate and communicate your ideas
  • software engineering enthusiasm is a must!


Highly desirable additional skills:
  • experience in designing highly scalable solutions
  • experience with following technologies: Zookeeper, Cassandra, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Elasticsearch, Spray or alternatives
  • experience with concurrent processing
  • experience with designing/building/supporting high availability products
  • experience in software continuous integration
  • experience working in cross functional SCRUM team
  • experience in DevOps role


What we offer:
  • live and work on full-time position in Bangkok, Thailand
  • receive competitive salary and benefits
  • work on solving challenging problems on huge scale
  • learn from many experienced professionals currently working with us
  • build products that currently do not exist on the market

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Bangkok team is looking for top quality passionate engineers to build products across our next gen data platform products.

Our systems scale across multiple data centers, totaling a few million writes per second and managing petabytes of data. We deal with problems from real-time data-ingestion, replication, enrichment, storage and analytics. We are not just using Big Data technologies, we are pushing them to the edge.

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. In this competitive world of online travel agencies, finding even the slightest advantage in the data can make or break a company. That is why we put data systems in our top priorities.

While we are proud of what we built so far, there is still a long way to go to fulfill our vision of data. We are looking for people who are as excited about data technology as we are, to join the fight.

You can be part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) products across all aspects of our core data platform products.

Responsibilities:
  • Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
  • Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
  • Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks.
  • Proactive and reactive monitoring of ElasticSearch/Kafka to provide 24 x 7 uptime and availability across multiple datacenters


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
  • At least 3 years' experience working with modern systems languages
  • Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues
  • A good understanding of data architecture principles
  • Be able to attend in on-call rotation


Bonuses
  • Any experience with 'Big Data' technologies / tools
  • Strong systems administration skills in Linux
  • Strong experience in JVM languages (Java / Scala in particular)
  • Python/Perl/Go/Shell scripting skills also a plus.
  • Experience working with ElasticSearch/Kafka Architectures
  • Experience working with open source products
  • Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies.


A few of the technologies we use

ElasticSearch, Kafka, Cassandra, Sensu, Graphite, InfluxDB, Grafana, Logstash, Kibana, Python, Go.

jobs.title: Back End Team Ninja - Scala, Node.js, Python - World class OTA
jobs.content:
We are a big technology company, but this opportunity is specifically for an important role on a small team. This ambitious team is thinking every day about how to use the latest technology to build new exciting services that will be used by millions of people. We really need someone special to join us and help lead the back end development.



Work will focus on building a service that combines many different 3rd party API integrations.



You must be confident in code quality and execution, working in an agile team.



Industry knowledge and understanding of the e-commerce and B2B SaaS is a plus.



Office location - Bangkok, Thailand.



Technology you should be comfortable with or interested in learning: OpenStack, Scala, Node.js, SQL, Go, Python, RabbitMQ, Redis, REST API's



ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Implementation of API endpoints for data manipulation and processes.

  • Build and maintain core application features.

  • Write unit and integration tests.

  • Collaborate in all project planning.

  • Work with both front-end and back-end web developers.

  • Prioritize tasks and coordinate work within the team.

  • Engaging with current team to improve and optimize current code and planning practices.

  • Be prepared to lead strategic technology decisions.

  • Take responsibility for successful delivery of solutions.

  • You will also be bridging the gap between the user experience and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both.






YOU WILL BE A GREAT FIT IF…



  • You are passionate about TDD.

  • You care about both user experience and developer experience.

  • You write DRY, readable, and modular code.

  • Are interested in learning new programming languages and tools.






RECOMMENDED SKILLS (NOT 100% REQUIRED):



  • Strong experience building and improving scalable applications.

  • Experience with using ORM and MVC frameworks.

  • Experience with HTTP, WebSocket, and Message Queue protocols.

  • Experience designing and building Restful APIs using Django Rest Framework.

  • Ability to learn and integrate 3rd party API's quickly into existing applications.

  • Ability to work independently and manage projects with many moving parts.

  • Familiarity with session and authentication best practices, access control, and preventing CSRF.

  • Familiarity with how front-end frameworks work such as Angular, Backbone, React JS, etc.

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, GitHub.

  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.










This is a permanent, full time position working on-site in our offices at Central World in downtown Bangkok, Thailand. We are open to candidates from all nationalities and will help with relocation if you are not currently based here.

jobs.title: Senor NodeJS JavaScript Developer Job
jobs.content:
Senor NodeJS/JavaScript Developer - London - Immediate start - £430pd


Your new company is a innovative provider of document-centric automation solutions. Currently the most powerful document automation offering on the market for financial, legal and commercial applications.

Your new role will require you to be an experienced senior-level JavaScript developer. You will have proven experience of building high-performance, scalable, enterprise-grade applications at a commercial level.

The ideal candidate will have experience implementing enterprise authentication systems using Oauth/SAML/SSO/Active Directory. You will have commercial experience integrating an existing NodeJS SSO OAuth 2 Identity Service with client SSO systems using NodeJS. You will have 3 years+ hands-on coding experience with NodeJS JavaScript and Client-facing technical documentation experience.

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Software Engineer will help design and implement features in a cloud-based web architecture.  Must be able to participate in a highly collaborated and innovative team.  The Software Engineer is expected to be results-driven and self-motivated, and he or she should have experience with JavaScript, HTML, and software engineering principles (GR 42)

This person will design and implement web user interfaces that are functional, intuitive, and elegant.  These user interfaces will be in a single-page application that is part of a new cloud-based solution that uses Javascript, Typescript, CSS, HTML, ReST services, Java, AWS, and other emergent technologies.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work with team members to create innovative solutions to various feature requests.

  • Jump into various complex code-bases, understand them quickly, and develop features in a fast-past environment.

  • Work with stakeholders to refine the requirements for new features with an emphasis on creating a great user experience.

  • Actively participate in a highly collaborative Agile development process to meet delivery dates and other goals.

  • Demonstrate the ability to be thorough and detailed oriented in looking at all aspects of the solution including: localization, licensing, scalability, memory management, bandwidth, latency, automated testing, security and compliance.

  • Write unit tests and work with QA team to ensure quality testing.

  • Stay current with industry developments and new trends.

  • Understand & comply with HIPAA Security and Privacy Law

  • Adhere to Interactive Intelligence Code of Business Conduct and Ethics

jobs.title: Integration Architect
jobs.content:
UNIVERSITY OF WEST FLORIDA Innovation InstituteFlorida Virtual CampusFlorida Academic Library Services CooperativeTallahassee, Florida


Integration Architect


The Florida Virtual Campus (FLVC) invites applications for the full-time position of Integration Architect (Enterprise Systems Architect), position #122690. This position reports directly to the Manager of Enterprise Architecture. This position is a member of the Enterprise Applications workgroup and is located in either the Gainesville, Pensacola or Tallahassee office. The position will provide support in the design, development, implementation and maintenance of architectural strategies and integration plans for information technology. Responsible for the inventory of integrations across our strategic application portfolio and associated information systems.


Minimum Qualifications: Master's degree in an appropriate area of specialization; or a bachelor's degree in an appropriate area of specialization and two years of appropriate experience.


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Three or more years' experience with system integration strategies, methods and architectures. • Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science or related field preferred. • Experience with Enterprise Integration Patterns • Experience with REST and SOAP web services preferred. • Experience with XML, JSON and EDI preferred. • Experience with Camel, Mule and message queues preferred. • Experience with C#, Java, Java EE preferred. • Experience with SAML2, OpenID Connect and OAuth2 • Effective verbal and written communication skills.


Salary: $80,000 - $90,000 annually


Apply online at https://jobs.uwf.edu. For the complete announcement position description, including qualifications and experience, and to apply please visit https://jobs.uwf.edu. Applications will be accepted through September 21, 2016.

jobs.title: Teamwork Desk Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Job


Come help us build the best HelpDesk software in the world. The product we built handles millions of support emails a month for thousands of companies. Join a small team of talented developers, doing what we love every day. You will be writing code most of your day :)



What started out initially as a single web app has evolved into an architecture with many small services working with message queues, in-depth metrics, monitoring and logging. We need you to help us build some of the incredible new features we have planned and continue developing this architecture.


Our Tech Stack



  • Go (we love Go)

  • CoffeeScript

  • KnockoutJS

  • RabbitMQ

  • MySQL

  • Redis

  • ElasticSearch

  • AWS EC2, ECS, S3, RDS, CodeDeploy, AutoScale

  • Docker


Meet some of the Team



  • Brandon

  • Yannick

  • Peter


Some things published by the Team



  • Teamwork Engineering Blog


    • Building Desk

    • Spam: You Shall Not Pass

    • The Go Experiment

    • Go Learn


  • Github (insert open-source stuff we’ve released in desk)


    • stripehelper

    • s3pp

    • tnef



We care about all our teams, and they care about when their teammates will be online, what their timezone is and where they will be working from. When you apply we will ask you about where you intend to work from. We will also ask you whether or not you are open to considering spending some time in our Irish office, if you would like to work remotely, if you would like to relocate or if you're already here and ready to start work at Teamwork HQ in Cork, Ireland.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developers
jobs.content:
Here at Teamwork.com we've gone as far as we can with Cross-Platform Technologies for our mobile apps.  But it's just not good enough.  We want to take advantage of the very best that each platform offers.  It's not enough to be able to just get stuff done with our apps - we want them to be so good that people become addicted to using them.


So we're going fully native and we're putting together the best mobile team in the country to do it.


If you're a die-hard iOS or Android developer, this is your dream job: No legacy code, and the freedom and resources to do the best work of your career.


What We Expect:



  •  Strong attention to detail.

  • Willing to learn. You must have an open mind, be able to pick things up quickly and enjoy working with passionate people.

  • Fundamentally, this position is for a senior developer role, so we want to see that you've made some beautiful apps that you're proud of.


Ideally we'd also expect you to be familiar with the list below, but the main thing is your portfolio. Show us with the stuff you've done. Definite bonus points for putting together something using our API (http://developer.teamwork.com) - doesn't matter how small. 


What we we're not looking for:


 Ninjas. (Although if you want to do some martial arts in your free time that's fine too.)

jobs.title: Clean Energy Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Doosan GridTech, an innovative, Seattle-based clean energy technology firm, has outstanding career opportunities for entry-level and mid-level Software Development Engineers. We’re addressing the growing field of electric energy storage with a new business model and innovative technologies like peer networks and multi-level optimization. Help us design and build the technology platform, system architecture and software solutions for the next generation of electric power systems, and see your solutions deployed with real-world customers.


If you’re a new or recent college graduate, no problem. If you’re a quick study and value gaining new skills, we’ll guide your learning as you contribute to our growth.


We require strong abilities with the core skills and concepts of software development, such as software architecture, objected-oriented programming, memory management and multi-threading. Good working knowledge of our desired capabilities would be a strong plus.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HERE is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. Built on 30 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 58 countries. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com or https://company.here.com/here/



HERE, is seeking a talented Sr. Software Engineer to develop feature recognition software which transforms rich vehicle data into next generation content for the Here platform.  In this role the successful candidate will work in a small team with algorithm experts to develop, test, and maintain computer vision and machine learning software applications.  This is an opportunity to work with a talented team of Computer Vision and 3D specialists in delivering solutions to help with HERE's mapping and location intelligence.



Key Responsibilities:


Software development of computer vision and machine learning applications from algorithm prototypes and specifications


Software architecture, design, review, and test


Software refactoring and algorithm re-structuring to improve performance, reuse, and maintainability


Investigation and root cause analysis of software defects


Maintenance of software code repository


Test and deployment of software releases

jobs.title: Senior Engineer - Big Data
jobs.content:
Position Summary
 
Are you interested in pioneering the next generation of real time processing of high volume streaming data?  Are you interested in building out a scalable and reliable technology platform that will act as a business intelligence (BI) enabler to the global HERE organization?  The platform we are building can power real-time dashboards, generate alerts, and drive real time business decisions that will help HERE become the leading location cloud.
 
HERE is building services and platforms to help people solve daily challenges and enrich their lives. It is our goal to help people live delightful, safer, more economic, more sustainable lives while respecting their privacy by providing the right map and the right experience, for every moment.
                                                               
Built on more than 25 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 41 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit our official blog at http://360.here.com/
 
The product development team in Seattle is expanding to help realize this vision, and searching for engineers at all levels with expertise building large scale distributed systems. We are looking for candidates that are entrepreneurial, have a strong sense of ownership, and are highly motivated with their own opinions who want to shape product and implement pioneering technology that matters to consumers.
 
Main responsibilities



  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web applications and services running on AWS.

  • Develop products using agile methods and tools.

  • Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.

  • Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.

  • Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web applications/services.

  • Participate in design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.

  • Participate in architecture and design efforts across multiple teams, across multiple HERE divisions.

  • Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

  • Mentor and assist other engineers in or out of your areas of ownership and expertise.

jobs.title: Sr Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you interested in pioneering the next generation of personalization that blends physical and virtual worlds seamlessly leveraging the richest map data in existence, all things digital, social networks, and real-time predictive analytics at scale (big data) to create an in-the-moment experience that enrich people’s lives? HERE is building mobile apps and services to help people solve daily challenges and enrich their lives. It is our goal to help people live delightful, safer, more economic, more sustainable lives while respecting their privacy by providing the right map and the right experience, for every moment. Built on more than 25 years of experience in cartography and drawing on more than 80,000 sources of data, HERE offers "Maps for Life" for more than 190 countries, voice guided navigation in 95 countries in more than 50 languages and live traffic information for 41 countries. To learn more about HERE, visit our official blog at http://360.here.com/ The product development team in Seattle is expanding to help realize this vision, and searching for engineers at all levels with expertise in mobile app, web services and big data. We are looking for candidates that are entrepreneurial, highly motivated with their own opinions who want to shape product and implement pioneering technology that matters to consumers. The ability to have fun turning great ideas into inspired products is a must. Main responsibilities



  • Work closely with product owners and engineers to design, implement, test and continually improve low latency and highly scalable web services running on open source stacks (Linux, Java).

  • Develop products using agile methods and tools.

  • Develop commercial grade software that is user friendly and suitable for global audience.

  • Extensively use test automation or Test Driven Development during development process.

  • Continually create and update domain expertise documentation for internal and external customers.

  • Support production issues both directly and indirectly with customers.

  • Investigate, evaluate, and present new technologies for use with web services.

  • Drive design reviews, code reviews of your work and the work of your peer engineers.

  • Drive architecture and design efforts across multiple teams, across multiple HERE divisions.

  • Be a technical lead for key complex systems or services, working closely with other engineers and testers to deliver high quality software on time.

  • Mentor and assist other engineers in your areas of ownership and expertise.

jobs.title: Sr Architect -
jobs.content:
HERE is the leading global provider of maps, and location-based services. We are developing technology that will make personalized navigation, autonomous driving and augmented reality part of everyday life.


HERE is looking for a solutions architect to help design and build the next generation of the HERE Platform. Essential requirements include a proven track record of the development, deployment and the support of large scale distributed services.


Key Responsibilities



  • As part of the Architecture Team, within Platform Operations & IT (POIT) organisation you shape the future of the HERE platforms as well as Production and Corporate IT services

  • Enable product teams to develop, launch and operate high-quality services in a fast-paced environment

  • Interface with the extended architecture community within HERE to develop standard solutions to common requirements

  • Rapid prototyping of new technologies in areas all the way from datacenter infrastructure to development tooling and the business intelligence area

  • Support senior management with reliable and consise analysis of a broad spectrum of technology areas

  • Continuous alignment of the POIT offering to the needs of the internal customer-base

  • Provide architecture support and expertise to Software Engineers and Systems Engineers to ensure infrastructure and software standards and security standards are met for new and existing applications, products and Infrastructure

  • Lead programs to build solutions across many departments within HERE while ensuring the progress and stakeholder satisfaction

  • Lead cross-disciplinary teams to dig into the hardest, most impactful problems and solve them

  • Plan and carry out POC (Proofs of Concept) for POIT services


Skills Required


Excellent background in Systems and Software Architecture and Engineering, understanding of the components of infrastructure as code, public Cloud (AWS), distributed systems theory and design, and big data concepts and systems, but also feel at home in strategy discussions, budget planning, project management as well as software development. 



  • Prior experience with deep knowledge in software development/engineering and managing large-scale server cloud infrastructure

  • Big Data analysis and machine learning experience are a plus

  • Experience with systems management platforms at scale

  • Automation and CI/CD systems experience required

  • Good understanding of networking and storage technologies and concepts.

  • Solid understanding and experience with Cloud technologies and public Cloud services (particularly AWS)

  • Excellent organisational, analytical, problem-solving and presentation skills

  • Communication of technical issues to a wide and varied audience, from engineers to executives

  • Working with remote teams and across time zones globally

  • Desire and capability to continuously learn new things in all areas (technology, communication, business, culture, …)


HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Database Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Profile:


Our Houston-based database team sets the global standards for data solutions. We don’t want people to maintain the status quo; we want people who creatively propose and develop new and better ways of doing things. Seismic imaging requires sophisticated systems for managing high-performance computing resources and large volumes of data. Our existing and next-generation systems make heavy use of ORACLE object-relational database technology to support large distributed databases that are optimized for fast and reliable transaction handling. As a database software developer, your primary role is to design and develop these key systems.


This role allows you to work as part of a geographically dispersed team to engineer and develop terabyte-scale systems. Our world-class data center has lots of resources and lots of computation to do, so resource scheduling is a big development priority. We also like forward-thinkers, who are constantly planning how to improve the scalability of our systems to meet future needs. Indeed, particular emphasis is on the scalability of the systems in light of anticipated step changes in the volumes of seismic data processed and the related computational demands of seismic imaging. Partner with our agile teams focused on HPC infrastructure and algorithm development to design and support the crème de la crème of seismic imaging computing at CGG worldwide. We’re a global team, and your work impacts the globe.


Must have current U.S. work authorization or qualify for sponsorship.  *Please note:  New H-1B visas are no longer available for 2016/2017.

jobs.title: Android Engineer

You also have to have experience using RESTful API to communicate with the backend, and integrating third party services. You are not a designer, but you will know that design and user experience is extremely important to the success of our product. You have to feel comfortable to work also on the backend.

  • Strong foundation in Object Oriented design

  • Ability to work independently but know when to ask questions

Bonus Qualifications

Benefits
