jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Nashville, TN
URL: http://roundingwell.com/

Have you ever wondered why our healthcare system is so complicated? How can an industry so large and important fail to evolve while every other sector sprints forward with the aid of technology? We have asked ourselves these questions and are working to be part of the answer. We want to reshape the way patients and doctors communicate to improve health outcomes and improve patient quality of life. Being a product-driven company at heart, we believe clinical rigor mixed with technology and strong user-centered design has the potential to transform healthcare. We’re going up against some of the largest healthcare technology companies in the business and winning due to our focus on clinical workflow and patient engagement.

Interested? Our team is looking to add a Senior Software Engineer to help enhance our robust and scalable product and platform. Day-to-day responsibilities include building new features, fixing bugs, troubleshooting acute issues, and mentoring junior members of the team. You'll also collaborate with product strategy to help flesh out new features, refine feature scope and identify roadblocks to feature completion.

Required skills:
  • Experience in building complex products (preferably in PHP) that have had to scale
  • Familiar with unit, integration and behavioral styles of testing
  • Solid experience in at least one of the following: building micro services, high-use APIs, domain driven design
  • Experience developing security-sensitive software (where PCI or HIPAA requirements had to be met)
  • Highly comfortable with git, PostgreSQL, Ubuntu (linux)

Nice to haves:
  • Understanding of relational database design patterns
  • Experience with AWS or comparable cloud-computing platform
  • Experience interfacing with health information systems

While we have a nice office, we see the benefits of working wherever you are most productive. We’re flexible, whether you want to be remote part of the time or all of the time.

A competitive salary, health insurance, profit sharing and flexible work schedules are standard issue. Beginning every day with the knowledge that what you’re doing has a real impact on people’s health is priceless.

To apply: Apply online at http://roundingwell.com/jobs/senior-software-engineer/

jobs.title: DevOps Developer
jobs.content:
The DevOps, Developer - PHP, Linux will be responsible for building automated data collection processes and tools for business users to interact with our core data content platform.  The role will work closely with product owners and development teams to develop automated workflows that make critical data content available through Genscape’s delivery channels. The candidate should have broad experience in web scraping, extraction, and data manipulation.  Solid experience in developing against a variety of databases, understanding, and modifying data models will be essential for the position.  The ideal candidate will also have experience leading remote support development teams through the software development cycle.



This position is an excellent opportunity for someone who:



  • Loves data and working with data based systems

  • Has systems administration experience coupled with application support

  • Enjoys working with various departments within the business and collaborting with various technical and product teams

  • Is extremely detail oriented and passionate about ensuring data content is received and delivered effectively.



A typical day in the life of a DevOps, Developer - PHP, Linux will include the following:



  • Relentless focus on availability and automation of content collection to product teams and customers

  • Develop tools and processes to allow business users to interact with content collection systems

  • Design, develop and operate a content technology platform that integrates and eventually consumes disparate one-off content collections systems resulting from acquisitions

  • Identify and pursue potential performance, reliability, and process improvements

  • Collaborate with a global team of developers operating with an agile methodology to reach development goals.

  • Take part in our team to provide Content Collections operations support and incidence response in order to meet customer SLAs.

  • Learn and implement new technologies to handle diverse, changing data sources and to meet complex customer data demands

  • Perform data analysis and modeling that covers content, technology and operations activities

  • Monitor and maintain the health of the collection systems and push the envelope to maximize consistency, reliability and performance.

  • Follow and investigate technology trends and make recommendations as they apply to the strategic business objectives

  • Collaborate with Genscape shared services and product teams to start, maintain, and evaluate data collection processes and systems.

jobs.title: Network Engineer
jobs.content:
The Genscape network team designs, implements and supports networks that provide services to our employees and customers.  The team supports the data networks that our corporate facility and branch offices rely upon for business applications.  The team is based in the Genscape Corporate Office in Louisville, KY. Successful candidates for the Network Engineer role must have a ‘can-do’ attitude and essentials skills in the areas of leadership and development of team mentality and guidance of less experienced personnel. Someone with strong communication skills when dealing with management and customers, as well as documentation, leadership, and mentoring traits and techniques would be a good fit for this role.



A Day in the Life of a Network Engineer on our Team:



  • Installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of Cisco routers, Cisco and Nexus switches, and ASA firewalls.

  • Configure and manage ASA and FortiGate firewalls.

  • Configure and manage wireless networks. 

  • Diagnose and resolve network outages.

  • Configure and manage DNS and DHCP Servers.

  • Configure and manage a Cisco VoIP System.

  • Analyze network traces/packet captures to identify root cause of network performance issues to recommend/implement corrective actions. 

  • Participate with teams in network planning and design, and document network architecture, standards, and procedures.

jobs.title: Web Developer

jobs.title: Forensic Software Developer - Entry Level
jobs.content:
You would provide support in the form of application development, scripting, debugging, and software development expertise to a digital forensic lab and malware reverse engineering section. You would maintain existing software and develop new software to customer specifications.


At Cipher Tech Solutions, Inc. (Cipher Tech), we take great pride in supporting some of the most mission critical work in the Department of Defense and the Intelligence Community. The majority of our company is comprised of extremely talented software developers who write production tools which directly support one of two missions: Digital Forensics and Malware Reverse Engineering.

Digital forensics is the practice of extracting and processing evidence from computers, phones, tablets, cameras, flash-drives, and just about any other form of digital media. The results of our work are then used to support federal and military law enforcement, counter intelligence, and counter terrorist activities.

Malware reverse engineering is the practice of analyzing extremely advanced malicious code. The goal of a reverse engineer is to understand how the malicious code works and determine facts such as:



  • How did it infect the victim's computer

  • What kind of information it is seeking to steal

  • How is it communicating with the author (actor)

  • Who that actor might be


If you would enjoy waking up every morning, using your keyboard to help protect National Security, this is the job for you!

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Java Backend Services
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

trivago is looking for Software Engineers who are passionate about their craft, versatile and ambitious to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward!

We offer an international, results-driven, fun and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, trivago should be your first choice!

Our engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users search for their ideal hotel at the best rate. Our ambitions reach far beyond just searching for hotels. Our product needs to handle information at the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from a lot of different areas of computer science, including information retrieval, data processing, data storage, distributed computing, large-scale system design and many more; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a Software Engineer, you work on a small team and on many different projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
You will be a leader in the design, implementation and ownership of major modules and sub-systems. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, maintain and enhance software solutions.


Your responsibilities:



  • Build and maintain Java backend applications. Play a leading role in designing and implement new functionality and platform enhancements as needed.

  • Work closely together with members/stakeholders from other teams (BI, Product, etc.).

  • Be creative, challenge yourself and spread the word: contribute to one of our lovely open source projects.


Essential requirements:



  • Sc. in Computer Science or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years' experience in designing and developing large scale web applications.

  • You have demonstrated the ability to master object oriented development in (Core) Java (especially Java Concurrency). JEE experience is not relevant.

  • Extensive knowledge in software architecture, data structures and modern design patterns.

  • Extensive knowledge in building high performance, highly scalable, and fault-tolerant web applications.

  • Experience in using NoSQL technologies (Redis, Cassandra, etc.)

  • Analytical and problem solving skills.

  • Excellent communication skills and you speak English (our company language) fluently.


Preferred requirements:



  • A master's degree or PhD in Computer Science.


Life at trivago is...



  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.

  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hoursbased on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of lifein the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Hadoop / Big Data Specialist  Hive / Oozie / Impala
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

You will maintain and develop our Cloudera Hadoop cluster, set up a backup cluster and keep them in sync. jobs.title: Junior Software QA Engineer  B2B Tools
jobs.content:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a work environment that encourages new ideas, having fun and challenging the status quo!

Do you desire a fast-moving, constantly evolving work environment? Do you want to help to develop the B2B tools that revolutionize how we interact with hoteliers? Our Hotel Relations team is looking for an entrepreneurial-minded individual to learn the trivago approach to software quality assurance. Instead of following test instructions, you will analyse user-behaviour and test results to detect problems. You will then find root causes by combining IT skills with exploratory testing, an analytical mind and the ambition to find bugs before anyone else does. You will test all aspects of newly developed features for web-based applications to ensure that they will work on current and future browsers and operating systems. As part of a cross-functional team, you will learn to write test plans for manual and automated testing and take the lead during test meetings. You will also get the chance to work alongside developers and project owners to detect malfunctions and deliver software that is bug-free. We want someone who seeks to leave their mark on the projects they work on and who is forever considering improvements we can make or new approaches we can take. We will expect you to take an active role as you recommend design improvements or corrections throughout the development process and contribute during planning and coordination of new software releases. If you can bring the mixture of ideas, problem-solving skills and an eye-for-detail that we are looking for, we would like to hear from you.

jobs.title: Linux System Administrator
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Can you spot safety issues at a glance? Can you think like a hacker to boost security? Do you think differently? Join our Data Center Operations team and help ensure the safety and stability of the world's largest hotel search as you maintain and protect our site's servers. We’re always considering what we can change in order to improve so we’re looking for an experienced, creative tech-head who can give us a fresh perspective. You will monitor and maintain our multi-data center infrastructure and monitor the workload of critical systems, deciding on what changes we will need to make to cope with future workload. You will identify and strengthen vulnerabilities and protect trivago from attack. Think logically to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions and set up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup. You’ll have to find the perfect balance of safety and accessibility so that our users have the best experience possible. We want someone who will question our current approaches to technical problems and who can make sure that we stay on the cutting edge of technology as we rapidly expand. If you feel you can help us move forward, step up and show us what you’ve got.



The ideal candidate:



  • Has at least 4 years’ networking experience in organisations with large networks – preferably in a web environment.

  • Holds a bachelor’s degree or has completed an apprenticeship in Computer Science or has equivalent experience.

  • Has hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting network-related issues using Linux or FreeBSD-based tools. For those unfamiliar with FreeBSD, although you will need to use it on a regular basis, we will provide training and only require that you are an avid learner.

  • Has advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Icinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd web server.

  • Possesses an up-to-date knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.

  • Has solid scripting skills.

  • Will speak up if they sense any problems and is fully able to communicate their thoughts, needs and intentions so that any potential misunderstandings are avoided.

  • Couples razor-sharp analytical abilities with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive.

  • Speaks English (our company language) fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

  • Can start as soon as possible.



Life at trivago:


trivago is an exciting hub of multicultural activity where nationalities from all around the world come to share their knowledge and work together on redefining the travelling experience for millions of people. We nurture all our talents and provide them with the support they need to develop professionally as well as personally. We encourage fanatic learning through regular code workshops, Hackathons and constant feedback as well as promoting quick decision making in keeping with our trial and error philosophy. Flexible working hours are in place to create a trusting environment where productivity is measured through goals rather than hours spent in the office. For our internationals, we help with relocation and provide language classes for those wanting to learn and practise their German.
Join us at trivago – a place where talented minds meet, crazy ideas are shared and innovation is born.



Important additional information:



  • Please note that non-EU citizens will require a university degree in order to receive a work permit.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Senior Python Developer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:50176



The Content Generation and Distribution team is responsible for Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to our customers, who include key financial players that rely on our software. Our system delivers a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, fixed income, indices, FX, and futures and options. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. We make data available to our clients via various delivery mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.
What's in it for you:

As a developer on our team, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies such as Python, C++, Perl, Java, Javascript, SQL, RabbitMQ, Celery, Git, Jenkins, Robot Framework - whatever it takes to get the job done. Our work atmosphere is fast-paced, spirited and friendly.

We'll trust you to:

  • Design and develop new software within the industry's leading reference data product suite
  • Enhance our software infrastructure to improve the reliability and computational efficiency of our content generation and distribution technologies
  • Interact with various programming groups across Bloomberg as part of the development process


You'll need to have:

  • 3+ years of current Python development experience
  • Experience developing software in a UNIX environment
  • Understanding of Python, including code organization and testing


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with compiled languages such as C, C++ or Java
  • Experience building both small scripts and large systems in Python
  • Working knowledge of development tools such as debuggers, memory profilers, and performance measurement
  • Relational database experience
  • Excellent communication skills


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

Our Team:



The Enterprise Products and Services (EPS) team is a new and growing area of Bloomberg. We build state-of-the-art software to support product implementation and client-facing tools that allow clients to manage their data distribution, users, applications and respective permissions. Our product has the potential to have a tremendous impact on the market. Our solutions offer cost effective, customizable and innovative alternatives to clients. We are solving old problems in a new way and bringing healthy competition to a well-established market.
Our day-to-day includes a wide range of development opportunities, from front-end to back-end to data warehousing. As part of our team, you will be exposed to a variety of domains and technologies, learn continuously and contribute new ideas starting day one.

We'll trust you to:

  • Create C++ and Python services on Linux
  • Work with Oracle and SQL Server databases
  • Script complex stored procedures
  • Build UIs in JavaScript
  • Work across multiple teams in Engineering
  • Communicate and interact with product managers and end users


You'll need to have:

  • 5+ years of programming experience with Object-Oriented languages
  • 5+ years of experience developing stored procedures, performing optimization and query tuning and designing databases


We'd love to see:

  • Familiarity with C/C++, Linux, T-SQL, Python, Shell scripting, data structures, algorithms and optimizations, Object-Oriented design or JavaScript
  • Experience working with UIs
  • An under- or post-graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance or related field (or equivalent expertise)
  • Ability to learn on the fly and the desire to share ideas and be a team player
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Analytics, Trading, and Execution Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:50212



Every day, trillions of dollars pass through the Bloomberg Terminal. As a result, hundreds of thousands of financial professionals turn to our 500 applications to manage their portfolios, execute their trades and analyze the markets. As engineers, we're the ones who build the applications our clients rely on to not just stay informed, but stay ahead of the market. We connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. The applications and infrastructure we build embody the speed, agility and financial data that make Bloomberg the go-to for financial professionals across the globe.

You'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and take ownership in growing our industry-leading applications. You'll be able to lead projects, partner with the business and meet clients to understand their workflows. We work primarily in C++, but we believe a smart engineer can learn any language with some ramp up time. If you're from a different OO background but you're willing to learn C++, we still want you to apply. We have opportunities in all phases of the SDLC, so if you want to make an immediate impact and work on the financial world's toughest technical challenges, apply today.

You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java
  • Strong problem solving skills


We'd love to see:

  • Experience with multithreading
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript
  • Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
  • Interest in the financial markets


When you apply, tell us which of our teams you'd like to join. Here are snapshots of each one.

Trading Solutions (TS)



TS empowers the biggest players in the financial world to manage their portfolios, execute and settle their trades and make decisions that move the markets. Trillions of dollars pass through our systems on a daily basis so our applications need to be fast, accurate and scalable. Our integrated platforms interact with a number of agencies and governments around the world, and we use the best technology the industry offers to build them. We are full stack engineers who specialize in everything from the UX to server-side development and are always looking for new ways to make our products better. As engineers, we live at the intersection of technology and finance, so you'll have the opportunity to learn about the financial markets and suggest new ways we can lead the industry.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics



We build a highly scalable and available system that processes billions of data points per day. The scale of our product (more than 250,000 analytical runs per day) imposes technical challenges around the stringent availability, throughput and responsiveness metrics on our system. Portfolio Managers use our system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. To keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product, we're constantly looking for ways to improve using new technologies. If you're interested in high performance distributed systems, a modern software code base and are looking to build new products using the latest technology, we want you on our team.

Tradebook



Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform that trades equities, futures, options and FX trading around the world. We're developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to more than 120 liquidity venues globally. This year, we are building our next-generation system that leverages Bloomberg's expertise in data and analytics to optimize algorithmic trading. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and help us break into more markets. You'll work some of the industry's smartest engineers to shape the future of brokerage technology. To learn more about our product, check out our blog at http://www.bloombergtradebook.com/

Equity Trader



We're building the best trading platforms in the financial markets. We offer an end-to-end ecosystem that provides market insight through advanced real-time alerting, the analytics that traders need to make quick informed decisions and the tools they need to automate their workflows. We build the trading interfaces that provide access to markets across the world through more than 5,000 liquidity destinations. Our complex system handles millions of transactions per day, which are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis. Clients rely on our advanced technology to power their trading decisions and stay ahead of the markets.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities Trading (FICC)



We're the engineers behind the global FICC product that facilitates dealer-to-client trading, liquidity and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. FICC is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, we've evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. We build multithreaded and distributed services, which have high transaction rates, and we work on everything from infrastructure design and implementation to database management and user interface development.



Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Polyglot Developer - Trade Ideas
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49120



Trade Ideas' is a leading research and investment platform in a niche market used by high profile customers. It can be used to exchange investment ideas and recommendations in order to demonstrate their stock-picking skills. Our robust set of tools help people to create and share research, estimates and proprietary data in a cost-effective and straightforward way.

This is a unique team in Bloomberg as you will have the opportunity to really get to know your customer base and their needs. This means that you will genuinely have an impact on their workflow and see the tangible difference you make. You will also work closely with your dedicated sales and product teams to ensure you're delivering exactly what is needed.

We're continually developing and improving our offerings, which is where you come in. Our engineering team are looking for a creative, enthusiastic and motivated individual to help design, build, and realise the next iteration of 'Trade Ideas'.

We'll trust you to:

  • Quickly deliver high quality code and effectively roll out new features using an agile methodology;
  • Convert requirements from your business partners into usable product;
  • Help us design and develop a new Microservices architecture as the team continues to move in this direction;
  • Be truly technically agnostic. You should love to identify the right technology for the task at hand.


You should have:

  • Strong knowledge of TypeScript/JavaScript or Python. Both would be fantastic;
  • Proficiency in C++;
  • Strong collaboration skills. You will be working with many people - colleagues, internal Bloomberg clients and external customers.


We'd love to see:

  • That you're comfortable working in an Agile/Scrum environment;
  • Exposure to Test Driven Development;
  • Familiarity with design principles such as DDD and patterns such as Event Sourcing;
  • Familiarity with scripting languages, Bash for example;
  • You're self-motivated with strong teamwork skills and like to "get things done".


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Data Warehouse Engineer
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.content:

The testing team assists development teams to identify, execute, maintain and enhance testing tasks. We are internal consultants who help product teams to be more productive by giving them testing tools, processes and frameworks. You will get to know different aspects of the Zalando platform by working with all kinds of different teams.

  • You are a confident user Linux/Unix based systems

  • The usual tools of the complete software lifecycle are known to you (e.g. Jira, Jenkins, JUnit, WebDriver)

  • You have experience with the latest test tools such as Jenkins, JIRA, Sonar, Testlink, Cucumber, Selenium (Webdriver)

  • You have experience with Continuous Delivery and End-to-End Testing

jobs.title: Big Data Architect
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!

jobs.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Search/Recommender Systems
jobs.content:
THE OPPORTUNITY


As a software engineer you will focus on developing Zalando’s in-house search engine service and recommender system into state-of-the-art microservices providing highly relevant personalize search results and recommendations for the customer. Your main task will be positioning this technology as a “software as a service” component which can be fully leveraged within the Zalando platform. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Java and Scala developers, and expert data scientists.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You have at least 3 years of experience, working as a Java or Scala Software Developer

  • You are experienced with Lucene-based technologies like Solr and Elasticsearch

  • You are keen on collaborating closely with data scientists to bring data centric 

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You know the most common design patterns and you know in which context to apply them

  • A background in applied machine learning is a plus

  • You love to optimize processes and code, and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving data-driven products at scale, which are real-time oriented

  • You have worked with current big data technology (e.g. Hadoop, Amazon Elastic MapReduce)

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommendation and personalization engine in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world’s best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment 


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Krista Vanhala at krista.johanna.maria.vanhala@zalando.de

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer - Source Code Management & Artefact Store
jobs.content:
The Opportunity



In order to empower our product teams to deploy their applications themselves, the continuous delivery team provides an infrastructure which builds, tests and deploys our applications automatically. The DevOps engineers in this team are automating every step of our delivery pipeline as well as they are supporting other teams to use this pipeline. The continuous delivery team is based in Berlin.

What You Are Going To Do

  • You will be working in an agile team which maintains our Source Code Management and Artefact Store appliances
  • You will be developing tooling for managing appliances
  • You are going to support our product teams in using our Source Code Management and Artefact Store appliances
  • You will take an active part in scaling our Source Code Management and Artefact Store appliances


What We Expect From You

  • You have an above average experience with managing Source Code Management and Artefact Store appliances on scale
  • You are confident in the usage of Linux
  • You are a coder and you have experience with AWS
  • You love taking part in analytical projects, you feel responsible for the quality of your work and you support your team members in what they do
  • You have no problems communicating in English


What We Offer



We are Zalando and we think big - what you do today will be seen by millions of people tomorrow. Working here means working for a fast-growing, international company with the aim of creating the best online fashion experience in the world:
  • Use of open source technology
  • Choice of operating system (Linux, MacOS) and IDE (including Eclipse, IntelliJ, Netbeans)
  • State-of-the-art hardware
  • Take part in our internal 'tech talks' and our exchange programme with other Berlin startups
  • Take part in the Zalando mentoring programme
  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matter with a relaxed office environment
  • An international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you
  • You'll never get bored - there's always something to do at Zalando


Want To Join Us?



Then we'd be more than happy to receive your application, which should include your earliest possible availability date as well as your desired salary. Please apply through our career portal.

Any further queries? Please do not hesitate to contact us via email // Alicja Notowska

jobs.title: Senior JAVA Software Engineer
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact



The Advertising Lab at Zalando is located in Hamburg 'The leading Fashion E-commerce Platform in Europe', spearheads data-driven media buying efforts with a focus on fashion-oriented buying strategies for accurate and relevant consumer targeting.

We are focused on ad-technologies and make use of a plethora of big data technologies. Such as machine learning, high-level database modeling, metrics definition, trend analysis and report generation are crucial to our business and we're looking for a SENIOR JAVA SOFTWARE ENGINEER (M/W) with big data focus to take our venture to the next level.

You Are Setting Standards



Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.

Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.

Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

What we're looking for

  • Significant experience in web technology concepts, agile development methodologies
  • Skilled in object-oriented and functional programming languages like Java / Clojure / Python / Ruby or similar as well as (No)SQL databases and big data environments
  • Knowledge of event-based systems and event queues in general is a plus
  • Passion well structured, readable and testable code
  • Experienced engineer who knows about scalability, high-availability, security, monitoring, architecture & design of state-of-the-art websites


You Benefit From



Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!



If you have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact our recruiter Paul Geier .

jobs.content:

jobs.title: Application Performance Management
jobs.content:
The Opportunity

The Monitoring & Logging Team - Team Eagle Eye - is seeking a Monitoring Engineer to focus on application, systems and infrastructure monitoring. You will use both your systems and engineering expertise to manage and grow our increasingly cloud-based platform, dealing with stakeholders from across Tech. If you are someone who enjoys architecting, monitoring and automating, and work with your head in the Cloud - we want to hear from you!



Required Skills
  • Strong knowledge of Application Performance Management (APM) processes and tools (e.g. AppDynamics, New Relic, Dynatrace, Splunk, etc.)
  • Deep understanding of cloud-based environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, etc.
  • Profound technical understanding of JVM-based environments and related programming languages like Java, Clojure, Scala etc.
  • Scripting abilities in at least one of the following languages Python, Go, Bash, Perl
  • Proficient Linux and command-line skills
  • Confident in working with collaborative development tools like Git, GitHub, etc.

Desired Skills

Zalando is Europe's leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast-with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams- and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for a Web Developer to join our Tech Team in Vienna. TourRadar works in a fast-paced environment where ideas are more than welcome. Creative minds that think out of the box will feel at home at TourRadar and experience a working environment of a true online travel startup.

Key Responsibilities

Assist in brainstorming, designing and implementing website enhancements / relaunches, processing the data feed of our partners, improving performance, setting up testing frameworks and much more. Depending on your skill level and engagement you will be assigned to projects and will hold responsibilities thereof.

Requirements

Candidate must have good verbal and written English communication skills, with a sound understanding of and interest in web, advertising, marketing, social media and mobile. The perfect candidate has a profound understanding of PHP5+, XML, SQL/MySQL, HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript, worked with multiple MVC frameworks and designed/consumed APIs.

Required Skills / Qualifications

  • 5+ years of Web development experience, including front and back end on the LAMP stack
  • Profound understanding of MVC Frameworks, such as CodeIgniter, Laravel or CakePHP
  • Experience with AWS (Amazon Web Services) platform
  • Efficient using of a RDBMS (schema design, indices, caching)
  • Experience with unit and integration testing
  • Experience working in an AGILE environment
  • Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (the concept and the tools)
  • Experience in solving performance problems and architectural challenges
  • Understanding of accessibility and security compliance
  • Understanding of fundamental design principles of a scalable application
  • Experience with RESTful, SOAP and RPC APIs
  • Version Control with Git

Bonus Skills:

  • Being fluent in multiple programming languages
  • Experience with Payment Service Providers
  • Experience with processing large datasets
  • Experience with client side frameworks, such as AngularJS

ABSOLUTE MUST FOR THIS ROLE - DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU MEET THIS Right to work in the EU (work permit or EU national) as this role is based in Vienna, Austria

jobs.content: This hourly (non- exempt) entry-level position serves and supports each of the business units of First American Bank through the analysis of business needs

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer, Analytics
jobs.content:
As a software engineer in analytics team at Celtra, you will build, maintain and improve all parts of our data processing pipeline, processing 2B+ analytics events per day, producing insights used by top brands, publishers and agencies.


Why you should care


We are not your typical "Ad tech" company. We were one of the early adopters of Apache Spark. (use in production since 0.5, long before it became well known), one of the first three companies to start using Databricks and are early adopters of SnowflakeDB, a new cloud data warehouse. Also, we are looking into streaming solutions (Kinesis). We’re constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure to deliver faster, better, and more reliable software.


We use Scala for ad serving and data processing and PHP for REST API.


What we’re looking for


You care about proper engineering and clean code. You write consistently high-quality, maintainable code and are aware of industry best practices and trends. You proactively identify and clean up technical debt before it turns into a long-term problem and encourage others to do the same.


Your code runs in production somewhere. You have production experience with some of the parts of our stack: AWS, Spark/Akka, Scala, MySQL, DynamoDB, Snowflake, etc. and for the parts you don’t, you are excited to learn.


You have something to teach us. You have had exposure to other big data technologies that we do not use in production. Whether it be streaming solutions (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Samza) or storage/databases (Vertica, Teradata, Redshift, BigQuery), we go by saying: “Be conservative in what you use, be liberal in what you learn.”


You own what you do. You have owned larger parts of codebase before and have had the phone ring on you because something went wrong.


What a great candidate looks like



  • Experience with AWS or another cloud computing platform

  • Good knowledge of Scala or knowledge of Java with interest in functional programming

  • JVM ecosystem experience

  • Exposure to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Vertica, Teradata or other MPP columnar databases

  • Experience in analyzing and manipulating complex, high dimensionality data sets using tools such as Spark, Pig, Hive (or other Hadoop tools)

  • Strong SQL experience


Nice to have



  • Open-source involvement


Our culture



  • We care about product, company and its people.

  • We believe in high standards and long term code quality.

  • We ship. Features and fixes are deployed weekly.

  • We believe in an open and proactive culture where engineers are expected to learn and contribute in ways outside the usual coding assignments.


We take good care of our people. This is what we offer



  • Receive a highly competitive base salary, benefits and quarterly bonuses for performance.

  • Enjoy a generous education budget for conferences, classes, literature or studies.

  • Choose your equipment.

  • Work in our cosy office in San Francisco, CA.

  • Our fridge is always full and we drink the best coffee.

  • Travel between US and Europe.

  • Not from around here? No problem: If you are the right person, we are more than willing to help you relocate.

jobs.title: SOFTWARE ARCHITECT M/F
jobs.content:
Who we are


FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider with headquarters in Munich, Berlin, Milan, Paris and Zagreb. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and an innovative technology, the former startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years.

To support our team we are currently looking for Software Architect (m/f) based in Munich and Berlin.


Your tasks


Facilitate Architecture: Instead of enforcing architectural solutions, you facilitate creation and evolution of the architecture collaboratively.
Requirements engineering: You work closely with the Product Owner and the business stakeholders to validate business ideas and their feasibility.
Communication: You communicate decisions whenever necessary but understand that documentation is a living process.
Coaching: Teach teams new architectural patterns and practices to help them grow as engineers.
Evaluation: You evaluate and introduce new technologies and tools that can accelerate feature delivery.
Culture: You foster and establish a culture of Software Craftmanship. You value maintainable, readable and testable code and constantly promote these values within the team.
Hands-On: You work hands-on with the team (pairing, mob programming, prototyping) to validate your own design ideas early.


Our offer


The possibility to work flexibly, goal oriented, and independently in an experienced and professional team.
Come work on a product with incredible non-digital value: We offer the chance for you to change how millions of people commute, spend their weekends, and discover the world.
The chance to develop and implement your own ideas.

jobs.title: Junior Industrial Designer: Innovation
jobs.content:
Junior Industrial Designer: Innovation
Frankford Candy LLC
Philadelphia, PA

Company Description

Frankford Candy is the nation’s largest distributor and manufacturer of kid’s entertainment licensed candy. We manufacture chocolate in our Philadelphia headquarters and partner with factories all over the world to produce high quality, great tasting and fun candy that keeps kids and adults smiling. Our licensors are the best in the kid’s entertainment industry and enable us to create innovative, exciting candy that we play with all day long!
Frankford Candy is a privately held company that’s been in business for almost 70 years. We value hard-working, passionate employees where creativity and teamwork are at the core of our culture.


Job Description

Frankford Candy is looking for a creative individual to take on a role dedicated to deliver break through product innovations and continuous improvements to existing product lines in their licensed branded portfolio. The ideal candidate should have both industrial design experience / and or schooling and also have knowledge of packaging design. This is an entry to mid level position, reporting into the innovation manager within the marketing department.

Responsibilities & Requirements

- Working closely with the innovation manager, he/she will design products, which are both brand appropriate and executable with in our vendors capabilities and budgets for each season. Development will include (but not limited to) candy and confections, ceramic gifts, bundled gift baskets, boxed gift sets, tins, plastics, and more!

- Help to create seasonal thematic concept boards and design concepts according to the innovation manager’s plans and schedules. This also includes conducting market research for product idealization.

- Create drawings, sketches and renderings to convey new concepts and ideas to marketing, packaging, engineering, international teams and management.

- Create new / unique dielines and packaging structures based off reference samples and from scratch.

- Create detailed and accurate specification packages for communication and sampling with overseas and domestic vendors.

- Apply licensed style guides to packaging for early stages of licensor approvals.

- Prepare and coordinate prototype samples.

- Mock up new and existing packing, products and boards for meetings and suppliers.

- Have an extreme attention to detail.

- Ability to understand concept ideas visually and verbally.

- Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines in a seasonal company.



Experience and Education

- 1-3 years of relevant design experience.
- B.S./B.A. in Product Design/Industrial Design or related degree.
- Strong portfolio demonstrating good design, sketching ability, and dieline development.
- Computer skills including proficiency in SolidWorks, Adobe, Illustrator.
- Hand and computer sketching abilities.
- Experience working with licensed product preferred.

To apply, qualified candidates should email portfolio/website link, résumé, and cover letter to Meghan Balik at mbalik@frankfordcandy.com

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a uniquely qualified individual to help us maintain our enterprise help desk solution, HelpSpot. In this role you will learn every nook and cranny of HelpSpot, developing bug fixes and feature enhancements. This role will spend significant time working in a PHP4 style codebase as we work towards a fully modernized PHP 7/Laravel 5.3 version over the coming year(s).

There's a lot more to this role than just maintaining HelpSpot. As a customer service focused company, providing great support is a number one priority of all employees. The person in this position can expect to spend several hours a day working directly with our customers.

This may take the form of working on a tricky support case, developing custom code under our professional services offerings, or jumping on a GoToMeeting to assist a customer with server configuration. Whatever it takes to ensure our customers are getting everything they need to provide the best service possible.

It's a very unique individual that has the combination of technical skills we need alongside the attention to customer satisfaction this position requires. It's a role for someone eager to learn and not afraid to roll up their sleeves and pitch-in.

Additional responsibilities will include working on a number of our Laravel applications including our customer management system, online store, and product website.

Qualifications

  • Demonstrated programming experience.
  • Experience working with Linux and Windows servers.
  • Broad technical curiosity.
  • Self-motivated learner.
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.
  • Possess the ability to be a self-directed team player.
  • Ability to take a Customer-focused approach to all tasks.

Experience in most of the following preferred:

  • PHP
  • SQL, including the various dialects in MySQL, MSSQL, Postgres
  • Javascript
  • Web servers, specifically IIS and Apache
  • Linux, Windows and OSX
  • Formalized customer service (help desk, retail)
  • HelpSpot or other help desk applications

How to Apply

Our application process is a bit different and as a small company we're extremely selective with our hiring process. Our application form asks basic information, work history, and a series of in-depth questions to assess applicants.

We know it's not as simple as shooting off a resume, but then, that's the point :). Every completed application will get a personal reply.

Application Questions Preview:

  • Why would you be a good fit for this role?
  • Is the customer always right?
  • A customer emails us and says they're unable to get HelpSpot installed after downloading it. Write an email back to them.
  • What's the largest software project you've ever worked on (by either LOC or importance)? Tell us about it.
  • What are 5 things you love about PHP?
  • Detail any experience you have working with downloadable server based software.
  • Tell us about an especially challenging bug or issue you've tackled.
  • Provide a link to a Gist with 500+ lines of your favorite code. Code you personally wrote and are exceptionally proud of.
  • What makes you want to work at UserScape on HelpSpot?

Think you’re a good fit? We’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Artbees is looking for a full-time Full Stack WordPress Developer. We are specialized in building WordPress themes and plugins, so a strong familiarity and interest in WordPress and its platform is a must. Your major responsibility as a Full Stack Developer will be to extend the capabilities of WordPress by building tools and modules that will make website building a fun and interactive experience.If you’re passionate about Wordpress, write clean, well-documented code and are interested in tackling a series of new, exciting projects, we want to talk to you.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum of 3 years experience coding skills with WordPress
  • Comfortable building websites using HTML, CSS, JS and PHP
  • Hands on custom WordPress development at scale
  • An excellent Knowledge of PHP
  • Deep understanding of Wordpress architecture, developing custom themes, custom content types and creating custom plugins
  • Fluid knowledge of JavaScript, jQuery, and common plugins
  • Proven experience writing high-quality front-end code with great attention to design detail
  • Good understanding of cross-platform and cross-browser issues
  • Ability to work with Git
  • Experience creating, building and working with APIs
  • Knowledge in WordPress security and optimization
  • Familiar with Agile and Scrum workflows
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills in English
  • Have had a team work (with developers) experience

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design, develop, and maintain the technical architecture of applications
  • Ability to quickly shift between multiple projects and technologies
  • Must be highly organised; capable of developing and meeting the project deadline
  • Write clean code and test it throughout the development process to ensure the top-tier quality

BENEFITS

  • Access to tons of premium books and resources to improve your knowledge
  • Paid travel & Accommodation to headquarters
  • Flexible and fair time off policy
  • Birthday surprises
  • Spotify subscription gifts
  • Gym Membership

We need to learn about your most accomplished projects. If you do not have a well-developed LinkedIn profile or online presence, we expect a CV attached to your application or a link to your online portfolio.

We accept Remote and on-site applicants.

jobs.title: Software Testing Engineer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Artbees is looking for a Senior Software Testing Engineer with a minimum of 3 years experience in this field. In this role you will be closely working with our development team and directly participating in the planning, design and evaluation process of the software test patterns which may lead to an automatic product testing platform. This position requires an individual who is creative, a quick learner and driven to produce outcomes rather than outputs.There's a common saying in the IT industry that behind every successful software is a careful Testing Engineer.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Ability to speak, write and understand the English language
  • Thorough knowledge of HTML, Javascript and AJAX
  • Experience as a Software Developer in Test or in Testing Automation
  • Detail-oriented: able to document and follow detailed instructions within test scripts and defect tracking documents
  • Experience in testing software across multiple web browsers and devices
  • Experience with automated testing tools (e.g. Jenkins, Cucumber, Selenium, PHPUnit, Codeception)
  • Experience in Functional/System Testing using tools like CasperJS, PhantomJS, SlimerJS, TrifleJS, Selenium, BrowserStack, Saucelabs or a test one cloud-based testing system
  • Some experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery processes and tools (Jenkins)
  • Experience working as a QA, test automation engineer or software developer in an agile project
  • Independent, self-motivated, and willing to contribute in order to drive change and improvement
  • Great communication skills
  • Some experience with php/shell scripting language would be a plus
  • Experience with test and project management tools, test case tracking, etc.
  • Working experience in QA/testing on applications within production environments

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Implement testing strategy
  • Develop and execute automated and manual tests
  • Identify, isolate, and characterize bugs
  • Review & Analyze daily test results and bug reports across teams
  • Capturing inconsistencies and bugs in desktop and mobile browsers. (Chrome, Firefox, IE, Safari, Android, IOS)
  • Detect false positives and collaborate with the dev team in improving a more test-friendly codebase
  • Creating tests scenarios for:
* Mouse events (Click, Drag & Drop)
* Making AJAX requests
* Getting screenshots of specific elements within specific scenarios
* Submitting forms
* Automating user interactions

BENEFITS

  • Gift packs for employees and their kids sent from headquarters (remote staffs)
  • Access to tones of premium books and resources to improve your knowledge
  • Paid travel & Accommodation to headquarters
  • Flexible and fair time off policy
  • Birthday surprises
  • Spotify subscription gifts


To apply: Apply via: https://artbees.workable.com/jobs/334778

jobs.title: Industrial Design Intern
jobs.content:
Lead Off Studio is a full service Industrial Design and Product Development consultancy based in New York. We work with both start-ups and established companies by creating innovative concepts and helping to bring them to life. Our projects are diverse across categories like consumer electronics, housewares, furniture, footwear, retail, packaging, and more.

We are looking for a passionate intern to join our staff over the next few months. As an intern at Lead Off you will get the opportunity to grow through guided learning and pitching in on real projects. This is a chance to work at a small studio where you can learn all facets of the design business, while also growing your portfolio and network.



Requirements
- A deep need to create and a desire to learn
- Recent Grad or current student of an accredited ID program
- Excellent sketching skills
- Some skill in 3D CAD, preferably Solidworks
- Knowledge of the Adobe Creative suite
- Ability to create and test prototypes using a range of methods
- Above all, passionate about design



All applicants must send in a resume and samples of their work order to be considered. We want to see your process work, especially your ability to work through sketching and prototyping. Applicants must be located in the New York Tri-State area, as you must be able to easily get to our studio based uptown in Manhattan (Harlem). Applicants must be authorized to work in the US.

This is a paid internship.

To apply please send the following to info@leadoffstudio.com:
- A brief note about yourself and why you want this internship.
- Samples of your work (a pdf is preferred).
- Your resume.

jobs.title: Assistant Professor of Interactive Design - Tenure Track
jobs.content:
The Graphic Program at St. John’s University invites applications for a full-time, tenure-track position in Interactive Design at the level of Assistant Professor, to begin August 2017.

We seek candidates with a strong understanding of front-end development, information architecture, user experience, concept modeling. The candidate should also have experience with standard prototyping tools and techniques. The position requires a strong understanding of designing in mobile environments including responsive design, website development and a working knowledge of CMS frameworks as well as the ability to teach classes focusing on more traditional competencies including: design strategy and entrepreneurship, typography, design rhetoric, theory, and semiology. Ideal candidates will have extensive knowledge of current and emerging professional practices in interaction design with the ability to prepare students for careers in the field. They will also be fluent with both historical and contemporary movements in design and will be able to connect design practice to issues of political, environmental, and regional concern. The teaching load is two studio courses per semester.

Minimum Qualifications: MFA degree (or equivalent) in Design, Graphic Design, Communication Design, Interactive Design, User Interface Design or a related field; significant and successful teaching experience at the university level; strong research and/or publication record.

Special Instructions Summary

Submit a letter of application; curriculum vitae; statement of teaching philosophy; link(s) to online portfolio documenting evidence of professional excellence, including brief project descriptions; link(s) to online portfolio of student work including examples of student outcomes and brief assignment descriptions; and a list of three references.

All documents must be in PDF format. To receive full consideration applications must be received by 12:00 pm on January 16, 2017.

More information about the Graphic Design Program and the Department of Art and Design can be found on our website at: http://www.stjohns.edu/academics/schools-and-colleges/st-johns-college-liberal-arts-and-sciences/programs-and-majors/graphic-design-bachelor-fine-arts

St. John’s University is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applications from women and minorities.

I understand that any offer of employment is subject to receipt by St. John’s University of satisfactory references, verification of employment and education.

jobs.title: iOS developer
jobs.content:
Football Addicts is looking for iOS developers with strong experience in Objective-C to join our team in Gothenburg, Sweden.

You will be working on our iOS apps - from Forza Football, that keeps our users up-to-date on their favourite teams and competitions to video highlight systems and new, groundbreaking systems.

Forza Football has over 10 million installs and over 2 million monthly active users, and at peak hours it handles thousands requests per second and sends millions of push notifications.

We are a small team of developers and designers dedicated to building great mobile apps for football fans all over the world.

Football Addicts is bootstrapped and profitable, which means no interference from investors - we have full control over our company and products, and we only build things we are proud of. We keep things simple, we have no middle managers and we avoid lengthy company policies and bureaucracy.

Our office is located in central Gothenburg, Sweden. We offer free breakfasts and Friday beers, ping-pong and shuffleboard and all the tools you need to do great work.


Benefits


  • Your choice of computer setup
  • Flexible work hours
  • Five weeks paid vacation, unlimited time off
  • No middle managers and unnecessary bureaucracy
  • Breakfast every day
  • Friday beers
  • Conference visits with all expenses paid
  • Ping-pong and shuffleboard
  • Read about how we created our new office: http://blog.footballaddicts.com/bestoffice

  • Come as you are, we strongly believe in a diverse workplace

jobs.title: Principal Web Developer
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:
Responsible for planning and designing new software and web
applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new
applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity.
Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance
metrics. Provides guidance and support to other Engineers. Integrates
knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key
contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or
projects and shares expertise.

Core Responsibilities:
- Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and
technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration
needs.
- Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under
development, and customizes current applications. Develops software
update processes for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of
software releases.
- Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed
software applications.
- Oversees the researching, writing, and editing of documentation and
technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans,
test results, technical manuals, and formal recommendations and reports.
- Keeps current with technological developments within the industry.
Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews
literature, patents, and current practices relevant to the solution of
assigned projects.
- Assists with technical leadership throughout the design process and
assists in guidance with regards to practices, procedures, and
techniques. Serves as a guide mentor for Software Development Engineers.
- Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team
delivers software on time, to specification, and within budget.
- Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit
specification and technical requirements. Tests and evaluates systems,
subsystems, and components.
- Acts as a technical contact and liaison for outside vendors and/or
customers.
- Presents and defends architectural, design, and technical choices to
internal and external audiences.
- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters
of significance.
- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work
nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.
- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Job Specification:
- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent
- Computer Science, Engineering
-
- Generally requires 11+ years related experience
