jobs.title: Client Integration Engineer -thePlatform
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part of Comcast Wholesale, is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






Do you love creating Apps that millions of people will use?

Are you inspired by customer needs to create solutions?

Do your creative instincts urge you to improve user experiences?





We are looking for a unique individual to fill our Client Integration Engineer position. This role is very diverse, you will need to be able to perform a variety of tasks that are both technical and social: helping to chart a client's strategic use of thePlatform's Media Publishing System (mpx), helping customers implement and configure their account, building exciting solutions that meet new objectives, writing small scripts using thePlatform's SDK, gathering/prioritizing new feature requests, working with customers to understand timelines and setting proper expectations.





Responsibilities:



Working with a technical team to create integrations and applications for video playback on the internet and devices.

Developing and coding custom Groovy scripts according to the customers workflow requirements.

Developing and coding custom Java projects using thePlatform API's to meet customer's application needs.

Communicating regularly with the customer to evaluate satisfaction and proactively identify upcoming needs.

Routing of customer requests to engineering, sales or support as needed.

Documentation of current customer practices.

Working in an Agile environment using Jira.

Traveling to Seattle for technical training





Requirements:



3+ years experience in professional services or technical project management.

Experience with a variety of web development technologies such as DHTML, JavaScript, XML, REST, HTML5.

Knowledge and ability to develop in Java.

Technical understanding of Web Services, current trends in the mobile and broadband marketplace.

Energized by making customers happy and successful.

Ability to understand the customer and to anticipate future needs and help determine the ideal solution for issues.

Phenomenal communication skills are a must for this job.

Ability to multitask effectively.





Preferences:



Experience with Groovy Scripting.

Encoding experience- knowledge of common codecs and transcoding solutions.

Knowledge of DRM and adaptive bitrate technology.





This position will be filled at our sister company NBCU's office in New Jersey and will report to the Manager of Integration Engineers in Seattle, WA.





About thePlatform:





We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated to provide our customers with the best online video publishing and management solutions in the industry.



We are a team of incredibly bright and driven people, who also believe in having fun. We enjoy a dynamic and flexible work environment, and hope you will consider joining us.



As a subsidiary of Comcast, thePlatform offers competitive compensation and spectacular benefits typically seen only at very large organizations. The following are a few of the many benefits we provide:



Company bonuses

A 401k where we match 100% up to 4.5% of your contribution

21 days paid time off + 7 paid holidays

Great medical, dental, vision insurance for you and your family

Comcast Restricted Stock Units

Employee Stock Purchasing Plan

Free Comcast Cable and Internet if service available

Flex Spending Account

Life Insurance

Tuition Reimbursement

- Performs needs analyses for the Company and its customers, and produces strategic, cost-effective solutions.

- Provides timely, technical support and problem resolution for field service questions.

- Supports Sales team with product modifications and engineering expertise for custom projects.

- Assists representatives and customers in evaluating and selecting products.

- Recommends products to meet customer needs

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer-thePlatform
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






thePlatform helps some of the world's largest media companies manage and publish their video content online. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, the Travel Channel, Oxygen and more. As an independent subsidiary of Comcast, we enjoy the benefits of a relationship with a large company while keeping the agility of a startup.





As a Senior Software Engineer, you will participate in the planning, design, and implementation efforts of a small team engaged in highly dynamic projects. You will work closely with Product Owners to ensure that services meet functional and scalability requirements. You will also work closely with leads and architects to leverage and improve thePlatform's core technologies.





This position offers a tremendous opportunity to influence the next generation of interactive media applications. The role provides unlimited creativity in bringing the latest web techniques to market in a large-scale consumer setting. We practice Agile methodologies, plan rational schedules, and our cross-functional teams build strong, collaborative relationships as partners in the delivery of quality products.





Responsibilities:





  • Design, estimate, and implement thePlatform's MPX services in collaboration with the development team and product owner.




  • Identify and propose ideas for design improvements and new components.




  • Analyze scalability with performance and stress testing.




  • Guide or mentor less experienced engineers.




  • Respond quickly to critical customer escalations.







Requirements:





  • At least 8 years experience in the design and development of Internet applications and large-scale distributed systems.




  • Experience leading small engineering teams through multiple releases of projects.Ideal candidates will have Scrum Master experience.




  • Demonstrable talent for elegant object-oriented design.

We also believe in fostering a sense of community in our workplace. jobs.title: Product Support Engineer
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






Our Continuous Delivery team's mission is to empower engineering teams to build, test, deploy and operate their own products. We will achieve this by leading the adoption of Continuous Delivery and Dev/Ops philosophies, by modernizing the company's product architectures to be cloud compatible and by implementing a Platform as a Service that our engineering teams can consume. We are leveraging both established and emerging technologies, such as Zookeeper, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes and TeamCity.





This role is focused around supporting customers, who are primarily fellow engineering employees, and operating the team's products. Day to day work will include troubleshooting, configuration management, automation, consulting on integration solutions and representing the customer's needs during design reviews. New and interesting challenges will present themselves almost daily. There is a heavy social aspect to this role, and in time you will come to be known by many as one of those people who knows how to do everything. There is huge upside for someone looking to advance a career in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering Site Reliability Engineering or Technical Support. We value cultural fit, intelligence, self-motivation, empathy and passion for learning as much or more than matching experience. If this sounds like a role you would enjoy, but you're concerned about specific details below, please apply anyway. You might be the perfect person for us.





Responsibilities:




  • Provide front-line support to internal users of the team's products through several channels: chat, JIRA, email and in-person help requests.

  • Troubleshoot and repair issues with the team's products with minimal guidance.

  • Perform regular and emergency maintenance activities.

  • Escalate software defects and the most difficult issues to the rest of the team. Advocate for the customer's interests in getting these issues solved.

  • Consult with users on the design and implementation of Continuous Integration pipelines, custom deployment workflows and complex monitoring problems.

  • Collect and analyze data for root cause analysis and business intelligence.

  • Champion Dev/Ops and Lean philosophies encourage empathy across functional roles, automate repeatable tasks and eliminate waste.

  • Take ownership for high quality, successful completion of projects.





Requirements:




  • A structured and detail-oriented approach to problem solving and troubleshooting.

  • A positive and collaborative attitude. A willingness to take calculated risks and learn from mistakes.

  • Strong foundation in Shell, Ruby, Python or a similar scripting language.

  • Some experience with Object Oriented programming in Java or C# a plus.

  • Proficient with Linux OS and command line operations.

  • Understanding of distributed web service architectures.





Extra Credit for:




  • Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS or Graphite.

  • Experience in UI design or implementation.

jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part of Comcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






We are looking for a unique individual to fill our Full Stack Engineer position. This role is very diverse, you will need to be able to perform a variety of tasks that are both technical and social: helping to chart a client's strategic use of thePlatform's Media Publishing System (mpx), helping customers implement and configure their account, troubleshooting a current implementation, writing small scripts using thePlatform's SDK, gathering/prioritizing new feature requests, working with customers to understand timelines and setting proper expectations.

  • Develop and code custom Groovy scripts according to the customers ingest requirements.

  • Develop and code custom Java/.NET projects using thePlatform API's to meet various customer application needs.

  • Seamless project management through all phases of the customer relationship-coordinating with the customer, account manager, technical resources, and support personnel.

  • Communicating regularly with the customer to evaluate satisfaction and proactively identify upcoming needs.

  • Coordinating with technical personnel as needed to meet customer needs, while managing customer expectations to prevent overload or missed deadlines.

  • Formal routing of customer requests to engineering, sales or support as needed.

  • Communication to the customer regarding new features and releases of thePlatform services.

  • Documentation of current customer practices.

  • Travel: 5-10%

  • 3+ years experience in professional services or technical project management.

  • Experience with a variety of web development technologies such as DHTML, JavaScript, XML, REST.

  • Knowledge and ability to develop in .Net (C#) or Java.

  • Energized by making customers happy and successful.

  • Ability to understand the customer and to anticipate future needs and help determine the ideal solution for issues.

  • Phenomenal communication skills are a must for this job.

  • Steadfast and calm in explosive situations.

  • Ability to multitask effectively.





Preferences:






  • Experience with Groovy Scripting.

  • Encoding experience- knowledge of common codecs and transcoding solutions.

  • Knowledge of DRM and adaptive bitrate technology.





We admit it. We are looking for a superstar. We are asking a lot, but this is an extraordinary chance for the right candidate to have an immediate and significant impact on our business.





This position will be filled remotely in New York City, and will report to the Manager of Integration Engineers in Seattle, WA.







About thePlatform:







We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated to provide our customers with the best online video publishing and management solutions in the industry.





We are a team of incredibly bright and driven people, who also believe in having fun. We enjoy a dynamic and flexible work environment, and hope you will consider joining us.





As a subsidiary of Comcast, thePlatform offers competitive compensation and spectacular benefits typically seen only at very large organizations. The following are a few of the many benefits we provide:

  • Free Comcast Cable and Internet if service available

  • Flex Spending Account

  • Life Insurance

  • Tuition Reimbursement

thePlatform is hiring a Software Engineering Lead for its Consulting Services organization.





Consulting Services at thePlatform works with a variety of customers to deliver world class IP-based video delivery solutions. Current projects include multiple initiatives for major media companies, as well as cable operators and telecommunication companies worldwide. We have offices in Seattle and London.





As a Software Engineering Lead, you will be responsible for the planning, design, and implementation efforts of a small team engaged in highly dynamic projects. You will work closely with customer-facing Solution Architects in our Seattle and London offices to ensure that solutions successfully meet functional and scalability requirements. You will also work closely with internal product engineering teams to leverage thePlatform's core services, technologies, and Continuous Delivery infrastructure.





At thePlatform we create highly scalable, standards-based solutions, based on open source software. Our multiple small engineering teams have a track record of managing sustainably paced workloads, successfully delivering multiple project releases every quarter. We have a proven record of success with several years of pragmatic application of Agile methodologies.





Responsibilities:

Design and implement applications and services using thePlatform's mpx services and Java technologies.

Solution architecture experience.

Experience working in Professional Services organizations.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Quality Assurance Analyst



Summary



The Quality Assurance analyst reports to the Senior Director of Development in Media Sales and is responsible for verification and validation of software products developed and implemented by the Development team. The role is a hands-on position located in the Chicago Headquarter that will serve as a contributing member of the Media Sales QA team as well as work closely with the QA Lead(s) and the Media Sales Development team. Ideal candidates will be innovative, self-motivated, a quick study, and willing to develop new skills while constantly improving existing abilities. This person must be able to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.





Essential Functions



The QA Analyst is expected to spend time for defined tasks as below:



Hands-On Functions



Develop and maintain test plans, test cases, test data, test scenarios, and other test documentations.



Execution of functional testing during sprints.



Execution of system regression testing for individual software modules, as well as, entire system regression testing on a regular basis, prior to public version release.



Role owns, and is accountable for identifying all critical issues prior to product release to the general client population.



Utilizes company tools for defect logging and creation of reporting and statistics throughout the testing cycle.



Gain a firm understanding of business rules and new features being implemented.



Estimate test effort and provide updates on remaining work to project team and project management.



Role will work with the Media Sales Development team, Test Lead(s) and the appropriate Product to highlight areas of inconsistency across various modules and improve upon quality of products.





Job Knowledge, skills and abilities (KSA's)



Candidate is expected to have the following knowledge, skills, or abilities:



Strong knowledge of Software Product Development Life Cycle and Quality Assurance practices.



4+ years of experience as a Functional Tester.



Experience working in an agile environment (SCRUM).



Experience in creating and executing test plans and test cases.



Expertise using defect tracking tools.



In-depth knowledge of QA methodologies and best practices



Strong understanding of testing techniques, approaches and strategies



Analytical and problem solving skills with hands-on, "get it done" attitude



Client/Server and Web/Internet application testing experience



Advertising and Media experience is a plus



Automation testing knowledge is a plus



Ability to understand SQL scripts and relational databases.



Knowledge of .Net, Java, Web and other coding languages a plus



Product testing experience is a plus





Other Requirements



Strong communication and organizational skills



Must be self-motivated and a team player





Working conditions



This is a full time position based in STRATA's headquarters office at 30 West Monroe, Chicago, IL. Working conditions are in agreement with conditions described within STRATA's company handbook unless explicitly noted in this document.





Minimum qualifications and requirements



The candidate should possess the following qualifications:



A Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent work experience in a related field, A Master's degree is preferred but not required



Minimum 4 years of experience as a functional tester responsible for the Quality management of a software product






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Director of Software Development
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




DIRECTOR OF SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT



Summary



Provide leadership and direction for engineers in the development of multiple software products, services and projects. Serve as the chief technical ombudsman for Media Sales division.





Responsibilities include:



Manage software engineering team and individual personnel (potentially across multiple locations).



Provide the technical direction, development oversight, and deployment of STRATA’s Media Sales products (non-invoice). Technical direction includes the system/application architecture, standards, and tools used to create the software.



Responsible for a regular release schedule of bug-free, client focused and technically efficient code. This leader will manage the release schedule and be responsible for deployment coordination with TAPS as well as advance (internal) communication.



Serve as the chief development process master, maintaining short-term and long-term development process, documenting this through Rally (or similar platform), and hosting a daily scrum meeting, bi-weekly Sprint Planning meeting, and bi-weekly Sprint Retrospective meeting.



Plan and execute projects to deliver new product releases. In conjunction with the product team, accountable for the schedule, cost, and functionality goals for the products and projects.



Manage cross-functional team on product roadmaps, program budgets, and sales or business development opportunities. Coordinate engineering contributions to sales and support activities, deliverables, sales proposals, deployment plans, demonstrations and prototypes, and trouble ticket resolutions.



Participate with Product Management, sales, and operations to set long term product and market solution strategy.



Contribute to development, review, and maintenance of product functional specifications.



Define contents, schedule and drive delivery of product service packs as needed.



Define and implement processes such as project lifecycle management, defect tracking, source code management, and field issue escalation.



Contribute to development and review of product documentation, training materials, white papers, and marketing communications.



Perform other duties as required.



Direct reports include the software developers. Indirect reports include the product managers, trainers, and QA personnel. This position reports to the VP, Media Sales with “dotted line” reporting to VP, Engineering.



Job Knowledge, skills and abilities (KSA’s)



Project planning, project tracking, and project lifecycle management skills.



Ability to handle multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced work environment and to contribute to all aspects of the software product development process.



Very strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.



Requirements analysis and use case analysis.



Solid understanding of networking topologies, components, standards.



Experience in multimedia and streaming protocols a plus.



Ability to lead and interface with cross-functional teams.



Working conditions



The SDSM will work at the company’s offices in Chicago. Some limited travel may be required. The SDSM will be expected to dress and behave professionally, acting as a role model for other technical staff.



Minimum qualifications and experience



Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering



10 years industry experience; at least 5 years in management preferred.



5 years of increasing responsibility in software engineering development of large data intensive systems.



Experience in cross platform technologies.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Delivery Engineering Team
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






Visible Worldis looking for a talented, experienced, and versatile Software Engineer to work in our Manhattan office. We are looking for a self-starter accustomed to working in a dynamic atmosphere, creating reliable and cutting-edge technology. As a member of our Delivery Engineering team, you will be working on custom development and deep integration of our and customer technologies. Interacting with our customer's technical peers, you thrive using a broad variety of technologies to deliver and deploy top quality production-grade systems in fast paced environments.





Responsibilities

- Design and implement custom software solutions that seamlessly integrate with and extend our services into our customer's environments.

- Help discover technical requirements of new products.

- Develop test and integration approaches and environments.

- Work with our customers to test new developments and prepare them for deployment.

- Work with our Operations team to develop operational documentation and product documentation, and assist when troubleshooting production problems.





Qualifications

- BS or equivalent in Computer Science or related discipline.

- 2+years of professional development experience.



- Experience working with avariety of computer languages, including Node.js, Javascript.



- Knowledge of C/C++ a plus.

- Experience with software development for Linux systems.

- Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

- Independent non-linear thinker who can route around obstacles and can come up with creative solutions.

- Dependable team player with strong communication skills.

We're looking for a Senior Data Integration Engineer. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of technical and functional designs for ETL, Database, Data Warehousing, and Reporting areas. This job plays a key role in customer analytics projects, systems design and development. This team is accountable for ensuring that the overall functional and technical design of work processes and applications meet business and functional requirements. In addition, the work must be sustainable and conform to operation infrastructure.



This position will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, tuning and the deployment of software solutions within Teradata and Hadoop Ecosystems. The Engineer will work closely with the administrators and application teams to insure business applications are highly available and performing within agreed upon service levels. This position will also work closely with business, architects and other development teams in an agile manner to quickly realize business value.





Responsibilities

Build and maintain optimized ETL solutions to process/load source systems data into Teradata/Oracle/Hadoop using Pentaho and other utilities

Develop, implement and maintain development best practices for within ETL environments

Analyze and solve problems and recommend improvements to existing systems and processes

Design, code and test major segments of a system in a timely manner

Leads unit, system acceptance, and performance testing by designing test cases, building test data, test execution and evaluation, along with recommending/making improvements/fixes to the system.

Ensure data security, data quality and governance of data within Teradata and Hadoop ecosystem

Develop, implement and maintain applications with RDBMS technologies





Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree preferred

7-11 years of experience





Preferred Qualifications

Seven to elevenyears with data integration, Development of End to End ETL architecture using Linux, Pentaho, Informatica, Teradata, SQL, BTEQ,

One plus years hands-on experience in developing applications utilizing one more, Hadoop Ecosystem components e.g.Sqoop, Hive, Pig, Flume, Accumulo, HBase, Kafka, Thrift API and Storm, etc.

Requires understanding of complete SDLC and Experience with continuous integration, test-driven/behavior-driven development, and agile, scrum development methodologies

Manage and Co-ordinate 1-3 matrix resources, experience with mange service and on-shore and off-shore development experience is must

Telecommunications experience Knowledge of Telecommunication/Cable billing, customer care systems e.g. DST, CSG and AMDOC etc.

Knowledge of NoSQL platforms; Hadoop, Teradata, TOGAF Certified

Ability to work effectively across organizational boundaries

Excellent oral, written, analytical, problem solving, and presentation skills

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Hadoop
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary





We are seeking an ETL, Hadoop developer with strong understanding data warehousing and the Big Data Hadoop Ecosystem (HDFS, MapReduce2, Accumulo, Pig, Hive, HBase, MongoDB etc.) to work within a DevOps team. This position will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, tuning and the deployment of software solutions within the Hadoop Ecosystem. The developer will work closely with the administrators and application teams to insure business applications are highly available and performing within agreed upon service levels. This position will also work closely with business, architects and other development teams.









Key Responsibilities



-Troubleshoot and develop on Hadoop technologies including HDFS, Hive, Pig, Flume, HBase, MongoDB, Accumulo, Tez, Spark, Storm, and Hadoop ETL development via tools such as Informatica, Pentaho.



-Software development in a collaborative team environment using Scrum Agile methodologies, primarily using ETL data ingest/egress frameworks.



-Translate, load and present disparate data sets in multiple formats and multiple sources including JSON, Avro, text files, Kafka queues, and log data.



-Participate in designing, building, installing, configuring applications that lend themselves to a continuous integration environment.



-Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed design.



-Participate in analysis of data stores



-Ensures solutions developed adhere to security and data privacy policies.







Required:



-1-3years of ETL data integration development and Scrum Agile development



-1-2 yearsof Big Data Hadoop Ecosystem components (Sqoop, Hive, Pig, Flume, etc.)



-1-2 yrsof Hadoop architecture, storage and IO subsystems, network and distributed systems



-Understanding of data warehousing concepts



-Familiar with open source technologies and libraries



-Knowledge of scripting with shell scripting (Bash, PHP, PERL, Python, etc.)



-Understanding of versioning, change control, and problem management





Desired Skills/ Experience:



-Understanding of RDBMS technologies and SQL language; Teradata and Oracle highly preferred



-Knowledge of java virtual machines (JVM) and multithreaded processing



-Knowledge of NoSQL platforms



-Experience with open source management tools (Pig, Hive, Flume, Thrift API, etc.) including participation in the community



-Large scale data warehousing



-Data Quality, DataCleaner, etc.



-Understanding of high performance and large Hadoop clusters

jobs.content:

As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Senior Designer User Experience





Team Overview:

The Sales & Marketing UX team is transforming how new and existing XFINITY customers learn about offers and enjoy our services. We're focused on improving the customer experience with enhanced flows, smart features and self-healing solutions while building a foundation for long-lasting relationships. Our Emmy-award winning UI delivers entertainment across our customer's devices in ways that are engaging, fun and fully satisfying.



Position Description:

The UI/Visual Designer will have a hands-on role in the design of xfinity.com. You'll help shape product benefits around user needs to create engaging and intuitive user interfaces with sales driven results. As part of your day-to-day, you'll collaborate with team Creative Directors as well as sales, marketing, brand and engineering leads. You'll help drive the delivery of digital applications that feature outstanding user experience and elegant design aesthetics.



Core job responsibilities:

- Take responsibility for the user interface: identify problems, propose solutions, recommend implementations, and execute UI solutions to improve the user experience.

- Create pixel-perfect, world-class user interfaces and original, eye-catching visual design.

- Deliver high quality work on tight schedules in a dynamic, agile product environment.

- Produce interactive prototypes for internal experimentation and usability testing, and test UI in a rigorous, data-driven way.

- Demonstrate a command of usability and accessibility standards in partnership with visual and interface design disciplines and principles.

- Have a broad experience and a deep understanding of users to recommend UI features that solve customer needs.

- Write intuitive style guides and design specifications with a focus towards engineering implementation.

- Support, communicate, course-correct, and revise through the development phase.

- Maintain a critical eye and an obsessive attention to detail.

- Help us make it new, while keeping the experience in the larger family. We are reinventing the design of the site and have a lot of opportunity to explore style and interactions.

- Demonstrate the ability to solve design problems, from both a usability and visual perspective



Qualifications:

- A portfolio that showcases several recent e-commerce designs is required for consideration. Mobile site/mobile phone and/or tablet apps designs a plus

- Minimum 6 years of UI and visual design experience within a digital agency or product team.

- Experience leading development of comprehensive and versatile digital design systems.

- Significant experience in iconography, symbol design, and data visualization.

- Expert typesetting and typographic design skills.

- Deep knowledge of cross-platform web/mobile usability standards and UI specifications.

- Understanding of design and technical capabilities/limitations of leading email and browser technology.

- Skilled in taking a project from exploratory and conceptual version, through to final production assets.

- Proven ability to multi-task and execute against multiple projects running in parallel paths.

- Ability to collaborate with copywriters and business stakeholders for successful marketing related launches.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





The Division: Comcast OSS Tools team is part of Comcast System engineering Organization. The OSS Tools Team provides capabilities for monitoring and troubleshooting Customer Premise Equipment and HFC Plant health and performance metrics. Our goal is to partner with the business and provide front line users with simple, easy to use capabilities that satisfy our Customers and improve the Employee and Customer experience. We use Agile software development methods to quickly meet the business needs. Our team is known for being innovative and collaborative when providing solutions, and we have excellent relationships with our business partners.



As an OSS Tools engineer on the Comcast system engineering team, you will design, prototype, and support state of the art network management tools that monitor Comcast's customer premise equipment, HFC plant health/performance metric to ensure the best customer experience for Comcast's high speed data, IP telephony and video services. The OSS Tools team is fast-moving team of world-class experts who are innovating in network management of Comcast's customer premise equipment and HFC plant. We are a team that thrives on big challenges, results, quality, and agility. We are always looking to try something new every day, and working with cutting edge technology. There is a lot of opportunity for innovation in this role!





Responsibilities:



-Partner with the Director and Managers to provide leadership and direction towards long-term objectives and strategic direction to the rest of the team



-Provides expert knowledge in the implementation of large-scale network management system for that can handle millions of transactions per day



-Conducts research that contributes towards patents and white papers for internal and external distribution



-Provides technical thought leadership for a large development team



-Displays passion for solving complex problems using technology



-Embraces and encourages change and innovation





Minimum Requirements:



-Bachelor's Degree or equivalent with 15+ years of individual experience (10 years domain experience)



-Advanced degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering Sciences, Computer Science, or Mathematics



-Proven ability to innovate and drive solutions across multiple teams. Recognized as an expert in the field with strong technical and business knowledge



-Drives architecture and development, jumps in to resolve critical issues



-Experience with high transaction volumes, high data through put



-Expert in writing core programming languages such as Java



-Expert with web application development including dynamic HTML, CSS, Angular JS and JS integration



-Experience with messaging queues such as Rabbit MQ, Kafka, or equivalent



-Strong problem solving skills



-Works well with a team environment and provides leadership to junior team members



-Excellent written and verbal communications skills



-Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution



-Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment. Requirements change quickly and our team needs to constantly adapt to moving targets



-Strong interpersonal skills; capable of writing recommendations and interacting with company personnel on complex topics



-Proven experience meeting large deliverables with fixed and aggressive deadlines



-Ability to present clear, concise reporting on concurrent projects and issues



-Proven analytical and problem solving skills





Preferred Requirements:



-Experience with HBASE, Hadoop



-Experience or knowledge of Cloudera, MapR, or HortonWorks



-Experience with CM tools such as, Ansible, Puppet, MagNeto, Code Wash



-Experience in deployment & administering web application containers like Tomcat, Glassfish, WebLogic



-Experience in developing, deploying and administering Java applications using JAVA, J2EE



-Experience with high transaction/throughput processing in a highly available environment





Technologies & Tools used in OSS Tools:



Linux, Unix, DNS, TCP/IP, CentOS, Redhat, RHEL, RPM, Kickstart, Debian, scripting, perl, shell, python, HTTP, httpd, apache, java, tomcat, networking, load balancing, F5, distributed systems, kernel, performance tuning, hadoop, hbase, database, nosql, memcache, erlang, message bus, splunk, puppit, chef, zookeeper, Jenkins, nexus, Zabbix, App Dynamics, Wiley, Nagios, Java

jobs.title: Vice President of Engineering
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






The Vice President of Engineering reports to the Chief Technology Officer. The role entails managing and growing the Engineering department. The Engineering department consists of a handful of engineering teams that focus on a specific technology domain (UI & Workflow, Core Data Platform, Optimization & Algorithms, Big Data, Advertising Delivery). Each team is run by a Tech Lead. Teams work in an agile manner, with monthly sprints.





Specific Responsibilities include:



- Personnel management direct or indirect supervision over all Engineering staff (developers, Tech Leads, QA). This includes hiring, coaching, and talent development.



- Program management and Execution manage plans, timelines, and interdependencies between different engineering teams.



- SDLC Manage and improve the Software development and release process, with special attention to automated testing, DevOps, and scalable development.



- Technical Leadership interface with Product Management and other business functions.





Professional Qualifications:



- BA in Computer Science or related discipline required,MS or MA degreein Computer Science or related discipline preferred.



- 12+ years of previous experience in a leadership in Engineering position, overseeing at least 35 Software Engineers



- Deep experience with agile development methodologies, automated testing, release processes, etc.



- Experience with managing "matrix development organizations" (multiple engineering teams / domains, and multiple end-to-end products)



- Experience with managing Software Development across multiple technical platforms, including C#/.NET, Linux, Python, Javascript/Node.js, Hadoop.



- Experience with developing and maintaining Cloud-based software platforms (SAAS).





Personal Characteristics:



- Strong People manager



- Passion for managing engineering organizations, and bringing them from "start-up mode" to more scalable development process (without losing the "startup mentality").



- Ability to successfully negotiate effort, timelines, features.



- Team player.



- Openness to learn, and foster continuous innovation.



- Work ethic highlighted by willingness to "roll up the sleeves" to get into the details required to get the job done.



- High integrity

jobs.title: Systems Engineer 2, Content Delivery Platforms
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

As a Systems Engineer 2, you will join a team in Comcast Wholesale responsible for engineering and operations for multiple video on demand and advertisement delivery products both traditional and over the top/IP video. The infrastructure is a combination of physical and VMWare based virtual instances with the goal of migrating to an OpenStack virtual environment with software defined networking (SDN) and object storage.





Comcast Wholesale offers media, communications, advertising and technology businesses access to the latest in networking, content delivery, subscriber experience and digital asset management, proven by an industry leader. Scalable from small independents to global brands, Comcast Wholesale's service portfolio helps businesses launch new products and remain competitive through lower up-front investment, improved efficiency and faster time to market. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast Wholesale.





Job Specification:



- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent



- Engineering, Computer Science



- Requires 2-5 years related experience



- Experience in Linux (RHEL) and Windows (Server 2008) system administration (especially networking) in a heterogeneous environment.



- Experience working in a team (10-12 engineers) interacting with other engineering teams (architecture, software development, QA, security, networking, etc.).



- Experience with networking concepts, configuration, and vendor equipment is a major plus (Cisco IOS & NX-OS, F5).



- Experience with one or more cloud compute platforms is a major plus (VMWare, AWS, OpenStack, Azure, Google Cloud).



- Familiarity with IP video/streaming formats is a major plus (HLS, MSS/Smooth, HDS, Dash, Adobe Primetime, etc.)



- Experience in a DevOps environment is a plus.



- Experience with the following is a plus (EMC Isilon, NetApp, Cleversafe, Splunk, Grafana, Sensu, Chef, Puppet, Zenoss).



- Experience with maintaining video based software applications solving for video specific applications is a plus (Telestream FlipFactory, Rhozet Carbon Coder, Elemental Encoder, Interra Baton).



- Familiarity with Content Delivery Networks (CDN) is a plus.





Core Responsibilities:

- Ability to troubleshoot and repair all but the most complex issues. Performs maintenance activities with a minimum of supervision and guidance. Leads technical outage bridges and engages appropriate

resources to drive issues to closure.

- Acts as an advocate for Engineering Operations procedures, policies, and processes. Ensures projects and initiatives are adhering to Company standards.

- Tracks and reports operational workflows; maintains records of results and feedback. Analyzes data and metrics, identifies problem areas, and provides actionable insight.

- Acts as a technical resource in projects and initiatives and ensures successful project implementation.

- Contributes to design considerations for new products or architectural changes to existing products.

- Analyses problems in design, configuration, data flow, and data state within a highly complex multi-product provisioning system.

- Performs routine maintenance tests for designated areas of engineering and ensures all maintenance is properly validated to minimize impact.

- Provides training and guidance to less experienced team members.

- Attains industry standard certifications and education.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

jobs.title: Sr Program Manager
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




thePlatform, a part of Comcast Wholesale, is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.



thePlatform, the industry-leading provider of broadband video management and publishing solutions, is seeking an experienced Technical Program Manager to work with our product development and cloud computing groups as technical product owner.



This position requires strong experience in software design.This is not a Project Manager role.You will need to have a strong technical program management background as well as several years of software development experience. We are looking for candidates that have a proven ability to design solutions based on a service-oriented architecture, can drive design across multiple teams, and thrive in a strong, collaborative relationship between program managers, developers, and QA engineers as partners in the delivery of quality services.



Core Responsibilities:




  • As a technical product owner, work with development and operations teams to establish overall product vision, create user stories, manage and prioritize the product backlog, participate in daily scrums and meta-scrums, and validate delivered software designs.

  • Partners with engineering project manager to provide consultative direction and develops long term objectives and plans to determine resources, technology and course of action to achieve results.

  • Participates in the product lifecycle process. Contributes to and creates product and technical requirements, detailed design documents including transaction, capacity and bandwidth models, systems definitions, and operational procedures as part of this process.

  • Understands key business drivers and applies the knowledge of internal/external business issues to improve products and services.

  • Anticipates and interprets customer needs, assesses requirements and identifies solutions.

  • Ensures that projects are properly accepted into the engineering team, worked on in a timely and efficient manner and smoothly transitioned into customer use.

  • Interprets internal/external business issues and recommends complete solutions based on best practices and proven technologies.

  • Solves complex problems. Takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions.

  • Provides guidance for the performance and reliability of various cross-platform applications and services. Ensures that system failures are restored in a timely manner.

  • Participates in the review of failures and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences.

  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.



Requirements:




  • At least 5 years technical program management experience in a software product development environment including direct experience in operational cloud computing.

  • Proven design experience with SOA, design patterns and web service technologies.

  • At least 4 years software experience at an engineering level. Proficiency in Java a plus.

  • Proven experience as a technical leader. Demonstrated ability to lead the design and development of complex applications.

  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of projects from inception to rollout and maintenance.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability and confidence to work closely with select customers in pre-sales and collaborative scenarios.

  • A BS degree in computer science or a related field is required.

  • Knowledge of video encoding and video delivery highly preferred.

Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






This individual reports to the Chief Technology Officer. The role entails managing technology and the integration of several of our Existing Business Lines (EBL). The EBL include several mature e-products and services that focus on a specific technology domain (ad sales support and workflow systems, data warehousing and reporting systems, billing support systems, media distributions systems).





Responsibilities:

- Personnel management indirect supervision of EBL leadership

- Program management and Execution manage plans, timelines, and interdependencies between different engineering teams.

- SDLC Manage and improve the Software development and release process where necessary, with special attention to automated testing, DevOps, and scalable development.

- Technical Leadership interface with Senior Engineering leaders, Product Management and other business functions to build a unified approach in a collaborative manner.

- Change Management evolve organization to reflect dual goal of commercial product development as well as professional service provider





Skills and Specifications:

- BA in Computer Science or related discipline required, MS or MA degree in Computer Science or related discipline preferred.

- 15+ years of previous experience in a VP Engineering position, overseeing leaders / multiple products in multiple locations

- Deep experience with software development methodologies, release management, quality assurance and automated testing, etc.

- Experience with managing and evolving legacy business-critical software that needs ongoing feature development to stay competitive

- Experience with managing professional service organizations or initiative, including process around SLAs, RACIs, customer satisfaction

- Experience with initiating and managing organizational change to reflect evolving business needs, including change impact analysis and change readiness assessment

- Experience with developing and maintaining Cloud-based software platforms (SAAS) as well as Customer-Premise software platforms.

- Organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics

- Problem solving and root cause identification skills

- Acute business acumen and understanding of organizational issues and challenges

- Familiarity with project management approaches, tools and phases of the project lifecycle





Personal Characteristics:

- Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others

- Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal

- Strong negotiation skills

- Strong people manager

- Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, to a variety of audiences

- Excellent active listening skills

- Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations

- Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere

- Forward looking with a holistic approach

- Able to work effectively at all levels in an organization






Comcast is an Affirmative Action/EEO employer M/F/D/V

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




As part of a team dedicated to Comcast's video playback experience, you'll have direct impact on the consumer experience of watching video over the web. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and realtime analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Combine your software engineering skills with the latest web and mobile technologies and come work as a Software Engineer at thePlatform, the leading online video management and publishing company.



Skills & Requirements

B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

3+ years experience

Passion for HTML5 and Javascript development

Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

Familiar with a scripting language

Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

Experience with version control tools such as git.

Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

Experience with multi-threading programing

Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Software Application Support Specialist
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






TECHNICAL AND PRODUCTION SERVICES (TAPS)



- TECHNICAL AND PRODUCTION SPECIALIST



Summary



The TAPS Technical and Production Specialist provides advanced STRATA software support to the Client Service, Onsite Training, and Sales departments, assists in maintaining the STRATA hosted application environment, and works directly with clients to resolve complicated technical issues. The Technical and Production Specialist documents and prioritizes support issues, refers them to the Product Management Department (SWAT), if required, and monitors those issues until they are concluded. The Technical and Production Specialist reports directly to the Director of Technical and Production Services.



Minimum Requirements



The successful candidate for the Technical and Production Specialist Position will meet all of the following requirements:



Skills:



Proficiency in supporting Microsoft applications and technologies, including but not limited to:




  • Windows Client and Server operating systems.

  • Relational database management systems including MS SQL Server and MS Office Access.

  • MS Office applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

  • MS Terminal Services or Citrix.


  • Scripting experience such as PowerShell




  • Experience with C++, C# or Java is a plus



  • A solid understanding of information technology.

  • An aptitude for troubleshooting problems with hardware and peripheral devices.

  • Strong technical written and verbal communication skills.


  • BA or BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.





Essential Functions



The TAPS Technical and Production Specialist is responsible for the following:



Responding to, troubleshooting, and resolving daily problems and requests forwarded by Client Service representatives.



Working directly with STRATA clients to resolve complicated technical issues. This may include inheriting particularly challenging or sensitive issues from Client Service Representatives, or if otherwise requested to do so by a manager.



Working directly with members of other STRATA departments, including Onsite Training, Sales, and SWAT as required.



Supporting the STRATA hosted application environment by performing installations, upgrades and other needed tasks.



Escalating urgent problems requiring more in-depth knowledge to the appropriate internal resources, such as SWAT.



Monitoring the status of issues in the “Mantis” issue tracking software on a daily basis, when the manager is not available to do so.



Expanding their own knowledge of STRATA products and of the underlying technologies required to support those products (e.g. Operating systems, database platforms, etc.).



Documenting customer feedback concerning software use, needed application adjustments, and enhancement requests.



Performing an on-going analysis of all applicable STRATA programs to identify possible improvements.



Updating TAPS resources including shared knowledge bases, and the documentation used to support the hosted application environment.



Updating documentation to support the use of STRATA’s Agency software products, if required.



Assisting in quality assurance testing for STRATA’s Agency software products, if required.



Providing guidance to Client Service Representatives who are working on special projects (e.g. Writing documentation, product testing, etc.)



Assisting the Client Service Manager in identifying training needs and/or improvement opportunities for the Client Service Department.



Ensuring the continuous operation of the help desk by answering calls from clients during times when there are not enough Client Service Representatives available.



Performing certain essential job functions outside of business hours, including on weekends, if required.



Carrying out other duties requested of them which are within their capabilities.



Carrying out all essential job functions in a courteous and professional manner.



Working conditions



Workplace – All employees are responsible for maintaining a professional, courteous, and respectful workplace environment. Each employee must conduct himself/herself appropriately without causing disruption for other STRATA employees, and adhere to the policies outlined in the STRATA Policy Manual.



Attendance – be punctual and available to help clients and STRATA employees when his/her shift begins (or when returning from a “break”).



Education:



BA or BS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field.



MA or MS in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field is preferred.



Success factors



The successful Technical and Production Specialist will be able to interface with clients and coworkers and employ a high degree of tact and diplomacy to promote a positive image of the TAPS Department. They will be able to resolve problematic situations in a professional manner, build strong partnerships with end users by projecting a positive attitude, and provide helpful support whenever required. They will demonstrate the ability to deliver against service level agreements to continually increase customer satisfaction




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Senior .NET Engineer
jobs.content:
STRATA is an advertising technology leader headquartered in Chicago.  A wholly owned subsidiary of a Fortune 100 company, with over 30 years of experience building innovative software products that have set the standard in the media industry.  As we continue to develop new systems and technologies that benefit our clients, we are actively seeking talented professionals in the following area(s): traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Summary The Software Developer is responsible for developing .NET, web-based software solutions. This development will occur in an Agile environment, typically in fixed-length sprints (Scrum methodology), with regular interactions with Product Owners and other team members. The Software Developer is expected to produce high-quality software, to function effectively as a member of a team, to interact with management and other members of the development group, and to continually seek to improve themselves and the company.



Essential Functions The Senior Software Developer must be able to write quality software based on the provided designs and specifications, within reasonable timeframes, and to be effective members of their department and company. The Senior Software Developer must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously when asked. The Senior Software Developer needs to be able to work with a range of technologies (e.g., Windows applications and services, websites and web services, XML schemas, relational databases), languages (e.g., C#, VB.NET, T-SQL, JavaScript, HTML, XML), and applications (Visual Studio, SQL Server, etc.). The Senior Software Developer must demonstrate good analytical abilities, attention to detail, and strong verbal and written communication skills in English.





Job Knowledge, skills and abilities (KSA's)



- At least 5 years of experience as a developer (lead developer would be a plus).



- Proficiency in the following programming languages and applications:



- C# and/or VB.NET for web applications and servers



- JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for web applications



- SQL Server 2008 or greater, relational database design and programming



- Significant experience with:



- Modern JavaScript-powered web applications (Angular, React, Backbone, Ember, etc.) and the "Single Page Application" (SPA) architecture



- REST/RESTful web service design and programming (Web API, Nancy, ServiceStack, etc.)



- Unit testing frameworks (NUnit, xUnit, Jasmine, etc.)



- Package management (npm, Bower, NuGet, etc.)



- Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environment



- Excellent debugging and troubleshooting abilities



- Excellent communication skills





Strongly Desired:



- Experience with:




  • Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)

  • Message queues or event bus technologies (MSMQ, RabbitMQ, NServiceBus, etc.)

  • Automated builds/Continuous Integration/Deployment (Jenkins, CruiseControl, TFS, etc.)

  • Cloud-based services (SaaS/IaaS/PaaS)

  • Data warehouses, reporting, and analysis

  • Very large database (VLDB) design and tuning

  • XML, XML Schemas, XPath queries, etc.

  • Familiarity with the Media/Cable industry



Working conditions The Senior Software Developer will work within the company's offices, based on hours agreed upon by their manager. The Software Developer will be expected to dress and behave professionally.



Minimum qualifications and requirements



MS Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field plus 2 years' experience in a Software Developer position.



OR



Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field plus 5 years' experience in a Software Developer position



Success factors Successful employees will have demonstrable ability with one or more key programming languages and technologies (C#, VB.NET, JavaScript, SQL Server), will consistently meet deadlines, and will do their part to help to deliver high-quality, functional software to the client in accordance with business needs. Successful employees must understand the entire product life-cycle and provide appropriate feedback through implementation, documentation and testing wherever appropriate.



Supervisory responsibilities The Senior Software Developer will have no supervisory responsibilities, but must function well within project teams, working with Product Managers, tech leads, and other team members.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer
