jobs.title: Business Systems Analyst - Financial Systems
jobs.content:
GitHub is looking for a full-time Financial Systems Analyst to join our new Business Systems team to manage, scale, and expand our Financial systems and technology.

The Business Systems Team is a new addition to GitHub that's developing new ideas to help scale the company as it moves to the next level. Tasked with the exciting challenges of the growing company, you will be expected to find new capabilities, recommend best practices to our business parters, recommend business systems of choice, and drive their implementations and integration.

The Role

GitHub is the gateway for software development. Our impact and customers are global, and so is our vision. We're looking for someone who will materially advance our business and culture.

Your role will be the administrator and gate-keeper of our Financial Systems, assist in building out our vision for business systems including business process designs, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance. We are ever-evolving and improving so you will be on the lookout for ways to enhance our internal processes and how to impact those improvements in our systems.

You'll partner with other awesome teams here at GitHub, such as Finance (Accounting and Strategic Finance), Product, Sales, Marketing and Engineering to transform their challenges into systems-driven solutions. Collectively, we're a resourceful bunch that enjoys mastering new and sometimes difficult subject matters, strives for efficient and effective processes, and works both independently and as part of a goal-oriented team.

Our primary customers are our internal business partners. We like to make sure they are set up to be successful by assisting in general change management during the introduction of process or system changes. Training and documentation is key though we're tactful in how we roll these out to keep us all nimble and focused on executing.

This position is based in our San Francisco office and reports to the Business Systems Manager, Financial Systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Administer, design, and scale our Record-2-Report and Procure-2-Pay processes and systems (GL, PO, AP, AM, RevRec, Financial Reports)

  • Assist to build business systems roadmap to include business process design, system implementations, project management, change management, training and information security compliance

  • Build cross-functional partnerships in order to translate business requirements into systems-driven solutions

  • Support continuous improvement and evaluate impact and prioritization of individual projects

  • Document end-2-end business processes, maintain best practices, procedures, and controls established within the internal financial reporting systems

  • Collaborate with leadership across all functions to drive decisions and execution plan

  • Maintain professional knowledge and skill relating to security, compliance, technology and best practices and make recommendations for process or service improvements, cost reductions and efficiencies

  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2-3 years of work experience in Financial or related systems administration

  • Experience working with Netsuite, Zuora, CallidusCloud, SFDC, or Coupa

  • Proven track record of cross functional collaboration

  • Knowledge of financial reports (balance sheet, income statement, cashflow)

  • Ability to work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment with some ambiguity and a need for directing energy and thinking

  • Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

  • Self-starter and ability to multi-task while performing a variety of complex tasks

About GitHub

With the collaborative features of GitHub.com, our desktop and mobile apps, and GitHub Enterprise, it has never been easier for individuals and teams to write better code, faster.

jobs.title: Director of Security Operations
jobs.content:
GitHub is changing the way the world builds software and we want you to help change the way we build and secure GitHub. We're looking for an experienced technical director to help lead a vibrant and geographically distributed group of engineers and analysts as they continue to protect the source code for millions of projects. This role is not about dictating or managing a team member's work directly, but rather guiding and serving to ensure the happiness and productivity of the entire Security Operations group. The primary goal of this job is to enable each team to do the best work of their lives.

As a technical director, you will lead both engineering and operations managers, as well as individual engineers and analysts in key roles. You will advocate for them and work to hire a diverse group of incredibly talented people. You will also help guide technical decisions and set the standard for how Security Operations is performed at GitHub.

If you have a foundation in information security, enjoy supporting humans across all experience levels from fresh-out-of-college associates to seasoned senior engineers, and fancy helping build a world class security team, then this might be the gig for you.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Serving as a great people leader for the team, meeting with members 1-1 on a regular basis, giving guided performance feedback, and helping individuals plan and execute on their career development objectives.
  • Serving as the hiring manager for the team to bring in new engineers who not only complement the existing team's skills, but who also have new perspectives, ideas, and experiences.
  • Guiding the team's vision, helping build roadmaps, ensuring projects get staffed effectively, and setting priorities that align with both the team and the company's goals.
  • Leading small group discussions about security issues with both technical and non-technical audiences, while making sure discussion highlights are captured in written form to benefit those not present.
  • Being passionate about creating and fostering good security practices and processes throughout the company.
  • Establishing and maintaining intra-department, cross-department, and management level communications.
  • Managing team budgets, external consultants, and service provider contracts.
  • Performing on-call rotations in an Incident Coordinator capacity.

The minimum qualifications are:

  • 5+ years of personnel management of small to medium sized engineering teams.
  • 10+ years of technical experience with several years focused on security engineering and operations, while having a strong foundation in other areas, such as application, system, and network security.
  • Demonstrated software development experience with Go, Ruby and Rails, bash, python, or other languages.
  • Experience working as a remote employee, and managing distributed teams.
  • Technical project management with a proven ability to meet objectives.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a strong sense of empathy and the ability to advocate for your team.
  • Solid understanding of large-scale web applications and infrastructure.

Bonus points if you:

  • Are an active contributor to open source security projects and/or security community initiatives.
  • Have had exposure to different software development life-cycles.
  • Are familiar with the open source community in general.
  • Have a working knowledge of Git and GitHub.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
The QA team is looking for an SDET that has a passion for testing complex applications and systems at scale.  You have demonstrated expertise in assessing quality with respect to service contracts, performance, reliability in addition to the standard competencies around software design, testing, and automation.







Responsibilities:


  • Design and build automation systems that reliably validate product code

  • Participate in code and design reviews

  • Advocate for the testability of product code

  • Suggest quality measures to be implemented

  • Write and implement test plans

  • Help development team diagnose and test fixes

  • Aiding issue fixing by recreating issues for Production team review

  • Recommend and utilize appropriate tools needed to better automate testing

jobs.title: Freelance Creative Director
jobs.content:
MKTG’s Studio is on the lookout for an ambitious, oddly versatile Creative Director to create high-touch storytelling experiences through visual, environmental and digital platforms. We want someone who, first and foremost, is passionate about collaboration and wants to bring big, transformative ideas to the table, leading designers to realize big vision for a premium portfolio of B2C and B2B clients. The role will bring big, transformative ideas to the table for new business initiatives and lead teams to realize vision for a premium portfolio of clients. The Creative Director is a true team player looking to become part of a vibrant culture of nice people that know how to work hard and have FUN. You should feel comfortable being uniquely yourself in an agency environment; weird hair and funky socks are highly encouraged.

The Creative Director will work hand-in-hand with MKTG strategy, account, production, and Studio services managing current and incoming assignments from inception to completion.

Note: We are looking for CDs interested in freelance roles with the opportunity for longer term engagement or employment.

Primary areas of responsibility include:
• Leading strategic and creative development against RFPs, new business opportunities and agreed upon client business objectives for integrated and experiential marketing initiatives
• Ensuring the proper Creative team is in place to manage the account appropriately including all of the creative disciplines that the Studio offers
• Developing the attendee and/or consumer journey through a variety of creative mediums
• Working closely with Program Activation and Strategy and Engagement department leads to ensure all client deliverables are being met and has the proven ability to partner to manifest concepts within budget while adhering to tight timelines
• Approving organizational plan of Creative team(s)
• Art directing, training, mentoring and developing Creative staff abilities and efficiencies with the intent of taking the best of all possible product offerings to market
• Knowing and coordinating all issues related to the development of programming, concepts and marketing-driven solutions for clients while owning the consumer journey
• Developing and presenting creative solutions on behalf of the agency that are informed by research and data and which generate a demonstrable ROI for our clients

Qualifications/Skill Requirements:
• A proven track record of 10+ years successful, relevant, industry strategy and brand development experience, preferably within an agency setting
• Experiential/events experience is a MUST
• B2B and conference experience is a plus
• A clear understanding of B2C and/or B2B marketing needs and initiatives (particularly in the areas of technology, lifestyle, sports and entertainment)
• Skill to develop decks and various communication vehicles with account and production teams that address client’s strategy and tactical concerns
• Capacity to facilitate brainstorming sessions and workshops designed toward specific outputs and client solutions
• Presence and experience to interface at the executive level, developing and maintaining client relationships and negotiating change within the business and within the brand
• Strong communication skills: written, verbal, presentations, meeting facilitation and email in both individual and group settings
• Extremely strong writing skills relevant to the articulation of marketing strategy and supporting content 
• Ability to generate and present thought leadership on behalf of the agency
• Fundamental understanding of market research and marketing to develop marketing-driven solutions for our clients
• Passion and intelligence to translate work with creative studio to oversee the visual manifestation of ideas and concepts

jobs.title: Backend/API Developer
jobs.content: The foremost responsibility of this position is development of (and maintaining of) the backend-end and middle-ware of our flagship product. Development is predominantly in Python with some C/C++. Strong backend-end development skills are a must with the ability to rapidly prototype and work collaboratively with other developers (including our overseas developers). It is important that a candidate be energetic and enthusiastic about this kind of work, with a "take charge" attitude and willingness to devour existing code/documentation to take ownership (or rewrite it if you think you have a better solution). In addition, this position requires work on internal tools and automation. Some basic web development/design skills are a plus. If you are interested in software security this position provides the opportunity to participate in security research.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.content:
The InComm Software Engineering Organization is hiring! We have a Joel score of 11, work on really interesting projects in a growing sector of financial services, and we are looking for talented and passionate engineers to join our team. 


We provide opportunity for upward mobility and advancement, technical and business training, a flexible, modern work environment and a great company culture. 


Developers would be primarily responsible for implementing new features for lnComm's stand-in platforms. Developers would also be responsible for replicating production issues in lower environments and patching code.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
InComm Agent Solutions represents the cutting-edge of payment processing, offering customers an innovative proprietary platform that allows consumers to make cash payments to an ever-expanding roster of service providers. Custom designed from the ground-up, the IAS platform can be run concurrently at multiple sites to give increased resilience and complete service reliability. Plus, each interface can be customized to meet the unique needs of any retailer or service partner. This architecture allows each agent to be implemented, operated, and managed separately from one another, while optimizing the processing capacities for each.



The IAS platform offers:



  • Next generation complete application and interface design

  • Exclusive web-based, fully-secure virtual payment system that connects to any broadband internet connection

  • Automated self-service kiosks that accept credit card, debit card, cash and check payments

  • Seamless integration with any billing platform



By simplifying your payment processing, we maximize your revenue by minimizing your headaches. For more information, please review: http://www.IASnet.com



Day-to-day responsibilities include but are not limited to:



  • Develop high quality, efficient and defect-free applications, tools and other modules in C#, .NET, Transact SQL and other applicable languages and tools. Modifying existing applications. Must have experience in WCF web services, SOA Architecture, MVC including supporting UI technologies such as JQuery. Has expertise in object oriented design concepts. Must possess the ability to work in a team environment preferably SCRUM team environments, have excellent communication skills and a cooperative, collaborative and positive attitude.

  • Must be detail oriented and submit source code with a minimum of errors. Respond quickly and effectively to correct defects reported by the quality assurance team in code you have authored and that of others. Develop and execute comprehensive unit tests.

  • Respond to production outages as your highest priority and quickly resolve those problems with a minimal disruption of business activities. These outages may occur after business hours on weekends. In rare cases, you will be called upon to assist in the resolution of outages

  • Actively participate in periodic source code reviews as a recipient and as a lead. Adhere to all communicated software development standards and practices.

  • Must be a self-starter and have the ability to learn new tools, concepts and computer languages through self-learning. Programming guidance will be given by other team members as required.

  • Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of this position.

jobs.title: Full-Stack .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
Come join the InGen team and help us build solid web and mobile applications.


We are looking for entrepreneurs and craftsmen passionate about developing great software for new problems. As a full-stack developer, you will work with SaSS, HTML, JS and server-side C# and databases that range from MSSQL Server to Oracle.

jobs.title: Front End Engineering Lead
jobs.content:
We’re looking for exceptional engineering candidates to join our team. We care deeply about making a difference in people’s lives and hope you do too!


Responsibilities



  • Take the charge on building and improving our React-based application.

  • Work with a small and nimble engineering team on designing and developing core product functionality

  • Lead large cross-platform projects across web and mobile experiences.

  • Collaborate with key partners including product management, data science, behavioral health specialists

  • Ensure that best practices are adhered to at all phases of development.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Here's a bit more about the Software Engineer position:



The Software Engineer is responsible for designing and analyzing applications, developing project plans, coding, testing and documenting all code utilizing Java and web-based programming tools.  The Developer will also be responsible for maintaining and upgrading existing applications and will communicate with customers to understand their requirements and assist in the implementation of work requests.



Java: Candidate will be responsible for creating software that is both customer-facing and internal, primarily in the Java programming language.  Candidate must demonstrate proficiency with common aspects of the Java language such as generics, collections, auto-boxing, as well as awareness of common software patterns.



Object-Oriented Design: The candidate must demonstrate a solid grasp of object-oriented design principles, such as polymorphism, encapsulation, the Liskov substitution principle, composition, and inheritance as they are expressed in the Java language.



Common Enterprise Software: We use several industry standard Java libraries, tools and frameworks that the ideal candidate will have experience with: Spring, Hibernate, JSP, Struts, Tomcat, Maven and Jetty.



Relational Database Systems: Interface with a relational database is done via both SQL and through the Hibernate object-relational mapper, but the latter is not a substitute for the former, so understanding of common SQL constructs including joins, sub-selects and grouping, preferably with experience in Oracle syntax and tools, is required.  If you can expound on the merits or demerits of object-relational impedance mismatches bonus points will be awarded.



The Browser is the Client: Knows how to use the browser as the exclusive client interface to server-side business logic. Understands the basics of the http protocol and the ramifications of its stateless nature, the basics of what web browsers do both in the html/CSS presentation layer and how JavaScript interacts with the DOM to effect client-side behavior using vanilla JavaScript or jQuery.



Web Services: Is a veteran of consuming remote web services via SOAP and REST clients.



Job Responsibilities:



  • Design and analyze applications, develop project plans, code, test and document all code

  • Maintain and upgrade existing applications

  • Interface with customers to assist in implementation of work requests

  • Assist support personnel in resolving moderately complex program problems

jobs.title: Principal Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Be a core part of the Data Platform team and help deliver the promise of a better and more interesting tomorrow today. Use data from over 25 million consumers to provide the customers with enhancements, feedback, and that “wow, that’s awesome!” moment that only big data can give as they build out their Perfect Trip.



  • In the first 12 months you will:

  • Implement algorithms and solutions to the burning business questions that have driven over 22 years of success in the travel and expense industry

  • Define and develop Auditing related solutions and blaze the trail by identifying new patterns

  • Enhance the technology behind Concur’s Big Data and advanced analytics strategy

  • Work closely with your peers on product and audit teams to integrate your offerings into our products and tech stacks

  • Grow the community of Data Scientists across Concur and facilitate information sharing and cross-pollination of ideas between analytical organizations




In order to accomplish this you will need to have:



  • Solid grounding in applied mathematics and statistics, including some of the following or related techniques: Bayesian modeling, multivariate regression, logistic regression, support vector machines, neural networks, cluster analysis, decision trees, time series analysis and forecasting, factor analysis, structural equation modeling, item response theory, and Markov chains

  • Strong visualization skills using Tableau or similar platforms and toolkits

  • Results driven personality, high enthusiasm, energy, and confidence

jobs.title: SW Mobile Engineer Senior
jobs.content:
TripIt, the leading mobile trip management service from Concur, Inc.



TripIt is a business unit of Concur®, the leading provider of integrated travel and expense management solutions for companies of all sizes. Concur’s easy-to-use web-based and mobile solutions help companies and their employees control costs and save time. Learn more at www.concur.com.



TripIt's web and mobile service is praised by travelers and industry notables, including TechCrunch, the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal and by thousands of bloggers worldwide. We’ve been called “absolutely awesome”, “addictive” and “a seriously powerful travel tool.” Just search Google or Twitter for TripIt and see for yourself. We’re located in spacious new offices in the sunny Mission District in San Francisco, close to BART and several MUNI lines.



Overview:


This position will have you working on TripIt's mobile applications, initially focusing on the iPhone, Blackberry, and Google Android platforms. You must be passionate about developing new technologies and solving difficult technical problems. You should have a good sense of product design, have solid development habits (e.g., unit testing, technical design documentation, etc.), have good experience with backend web technologies. Most importantly, you should not be afraid to dive into new and unfamiliar technologies. Programming experience with iPhones, or J2ME is a strong plus, but it is not required.

jobs.title: Principal Software Design Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software and technology? Do you want to work in an Agile environment that is dynamic, challenging and constantly evolving? Come help us with the continued transformation of our platform into a highly scalable and robust Data Architecture. Your work will reach millions of customers around the world!


In the first 12 months you will deliver:


Contribute to an industry-leading analytics platform: As part of the team you will be involved in the development of the backend data integration architecture that drives our analytics platform.


You will be part of an end-to-end service: Working closely with an agile team to deliver your work to our customers.


Turn requirements into product: Work with Product Owners to understand customer needs and turn them into product.



In order to accomplish this you will need to:



  • Build features in our data integration architecture.

  • Good understanding of complex data driven systems and distributed computing.

  • Building systems in a SaaS/Cloud environment.

  • Review of designs and code.

  • Feeling of end-to-end ownership of releases.

  • Ability to be a self-starter with a results driven attitude.

  • Ability to work individually as part of a team.

jobs.title: Cloud Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
Tenable Network Security delivers comprehensive security solutions that provide continuous visibility and critical context, enabling decisive actions to protect your organization.  Transform security with Tenable, the creators of Nessus and pioneers of continuous monitoring.

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products and customers!


Tenable now has over 600 employees globally and over 20,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by Glassdoor, The Washington Post, The Baltimore Sun, The Washingtonian, The Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.


The Cloud Services Engineer position will support the implementation of Cloud technologies for Tenable. The position will utilize strong technical skills as part of a team of engineers responsible for the automated deployment and support of full application stacks from the system (Linux) up through a custom application in all cloud environments. Cross-functional collaboration with internal teams to ensure a consistent and high-quality level of service delivery will be a critical focus.


Role Requirements:



  • Responsible for responding to support escalations which involve troubleshooting complex technical problems and resolving data/configuration issues within defined service level objectives

  • Responsible for developing software, tools, and scripts to automate deployment, management, and monitoring of production systems in all environments

  • Provide strategic and thought leadership among peers on complex projects

  • Collaboration with cloud engineers in understanding new cloud technologies, assessing impact to security services operations, and proposing solutions to existing business problems

  • Collaboration in the software development lifecycle to develop detailed enhancement/bug definitions, write functional requirements, translate the requirements into solution designs, and navigate the functional requirements through to Production deployments

  • Proactively look for ways to create efficiencies within operations as it pertains to the tools and technology used by Tenable to support their customer base

  • Manage, participate in, or directly work on any additional projects, assignments, or initiatives assigned by management

  • Create/maintain documentation for operational procedures

  • Document and perform system upgrades, application updates, and define monitoring requirements based on customer needs

  • Participate in an on-call rotation

jobs.title: Software Developer for Scientific Applications
jobs.content:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented software developers to create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. We maintain high standards in all our software development efforts, utilizing modern development practices including continuous integration, test-driven development, and code reviews in order to develop high quality, maintainable, and reusable code. By employing a lightweight development process, we remain highly productive and responsive to changing customer needs.



We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.



Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new languages, tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.



Minimum Requirements:




  • B.S. in computer science, physics, math, engineering, or a related field

  • Substantial software development experience

  • Object-oriented design and programming in Java or C++

  • Ability to implement, understand, and maintain mathematical and scientific codes

  • U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation



Desired:




  • M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science or a scientific or engineering field with substantial software development experience



Experience in any of the following is a plus:




  • Cross-platform software development on Linux, Windows, Mac

  • 3D graphics using Open Scene Graph and/or OpenGL

  • User interface development with Qt, Java Swing, Gwt

  • Supercomputing, OpenMP, threads, MPI, GPUs

  • Microsoft Visual Studio, Qt Creator, Eclipse

  • Google closure or similar tools for large-scale javascript development

  • OSGi, orekit, commons.math

  • Image processing, imagery analysis, or computer vision

  • Aerospace vehicles, orbital mechanics, electromagnetics, space situtational awareness

  • Directed energy modeling and simulation

  • Computer aided design (CAD)



A representative sample of your code may be requested early in the evaluation process, e.g. something you've written for work, for a class, or for fun. It need not compile, but should be long enough to help evaluate your programming and software engineering skills.



Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its developers and scientists to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

jobs.title: C++ Expert
jobs.content:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented scientists and software developers to create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. We develop custom software products and perform research and development in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, computational electromagnetics (CEM), monitoring the health and status of on-orbit satellites, high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools for building spacecraft models.



We maintain high standards in all our software development efforts, utilizing modern development practices including continuous integration, test-driven development, and code reviews in order to develop high quality, maintainable, and reusable code. By employing a lightweight development process, we remain highly productive and responsive to changing customer needs.



Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced scientists; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new languages, tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.



This C++ Expert position is seeking a top-tier C++ software engineer, focusing strongly on large-scale C++ development. The job requires a high level of software development productivity and the ability to mentor other developers on best practices, language standards, and new language features. Applicants will be asked to submit a modern and compelling C++ example.



Minimum Requirements:




  • B.S. in computer science, math, engineering, or a related field

  • Substantial software development experience

  • Mastery of The C++ Standard Library (STL)

  • Mastery of commonly-used Boost C++ libraries

  • Working knowledge of the C++11 standard, and familiarity with the C++14 standard

  • Working knowledge of C++ template metaprogramming

  • Cross-platform development in C++

  • Advanced object-oriented design skills

  • Enjoy learning new technologies and leading edge development practices

  • U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base



Desired:




  • M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science or a scientific or engineering field with substantial C++ development experience.



Experience in any of the following areas is a plus:




  • Contributing to open source projects and interacting with open source communities

  • Supercomputing applications development

  • IDEs (e.g., Microsoft Visual Studio, Qt Creator, Eclipse) or editor extensions to efficiently search, refactor, and debug large projects

  • Multiple compilers and their standards conformance differences

  • git, Subversion

  • CMake

  • Qt



Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its developers and scientists to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

jobs.title: Senior Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
Campspot created and maintains a reservation, management, and payment system for clients managing campgrounds and boutique resorts. Our management system stands out for its ease-of-use and powerful optimization engine, which ensure clients get the maximum return on each spot in their property. The Campspot software product is currently built with JavaScript and Java using AngularJS, Dropwizard, and Loopback.


Campspot is looking for a Senior Operations Engineer. This person will be responsible for Campspot's production infrastructure, handling performance, scaling, security, and networking, as well as supporting business operations with data management and customer administration. This person will also work closely with our development team on management of our build and test infrastructure as well as on development tooling.


In a typical day, our Senior Operations Engineer would manage production deployments, support business functions like onboarding new customers, monitor systems and applications for and address emergent issues, seek to improve existing production and development infrastructure, and provide operational support to the development team.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Scottsdale, AZ
URL: www.mgcare.com

Job Description: The primary objective of this position will be the support and modification of MCSI's benefit management system. The Web Developer position will require the use of PHP, JavaScript, and other web technologies to provide support to internal and external customers in the implementation and support of new business and workflows. The Web Developer will work with other departments, such as Tools and Business Analysis, as needed. The Web Developer will need to respond in a timely manner to aggressive deadlines. The Web Developer will need to understand basic networking, web server configuration, and other similar technologies in order to assist in the initial analysis and triage of support incidents.
Technical Skills:
  • Required: PHP, JavaScript, JSON, Apache configuration
  • Optional: MongoDB, SQL (MySQL and MS SQL), Java, Python, C, Jasper Reports
Business Experience Desired: Candidates with experience in health benefit management, implementing large systems, leading long-term projects, financial services reporting, compliance and security will move to the front of the line.
Personal Skills: Having the ability to communicate complex and technical subjects in language that makes it accessible to non-technical business professionals is essential. The ability to use jargon when appropriate with peers and then being able to communicate the same information in layman’s terms is necessary for this position.
Position requirements: This is a telecommuting position requiring you to work from your own professional home-office. You must have a quiet working environment with fast and reliable internet. You will be provided the necessary computer and telephony equipment and be reimbursed for reasonable internet service expenses. The candidate must live in the US and expected working hours will be best suited for someone that resides in the Central or Eastern time zones. Due to the security requirements of our industry, all candidates will be subject to a background check and security screening prior to hire.
Opportunity: This is a position with great opportunity for growth. Aptitude and attitude will far out-weigh experience. As long as you come to the table with tenacity and eagerness to learn, training will be provided. MCSI is a 20 year old company using state of the art technology to develop automated solutions for complicated workflows for the health benefits management industry. Salary will be commensurate with experience and Medical and Dental benefits are provided.

To apply: Send Resume to hr-jobposting@mgcare.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
It is the primary responsibility of the development team to design and build tools that will help our customers provide quality health care at a lower cost.  As a Software Developer, you will assist with the integration, development, administration and support of our systems. The position will work closely with end users, as well as IT and Engineering staff to develop, upgrade and maintain customized applications and solutions.


Although we work in a collaborative team approach, as a Software Developer you are empowered and encouraged to use creativity to choose the best solution that fits each unique problem and then vet it with the team.  


In Software Development role at InXite Health, you can make a difference and affect change.  We welcome ideas and feel this position will give you a chance to give your ideas or thoughts on making aspects of development easier, better, faster, cheaper.


Job Duties



  • Develops software solutions using PHP, MySQL, Apache/NGINX, Linux (Ubuntu).

  • Documents solutions with clear code and comments.

  • Maintains current working knowledge of modern development tools, techniques, and equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

  • Monitors database activities to ensure data integrity, data security, and information availability.

  • Protects operations by keeping information confidential.

  • Clearly communicates service issues and development lifecycles.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer - JavaScript, MS full stack
jobs.content:
The Senior Developer is responsible for designing, developing and troubleshooting high performance and high availability web applications using both front-end technologies including HTML/CSS/LESS, JavaScript, jQuery, Knockout, WebPack, and NPM as well as back-end technologies including C#, ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, and SQL Server to meet the company’s strategic objectives. He/she is also responsible for adhering to CoStar’s development frameworks & best practices and follow CoStar’s SDLC processes.


Objectives



  • Analyze technical requirements and design new components, web pages and controls to meet CoStar’s functional, performance and availability requirements.

  • Design both front-end and back-end components that leverage the appropriate object oriented design principals and patterns to attain high reusability and maintainability.

  • Develop an in-depth understanding of CoStar’s product architecture and frameworks. Maintain and contribute to CoStar’s product platform as necessary.

  • Maintain and support CoStar’s products that are released to stakeholders and customers.

  • Build consensus among different teams working on software development projects.

  • Facilitate discussions among other developers to exchange new ideas and improvements.

  • Continually evaluate emerging technologies to identify opportunities, trends and best practices that can be used to strengthen CoStar’s technology platform and development practices.


Competencies, Knowledge & Skills



  • Possesses at least 3 years Enterprise development experience.

  • Ability to work with minimal supervision or assistance to complete tasks (after initial onboarding).

  • Possesses strong analytical and problem solving abilities.

  • Demonstrates solid knowledge of OO programming and design patterns.

  • Demonstrates solid knowledge of C# and the .NET platform

  • Demonstrates working knowledge of web application development, including:

    • HTML/DOM/CSS

    • Core JavaScript fundamentals (prototypes, closures, single threaded, promises, etc.)

    • AJAX (XmlHttpRequest, JSON, etc.)

    • Performance (code bundling, minification, image sprints, etc.)

    • AMD and/or other module patterns for client code organization



  • Demonstrates good working knowledge of web services, ideally ASP.NET MVC, WebAPI, and/or WCF

  • Demonstrates working knowledge of ADO.NET, TSQL and stored procedure development.

  • Demonstrates basic understanding of relational database design, normalization methods and performing tuning techniques.

  • Possesses direct experience with, or at least familiarity with, the Scrum agile software development methodology.

  • Demonstrates solid understanding and experience with various software testing techniques, including unit, integration, functional, and performance testing.

  • Ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas within and across teams.

  • Ability to work well with other developers and management.

  • Awareness of emerging technologies.

  • Eagerness to learn.


DC Office Benefits:



  • Work for an environmentally conscious company in an environmentally friendly building that is LEED Gold Certified

  • Available Segways and bikes for personal use - free

  • $100 / month in Metro SmartCard Benefits

  • Beautiful roof top terrace with expansive views of the city; great for lunch and after work hangouts

  • Green roof

  • Electric vehicle charging stations

  • Underground parking

  • Complete fitness center with locker rooms onsite - free

  • Onsite free Yoga

  • Complimentary Fresh fruit, juice, vegetables, and yogurts stocked daily

  • Complimentary shuttles between Metro Center and our office on L Street

  • Full HD video conference system between any CoStar office

jobs.title: Full-Time Graphic Designer
jobs.content:
OVERVIEW

We're looking for a Full-Time Graphic Designer with experience creating strong visual communications online and offline. Our Marketing Department currently consists of our Marketing Director, Art Director / Director of Photography, another Graphic Designer, two Photographers, and a Production Artist. As a Graphic Designer at Loloi, you'll work on a very wide range of creative projects including print catalogs, advertisements, brand identification, website UI/UX, and more. If you enjoy working hard with a tight-knit team on a wide range of creative challenges, this position is for you. (You'll report directly to the Marketing Director and Art Director).

THE ROLE

Design the visual communications for a variety of projects including catalogs, email campaigns, editorial layouts, advertising, producing labeling, brand identity, packaging, UI/UX design, and much more with thoughtfully consideration of the Loloi brand identity.

Collaborate regularly with creative team to brainstorm and exchange design and marketing ideas.

Ensure work is done timely and within budget.

Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

No personal ego; just a drive to create inspiring visual communications through beautiful and creative design.

Expert proficiency in Adobe CS Suite, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, and Lightroom.

Skilled and passionate in the areas of typography, color, layout, and composition.

Willingness to work overtime during busier periods.

ABOUT LOLOI RUGS

Founded in 2004, Loloi Rugs is a fast-growing family-owned company that creates artistically-designed rugs, pillows & throws for the thoughtfuly layered home. See our most recent look book here: https://issuu.com/loloi/docs/rug_booklet_final_issuu_65014ce72df2d6

To see how we create our product, view www.loloiexploresindia.com.

HOW TO APPLY

Your application must include three things:

1. Resume

2. Cover letter with requested hourly wage and available start date.

3. Link to your work portfolio.

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer -- Solving Problems that Matter
jobs.content:
We're looking for a Mechanical Engineer with at least 3 years of experience (more is better), who is very experienced at creating electro-mechanical systems, and developing highly manufacturable products that work exceptionally well for many years.

Inch is a Product Development consultancy with over 25 years of experience creating award winning products that are a pleasure to use, look great, and solve problems that matter. Take a look at our emergency oxygen generator http://www.rapidoxygen.com/, our lung rehabilitation trainer http://alv.io/, and our connected pet feeder http://pettraxinc.com/

Tell us what you've been up to. We want someone who has built lots of working prototypes, is an expert SolidWorks user, and who has brought dozens of products from concept to production.

Experience with injection molded part design, die casting, overseas suppliers, and automated assembly systems is important. Experience using Arduino, PLC, RFID, programming in Python, gaining FDA approvals, and developing medical devices is a plus.

Show off your artistic side. You probably won't be responsible for how the product looks, but you will have a significant effect on the final appearance. The products we make have to work flawlessly, and look great. You’ll need to have a lot of patience, as we often start over several times to develop a design that’s a little better than the third iteration.

Good engineering intuition is important. We expect you to anticipate many of the things that might go wrong on a new design. Give us some examples of your experiences where you showed that you understood the physics of the problems you were solving, and tell us about the failures you learned lessons from.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Who are we? CoStar Group is the leading data provider of Multi-residential and Commercial Real Estate Data in an industry valued at over 13 trillion dollars. We own and run some of the most highly trafficked sites in commercial real estate like www.Apartments.com, www.ApartmentFinder.com, www.Loopnet.com, www.LandsofAmerica.com to name a few.


Responsibilities:



  • Work in a fast-paced environment managing multiple products across the organization to include www.Apartments.com, www.LoopNet.com to name a few.

  • Manage all components in the full stack, and assist with building out server automation across the entire infrastructure. 

  • Ensure critical systems, applications, and services are always up and running by monitoring, gathering, and analyzing data from different network sources.

  • Oversee and administer the operations and processes of a virtualized environment.


Qualifications.



  • At least 5 years of experience managing a highly available public facing webserver or website.

  • Expertise in configuring, maintain and troubleshooting issues.

  • Hands-on experience in at least 2-3 of the following:



  • Chef or Puppet or similar tools,

  • F5, Web configurations, caching, and content delivery networks.

  • Scalable and open architecture of IIS.

  • Experience with monitoring tools.

  • Experience with Virtualization.

  • Scripting guru.

  • Good understanding of storage and Networking.

  • You consider yourself a borderline developer – but you know that you enjoy playing the coveted role in operations.


Good to have:



  • Experience with AWS or Azure

  • Have supported iOS or Android applications.

  • Experience with SSIS and ETL.

jobs.title: Design Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:
• Manage the technical product development process with vendors
• Oversee development process at all factories
• Engineering, technical & quality contact/conduit for external customers
• Be the conduit for all technical communication between designers and factories
• Research, sample and approve new materials, techniques, treatments and methods for application to projects in development
• Certify and approve final tooling CAD before production.
• Optimize molds for costs, parts and materials
• Work closely with designers to achieve a clear understanding of the design intent of each product as well as discuss potential areas of manufacture difficulty
• Assist in development of crude working models, prototypes and proof of concept for new projects
• Review all shot samples in tandem with the designers. Relay details and follow up via comment sheets.
• Develop an initial optimized BOM with designers and VP to ensure design intent is meshed with cost constraints
• Approve tooling CAD before tooling commences to ensure all details are known in advance of cutting steel
• Ensure all subsequent off tool shots arrive as scheduled
• Meet with designers after each shot/off tool sample is received to review all their concerns and desired changes
• Compose and send complete and timely feedback to the factories on all subsequent shots and follow up comments
• Approve final shots with CIO and VP, assisting in making the final call on when a new product is fit for production
• Create product specification sheets and inspection detail for all development projects
• Travel to China 4-6 times per year to meet with manufacturers to address current projects
• Work with the VP of Product Development and Sourcing to ensure that all timelines are followed and all deadlines met

Qualifications:
• Can do, innovative attitude
• Self starting team player
• Demonstrated drive to problem solve
• B.S. in Mechanical or Mold Engineering
• 4+ years product engineering experience with hands-on prototype development and testing
• 4+ years experience working with factories in Asia on consumer products featuring injection molding and other relevant materials (stainless steel, silicone, TPE etc.)
• Experience with vendors and manufacturing techniques
• Understanding of metals, ceramics, rubbers, plastics and related assembly techniques
• Demonstrated 3-D CAD SolidWorks experience

If you’re looking to work for a company with a culture as vibrant as the products it produces, this is the place for you. We’re a driven, yet easy-going, group of people working hard at having fun.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Poughkeepsie, NY
URL: http://userscape.com/careers.html

We're looking for a uniquely qualified individual to help us maintain our enterprise help desk solution, HelpSpot. In this role you will learn every nook and cranny of HelpSpot, developing bug fixes and feature enhancements. This role will spend significant time working in a PHP4 codebase. Experience with on-premise PHP 4 style applications is strongly preferred.

There's a lot more to this role than just maintaining HelpSpot. As a customer service focused company, providing great support is a number one priority of all employees. The person in this position can expect to spend several hours a day working directly with our customers.

This may take the form of working on a tricky support case, developing custom code under our professional services offerings, or jumping on a GoToMeeting to assist a customer with server configuration. Whatever it takes to ensure our customers are getting everything they need to provide the best service possible.

It's a very unique individual that has the combination of technical skills we need alongside the attention to customer satisfaction this position requires. It's a role for someone eager to learn and not afraid to roll up their sleeves and pitch-in.

Additional responsibilities will include working on a number of our Laravel applications including our customer management system, online store, and product website.

Please see the full description on our website: http://userscape.com/careers.html

To apply: Please see our full listing for details: http://userscape.com/careers.html
