jobs.title: Sr. UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
Senior UI/UX Designer


Are you looking to broaden your Information Technology career? If so, then UPS is the place for you!


UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence. This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.


UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team. If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Sr. UI/UX Designer will prepare the effort needed for the coming UI/UX workload assessed for the EDGE program, mainly to deliver CIPE exceptions and staffing release. We need a senior level designer who has the knowledge to drive the work and help to direct our UI/UX team. 


Details of Position: UI/UX research, analysis, design and usability testing Well-versed in UX Design Process with experience includes but not limited to contextual inquiries, affinity diagrams, survey design & analysis, wireframes, and usability testing. Highly proficient in the UX toolset adopted at UPS, plus others: Axure, and Balsamiq, plus Photoshop and Illustrator Familiar with HTML5 / CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery.


Job Duties:


Contributes to the Elicitation, Analysis, & Communication of UI/UX Needs



  • Participates in and contributes to usability studies and analysis, detailed usability testing, and the development of low and hi fidelity prototypes to ensure optimal user experience.

  • Conducts primary user research (e.g., interviews, surveys, contextual field observations, etc.) to identify issues, determine goals, and contribute to the development of UI/UX solutions.

  • Analyzes UI/UX requirements and customers’ expectations to identify and implement required tasks.

  • Elicits and analyzes moderately complex business problems and opportunities to drive optimal, cost-effective UI/UX solutions.

  • Facilitates collaboration (e.g., stakeholders, team members, customers, etc.) to address issues and ensure common understanding.

  • Works on presentations and documentation to convey UI/UX information to stakeholders and senior management to ensure consistent understanding of problems, opportunities, and solutions.

  • Assists in identifying, anticipating, and mitigating risks and potential issues to prevent project delays.

  • Elicits information and gains consensus from project stakeholders to ensure common goals are established and achieved.

  • Breaks down moderately complex concepts into smaller, comprehensible concepts for analysis to ensure appropriate level of communication and understanding for the project stakeholders.

  • Applies appropriate level of detail, based on the audience and stage of project life cycles, to ensure mapped solutions satisfy business problems and opportunities.


Contributes to User Interactive/User Experience Project Deliverables



  • Contributes to the creation and evaluation of interaction models, user/task flows, screen designs, and UI/UX details to promote ease of use and optimize the user experience.

  • Defines role-based user personas and user activity/communication-flow models to determine the needs and behaviors of various user types.

  • Conducts usability testing (onsite or remote) and socializes results with key stakeholders and developers to ensure usability objectives are based on business needs.

  • Participates in defining and prioritizing design schedules for multiple project initiatives to ensure deliverables to meet project plan requirements on a timely basis.

  • Designs intuitive, engaging design solutions to satisfy various user experiences including websites, product user interfaces and other digital initiatives, and all points in between (i.e., wireframes, flows, mockups and visual prototypes).

  • Identifies and assesses issues to communicate potential risks and impacts.

  • Collaborates with design, architecture and development teams to ensure integration of front-end design to back-end functionality.

  • Works effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure that designs are successfully created and implemented to achieve the user goals.

  • Contributes to task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, monitors, and determines solutions for project deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Monitors project activities to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Supports Emerging UI/UX Technologies, Techniques, and Trends



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Identifies new and emerging UI/UX design strategies, research techniques, and user trends to maintain industry competitiveness.

  • Determines relevance and potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.


Generates User Interactive/User Experiences Documentation



  • Creates documentation to communicate and update customers, project teams, and stakeholders during the project lifecycle.

  • Communicates and documents research, analysis, and test results to ensure consistency and accuracy.

  • Collaborates with stakeholders and customers to monitor assignment deviations, establish best practices, and document effective resolutions.

  • Documents newly created interaction models, user/task flows and screen designs to ensure consistency, reusability, and future optimization.


Supports and Maintains Stakeholder Relationships



  • Interacts with stakeholders to clarify project and business needs.

  • Provides customer service to end users to ensure value in products and services.

  • Facilitates collaboration among stakeholders to achieve project goals and objectives.

  • Establishes and maintains customer relationships to maximize products and services benefits.

  • Maintains relationships among stakeholders and technical groups to facilitate technical problem resolution.

  • Prepares reports to provide timely stakeholder updates.


Mentors and Guides Junior Team Members



  • Reviews project team accomplishments to assist with peer development and to provide project updates for management and customers.

  • Assists in identifying learning opportunities for individuals to facilitate skill development and increase knowledge level.

  • Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments for increasing and advancing skills and capabilities.

  • Listens to employee concerns to understand the situation or issue and advises accordingly to ensure appropriate action is taken.

  • Provides an environment that is interactive, participatory, supportive, and regularly provides constructive feedback to help ensure employee engagement and performance management.


Education:


The desired Sr. UI\UX Designer will possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field, or a current UPS employee with a minimum of three years of UPS experience.

jobs.title: Intermediate C# .Net Developer
jobs.content:
JOB DESCRIPTION:


Intermediate Applications Developer


Are you looking to advance your Information Technology career?  If so, then UPS is the place for you!


UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence.  This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.


UPS Information Services, a leader in information technology, is currently seeking career-minded individuals to join our team.  If you are highly motivated with a degree in Computer Science or related discipline, then UPS is a great place for you to advance your career.


Job Description:


The Intermediate Applications Developer will work on the DIAD Next Gen designing, developing, supporting and maintaining Windows/Mobile solutions for Package Operations.  He/she provides input and support for full systems life cycle management activities (e.g., analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation of systems and applications software, etc.).  He/She performs tasks within planned durations and established deadlines.  This position collaborates with teams to ensure effective communication in supporting the achievement of objectives.  He/She provides knowledge, development, maintenance, and support for applications.


The Intermediate Applications Developer must have the ability to facilitate and drive consensus and independently document technology findings of solutions and recommendations.  He/she must have strong analytical, problem-solving, decision-making, planning, organizational, interpersonal, presentation, teamwork, relationship building, and verbal and written communication skills.


Responsibilities:


Contributes to System Analysis and Design



  • Analyzes and assists in defining specifications and user requirements to perform assigned applications development work.

  • Contributes to system components' designs to meet requirements.

  • Provides input for design reviews to improve quality.

  • Contributes to product evaluations to determine product usefulness and fit.

  • Participates in the creation and review of interface agreements to support the proper transfer of information between systems.


Designs and Develops Moderately Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, and documents moderately complex programs to develop applications software.

  • Develops unit test plans to deliver quality components.

  • Records and updates the defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.

  • Contributes to the implementation of software products to meet application needs.

  • Performs testing and fixes of components and small applications to ensure compliance with functional requirements.

  • Provides input to Applications' peer reviews to improve code quality.


 Designs and Develops Moderately Complex Applications



  • Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, and documents moderately complex programs to develop applications software.

  • Develops unit test plans to deliver quality components.

  • Updates the defects log to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.

  • Contributes to the implementation of software products to meet application needs.


Generates Application Documentation



  • Creates technical documentation to communicate and update project teams and stakeholders.

  • Communicates and documents unit test results and code revisions to ensure consistency and accuracy.

  • Creates technical documentation in compliance with UPS Software Development Lifecycle to ensure proper and consistent application development.

  • Documents test plans to ensure expected outcomes.


Contributes to Integration Builds



  • Provides input in the development of software builds and integration build components to meet application needs.

  • Conducts tests and analyzes results to diagnose and record failures and to report results.

  • Escalates complex integration issues to support the resolution of system discrepancies.


Contributes to Maintenance and Support



  • Defines and administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.

  • Performs applications maintenance and support functions to assist with problem resolution.

  • Documents maintenance and support activities to ensure quality control.

  • Records and updates the defects log to monitor system reliability Administers procedures to monitor systems performance and integrity.


Assists with I.S. Projects



  • Conducts systems and requirements analyses to identify project action items.

  • Contributes to task lists and cost and time estimates to support project plan development.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan and quality review requirements.

  • Records, updates, and monitors assignment deviations to ensure effective resolutions.

  • Raises issues as appropriate to support effective resolutions.

  • Monitors assignments to ensure I.S. governance, standards, and policies compliance.


Monitors Emerging Technologies and Products



  • Monitors the industry to gain knowledge and understanding of emerging technologies.

  • Investigates new and emerging hardware and software technologies to assist in maintaining industry competitiveness.

  • Analyzes potential value of new technologies to support business objectives and strategy.


Education:


The desired Intermediate Applications Developer will possess a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.

jobs.title: Intermediate Operations Research Analytics Developer
jobs.content:
JOB DESCRIPTION:


Job Summary


The Intermediate Operations Research (OR) Analytics Developer provides input and support for full systems life cycle management activities (e.g. analyses, technical requirements, design, coding, testing, implementation, etc.) to model UPS business situations resulting in the development of applications and algorithms.  He/She performs tasks within planned durations and established deadlines to support the application and development of optimization techniques to business problems.  This position collaborates with teams to ensure effective communication in supporting the achievement of objectives.  He/She provides knowledge, development, maintenance, and support for both applications and business needs.


The Intermediate OR Analytics Developer contributes in the development of C# programs to develop optimization tools and heuristics using Microsoft Visual Studio 2013.  He/She Analyzes, designs, codes, tests, corrects, and documents moderately complex .NET programs and databases to ensure optimal performance and compliance.  This position develops and performs unit testing to deliver quality components, as well as performs maintenance and support functions to support problem resolution.


Other Duties



  • Records and updates defect logs to ensure thorough and accurate documentation.

  • Contributes to work sessions to gather relevant information and to ensure understanding of the problem domain.

  • Performs assigned functions and tasks to meet project plan.

  • Contributes to defining integration test specifications to conduct tests, record failures, and conduct fault diagnoses.

  • Contributes to the creation of build processes to produce software and to prepare tools for delivery.

  • Contributes in the gathering and development of needed data sources.


Preferred Competencies



  • Designs/Develops Integrated Solutions to Business Problems: Demonstrates a broad understanding of business requirements or critical elements of a problem; identifies the impact of a problem on multiple areas of the business; recommends improvements to existing processes or programs.

  • Knowledge of Emerging Technology: Assists with application of new technologies for solving business information needs. Supports new technologies. Maintains basic understanding of potential risks and rewards with emerging technologies.

  • Problem Management: Monitors actions to investigate and resolve incidents and problems in systems and services.

  • Technical Problem Solving and Analytical Processes: Conducts root cause analysis and diagnoses and manages technical problems using pre-defined steps, limited experience, and available tools. Identifies and documents changes that need to be made to established procedures. Makes recommendations and resolves moderately complex technical problems. Contributes to the identification of inefficiencies and deficiencies in processes and applications during walk throughs, tests, and actual execution. Proposes improvements to processes and applications and executes the agreed upon changes designed to improve processes and applications.

  • Technology Knowledge: Recognizes the basic impact of technology on UPS business, services, and processes; identifies technological barriers in achieving desired objectives; maintains appropriate breadth and depth of technological knowledge for current work assignment.

jobs.title: BI Developer
jobs.content:
As market leaders, we have high expectations of ourselves – quality, reliability, safety of our products – and strive for continuous improvement. We work with the best, to be the best, and the secret of our success is simple: we keep learning and exploring. We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. Care to join us?


As an integral member of our product team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is responsible for the entire development cycle of our mission-critical enterprise BI solution. Working with cross-functional teams, you will take responsibility not only for design and development of the platform but quality assurance and maintenance as well.


Using your skills and experience as a BI Developer, you will then shape the underlying architecture of our data warehouse according to business needs identified and projected by the Product Manager.


We are looking for BI Developers.


Accountabilities:


As a Business Intelligence Developer within eVision, your accountabilities will include (but not be limited to):



  • Participate in design and analysis of our solutions

  • Assist Product Manager with translating business requirements into product specifications

  • Implement and guard technology best practices, guidelines and development processes

  • Work closely with Chief Architect to ensure seamless integration with our core products

  • Streamline Quality Assurance by automating tests

  • Provide support to eVision Professional Services to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal stakeholders

  • Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members and Professional Services teams

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


Design and build new features for our health and safety products


Member of a product development team, working in a very agile way


Own parts of the product, participate in creating vision and coordinate product evolution


Focus on code quality and continuously improve with every next release


You work with:


A product development team composed of software developers, QA engineers, UX Designer and a Product Manager


Professional Services associates who deliver projects to our customers


Your very own team lead, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional


Desired Background, Experience and Education:


2+ years of experience in software development


Good knowledge of, and proven experience with: C#, .NET Framework 4.0+, LINQ


Firm grasp of design patterns and of SOLID, and experience using them in a commercial application


Knowledge of Domain Driven Design, CQRS, Event Sourcing desirable


Good experience with code quality – unit testing, TDD, code review, automated testing concepts and defensive coding are essential


Strong knowledge of continuous integration and deployment;


Knowledge of HTTP and .NET HTTP frameworks – ASP.NET MVC


Knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores – MSSQL (preferred), RavenDB (optional)


Able to understand and write multi-threaded code


Good grasp of both technical and functional characteristics of software products, particularly in terms of scalability, performance, usability and quality


Knowledge of concepts of scripting and automation


Experiences with developing for mobile platforms (Android, iOS) is desirable and a plus


Good communication skills in English, both written and verbal


In possession of a valid European work permit.

jobs.title: Developer Support Engineer
jobs.content:
• Provide answers to inquiries concerning usage of Tech Soft 3D software products via email, phone or in person.

  • Analyze and reproduce complex problems with technical 3D graphics and geometric modeling software to identify defects and recommend corrective action.

  • Effectively triage inquiries and manage multiple priorities and interruptions.

  • Provide feedback on and assistance with creation of customer application code, product programming examples, white papers, product documentation, etc.

  • Assist with related technical tasks, including software builds, platform support, system management, and quality assurance testing.

  • Interact and communicate in an efficient and professional manner with team members as well as Tech Soft 3D customers and partners.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are a fast paced team where developers are responsible for all aspects of feature design and development. Our ideal candidate would bring ideas to the table and be able to quickly iterate on them.


Our application, https://www.stream.me, is in a space where innovation and new technology is important; we expect team members to be able to explore novel tasks and pragmatically build out the features.


We are looking from someone with strong Front-End skills who has experience working with a full Javascript stack. We use React and Express to render views on both the front and back end (isomorphic/universal). Most of our components are built in house and we are often experimenting with new and unexplored technologies. We expect our developers to be able to use existing open source tools as well as judge when a custom component should be made.


All team members participate in code reviews, helping improve the work as well as knowledge of the code base. Our Senior team members should also help improve our best practices and help teach other team members. We release to production multiple times a day and developers are responsible for getting their features into production. Senior team members are also responsible for helping maintain the applications in production and debugging issues to help "put out fires".

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Milyli is hiring a smart, passionate, and hardworking individual to join our development team and help build our latest software products and solutions. In this role, you will work alongside other developers, QA engineers, UX designers, and project managers to solve real-world business challenges. We’re looking for someone who takes pride in and ownership of their work, and who has the desire to continue learning and improving their craft.


 We believe that giving the best people the best tools to work with in a fun, casual work environment will result in the best work. If you are committed to working at the highest level in order to provide the best customer experience, we want to speak with you.


What your days will be like:



  • Participating in solution design

  • Writing usable, effective, and maintainable code

  • Creating automated tests to help ensure code functionality

  • Troubleshooting issues and solving problems


Additional Details



  • This is a full-time position.

  • We offer a variety of competitive benefits.

  • There is minimal travel required for this position.

  • You must be able to legally work in the U.S.

  • While we consider candidates from around the world, we cannot provide relocation assistance.

jobs.title: User experience and visualization developer
jobs.content:
Verity Studios is creating a new breed of dynamic flying machines and related systems for the live entertainment industry, leveraging technological innovation, scientific principles, advanced algorithms, and the art of design in unprecedented ways. Verity Studios' synthetic swarm of 33 Fireflies debuted at TED 2016, performing above a live audience, and our work is currently featured in Paramour, the new Broadway show by Cirque du Soleil.


To complement its growing team, Verity Studios is looking for a talented software developer capable of creating functional graphical interfaces, useful visualization tools, and stunning animations.


Your tasks



  • Responsible for the overall user experience of the Verity Studios system, including development of graphical interfaces, system usability evaluation, and preparation of relevant material for manuals

  • Creation and maintenance of visualization tools for internal use (e.g. real-time 3D visualizations, plotting tools, etc.)

  • Creation of renderings and animations to support the creative process


Benefits



  • Work in an early stage startup where you’ll help shape the culture and can have a huge impact

  • Competitive salary

  • Work in an interdisciplinary, international team of highly skilled people

  • Build something that will be seen by millions

  • Offices close to Zurich in the heart of Europe and the Alps


How to apply


Submit a single PDF to careers [at] veritystudios.com (subject “[j-008]") including:



  • Resume/CV

  • Portfolio of relevant projects

  • Transcripts of relevant degrees

  • Two references


Incomplete applications will not be pursued. Applications will be considered until the position is filled.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Python
jobs.content:
IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. The world's top financial institutions rely on our software to run their core business. Our products also help everyday people make some of life's most important decisions – how to purchase a dream house, reach financial goals, plan for retirement and trade on the stock exchange. We are client-driven, responsive and promote a culture that supports working with our customers and the industry to face challenges and keep pace with industry developments.



As a Python Developer at IRESS you will be joining a team of highly intelligent developers who first and foremost love what they do and love developing complex functionality into enterprise software applications. We are keen to hear from like-minded developers who truly enjoy developing complex web applications and/or products.



You will be responsible for ensuring continuous innovation and development of IRESS products from inception to deployment and production support. You will work as an integral part of creative and motivated teams to ensure high-quality benchmarks are met for deliveries of innovative products for global markets.



Skills & Requirements



  • Exceptional Python and front-end development skills using modern HTML 5, CSS 3 and JS

  • Strong understanding of web standards and architecture

  • Good understanding of relational databases and SQL

  • Knowledge of multi-tiered object-oriented application development

  • Experience in the cycle of software development, and agile methodologies

  • Experience with xUnit testing frameworks and selenium testing

  • Ability to structure test code effectively and write robust test cases



About IRESS


With offices across Australia, the UK, Canada, South Africa, New Zealand and Singapore, our team might span the world but we unite to deliver a shared vision - to help our clients keep their promises by providing the very best that FinTech has to offer.


We provide a flexible work environment and like to get our people together to have fun whether it's over a drink on a Friday afternoon, having a friendly kick about on the footy field or doing some team bonding for a charity event. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are.


Come shape the future of FinTech with us and build world class products that make a difference to people's lives and financial well-being.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Rails / Fullstack
jobs.content:
Looking for a job at the Intersection of Big Data, Social Media and Finance?


Contix, a leading provider of social media sourced breaking news alerts and analytics for traders, is hiring a full-time Senior Rails Developer for its Honolulu or St. Louis (MO) office.


JOB DESCRIPTION


The position of Senior Rails Developer entails software architecture, implementation, development of best operational practices, testing and documentation of non-trivial systems with massive scalability requirements. As a startup we are looking for motivated individuals who do not require step-by-step directions and can work cohesively with our team.


Successful applicants will have a proven track record with non-trivial Ruby on Rails projects, understand web client frameworks such as React.js, be comfortable with agile development methodologies and have a solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns. Our interviews are rigorous, so only serious developers with the requisite skills need apply.


We provide a competitive startup compensation package with a generous equity component.


Send resumes, your GitHub repo and a brief paragraph describing why this position appeals to you to careers@contix.com

jobs.title: Security Analyst
jobs.content:
HackerOne is looking for security-minded, customer-service oriented individuals to help lead up the newly formed HackerOne managed service offering. You will be responsible for vetting security vulnerability reports from some of the world’s best hackers being submitted to Fortune 500 and other companies as part of their bug bounty programs. You will have the opportunity work with some of the best hackers in the world and the security teams behind some of the most competitive bug bounty programs, gaining hands-on experience with thousands of vulnerabilities unique to HackerOne’s customers.


This role requires that you have both excellent communication skills to serve as the glue between the hacker community and companies running bug bounty programs, as well as the technical capacity to ensure every bug report is reproducible and provides value to each customer.


About HackerOne


HackerOne connects companies and the hacker community to build a safer Internet. HackerOne powers the leading vulnerability coordination platform, tapping into the power of the hacker community to reveal live vulnerabilities that require a company’s immediate attention. Vulnerabilities surfaced by hackers help protect a company’s brand and its user’s information and data. With over 500 companies and more than 3,000 actively rewarded hackers, HackerOne has the world’s largest platform and community of its kind.


As a company, we believe in transparency, trust, collaboration and community. We work together to make our customers successful, and act with a sense of urgency in our work. We believe in the positive power of hackers.


The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a problem solver, a great communicator, and detail oriented.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Help companies design and build better software
jobs.content:
Your day-to-day


Most of the time, you will work in a small agile team along with the client(s), a product strategist, and a designer. You will typically focus on one project at a time. You will lead your project team to make and implement thoughtful technology decisions that support a great user experience and the client's objectives.


Usual activities include:



  • Evaluate and select appropriate tools and technologies for projects

  • Determine and implement appropriate automated testing solutions given the constraints of a project

  • Actively participate in the research and design of new applications

  • Setup and manage deployment environments (generally on Heroku, sometimes VPS)

  • Deliver working code that exceeds the expectations of the team

  • Iterate, iterate, iterate

  • Support colleagues through code review and pairing


What we're looking for



  • Proficiency building modern web applications and using Git

  • Versatility across the full stack

  • Strong awareness of the user experience

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

  • Insatiable desire to become a better developer

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced environment


What we value


Same Team


There is no “us” vs. “them." We are on the client’s team and vice versa. We teach them about good design and development and they teach us about their industry and customers. We rally around a shared goal and measure our success by theirs. Adopt the idea that if the project fails, it is your responsibility.


People Before Pixels


We make things for humans. Behind every business plan, software application, or digital art piece is a human motivation that we aim to satisfy. If you don't know what it is, talk to people. Always ask "why?"


:shipit:


Thought is cheap. Talk is cheap. Sketch files and localhost are cheap. We measure progress by what we put into the world and what we learn from doing so. Make small bets and test them outside of the building.


Make It Better


Creating great digital experiences is an iterative process. Our basic project approach is: Think. Make. Validate. Make it better. But what makes usbetter at making things better? Simple: we make ourselves better. We're constantly pushing the limits of our own knowledge and working to improve our skills and process.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Leepfrog Technologies' CourseLeaf software is used by over two hundred of the nation's most academically complex universities to manage their online academic catalogs and curriculum processes.


The JavaScript Developer is primarily responsible for designing, customizing, coding, testing, and implementing client websites in support of the CourseLeaf system.  A successful candidate should be capable of full cycle project leadership including site layout/user interface, database design/programming, and development.  Developers are obliged to be quality, detail, and results oriented.  A combination of overall technologist, a passion for testing, and interpersonal skills is desired and will frequently garner the greatest rewards. 


Duties:



  • Coordinate/work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Development Team to ensure timely completion of deliverables.

  • Manage project tasks, timelines, and communication.

  • Design and creation of relational database schemas.

  • Routine daily maintenance of existing sites and applications.

    • Fix software issues and code irregularities.

    • Perform code maintenance, testing, and analysis.

    • Implement software or product enhancements.

    • Give technical feedback to non-technical business professionals.

    • Design and complete project assignments.

    • Stay current about industry developments.

    • Write reports and documentation as needed.

    • Other tasks as needed for successful project completion.

jobs.title: Linux Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
Work remotely from anywhere (our employees often do), in-person frequently in Los Angeles, California, or on-site in Davidson, North Carolina.


Oversee, administer, and provide support for a network of GNU/Linux servers, and technical support for GNU/Linux desktop workstations, in multiple locations. Will be responsible for security updates, upgrades, general system health, anticipating problems, correcting problems, collecting statistics on system operation and health, maintaining security policies, building and installing systems (software side), and writing and maintaining code supporting the company's systems infrastructure.


Challenging environment: System comprises multiple databases (updating constantly), containing hundreds of millions of records, being accessed by over a dozen different servers.


Looking for mid-level, but will consider junior and senior level as well, as long as you eat sleep and breathe this stuff, have been doing it as a hobby for a long time (in the case of the former), and aren't stuck in your ways (in the case of the latter).


Full-time. Competitive compensation. Planning to hire by 1475294400.


No recruiters please.

jobs.title: Principal R&D Quality Engineer/Project Manager, Predictive Analytics
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

     

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Job Summary:

Identify innovation via predictive analytics for one of the largest Information System at Abbott Diagnostics. Responsible for working with a  cross-functional team to develop, prioritize and maintain a product roadmap. The responsibilities would also include converting the roadmap into an executable product backlog by providing functional and analytics specifications and design.

Primary Job Function:

Leads product development core team members responsible for producing quality engineering deliverables including specification development, risk management, process and test method characterization and control plan development.

Consistently, and on an ongoing basis, develops and applies advanced theories, methods, and research techniques to the investigation and solution of complex technical problems.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.

Analyzes, evaluates, and plans methods of approach to and organizes a means to achieve the solution of complex technical problems.

Conducts investigations of considerable complexity pertaining to the development of new designs, methods, materials, or processes, and investigates possible applications of the results.

May provide technical consultation to technical staff.

Applies the results of reviews of literature and current practices relevant to the business; uses results to determine strategic technical direction.

Position Accountability/Scope:

Establishes and defines the theoretical bases and principles which should apply, the empirical test procedures to be used, and the estimated time, expense, and manpower for completion.
Reviews project progress and evaluates results.
Reviews, generates, and approves related inputs such as FMEAs and specifications.
Evaluates vendor capabilities to provide required products or services.
Specifies equipment, materials, and supplies required for the completion and implementation of technical projects.
Plans and directs major technical phases of projects within a specific area.
Provides technical direction to and coordinates the efforts of engineers and technical support staff in the performance of assigned projects.
Provides input to the manager on staffing decisions and future strategies and goals.
Leads or enables project completion.
Interfaces with product team members, manufacturing quality and medical affairs, Development managers, operations and business unit managers.
Communicates with outside decision makers in a manner appropriate to the goals of the communication.

Minimum Education/Experience:

Bachelors degree in a science, statistics, engineering discipline or ASQ Quality Engineering certification with six to ten years work related development experience and 2 to 4 years of Quality Engineering specific experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Expertise in Predictive Analytics, Big Data, Data Science, Mathematics and Statistics

Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence technology

Experience in Product, Feature and Functionality grooming

Familiarity with one or more software programming language and databases. E.g. C++, C#, Java, Oracle, SQLServer...

jobs.title: Sr. BRI Manager
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function:

This position is responsible for all phases of the risk intelligence cycle, from identifying emerging security risks and collecting intelligence, to analyzing, collaborating, and sharing intelligence. The position is responsible for using analytical techniques to identify trends and forecast the potential direct or indirect impact to Abbott's assets worldwide: people, facilities, and operations. The position interfaces with Company personnel across multiple business units and countries, and offers proactive and reactive recommendations to mitigate identified risks. Reports to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

This position is responsible for managing a global team of business risk intelligence staff in providing strategic risk analysis and developing risk mitigation strategies to prevent and minimize the companys exposure to risks. Additionally, the Sr. Manager assists Global Security Leadership in implementing programs and strategies to ensure safety of employees, assets and special events security. The position also serves as a liaison with private sector counterparts, law enforcement and government partners.

The position is responsible for managing the Abbotts travel safety program. The position overseas and coordinates preparation of strategic assessments, presentations and updates to senior management.

Position Accountability/Scope:

The position includes both a domestic and international scope and is accountable to the Director of Crisis Management and Business Continuity.

Minimum Education:

Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience required. (Masters Degree preferred).

Minimum Experience/Training Required:

8+ years of experience with a major public or private sector security organization. International work experience and previous global risk and analytical experience are highly desired.

JOB FAMILY:

Administrative-Other

DIVISION:

GES Global Engineering Services

LOCATION:

United States - Illinois - Abbott Park

ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS:

WORK SHIFT:

Standard

TRAVEL:

Yes, 20 % of the Time

MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE:

No

SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES:

Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day), Keyboard use (greater or equal to 50% of the workday)

jobs.title: QA engineer with strong dev skills
jobs.content:
We need a QA Engineer with great dev skills


We’re a FinTech company that just raised more than $7MM to disrupt a $100Bn market.  Sorry if that’s  a little vague, but we’re sort of in stealth mode. We're running hard and working fast and need to be responsive and agile as all get-out. A key part of moving fast is making sure our product meets a high quality bar. (People get very nervous if the company to which they're entrusting their financial future can't make their own website work right.) We need a QA engineer who's comfortable at every part of the job: manual UI testing, black box acceptance testing, whitebox exploratory testing, test automation, and continuous integration. We've made a big investment in test automation, but we need to take that - and our quality bar in general - to the next level. Another way to put it: you need to be able to read and write code as well as you can write and execute test plans. 


If you're interested, reach out!

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Equate Media is looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the science of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX wireframes to working code to produce the visual elements of the application. You will work very closely with designers and back-end developers to bridge the gap between the aesthetic vision and the technical implementation.


Responsibilities



  • Develop new user-facing features

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs

  • Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end

  • Collaborate closely with other team members and stakeholders

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Back End
jobs.content:
The Brightcove engineering culture is tailored to software professionals who enjoy solving challenging product development problems. The team you'll be joining is a small, self-organized Agile group. We use a light-weight development process that balances craftsmanship with execution.  We strive to build engaging products with features that will delight our customers.

Our team takes pride in achieving high uptimes and quality-of-service with low operational overhead.  Team-members double as experts in operating the systems that they build.  We are continuously shipping code -- several times a day.  Everyone is encouraged to contribute to meeting our operational goals through robust, scalable designs, software quality, customer-facing service metrics, and DevOps automation.


THE ROLE


We’re looking for a developer to help us transform the Video Cloud content management system into a scalable, cloud-based platform with rich, developer-friendly APIs.  The Brightcove CMS holds the central catalog of information for Brightcove’s flagship Video Cloud product.  This CMS is a high-performance metadata management repository with integrated search capabilities.  You’ll be on a team responsible for designing, developing, and operating a fault-tolerant, low-latency system that currently handles over 5M updates and nearly 200M reads each day, with peak rates of around 5k writes and 10k reads per second. Our throughput continues to grow, having nearly doubled year-over-year for the past few years.

We look for people people we can learn from; people who are creative, passionate, and curious; and people who know how to get things done.



ABOUT YOU



  • You have 3+ years of experience building large applications in multiple languages (We mostly use Java/Groovy, with some Ruby, Python, and Node.js sprinkled in).

  • You have experience developing and deploying software at high scale.

  • You understand the basics of scalable SaaS systems.

  • You are familiar with Linux, basic SaaS security, Amazon EC2, REST, and API design.

  • You understand the principles of software craftsmanship. You write clean code, even when working on extremely hard problems. You unit test everything

  • You’re familiar with different types of data stores for handling large volumes of data with high levels of traffic.  We’d love to talk to you about the tradeoffs between in-house and hosted Mongo solutions, Dynamo/Cassandra/Riak, and when and how to use different kinds of caching.


ABOUT US


We offer a fun work environment, regular hack weeks, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement.  Our offices are located downtown, right on Fort Point harbor, with a fully stocked kitchen, ping pong and foosball tables.  We also offer unlimited vacation — and expect you to use it.


We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Tier 2 Technical Support Engineer - Development
jobs.content:
Technical Support Engineer - Tier 2 Development


Description


Are you passionate about working directly with customers and immediately impacting their success? We are looking for an exceptional person to join our Customer Support team in providing efficient and accurate technical assistance to ensure complete customer satisfaction for our growing customer base of online video publishers. The ideal candidate is a dedicated problem solver, passionate about rich media technologies, and a proven customer advocate. We are looking for someone who is highly motivated with strong technical experience, excellent written and verbal communication skills and high enthusiasm for customer success.


Responsibilities will include working directly with customers via phone and email to respond to technical issues, providing escalated technical and triage support for other team members, and actively contribute to our online community and knowledge database for up-to-date customer information and solutions. This individual will also work closely with our Engineering, Product Management and QA teams to increase customer satisfaction by providing critical feedback and assistance for product enhancements. As a member of Customer Support, the candidate will be part of a Global team interacting closely with Support offices in the US, Europe, Australia, Korea, and Japan, as well as with customers around the world.


Working for Brightcove will give you a unique opportunity to join a fast growing company and play an integral role building products and online services that promise to transform the media industry and change the way people all over the world watch video.


Qualifications and Required Experience



  • College degree (CS degree preferred)

  • 3+ years work experience in online technical problem solving

  • Excellent communication skills and strong customer focus

  • Proven analytical / problem solving ability

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively, both written and oral

  • Demonstrated ability to lead and manage initiatives to completion.

  • Proven ability to work with the team to quickly and calmly resolve technical issues.

  • Solid understanding of internet technologies including browsers, networking, firewalls & proxy servers

  • Demonstrated ability to learn new skills quickly.

  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team.

  • Required to be flexible, detail oriented and organized with the ability to multitask.

  • On-call availability


Technical Experience 



  • Strong technology background with a comprehensive knowledge of Internet, Mobile and Digital Online Media technologies such as networking, servers, etc

  • Proficient in web-based technologies, including HTML, XML, FTP, JavaScript, CSS

  • Proven experience with CDN services (Akamai, Level3, etc)

  • Proven experience with Cloud computing (AWS, S3, Cloudfront, etc)

  • Proven experience with Online Advertising servers and implementation (VAST, DFP, Freewheel, etc)

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of RESTful API use, data collection tools, developer support experience

  • Familiarity and working knowledge with rich media applications and mobile SDK development or testing

  • Familiarity and working knowledge of Java; experience in Android development a plus

  • Meaningful experience with online video and of video encoding applications

  • Exposure and working knowledge in at least one other programming language including Objective C, PHP, BASH, etc


Location


This position is based in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.


Why you want to work for Brightcove


Brightcove is the leading online video platform. Media companies, businesses, and organizations worldwide use Brightcove to publish and distribute video that reaches more than 135 million unique viewers every month. We've worked hard to create a company where talented, passionate people can thrive in a culture that values individual empowerment, excellence, and collaboration. Working at Brightcove gives you the chance to reshape how media is published and consumed worldwide while you develop your skills, grow your career, and have fun.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Engineer for an Outdoors Media Startup
jobs.content:
RootsRated is on a mission to power outdoor discovery.


We are looking for a dynamic and driven individual to join the software engineering team at a rapidly growing organization. As the fastest growing media property in the outdoors space, RootsRated is positioned to create the most comprehensive and trusted resource for outdoor recreation in the United States.


This role reports to the CTO. A successful Software Engineer at RootsRated is excited about the challenge of creating both consumer- and business-facing products. Recognizing the stage and trajectory of RootsRated, a successful candidate will thrive in ambiguous and resource-constrained environments (doing more with less).


We're a small team with huge ideas, and we're steadfast on holding to some core practices that help us deliver high impact products, including:



  • Taking on individual ownership over features and projects

  • Saying "no" to shiny objects

  • Using data to drive feature priority

  • Being cognizant of technical debt and diligent about test coverage

  • Shipping regularly to test hypotheses


What you'll be asked to do:



  • Contribute valuable expertise to a highly-motivated and agile team

  • Play a key role in all parts of the product lifecycle: brainstorming, design, prototyping, planning, implementation, testing, launch, and support

  • Demonstrate productivity in a variety of work environments: independently, under direction, and in paired-programming

  • Have a passion for growing your skills, but also lifting the skills and expertise of those around you

  • Exercise flexibility in achieving tasks and priorities across multiple codebases

  • Excel at both providing and receiving code reviews

  • Develop novel features for creating, organizing, distributing and analyzing content across multiple platforms

  • Build and refine RootsRated’s platforms to house and discover content beautifully and creatively


Benefits:



  • Unlimited Vacation

  • Health/Dental (50/50)

  • The equipment you need to be successful

  • Outdoor apparel and equipment Pro Deals

  • Amazing open workspace with outdoor firepit

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:


Braintree builds products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. The Braintree full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We're known for our technology but we're also known for our support, with internal risk and underwriting, account management and technical support teams who ensure a frictionless payments experience.

Our technology fuels companies like GitHub, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable, Heroku and more.


Headquartered in Chicago, Braintree has offices in San Francisco, New York, Sydney, and London with employees stationed around the world. 

Check us out - Braintree on The Muse: http://muse.cm/1wWa28H


Senior Software Engineer:

We’re looking for Software Engineers to join the squad and help us continue building solutions to complex problems and innovate in the space. Here is a little info on our team:


We are polyglots... 

Although most of our software is written in Ruby, we don’t confine ourselves to a single programming language. We believe in using the best tool for the job while maintaining a slight bias toward the tools the team knows the best. We’ve written infrastructure components in Python, and we build client libraries for integrating with Braintree in Ruby, Python, Node.js, PHP, Java, and .NET.


We pair program…


We work on Macbook Pros with two keyboards and dual 27" cinema displays. We work in an open team room; no cubicles or private offices. Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. 

We test... 

Testing is at the forefront of our development philosophy. We never need to check our code coverage to know that it's at 100%: with disciplined TDD, no line of code will be written without a test. We're confident that our automated testing is thorough and will catch any regression bugs - and that’s critical given the software we write! We use continuous integration to test every version of every client library against our gateway.


We are agile...


Agile development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us, the most important part of Agile is doing what works best for the team. We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We’re pragmatic, not dogmatic. Although we have strong opinions, we're never afraid to try to new things to see if they work and reconsider our positions if the situation warrants it. 

We value our people... 

-Two paid conferences annually to everyone on the Products Team


-Open Dev Day twice a month 


-Catered lunches daily


-Commuter reimbursement program


Take a look at some of our blog posts and scope our code on GitHub


Braintrust

Braintree GitHub

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Commerce
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook | Twitter


Engineering Team Culture:


We are hiring Software Engineers to join our Commerce Team. The focus is to build the future of commerce. We simply look to hire smart people. No emphasis on a CS degree, or deep understanding of our tech stack, but instead Engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to join a collaborative environment building the future of commerce. We are a largely remote team and have built a strong set of principles around our communication and workflow to support this.


Types of projects we work on:


Contextual commerce — With one seamless Braintree integration, you’ll pave a simple path for retailers to sell, and users to buy what they see - when they see it - on your platform.


PayPal Commerce iOS SDK — building a better way to sell on mobile and giving customers a shopping experience with less typing, smarter purchasing, and more flexibility.


Think — dropping a buy button into an email or online article to reduce friction and cart abandonment. Embed a store with our simple SDK to bring the complete shopping experience right into your existing app.


What we look for in you:


Proficiency within your current tech stack and desire to continue learning. We build with Python and JavaScript, but are open to candidates with other experiences.


Work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is spread out across the country with people working in our Chicago and San Francisco offices, as well as remotely. You should be open to various channels of communication and enjoy the workflow of that team dynamic.


You’re excited about the work we’re doing. Contextual commerce is a new concept in the space, and we’re hoping you are passionate about helping build new consumer experiences.


Braintree Perks:


Open Dev Day — two days a month our engineers work on projects that interest them to improve their craft


Product conferences — attend two conferences … all on the Braintree dime


Daily catered lunches — salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement — we take education and skills development seriously


Tracking Free Vacation — employees self track their vacation to ensure you get the time off you need


Take a look at our GitHub and blog: Braintree GitHub | Braintrust

jobs.content:

Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.

jobs.title: Full Stack Python Developer with SQL to Join Virtual Team
jobs.content:
We are a small, established, and profitable technology company providing online exam software to customers in over 25 countries. We are looking for a senior developer to join our team. You can work remote as long as you overlap with the U.S. Eastern Time zone.


This is a great job for someone who loves technology and wants to work on a cool project without big company bureaucracy. You won’t be pigeon­holed into doing the same thing every day. In fact, the ability to wear multiple hats is essential. Here are some of the roles you’ll play on the team:


Hands­ on Programmer. We are looking for a senior developer who can write code. Most of it will be Python, JavaScript or SQL. You may have to set up an Ubuntu server, modify nginx settings, write a Python module for a new feature or script a Web­-based API to integrate with another application.


R&D engineer. As our product evolves and our company grows you will assist us in evaluating new technologies, designing product architecture, and thinking through Internet security issues.


Design Opinionator. While we won’t ask you to fire up Photoshop, you can certainly help us find JavaScript widgets or CSS tricks that make the site drive better and more fun to use. We don’t stuff programmers into code hell; feedback on all aspects of product development is expected and encouraged.

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Mobile App Developer

Village Print & Media is Manhattan’s most innovative creative solutions agency specializing in print, design, and media. We are currently experiencing explosive growth and are seeking a talented and experienced Mobile App Developer to join our in-house team and work closely with our technology and marketing departments. This is a unique opportunity to help shape the creation of our mobile app division in an entrepreneurial leadership role. As we grow our development team, there is significant room for upward mobility and managerial experience. This is an opportunity to gain valuable knowledge and experience while working on a variety of both client facing and internal projects. Please note that this is a full time, in-house position based in Manhattan, NYC.



Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in Application, Database and Mobile Application development

  • Understanding of the software development life-cycle – scoping, planning, design, implementation, deployment and maintenance.

o    Application development with MVC framework experience (Example, PHP+Laravel)


o    Web application development (HTML, CSS, Javascript)

o    iOS and Android experience front end and back end implementation


o    We are Open to Visual-Studio-xamarin / PhoneGap multi-platform development


o    Experience in Client-Server communication


o    Strong intuition for UX and customer behavior


o    Extensive hands-on experience creating custom UI controls, designing protocols, implementing delegate interfaces, and performance optimization


o    Work from UI/UX requirements to build fully functional applications



  • Experience with Git or a similar control system

  • Comfortable working in a collaborative environment

  • Able to handle multiple high priority projects and work under tight deadlines

  • Excellent planning and organizational skills

  • Self-motivated, quick learner, and detail-oriented

  • Up-to-date portfolio featuring exceptional examples of recent development work in Google Play and Apple iOS App store, preferably with server-side components (ideally with web front end as well)



 Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to conceptualization and execution plans

  • Write clean, readable, and reusable code that is well-documented/commented

  • Code mobile applications to achieve specific objectives

  • Effectively manage designated projects from conception through execution

This is a full time opportunity that offers full benefits, competitive salary, and a great opportunity to join a 45+ year company and be a major contributor to its growth. If interested, please email your resume, cover letter, and links to your published applications as well as GitHub repository if available to jobs1@villagegroup.com. Incomplete applications will not be considered. No phone calls, please. Salary is extremely competitive and commensurate with experience.

jobs.title: Technology Analyst
jobs.content:
The Technology Analyst contributes to the design, implementation, support, and maintenance of automation, computing, and database systems essential to carrying out the responsibilities and daily activities of Division or Board staff.


 The Technology Analyst (TA) in the Monetary & Financial Market Analysis (MFMA) section works with other staff members, including a fellow TA, towards maintaining and further developing MFMA’s data science environment.


 As part of the Division of Monetary Affairs, MFMA’s mission consists of conducting analysis and academic research on financial markets and their interaction with the macroeconomy to support the design and implementation of the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy. MFMA focuses in particular on using prices of fixed income securities (such as U.S. Treasuries), associated derivatives, and surveys to extract and analyze market expectations about interest rates and inflation.


In support of MFMA’s mission, the responsibilities of the TA position include the development of software systems and applications, the administration of shared databases, improvement of the dissemination of information produced by the section, and the maintenance of the security and integrity of data systems. The TA also provides technical support to the section’s economists/staff and participates and assists in economic/financial research.

jobs.title: Javascript Engineer
jobs.content: Javascript Engineers at QuikOrder are creating our node-based next generation eCommerce platform. We’re looking for solid engineers who bring fresh ideas from their own experience and are eager to tackle new problems across the stack. Expect to use the latest frameworks and contribute to them as needed.

jobs.name: The Turing School of Software and Design

jobs.title: Web Development Instructor
jobs.company: The Turing School of Software and Design
jobs.content:
Turing is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization working to change the landscape of the technology industry by training a diverse, passionate, and highly skilled workforce ready to change the world.


Turing currently runs two 27-week full-time intensive instructional program for adults desiring to become professional software developers. We are hiring instructors for either program: Front-End Engineering and Web Application Development.


Instructor: Front-End Engineering Program


Our curriculum focuses on JavaScript, HTML/CSS, user experience, agile development, and project management. The 27 week program is broken up into four modules. The first module focuses on the fundamentals of web development and covers semantic markup, responsive design, and an introduction to JavaScript. In the second module, students will dive deeper into the language's mechanics and learn how to write object-oriented as well as functional JavaScript, build Node APIs in Express, and create a game with HTML5 canvas. In the third module, we'll explore how to leverage front-end frameworks to create rich experiences in the browser. Students will build applications with web technologies outside of the browser in the final module: They'll build desktop applications with Electron, mobile web applications with PhoneGap and Cordova, and native applications with React Native.


Instructor: Web Application Development Program

Our curriculum focuses on Ruby, Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Git, relational databases, agile development, and project management. The 27 week program is broken up into four modules. The first module focuses on the fundamentals of object-oriented programming, algorithms, and data structures. In the second module, students learn how to build web applications with Sinatra and Ruby on Rails. In the third module, students build upon their Rails knowledge and learn how to build APIs, optimize database queries, and add multitenancy to their applications. In the fourth and final module, students write client-side code to enhance their web applications.


Responsibilities



  • Research, prepare, and deliver lesson topics in a way that is both engaging and effective

  • Facilitate evaluations and assessments of projects and individual student progress

  • Collect and analyze student achievement data in order to implement changes to existing curriculum

  • Contribute to the development of internal software tools

  • Create and publish open-source instructional materials

  • Work and teach in our office in downtown Denver during the hours 8:15-5:00 daily in addition to occasional special events outside of these hours

jobs.title: DevOps developer - fast growing tech/consulting startup
