jobs.title: Director of Software Development
jobs.content: Something Digital is seeking a Director of Software Development to oversee a staff, process, and P&L for an experienced software development practice, as part of a larger technology professional services firm. Candidates must be prepared to oversee the building of custom software in the Microsoft stack (.Net, SharePoint, Dynamics CRM), manage teams and processes, and support sales and marketing initiatives specific to their practice group. Role will report to the Principal and Founder.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring senior back-end engineers for our Seattle office, who are passionate about technology and education, to help build out our online video platform (Arc) for interactive learning. Our product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks. A week each quarter to work on relevant pet projects and features. Woohoo! Most of our work is open source, even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github: www.github.com/instructure.


This position is based in Seattle, and is not a remote opportunity. Our Seattle office is located downtown in the Westlake Center, 1601 5th Avenue.

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity. We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. Most of our work is open source, even our primary product. We are also changing how teachers and students interact, whether in small groups or with tens of thousands of students in one course. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network. So…if you like front-end development, back-end development, or some combination of these, let's talk. There are lots of interesting, complex, and challenging problems that will leverage your skills; oh, and new things come up every day. There will be a technical interview with lots of white board action (but no silly puzzles or trick questions). We may even have you code up a simple app to demonstrate your abilities.


Join us at our downtown Chicago office. Address: 1 Prudential Plaza, 130 E. Randolph St. Suite 1800, Chicago, IL 60601


Remote option is only available for US authorized workers who currently reside in the US with proven success in working remotely.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring a Lead Software Engineer, who is passionate about technology and education, to lead a team of Engineers in building new features into our Arc video platform. Learn more about Arc here: https://www.canvaslms.com/arc.

Our product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks.  A week each quarter to work on relevant pet projects and features.

Most of our work is open source, even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github: www.github.com/instructure.




This position is based in Seattle, WA. 



Our Seattle office is located downtown in the Westlake Center, 1601 5th Avenue.




WHAT WE DO:




    • We are full stack engineers with experience building web scale services in a loosely coupled but highly integrated system, as well as developing web scale single-page web apps with modern web technology.

    • We are a mixed stack and polyglot team with a deep commitment to quality and to using the right tech for each problem we solve.

    • We use Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, Node.js, Go, PostgreSQL, Linux, and our platform runs on AWS.

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together.

Most of our work is open source, even our primary product. We are also changing how teachers and students interact, whether in small groups or with tens of thousands of students in one course. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network.



This position is based in Salt Lake City, UT or Chicago, IL. It is not available for remote work. 





HERE'S WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:




    • 5+ years experience developing native Android Applications. Web experience is a plus. 

    • Ability to mentor and express concepts among cross functional teams clearly and succinctly. 

    • Ability to work independently, collaborate on complex projects, and drive results. 

    • Great attitude and excited about learning.

    • Deep understanding of Java, Design Patterns, and Android architecture

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Agile Java - Javascript - Web Developer
jobs.content:
Scoutahead is looking to add an agile Java developer to help change the way people get information.


Scoutahead’s engineering team is building a next-generation platform for anyone to get accurate information about what really matters to them. We take pride in our work and are focused on delivering a product that users will love. Our engineers are involved in every aspect of the product lifecycle from conception through design and execution. We care about the details because details separate merely good ideas from excellent and successful products. We believe in delivering innovative products that never compromise on privacy, security, or morality.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a senior UI engineer looking to make a big impact on a high profile project?


Ai is a leading interactive strategy, design, and development agency. We are looking for driven, self-motivated coders that are able to understand business problems and translate these into technical solutions. Ideal candidates should have concept-to-launch experience building scalable and secure transactional web applications. 


As a senior UI engineer you will be leading the design and construction of the interface interactivity of our clients’ sites through the masterful use of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other related front-end technologies. You will own the technical front-end direction and collaborate with backend developers, information architects, business analysts and visual designers. 


Our typical engagement size and the size of our teams makes it possible for all team members to craft and shape the experiences we produce, with the full support of the leads and directors. The flexibility of our process makes for happy clients and the unusual ability to produce exactly the work you envision. If you want to make a real difference on a project, this is your dream role.


Off projects, you will be expected to teach your colleagues something they didn’t know in an area you are excited about. Is mobile app development your fantasy? How about responsive markup or rich, cross-browser compliant animations? Show us what you’ve got.

jobs.name: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016

jobs.title: Director of Infrastructure
jobs.company: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016
jobs.content:
At Motus, we are passionate about leveraging technology to make work-life better for mobile workers and their managers. Our cloud-based mobile technology streamlines administrative tasks, provides fair and accurate reimbursements, mitigates risk, and offers actionable data insights—all designed to allow the mobile workforce the freedom to allocate their time in ways that make them happiest.


The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced, creative Director of Infrastructure to manage our application systems and tools. In this role, you will report directly to our VP of Technology, manage our DevOps engineers, and work closely with the Development and QA teams. You will be responsible for continuing to improve the reliability, security, and productivity of our production and staging, and development systems.


We run our systems on a cutting edge platform using AWS, Apache Mesos, Mesosphere Marathon and Chronos, and Docker.  We use Puppet, Terraform, and Ansible to manage our platform.  Experience with some or all of these technologies is extremely valuable in this position.


What You'll Do:



  • Build, develop, and manage a high-performing infrastructure and DevOps team to meet the needs of a rapidly growing and changing business in an even more rapidly changing technology landscape.

  • Architect and implement a security environment to manage sensitive information across the organization.

  • Enhance automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure and scale their applications internally and at AWS, including SLA's, 24x7 monitoring, alerting and incident response.

  • Continuously improve our visibility into our systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics and log analytics.

  • Actively participate in high-level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations.

  • Design, implement, and facilitate an annual infrastructure plan.

  • Manage infrastructure projects on and to budget.

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer who can support a small team of engineers and develop automated tests that we can rely on to ensure our new code is safe to release.


Do you take joy in spotting what others miss? We are looking for someone who understands how frustrating it is when things don’t work right; who feels it is their duty to protect the world from bad code.


We want an engineer who understands how to build automated tests that are reliable and easy to maintain.


Responsibilities:



  • Support a team of engineers, acting as gatekeeper for their changes

  • Build and maintain automated test suites for multiple web based products

  • Identify areas of risk and develop appropriate test plans

  • Perform investigation of escalated issues

  • “Fight for the user”


Minimal Requirements:



  • 3 Years of QA or Support Engineering

  • 1 Year QA Automation Engineering

  • Incredible attention to detail

  • Clear communication skills

  • Experience with Scrum a plus


Preferred Skills:



  • Watir

  • Selenium

  • Ruby

  • Web Console

  • CSS

  • Javascript

  • Git


About our Engineering Department


All of our developers are full-stack and work closely with Product, Design and QA teams to deliver features to about 45-55k users per day. Here is some of what you can expect working here:



  • Autonomy. Developers are organized into autonomous teams of 2-4 developers and have a lot of control over how they collaborate, communicate, and generally work.

  • Agility. Teams practice scrum, work in sprints, calculate velocity, do code reviews and rely on Continuous Integration.

  • Diversity. Women make up roughly a third of our team, and we have people from all over the world on our team. It’s part of what makes our culture great.

  • Craftsmanship. We have excellent engineers spanning all skill levels, and we all are committed to becoming better at our craft. We practice Lunch & Learns and mentorship.

  • Stewardship. We are big proponents of open source, use it a lot, and give back to the community wherever we can.


Perks


We truly care about our people, and as such are strong believers in having fun at work, continuing education and work/life/family balance. We demonstrate that in the followings ways:




  • Competitive Pay. We hire excellent people and reward them accordingly.




  • Flexible Work Hours. If you work better evenings than mornings, that’s fine by us!




  • One Paid Conference per year (includes hotel and airfare).




  • DashCon. An internal yearly conference showcasing our engineering culture.




  • 10% time per week to invest in open source or self-education.




  • Great benefits. Health, dental, vision, 401k, and more.




  • Parties! We can fly you out for our company-wide get-togethers.




  • Good times guarantee. Board game nights and Bad-joke Wednesdays, our favorite perk ;-)

jobs.title: Software Developer to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work in this role?



  • Cool opportunity to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program; to be in on the ground floor engaging the world with this new technology.

  • Working to take holographic video to other outlets, get really high end creators such as MTV, Disney, Nike to make holograms for video application.


  • Qualifications:



    • This is a relatively self-driven role

    • We need someone that is used to dealing with real time hardware systems and gathering and integrating data from that and controlling a system like that.

    • Computer Science Degree is preferred

    • Disqualifiers: Too much JAVA is not good; database applications would be a red flag because the coding there is high level and not close enough to working with the hardware.

    • This person needs to have experience optimizing programs that work with hardware/components and paying attention to performance, they will need to be aware of the bottlenecks in the system

    • Best vs. Average: Somebody that has worked in a production studio, worked for capture systems and have been exposed to content production a video stage or motion capture stage.

    • Performance Measures: A successful performer will provide robust solutions and minimal revisions would be a high performer; understanding or ability to work with production clients that may not be technical at all, like a director listen to them and what they need and be able to interpret that and help them meet their need. There will be a social component to this and to the right candidate it will be very appealing, it would be a bad fit for a lot of engineers.

jobs.title: Rails Platform Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Surkus is a rapidly growing, well-funded, mobile-first platform where anyone can cast amazing people for events, parties, product launches, and a wide variety of exciting experiences. Surkus transcends traditional entertainment and on-demand staffing applications to allow clients nearly instant to talented, amazing people for real-world events.

We are experiencing tremendous growth and driving significant technology innovation in our space.

Ensuring continuous improvement in platform performance, reliability and scalability is critical to our continued success. You will be working with a team of top-notch developers with advanced skills in a variety of technologies to make major platform enhancements to achieve these objectives. You must be a strong problem solver, with advanced knowledge of design patterns, database design, network protocols and code optimization techniques.

Experience with our core stack is helpful: Heroku, AWS, Postgres, Elasticsearch, React

We currently have offices in Hollywood and Santa Monica.


Benefits


  • Health insurance
  • Stock options

jobs.title: Senior Java Developers
jobs.content:
We are looking for developers who are proud of their code and who are willing to stand behind it every time. People who want to make Test Driven Development and metrics a part of their everyday development process with a focus on quality, elegant code, and superior standards. We want people who take an active interest in the technical community as a whole and who have a passion for what they do.


As a Senior Java Developer you will be developing a cutting edge API based web application, you will be provided with a working environment that is stimulating, challenging and rewarding.  Our focus is very much on constantly improving our development processes using agile development methodologies where developers are encouraged to design and develop systems in regularly delivered iterations and unnecessary documentation is minimized.


 If you want to influence, have the talent and ability to innovate with the best and the courage to stand up for quality then we want to talk to you.


Key responsibilities:



  • Develop, test and deliver highly performant and secure API based services

  • Working in a cross-functional agile team you will be developing features end-to-end across the software stack and responsible for all non-functional capabilities.

  • You will be expected to write elegant, simple code that lends itself to low cost maintenance, extensibility, testability and performance.

  • You will validate proposed approaches and explore new concepts using proof-of-concepts, wire frames and early experience prototypes.

  • Work within a Scrum with team members based in Ireland & India.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer/Reverse Engineer
jobs.content:
Caesar Creek Software is a reverse engineering and software development company located in Springboro, Ohio.  We work closely with various government agencies to perform cybersecurity research into major operating system platforms, including Windows, iOS, and Linux.  We have also performed cybersecurity research on a number of computing devices, including personal computers, cell phones, and networking equipment.  We have performed red team analysis and cracked DoD-grade protection mechanisms.  We have a robust Internal Research and Development program that lets us do cool stuff on our own.  If it has a processor, we love taking it apart to see what makes it tick.  Our company motto:  “We void warranties!


Multiple positions are available in the following areas:
• Reverse Engineering
• Vulnerability Analysis
• Exploit Development
• Offensive Information Operations/Information Warfare
• Mobile Device Hacking

This is a full-time, salaried position. All work is done at our Springboro, Ohio facility. A current security clearance is highly desired. Entry-level engineers and new graduates are encouraged to apply!

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
You have already solid experience as a DevOps Engineer and would like to tackle a new challenge in an different environment? This is your chance!


Support our development and operations team in making our infrastructure even more robust and flexible. Help us to manage our mobile device cloud by enhancing the existing monitoring solution and automating as many administration tasks as possible.


Your responsibilities as Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f):



  • Design, setup and maintain our mobile device infrastructure

  • Drive the adoption of latest cloud hosting technologies

  • Consult us in making the TestObject cloud more scalable

  • Contribute to open source tools and frameworks we use on a daily base


Your Benefits:



  • An exciting and challenging job: You contribute to serious production grade software together with an experienced, friendly, agile team of developers and operations.

  • Benefits: You will be fully responsible for your projects and will receive a competitive salary alongside having the opportunity to directly impact our company’s success.

  • Team spirit: We are open-minded people and are happy to integrate new colleagues into our team. Team lunches, team events, after work … included.

  • Getting started: New in Germany or Berlin? We want you to feel at home here. We assist you with finding accommodation, obtaining a visa, learning German, and to establish your network in the Berlin Tech community.

jobs.title: Front End Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
The iCentris team is dedicated to developing beautiful, usable, and practical web applications for our clients. We’re highly collaborative fast paced environment utilizing a combination of agile and waterfall project management methodologies. We believe in customer validation early in the process, verifying solutions with real data, and running with our industry expertise. The team includes UI/UX design, Ruby on Rails developers, DBA’s and project/product management where everyone on the team is responsible for the success of our products and ensures we’re leading the MLM industry in technology.


We're seeking a Ruby on Rails developer with strong analytical and problem solving skills who can identify solutions a task level as well as at a product level. Candidates must be highly skilled with developing in HTML/CSS/JavaScript technologies.  The ideal profile combines deep experience in web design and strong understanding of implementing markup. You must be able to demonstrate prior experience on web sites you’re proud to show off for their functionality and polished UI, appropriate use of JavaScript and standard CSS best practices.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Seeking an experienced Android Developer who can create and design mobile applications for Android platforms.


In addition to having excellent technical skills, you have a keen interest in the latest technologies and have a feel for user experience. You'll be responsible for building exciting applications and implementing flows and mock ups as provided by UX and Design teams. Apart from having the ability to write fast and clean code with great attention to detail and proper documentation,  you also come up with solutions and suggestions for improvement as you will be working closely with Product Development and Marketing teams. 


Being one of our talented developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn and grow, and be a key part of creating our products. Check out http://www.omvana.com and http://www.dormioapp.com/ for our latest releases. Omvana is One of the Top 20 Health and Fitness Apps in the USA Apple Store.

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about coding?

If Activities, Content Providers, Intents and Services sweeten your Marshmallow and you like to have a Lollipop with your coffee, send us an email with links to any of your published projects in the Play Store or Github repositories. Ideally, you have also gained experienced over time in some of the following fields: JSON, REST Webservices, NodeJS, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration, Git and Jenkins.

In this role your creativity and ambition is required, whether you apply it to smartphones, tablets or Google Wearables. Develop new concepts for our technologically sophisticated business applications! Contribute to the apps for DriveNow or Sixt, our internationally successful rent-a-car app!

You will get to interact with like-minded mobile experts in our own mobile development blog and on regular hacking days, giving you the chance to expand your knowledge of other platforms and technologies. We will provide you with a great working environment that of course includes lots of great coffee, Club Mate and foosball.


For our IT, software and web development departments in Pullach and Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated Android Engineer (m/f).


Your job – performs as smoothly as our cars:



  • You develop the Sixt rent-a-car, DriveNow and myDriver apps.

  • You have high standards in regard to quality, which is reflected in your Clean Code and efficient architecture.

  • You collaborate closely with product management and design teams in a proactive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies.

  • You evaluate new technologies and create new features based on your findings.

  • You communicate fluently in English and appreciate cultural diversity.



Your profile – your willingness to accelerate:



  • You are already a passionate Android developer?

  • You have extensive experience with Java and want to become an Android developer?

  • You completed a university degree, a relevant vocational education or have related work experience?

  • You have experience with Webservices, Persistence and Material Design?

  • You even know Retrofit, Picasso, Eventbus and ButterKnife?


Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:



  • We have a very diversified job for you!

  • We offer you great degrees of freedom!

  • We offer you international career development opportunities!

  • We work in a very dynamic working environment!

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about coding? Are you enthusiastic about every iOS update?


Ideally, you are experienced in some of the following topics: JSON, REST webservices, nodeJS, unit testing and test automation, continuous integration, Git and Jenkins. We need your creativity and ambition relating to iPhones, iPads or the Apple Watch! Join us and develop new concepts for our technically sophisticated business applications. Contribute to the apps for



  • Sixt - our internationally successful rent-a-car app

  • DriveNow – our internationally successful carsharing app

  • myDriver – our internationally successful limousine service apps



You will get to work with likeminded mobile experts in our own mobile development blog and on regular hacking days, giving you the chance to expand your knowledge of other platforms and technologies. We will provide you with a perfect work environment that includes great coffee, Club Mate and foosball.


For our IT, software and web development departments in Pullach and Munich, we are currently looking to hire a highly motivated iOS Engineer (m/f).


Your job – performs as smoothly as our cars:



  • Your high quality standards are reflected in Clean Code and efficient architecture.

  • You constantly discover new technologies and improvement potential for our products.

  • You collaborate closely with the product management and design teams in a responsive and fast-paced environment with flat hierarchies.


Your profile – your willingness to accelerate:



  • WatchKit, MapKit and CoreLocation are at the top of your favorites list?

  • Rumors of upcoming keynotes excite you many weeks in advance?

  • You have extensive experience in iOS development?

  • You already developed your own apps?

  • For you, design patterns do not involve using crayons?

  • Your proactivity gives you the ability to mobilize others?

  • You can communicate very well in English?


Your perspectives – move your career to the fast lane:



  • We have a very diversified job for you!

  • We offer you great degrees of freedom!

  • We offer you international career development opportunities!

  • We work in a very dynamic environment!


Send us a mail with a link to a successfully completed project in the app store or your GitHub repository.

jobs.title: ASP.Net Developer Wanted To Join Fun, Growing Company
jobs.content:
Looking for a mid-level developer familiar with ASP.Net 4+ with MVC and Webforms to begin work on projects using a proprietary e-commerce platform developed in-house. Developer would be trained and mentored until comfortable with tasks. Platform interfaces with MS SQL databases, so working with SQL is essential, as well as Entity Framework and Linq to SQL.


Programmers meet once a week to share ideas, gotchas, expectactions, etc.


Programmer can expect to work on one to three projects at any given time. HTML and JS will be provided to them along with a functional and technical spec, a dedicated Project Manager and a senior developer for guidance. The programmer will generally lead the project from beginning to end

jobs.title: Sr Android Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian is looking for a few passionate Android Engineers (mid and Sr level) to join our Mobile Team! This is a new team that will be housed in a brand new office in the heart of downtown Mountain View. The key responsibilities of the team are:



  • Research and prototyping with newest mobile technology

  • Development of both reusable software components and libraries as well as consumer facing mobile applications

  • Setting the standards and best practices

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian is searching for a talented Web Developer to join our brand-new Atlassian Community team. You'll be joining at the ground floor of a small, cross-functional team that is tasked with creating a flourishing online community for our users.


We're the team behind JIRA, Confluence, HipChat, Bitbucket among others, and we're working to create a thriving social community that supports our rapidly growing user base. You'll be empowered to utilize your deep understanding of user experience and web development to solve tough UI challenges, and ultimately, work alongside your cross-functional product team to make Atlassian Community an amazing experience. If you want to be part of a creative team that is pushing current trends in web development and has a substantial impact on the growth of a great company, this is a great opportunity for you. 


What You'll Do


As a Web Developer on the Community team, you will be working with a team of talented UX experts (Product Manager, Designer, Back-end Developers, and Community Managers) to build a cutting edge web experience for our users. You'll help craft a dynamic social platform that brings our user community together, creating a hub for discussion around support and knowledge sharing.  You'll drive innovation by coming up with new and exciting ideas to creatively solve issues. You will be encouraged to proactively look for opportunities to improve the design, interface, and server architecture of Atlassian Community.

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Our customer base is growing quickly, and we want your combination of sharp technical and warm people skills to help our customers solve problems and get the most out of their databases at Compose. We operate a fleet of various databases, so there is something for everyone: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, RethinkDB, and likely many more!


If you are a developer, DevOps/SRE magician, or database junkie and know how to help developers with technical questions, we want to talk to you. You will be most effective if you have an inquisitive nature, are technically-inclined and love to learn. We are not just looking to fight fires, we are looking to prevent them. We pride ourselves in providing top-notch support and guidance, so being able to communicate effectively with empathy and compassion is a must.


This is the perfect position for a motivated learner who wants to gain experience within a vibrant team focused on building an intuitive and customer-focused product. Spending time with our customers and product will let you interact with all sorts of interesting characters and will help you grow into a high-end distributed systems engineering position (we need those too, so if you start on support and do a great job, there is a huge amount of room for growth).


We're a distributed team and we work across many different time zones. If you're a night owl, an early riser, or somewhere in between, we're happy to accommodate untraditional work schedules -- our worldwide customers often need help at odd hours!


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Developing software appeals to those who love to solve puzzles and apply their creative energy -- and also to those, in our experience, who like working from home in their pyjamas. It is often said that one of the trickiest accomplishments in the development world is imagining, building and maintaining a complex and interconnected mental model of your entire infrastructure within your working memory. If you have experience applying this mental feat within some type of Software-as-a-Service and want to grow into something new, we have a tremendous challenge for you and a terrific team willing and able to support you through it.


We need crafty humans to help expand the Compose vision. Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.


Think you're a match?


Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.


At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.


We look forward to meeting you!


Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.

jobs.title: Senior Applications Developer
jobs.content:
General Summary:


Wayside Technology Group, Inc. is seeking qualified candidates to fill a Senior Applications Developer position. In this position you would work within the IT Development Team designing, developing and maintaining all applications systems within the Company. As a Senior Application Developer you will be involved in the more challenging or domain-specific projects having both the experience and instincts to move rapidly. Candidates for this position will need to be ready for the most cutting edge technology as well as transaction processing and complex database interaction.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Developing new architecture and maintains existing architecture of Application Systems

  • Integrates pre-build products into the Company's network, working closely with third-party vendor technical support

  • Communicating with outside vendors with questions regarding API's of third-party products

  • Having significant responsibility for architecture design decisions — a confident decision maker who can make decisions on their own while establishing and meeting timelines

  • Contributing creative technical ideas at weekly scheduled meetings regarding the development of software modules

  • Contributing constructive ideas as well as constructive criticism at bi-weekly peer code reviews

  • Developing Requirement documents, Code Specification documents for planned software modules

  • Responsibility for performance tuning and optimization

jobs.title: Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Wirecard is a globally operating and leading provider of technology for electronic payments in all distribution channels: Online, mobile and at the point-of-sale

As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.

The companies belonging to the Wirecard Group develop intelligent solutions to assist mail-order merchants, tourism and haulage companies as well as providers of digital goods and services with electronic payment transactions. 


We are looking for a System Administrator Linux (m/f)  to join our team at Wirecard Technologies GmbH, a subsidiary in Aschheim/Munich.


Your Duties



  • Operating and planning of an enterprise server environment

  • Support of development, QA and production systems

  • Install, upgrade and support of infrastructure services

  • Development and maintainance of different administrative applications and scripts

  • Enterprise-level Troubleshooting and Analyzing

  • Conceptional work and project based work

  • Optimizing performance and reviewing concepts of the current IT Infrastructure

  • Coordination of subcontractors


Your Profile



  • Planning, design, specification and development of test plans and development of test cases for our web and backend applications

  • Automation of test cases covering front end and backend applications

  • Working together with the Scrum team to add value to user stories

  • Develop and work together with the entire Scrum team on User Stories during Sprint Planning and User Story Workshops

  • Documentation and presentation of test results including release recommendations at the Sprint Demo

  • Active participation in defect tracking and root cause analysis


What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events


Become part of our success story. Become part of a highly qualified team, united by a vision: to make payment happen. For any questions please contact: Mr. Benedikt Bossert Human Resources Manager benedikt.bossert@wirecard.com +49 89 4424 1323

jobs.title: Wanted: Data Scientists for our Data Driven Analytics Products, Nuremberg
jobs.content:
GfK is one of the biggest global insights providers, with an incredible data landscape: Sales data, purchase insights, global trends, consumer profiles, cross-media exposure, Social Media buzz – all these sources contributing to a holistic, integrated understanding of markets, preferences, and behaviors.


We are convinced that by bringing this data landscape together with the best Data Scientists and consultants, we can create data products and services of tremendous value. For this reason, we have founded our new global DDA (Data-Driven Analytics) unit that leverages our data landscape, our technical solutions, and our expertise in order to develop and launch a new premium analytics offering for our clients.


Are you interested in taking this journey with us? Join our team!


For our DDA unit, which will combine agile start-up atmosphere with the advantages of a Global Player, we are looking for exceptional (Senior) Data Scientists who want to become part of an interdisciplinary and international team and contribute to an important global initiative: Leave your footprint and make an impact on GfK’s position in the analytics market!


Concrete tasks will include



  • contributing to the refinement and ramp-up of the DDA technology and (Big) Data analytics stack (which includes e.g., testing new tools, defining processes and blueprints, developing recommendations on how to handle specific data challenges),

  • developing scalable, cloud-based analytics “as a service” software products that leverage GfK’s data landscape for answering important business questions of our clients,

  • driving successful, data-agnostic analytics projects, by

    • supporting our DDA “Analytics Services” teams in consulting our clients with regard to data-related business challenges,

    • translating the client challenges into analytic designs and data requirements,

    • carrying out the analyses using suitable Data Science tools and our Big Data integration platform

    • presenting the results convincingly, or developing interactive data products.





Requirements


We are looking for team players with a hands-on approach, who appreciate the opportunity to work in an international environment on product developments and projects of strategic importance. A close collaboration with both our consulting/business experts and our technology experts should be appreciated – we are all part of one new, integrated team and work towards the same objective!



Developing scalable data products will be at the core of our DDA unit. Therefore, experience in turning Data Science algorithms and approaches into products will be very beneficial. A thorough understanding of how to address marketing challenges (such as pricing, product launch forecasting, etc.) analytically will be helpful, too.



Individuals who want to have direct client contact will get the possibility through challenging ad hoc projects. While our aim for solutions and data products of extraordinary quality requires research-driven individuals, a strong commercial focus and a very good understanding of how to address real-world business challenges with analytics solutions are equally important.



We are convinced that Data Science works best in teams – nobody knows everything. Hence, we look for a variety of profiles with complementary skills, such as:




  • Expert statistical modeling skills (e.g, predictive models)

  • Expert knowledge of analytic programming languages (R is required, but knowledge of further languages, such as Python or Julia is a plus)

  • Experience with using cloud-based analytics platforms, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services

  • (Expert) skills with regard to developing data products and transforming algorithms into scalable software

  • (Expert) skills with regard to performance optimized programming (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, C++ integration in R)

  • (Expert) data visualization/visual analytics skills, also using standard tools, such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau

  • (Expert) knowledge of optimization, data integration, data mining, and machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with handling and integrating data from different sources – structured and unstructured, small or big.

  • (Expert) skills with regard to working in Big Data environments (e.g., Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Pig, Hive)

  • (Expert) skills with regard to sourcing of open data (e.g., from Web APIs)

  • Solid to good understanding of Big Data Architectures

  • (Expert) skills with regard to database handling, in particular SQL

  • Ability to think creatively in addressing real-world business problems analytically, while maintaining the balance between “art & science”

  • Ability to translate sophisticated analytical information into understandable recommendations

  • Strong business understanding – ideally with in-depth experience in a certain industry (e.g., Technology, Media, FMCG,…)

  • Proven project management skills

  • Proven communication, presentation and client facing skills

  • Ability to confidently and clearly communicate in an English business environment (required!)

jobs.title: Developers for healthcare software platform
jobs.content:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

jobs.title: Senior Application Developer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Developer, you will be responsible for maintaining and expanding the tools our company uses every day.  Additionally, you will assist in the improvement of the department as a whole, extending influence beyond individual programming tasks.  This includes assisting more junior developers with their projects, guiding them toward better programming solutions; assisting department leadership in setting and achieving department goals; reviewing complicated or mission-critical designs, code, and tests; and seeking and documenting ways to improve our current codebase and system processes.


We value developers who write simple, efficient, maintainable code; possess good communication skills; seek to thoroughly understand the needs of the business; and are able to get things done.  Our team growing: if you possess these qualities, we would love for you to apply!

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for Software Engineers to lead our Agile Scrum development teams in building products to support Merkle’s Identity Recognition vision.  Your team will develop code all day, every day, on a full stack cloud platform using Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure, leveraging test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery.  Your team will work in a highly structured, paired programming environment to enable learning and maximize productivity.  You will partner with Product Managers at Merkle to translate our product strategy into highly functional, modular, and high-performance code.  This is a tremendous opportunity to lead the creation of next-generation technologies, capabilities, and products to set us apart from the competition.


About You



  • You love to code and you’re willing to fail fast and iterate to success.

  • You’re an experienced team lead or senior software engineer ready to step into a lead role

  • You’re someone who enjoys educating less experienced developers

  • You’re ready to judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of your customers.

  • You play well with others and have well developed communications skills.

  • You have experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies. If you are not interested in truly living in this world, it’s not going to work out.

  • You are proficient in several programming languages. You will be pairing with developers and need to be able to understand code well enough to ask/answer good questions.

  • You have a clear understanding of cloud services, deployment models and distributed systems.

jobs.title: Senior C++ Engineer - Rendering
jobs.content:
Animal Logic is seeking a Software Developer to join its core R&D group to develop and enhance our proprietary rendering software, including our state-of-the-art rendering engine, shading system, and scene representation.


You will be working alongside some of the best artists and developers in the world applying your technical skills to create new tools and techniques for generating highly realistic imagery.

jobs.title: Web Software Engineer/Developer
jobs.content:
HappyCo is looking for a Web Software Engineer/Developer with experience in designing and creating high quality software applications. 


A Software Engineer performs software design and development in accordance with organisation standards, participating in and devising solution approaches by analytical thinking. They work in a team-oriented environment to produce the best result in the given constraints.

jobs.title: Software/Productivity Engineer
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for talented Software Engineers who are passionate about improving the state of Software Engineering. This role impacts all of our engineering team and will help improve speed of development and quality of product. Responsibilities will include: Identify and develop technologies/tools which can drive improvements in efficiency of our system; recognize potential risk factors on our website; Performance, integration and chaos engineering; provide best practices to the engineering teams. Our software is quickly evolving and used by millions, this role will be dynamic, challenging, and critical to our success.



  • Identify and develop technologies/tools to improve the efficiency of our system.

  • Risk assessment: help determine functionality that have the biggest productivity impact on the site.

  • Performance/Integration/Chaos Engineering.

  • Provide best practices to the engineering teams.


The Person



  • Must have good programming skills with OO (preferred experience with functional programming)

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Working knowledge chaos/performance engineering;

  • Working knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment process

  • BS or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred

  • Experience with building code static analysis tools


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

jobs.title: Mobile Lead
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for a talented iOS developer to join our mobile development team. The successful candidate will be part of a team that is developing a highly visible app in the App Store. More than just an app, Jet.com is leveraging technology and innovating around price to help reduce some of the inefficiencies in the ecommerce market to ultimately help drive down consumer costs. Being a small company with an even smaller mobile development team you will have a chance to work on a new platform from the ground up, helping architect and build new features for the Jet app.



  • Work closely with our product and design teams to customize the Jet experience for the iOS platform

  • Join our collaborative philosophy by being an active member in the Objective-C/Swift/iOS community

  • Architect and build new features for the Jet iOS app and help with development of our iPad specific app


The Person



  • 3+ years of professional software development experience during which you have worked with a team to ship products iteratively

  • Experience working with a disciplined software release, build, and deploy processes

  • Experience building or adding to a published native iOS application

  • 2+ years experience building iOS applications

  • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field preferred

  • Excellent communication and organizational skill

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

jobs.title: Sr. Financial Analyst/Manager, Sales & Marketing
jobs.content:
At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. People—the listeners, the artists, and our employees—are at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora.

We're looking for an experienced Sr. Financial Analyst with drive, enthusiasm and flexibility to take on a high impact role supporting our Sales organization. We are looking for a motivated professional who can, drive process improvements and solutions needed to support the business, and deliver outstanding financial analytics & reporting.The successful candidate must be comfortable with ad-hoc analysis and projects, finance and accounting processes/systems/tools/modeling, implementing controls and driving impact.

We are looking for an individual with a “can-do” attitude who is a fast learner, hardworking, organized, detailed, passionate about their work, energetic and ready to make a big impact. The ideal candidate is personable, approachable and collaborative in all of their working relationships.

Responsibilities: 
  • Consolidation and ownership of monthly reporting package for Sales Leadership
  • Ability to ‘tell the story’ and drive insightful analytics from overall Pandora financials
  • Management of Powerpoint decks for budget, strategy, and business reviews
  • Various ad-hoc analysis and process improvement projects - must be able to jump in and support team needs

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • 5-7 years of FP&A work experience at a media company; experience supporting an Ad Sales organization a plus
  • Strong PC skills - proficiency Excel and PowerPoint required
  • Knowledge of financial systems (Anaplan and Oracle) a plus
  • Demonstrated experience in developing complex financial models; excellent quantitative analysis and forecasting skills
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, can easily present complex financial issues to non-finance executives
  • Strong interpersonal and cross group collaboration skills, ability to drive simplicity within a matrix environment
  • This role requires a hands on approach and the individual must be comfortable in rolling up his/her sleeves and driving change
  • Ability to thrive in an unstructured environment with minimal supervision
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics

Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply.

Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation.

If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com.

jobs.title: Sales Training & Enablement Onboarding Specialist
jobs.content:
At Pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. People—the listeners, the artists, and our employees—are at the center of our mission and everything we do. Actually, employees at Pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. Collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. Be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. Discover your future at Pandora. 

The Sales Training & Enablement Onboarding Specialist at Pandora will manage select Onboarding projects for the Pandora sales organization, including but not limited to content, project management, delivery, and measurement of Sales Boot Camp for Outside, Inside, and Vertical sales teams. This person will report to Sr. Manager, Sales Training & Enablement, in the Pandora Oakland office.

RESPONSIBILITIES (include, but not limited to):

  • Content:
    • Liaise with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to update training content via PowerPoint, Word documents, job aids or similar materials.
    • Design interactive and engaging training games and activities.
    • Customize select modules for specific sales channels.
    • Identify content recommendations for future improvements based on observations and post-training analyses.
  • Project Management:
    • Develop work-back schedules and timelines; manage projects and contributors to milestones, monitoring timeliness, quality, and budget.
    • Communicate project status to management and stakeholders; anticipate roadblocks and recommend alternatives.
    • Oversee version control; identify folder conventions to archive and manage content accordingly.
    • Manage participant enrollment and communications
  • Event Management & Facilitation:
    • Execute a seamless training event; manage logistics and details
    • Facilitate modules + webinars; participate in voiceover opportunities.
  • Reporting & Measurement:
    • Oversee and manage registration, attendance, completions, and assessments.
    • Utilize the Learning Management System (LMS) and relevant tools to manage courses and aforementioned tasks accordingly.
    • Assess data and identify trends; Create readout reports and show key findings. 

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum of 3 - 4 years of experience in training, sales, client services, or marketing. Experience within the digital media space a plus. Direct sales experience is also a plus.
  • Experience managing projects within a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines is a must; supporting a sales organization is a plus.
  • Experience developing and overseeing creative deliverables, such as PowerPoints and 1-sheets.
  • Experience working within an LMS (ie. CornerStone) is a plus.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Highly organized; must demonstrate an ability to develop workback plans and adhere to timelines.
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills; can present ideas and content in a professional and engaging manner.
  • Can work with data, identify trends, draw conclusions, and form recommendations.
  • Is flexible with changing priorities and simultaneous projects; Enjoys and thrives in a fast-paced, changing environment; Possesses a sense of urgency.
  • Strong interpersonal skills; Enjoys building cross-functional relationships and working with others in a collaborative, social environment.
  • Has mastery of Microsoft suite of products, including Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, and Excel; Is adept at learning new technologies and tools, including but not limited to a Learning Management System.
  • Independent thinker; Takes initiative; Able to push a project from start-to-finish
  • Great attitude; No job is too big or too small
  • High energy; Finds inspiration in each wave of new hires

Travel to New York City or other Pandora offices may be required ~2/year.

Pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. Pandora is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status. Women and people of color are encouraged to apply.

Pandora is also a VEVRAA federal contractor. Pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each ESDS, as required by regulation.

If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com.

jobs.title: Principal Full Stack Rails Engineer/Manager
jobs.content:
About the Role


Product is our primary concern. We hire engineers with great Product instincts because we are also the Product team. Building great software is a collaborative effort, so we work directly with stakeholders in the business. We deliver products & solutions—not features—because we understand how Stitch Fix works and are trusted to focus our time and effort where they are needed most.


We are looking for an experienced principal full-stack engineer who has built or worked heavily on a couple of Rails applications and has some other MVC framework experience. You want to help lead a team to success.


You love talking to your clients & users about what you can build for them. You are interested in how Stitch Fix works as a business, not just in the technology, and you would like a chance to make it work even better.

jobs.title: Mid Level Full Stack Developer Overseas Welcome
jobs.content:
We are currently recruiting for a web developer to work within our technical team on a wide variety of projects related to the company’s technical and marketing projects, both internally and on behalf of our clients. Assignments will include front end development, server side programming, API development and database administration as well as support, development and maintenance of our proprietary core platform.


The role will require the use of a wide range of technologies and frameworks including (but not limited to) ASP.Net (C#), ASP.Net MVC, ASP.Net Web API, Relational and Document Databases, XHTML, CSS/sass, jQuery, Node.js, AngularJS and React.


Key roles and responsibilities:



  1. Development of responsive user interfaces using modern front end frameworks (AngularJS or React) and/or traditional XHTML/CSS/jQuery as required.

  2. Integration of front end systems with our core platform (CMS) and/or web APIs.

  3. Installation, configuration and maintenance of our clients’ systems and our core platform.

  4. Development of API controllers and other server-side components.

  5. Basic database support and maintenance.

  6. Investigation and resolution of general support issues.

  7. General maintenance of servers/hardware.

  8. Documentation and utilisation of internal development standards and practices.


We welcome applications from international developers that would be happy to work remotely in our team as well as local candidates.

jobs.title: Back-End C# Developer
jobs.content:
Dynamic Signal is searching for talented back-end engineers to help us build a globally distributed, consumer-facing platform coupled with real-time reporting and analytics tools.  You will solve architectural and algorithmic problems that come with having a fast-growing list of Fortune 500 customers.  This includes exposing data and business logic to front-end developers and building behind-the-scenes services and databases.


What you do:



  • Put things together.  You know how to build business logic in C#.  Your code is manageable, modular, and constantly being tested.  You can integrate systems such as PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, and RabbitMQ.


  • Take things apart.  You rely on solid computer science fundamentals to break down a problem into high performance, scalable, and distributed solutions.


  • Learn how things work.  You’re not afraid of new technologies.  You handle .NET technologies such as LINQ, Entity Framework, and Windows Services.  You quickly pick up third party APIs, particularly OAuth social media APIs from Facebook, Twitter, and others.


  • Play nice.  You collaborate with the product management, front-end, and mobile teams to design and build new features.  You expose APIs for internal use and modern RESTful web services for the public.

jobs.title: Full Stack API Developer
jobs.content:
What we do:


We develop a platform that helps companies get information into the hands of their employees in a way they can easily use and share.


Who we are:


We have created a welcoming work environment that fosters collaboration as well as a realistic work-life balance. We are passionate about our product and encourage everyone to bring their unique skills and experiences to make it that much better.


Who you are:


We are looking for a talented problem solver with at least one year of real-world experience to help us develop, troubleshoot, and document our internal and external REST APIs. We use technologies like C#, JSON, and Postman to build manageable and reusable web services for our clients. Roles you will play in a typical day:



  • Advisor: A key part of our APIs is exposing them for our customers to use. We make this possible by documenting them and creating useful examples.


  • Programmer: Our APIs are used by our member-facing website, mobile apps, and external clients. We build our systems using C# so experience with a robust, type-safe, object-oriented language is a plus.


  • Investigator: Do you like getting to the bottom of a problem? Our APIs play a central role in how all of our systems interact so switching gears and tracking down potential bugs can come at a moment’s notice.


Do you want to become intimately familiar with the finer points of OAuth? Do you dream about crafting a response object that will work in the future as well as right this moment? If you enjoy helping out by having a keen awareness of all the major components (and not just a single silo) then you will be a great fit on our team.


Bonus points:


Want to earn some serious bonus points? What better way to show interest in an API developer position than to actually make some API calls? Feel free to check out what positions we have available and apply for one that you like by sending a GET request to http://api.dynamicsignal.com/jobs and going from there.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content: The primary focus of this position is to provide integration, design, and application development services for our clients. This is a high-visibility position requiring an individual primarily versed and experienced with web technologies and programming. In addition, the individual must possess good communication skills, as well as good planning and foresight to help design and implement unique and customized application solutions.

jobs.content: The primary focus of this position is to provide integration, design, and application development services for our clients. In addition, the individual must possess good communication skills, as well as good planning and foresight to help design and implement unique and customized application solutions.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


As part of the Artemis engineering team you’ll help craft simple and — dare we say it? — fun tools that help benefits professionals get value out of their healthcare data. You’ll have a lot of variety in what you work on (from custom data visualization to fluid user interfaces), and you’ll have a lot of autonomy in how you get the job done. Consequently, we expect you to take initiative in planning out how you’ll implement features and proactively consult other team members when you need input.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • Javascript

  • AngularJS

  • d3.js

  • HTML5

  • TypeScript

  • CSS, LESS

  • Bower

  • Gulp


Bonus Points for Experience With...

  • Healthcare data in general

As part of the Artemis engineering team you’ll help craft simple and — dare we say it? — fun tools that help benefits professionals get value out of their healthcare data. You’ll have a lot of variety in what you work on (from custom data visualization to fluid user interfaces), and you’ll have a lot of autonomy in how you get the job done.
