jobs.title: Sr. SQL Data Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


Help us build the most robust health data pipeline ever! If you don’t want to be a cog in a machine, you’ll love it here. We need your help in a lot of places:



  • Translating incoming data layouts into clean database tables

  • Working with implementation managers to ensure that the metrics our customers want to analyze are fast

  • Translating classification and summarization logic from our clinical teams into efficient SQL or Python

  • Tuning slow queries to get them up to speed

  • Writing data quality tests and summaries to run as part of our data pipeline


We like to work with people who enjoy owning projects and both the responsibility and the autonomy that comes with that.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • SQL

  • MySQL

  • Data warehousing

  • AWS


Bonus Points for Experience With...



  • Healthcare data (especially claims and eligibility)

  • Python

  • Postgres

  • Building web-based enterprise software

jobs.title: Product Engineer  no BS
jobs.content:
As one of the first full-time hires – and the first non-founder engineer – you'll be a core member of the founding team. You could be someone who wants to remain an individual contributor or someone who wants to grow and manage an engineering team. We’re open to both.


We’re looking for someone to help launch new features, expand test coverage, bolster our API, and improve site and platform reliability as we grow. The ideal candidate is someone who values code simplicity, readability and reliability, but who also realizes that successful software is more than just a passing test... it’s a happy customer! 


More generally: your role will be to build and support a marketplace that connects parents with teachers, coaches, performers and other providers of activities, camps and classes. You’ll work closely with our product team to find the sweet spot between customer development, design and code. And you’ll also help set the company’s overall technical direction.


The Galore founding team is based in SF, but we’re open to making this a remote position. If you’re not located in the Bay Area, we’d establish clear and open lines of communication. We use Slack, so this should be easy, and we'd need to spend at least one week per quarter working together in person.


Though we’re well-funded, we’re scrappy and very intentional about the way we spend money. We expect you to value equity and that you’ll make millions of dollars if and when Galore reaches a liquidity event. Also, take comfort in the fact that our funding gives us a very long runway to seize this opportunity, and we’ll increase cash comp as our revenue grows.

jobs.title: Senior QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Connance is looking for a strong Senior QA Engineer who is passionate about delivering quality products to our clients. As a Senior QA Engineer, you will develop, implement, and execute test cases to ensure our software functionality meets the highest standards of quality before going out to production.


We work in a fast-paced, collaborative and fun environment, and are seeking a Senior QA Engineer who can not only bring experience to the team, but can also explore and learn new and interesting ways for us to efficiently test our products.


Responsibilities:



  • Define, develop and implement quality assurance practices and procedures, test plans and other QA assessments

  • Design and execute manual and automated testing systems using commercial tools, scripts and data sets

  • Assist with test automation efforts by writing test scripts and analyzing results of automated tests

  • Perform thorough test case execution and defect reporting and documentation

  • Review test results to assure quality of existing and new functionalities

  • Work with other members of cross-functional teams to deliver quality test plans that meet defined requirements

jobs.title: Senior Web Application Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Prospecting team at AdRoll is seeking a Senior Web Application Engineer to develop a new, innovative data product as a part of AdRoll's marketing platform. You will work closely with a small team of engineers, product managers, and data scientists to implement user-facing features for Prospecting and our library of shared UI components. If building scalable, usable, modern UIs is close to your heart, this is your dream job.


In this role, you will collaborate with our Product and UX teams on designing new features and improving existing products based on usage data. Through this cycle of iteration you will learn what makes great products tick and ultimately make life better for our users.


At AdRoll Engineering, we value the freedom and autonomy we give to our employees and encourage everyone to use a multitude of different technologies based on their interests. As a UI engineer, you have an opportunity to share your knowledge and help other engineers build modern web UIs and shared components.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with other engineers and product managers on building web applications, APIs and data visualizations

  • Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt

  • Perform A/B tests, participate in user interviews and analyze usage data to make informed decisions

  • Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger


Qualifications:



  • 3+ years experience building web user interfaces for B2B or B2C products

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript as a language beyond popular frameworks

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals

  • Experience with (or willingness to master) our stack, in order of importance: React, Redux, ES6, SASS, Python, SQL, Docker, and AWS


Bonus Points:



  • Contributions to the open source community

  • Experience building shared components or libraries

  • Experience with internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n)

  • Experience in visual arts, graphic design, usability research or human-computer interaction


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Real Time Bidding
jobs.content:
About the Role:


As a Real Time Systems Engineer you will need to straddle several of AdRoll’s core technologies: our stack includes Python, Erlang, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL, HBase, and our own open-sourced solutions.  


Responsibilities:



  • Improving the intelligence of the bidding systems, converting insights from AdRoll’s data science team into robust, scalable code

  • Make key improvements to our core distributed systems infrastructure, powering over 500 thousand individual bid requests per second

  • Be a part of a team working on a high volume, highly available system, critical to the success of the business. Balance performance and modularity in systems where every millisecond counts

  • Roll up your sleeves and dig into every nook and cranny of AdRoll’s codebase


Qualifications:



  • BS or MS in computer science or related field

  • 5+ years in a functional or object-oriented language

  • You do your best work when you have lots of freedom and can take ownership of your projects from concept to finish


Bonus Points:



  • Erlang, Java and Python experience - programming Polygots welcome!

  • Has a genuine interest in Open Source and has personal projects


About Our Tech Stack:



  • Web applications powered by Flask, Pylons, PostgreSQL, Backbone.js, React, SASS and more

  • Soft realtime systems running in Erlang

  • Big-data backend running Hadoop, HBase, Storm and Thrift

  • We rely heavily on AWS -- AdRoll is one of Amazon’s biggest customers!


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Role:


AdRoll Growth is a cross functional team focussed on driving core business metrics by deploying technical assets across the AdRoll sales and marketing funnel. We have latitude in terms of what problems we solve, what tools we use and how we solve those problems. We are data driven and work in six-week experiments. We have Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Intelligence people that collaborate and sit together. A day in the life of AdRoll Growth can include working on our A/B testing infrastructure, implementing a new onboarding tool, helping other teams become more growth orientated, adding a new feature to our product dashboard or writing an MVP to test out a new idea.


You are:



  • Comfortable working across the stack: including Python/Flask, PostgreSQL, JavaScript (React/JQuery/Backbone) and AWS

  • Biased towards action. You ship quality code quickly and don’t let the perfect be the enemy of the good

  • A voracious learner. You’re excited to learn about new tools and methods and you’re not afraid to ask for help

  • Data driven. You look to the data to drive your decisions and build products with measurability in mind

  • Up-to-date on the most cutting edge developer growth tools. You know when to buy versus when to build

  • Empathetic to the customer. You’re passionate about improving the AdRoll experience

  • Love to work collaboratively with a tight-knit team


Requirements:




  • You have experience building web applications in one or more server-side web frameworks and languages (preferably Python)




Bonus Points:



  • Previous experience in a growth team or early stage startup

  • Any experience in marketing, AdTech or UX


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About the opportunity:


At AdRoll, we prefer the sense of perspective that comes from a diverse group of people and a healthy work-life balance. When we aren't busy making AdRoll a fantastic place and product, you'll likely find us tinkering with hardware projects, going on bike rides around the bay, playing some Street Fighter, and spending time with other Rollers.


We are currently seeking Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our teams in retargeting, native ads, big data and data science to implement and develop products and features that will make a big impact for our external customers and internal stakeholders.


If you think AdRoll is the place for you, then apply today to join our engineering community. If there is a team/role that looks to be a match, a member of our technical recruiting team will follow up.


Responsibilities:



  • Write high quality maintainable code

  • Work with product management and fellow engineers to plan features, create specifications, and estimate effort.

  • Help establish technical standards as the product(s) scales up

  • Create high profile customer facing/internal product(s)

  • Develop novel solutions to the test, interface and stability challenges that arise in SOA environments


Requirements:



  • 5+ years experience building production web applications in a corporate or start-up environment.

  • Strong fundamentals: B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

  • Productive in one or more imperative programming languages.

  • Productive in one or more server-side web frameworks and object-oriented languages.

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and system design

  • Experience in modern web application development and frameworks, e.g. ES6, React, Redux, Sass.


Bonus Points:



  • Interest in deployment automation and scalable infrastructure. (AdRoll is a big user of AWS!)

  • Meaningful contributions to the open source community

  • A good sense of design, direction, and humor


Our Stack:


Python, React, AWS, Redux

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer - SF/DC/CHI/MN
jobs.content:
Here at Rally we believe in teamwork, communication, trust and not taking ourselves too seriously. We believe in the power of small teams. We believe in supporting personal growth and the importance of nurturing a great culture.


About us:



      Flexible minds: We need to do a lot with a small team, so it's important to use the right tools for the right job and be willing to change down the line if we find a more efficient solution. We also believe in "strong opinions, weakly held," being humble, accepting and giving feedback.


Self-driven: Developers are given a large amount of autonomy in how they work, who they work with, when they work, and are responsible for a large part of driving project functionality and seeing them through to completion.



      Quality-focused: Quality code helps a small team do more. Increasing communication through code readability decreases the cost of maintenance to ensure we don't work weekends.


Entrepreneurial: Developers are given complete ownership over their projects from design to implementation, testing, deployment and production maintenance.



      Communicative: We believe in teamwork and sharing the experience through design reviews, code reviews and weekly technology presentations.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer, Rally Core - DC/CHI/MN
jobs.content:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a privately owned company of 400 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with a market capitalization of $115B and net income of $5.8B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.


This position is with the horizontal (non-product specific) engineering organization whose mission is to provide data engineering, authentication, identity and session management, authorization, medical plan eligibility, enterprise admin tools, and related services to the rest of the company.  We have openings across the entire org and there are opportunities to move across individual teams and work on different services.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
Purpose, mastery and autonomy. We provide all three at Rally Health (rallyhealth.com), a startup that's revolutionizing health and the face of health care. Work for the purpose of improving millions of people's wellness and lifestyles. Help build our platform which includes Scala using the Play framework, MongoDB, RabbitMQ and Elasticsearch. Join an elite team of engineers and have the autonomy to architect the full solutions that scale to fit our user growth. 

 Responsibilities:



  • Vocal champion of quality within the organization

  • Work with the most technically challenging components to create automated testing scenarios

  • Work as a key contributor to increasing the speed and quality of key deliverables

  • Contribute to developing performance testing infrastructure

  • Drive organization-wide adoption of automated testing frameworks 


Requirements:




  • B.S. degree preferred

  • 2+ years of real industry experience creating automated test architectures

  • Experience working with Scala/Java & Python

  • Experience using Object-Oriented programming languages such as Java or C++ 

  • Experience with Selenium Webdriver

  • Experience with Load testing frameworks is nice to have


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer, Mobile
jobs.content:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a privately owned company of 400 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group. Join a passionate mobile team on a mission to empower millions of users to improve wellness and find care through devices they use every day.


We are looking for someone to join us and make an impact right now as we increase our offerings on the mobile platform. This is a technical leadership role with an opportunity to influence technical and product decisions. If you are fascinated by mobile and its endless possibilities in health care, come join us!

Things you’re excited about:




  • Mobile development

  • Building consumer products that delight millions of users

  • Continuously improving and simplifying user experience

  • Joining a team built on a foundation of collaboration and respect




You have experience with:


  • iOS and Android development with deep knowledge on at least one platform

  • Technical lead role with responsibilities to oversee work of other engineers and interfacing with partner teams

  • Programming languages - Swift / Objective-C / Java

  • Server integration (REST endpoints)

  • Released at least one app participating from inception to launch

  • BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related field




Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

jobs.title: DevOps Director
jobs.content:
Rally Health improves health and saves money with our friendly, easy-to-use products that help people improve their diet and fitness, shop for health benefits, and find the best doctor at the right price for their needs.


We do it at scale, with millions of reachable accounts and thousands of concurrent users, figures which are roughly doubling every year. The Operations team drives the systems that power this growth in a stable, secure, and performant way, and we are looking for YOU to join and lead our team, working from our San Francisco office. The team is geographically and organizationally distributed, with nationwide presence and complex reporting relationships. The ideal candidate will have management experience in such an environment.


As a director, you will be responsible for setting a direction for operations, reacting to and anticipating business, technical, and cultural problems and opportunities. We are a high-touch, collaborative organization, and you will be expected be an aggressive steward of the culture, providing room for individuals and teams to take risks and sometimes fail while not compromising the integrity or availability of our systems. "Firm but fair" is sort of corny but that's what you will be. You'll be courageous and strong-willed too, changing the team and technology as it needs to be changed in order to achieve our goals.


Security experience is a must, including defensive design, incident management, and vulnerability management and assessment. Since we manage health-care data, we must comply with HIPAA and related laws, and good decision-making and data-defensive thinking are critical for our team members: you will be expected to articulate and enforce security policies and present them at a senior level inside and outside of Rally Health.


Our technology stack is modern and always changing, but we are thoughtful and deliberate about bringing new technologies; it is important that you are or were hands-on relatively recently, as this is a fast-moving space. You will develop and communicate a technical vision for where our site operations needs to go to meet business needs over a multi-month timeframe. Where we can, we make decisions based on data, and the ideal candidate would know how to use tools such as Librato and Splunk to gather their own data to make design and architectural choices. Experience in creating and managing a technology roadmap in a SaaS environment would be a major advantage for any candidate.


Culture is important to us and we cultivate it carefully. We do not strive for heroism and while we recognize and reward individual accomplishments, we know that ultimately, teams win. Most of our projects are paired work and several of our team members are embedded in development teams. I almost wrote this whole job posting without saying DevOps. Oh well! Yeah, we do that too, whatever it is. 


We offer a competitive compensation package that includes stock options, free health care for individuals (families prorated and highly discounted), daily catered lunches, snacks, and unlimited PTO.

jobs.title: Senior Designer
jobs.content: TMZ is hiring a Senior Designer in Los Angeles

jobs.title: Web Developer - PHP Full Stack
jobs.content:
VTM Group is looking for a PHP Full Stack Developer to join our Web Services team. Do you have a passion for designing and building great web software? If you are eager to work hard and are ready to hit the ground running, then we want you on our team! The ideal candidate will have a can-do attitude, passion for technology, development experience, and a constant desire to grow.



In this mid-level position, we’re looking for someone who can get up to speed quickly, manage their assigned tasks, interact with and contribute to our dynamic team.



What you’ll be doing:


This role will be primarily responsible for the development and maintenance of VTM Group’s web software systems, including Causeway and other custom web applications. Additional responsibilities will include support and maintenance of Drupal and WordPress websites, customer support and service, and managing/planning development projects.

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
Crest Financial, the fastest growing leasing company in Utah, is growing and looking to hire a new Senior Software Architect. We are an exciting entrepreneurial company providing services for the Finance industry. Our company uses many of the latest technologies offered by Microsoft. We have been in business for over 11 years with continued growth each year. We are located in Draper UT.

This is a permanent position. Salary is commensurate with experience. Our company offers health insurance, 401K, life insurance and vacation/holiday benefits. Candidates must pass a background check and drug screening.

What Youll Do:

You'll be responsible for architecture, coaching junior developers, maintaining coding standards, implementing development practices, and overall management of a group of bright, motivated software developers.

  • Have 7+ years' experience in multiple IT disciplines; Operating systems, databases, networking, MSSQL scripting, hardware and software troubleshooting, familiar with xml, other languages and technologies.
  • Must love developing solutions for integrating systems into complex environments.
  • Must thrive on problem solving and troubleshooting
  • Be passionate about owning end to end solutions and delivering with quality.
  • Be a collaborator and easily build a network of subject matter experts.
  • Have a Bachelor's, Master's degree or equivalent experience.
  • More than willing to lead, but also know when to follow.

Benefits


Compensation, Perks & Benefits

We know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture and one that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired, you can expect;

  • Very Competitive Base Salary
  • Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage, 401K,
  • Great PTO plan
  • Fun and relaxed work environment


Recently honored as the #1 FASTEST GROWING COMPANY IN UTAH by Mountain West Capital Network, #2 by Utah Business Magazine, and the 39th FASTEST GROWING COMPANIES IN THE US by INC 5000, Crest Financial is an industry leader in No Credit Needed financing throughout the U.S., located in Draper, Utah.


Founded in 2005, Crest has been able to achieve success due to our awesome employees that believe in our mission statement of "...provide Families with No Credit Needed financing through selected Retail partnerships". We truly believe in helping our customers and retailers nationwide with options that they normally wouldn't have access to! We are looking for individuals that are up for the challenge in helping us not just maintain but exceed our past growth!


A truly Employee-Centered company, Crest Financial believes in hiring the right people, for the right job, and giving them the creative freedom to use their strengths to benefit the team.

Crest Financial does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Crest Financial does business.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead .NET Software Developer
jobs.content:
***Please note: only US applicants will be considered for this position***


We are looking for a Senior/Lead .NET Software Developer who is well-rounded and passionate about technology, software development, and anything else they do.  Your experience, and your capability to learn new skills, will be fully utilized.


Team Size / Dynamics



  • You will be working with a small distributed team, and a variety of technical team members (including Systems, Data and QA)

  • We work collaboratively, use Kanban for task management, and daily Stand Up meetings for coordination

  • Our processes and systems are geared towards making us lean, efficient and effective, and we will expect you to push these further


Technical Environment



  • We are heavily invested in Microsoft technology with Windows Server, .NET, Azure, and SQL Server serving as the foundation for our systems.

  • We maintain & develop solutions on a variety of platforms, including mobile, web, cloud, and desktop.


Responsibilities



  • Execute full lifecycle software development

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code

  • Design test plans and scripts from project requirements

  • Integrate software components into a fully functional software system

  • Document and maintain software functionality

  • Maintain accurate tracking of issues and work items

jobs.title: Senior Rails Developer
jobs.content: We’re looking for an experienced Rails Developer to help us turn around a wide variety of client projects. You should be actively engaged and passionate about the technologies you’re using, quick to learn, and excited to collaborate. And you should be inspired by a work environment in which requirements and technologies vary from project to project, driven by a balance of the client’s needs and our expertise and experience.

jobs.title: Freelance JavaScript Engineer
jobs.content:
Smart Design is looking for a Freelance JavaScript Engineer to help supplement our Interaction and Technology team on an exciting client project.  We are seeking an engineer who is passionate about working with design teams and being a part of a fast moving team where you can make a difference, solve a challenging engineering problem and deliver quality code for an MVP. The client project is an interesting challenge in the healthcare space, but some of the deliverables will include heavy data-driven dashboards, so previous fintech experience a plus.


As the primary engineer on this project, you will be responsible for ensuring that we are up to date with the latest technology trends, libraries and best practices. The role will be full-time for approximately 2 months. Some remote flexibility, but must be onsite 3 days a week at our studio, and be available for daily stand-ups even when working remotely.


We are interested in talking with Software Engineers who have experience with the following technologies:  



  • Proficient in either Angular or React is a MUST

  • Ruby on Rails or PHP (preference for Ruby)

  • D3.js

  • LESS or Sass

jobs.title: Front-End Developers
jobs.content:
Exceptionally gifted front-end developers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded interdisciplinary research group based in New York City.  These hires will work closely with our world-class team of chemists, biologists, and computer scientists on developing web and mobile information-management interfaces that are critical to our research efforts.

Successful candidates will design and implement dynamic websites that deliver rich and intuitive user experiences using Javascript, HTML, and CSS.  In addition to UI/UX design, relevant areas of expertise might include WebGL, D3, Python, SQL, Django, Flask, Numpy, and Matplotlib, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement. 

D. E. Shaw Research is pursuing long-term projects aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the fields of biochemistry and molecular biology using high-performance computation for molecular dynamics simulation. We are developing multiple generations of the Anton special-purpose supercomputer, as well as a variety of simulation tools that run on commodity clusters and GPUs, with the aim of fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.

We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation to candidates of truly exceptional ability.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/UID

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

jobs.title: Remote Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Ideally you are better at *something* that the rest of the team. A team is like a jazz band. You always want to be playing with people that are better than you. That applies to us. We want you to be the best at something so you can learn from us and we can learn from you. The only thing we're sure of is that we don't know everything.


As a Rails Devleoper you'll primarily be responsible and be the go-to person for all of our front end application dev. You probably have a good eye for design.


We use Node.js, Rails and Ember.  So we would expect that you'll want to learn that. Willingness to learn, and aptitude to learn are important. I've seen rookies that can learn faster than veterans with a decade of experience. So, we don't have any hard and fast rules about "number of years experience".


We'd like to see some URLs or some kind of portfolio with your application. You'll generally get an e-mail back right away if you take the time to send us an application and include some kind of URL or portfolio.


Bonus points for using remote technologies to get an interview scheduled.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content: Work for a company you can be proud of. WaterFurnace, the most respected name in geothermal, is looking for a talented developer with an aptitude for front-end development to join our award-winning ma...

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Network Systems
jobs.content:
SOFTWARE ENGINEER - NETWORK SYSTEMS


Fastly is looking for engineers to create the software responsible for configuring, controlling and coordinating our global network. While we operate within the same constraints imposed by network hardware as our competitors, Fastly distinguishes itself by being a software company first and foremost, and we pride ourselves in having always taken a systems perspective to computer networking.


Whether you work on pushing packet performance at the data plane, defining APIs for interacting with network processes at the control plane, or applying decomposition methods to global traffic management is largely immaterial: if you have built a solid understanding of a problem space and are now ready to drive clean slate solutions, you should talk to us.

jobs.title: Distributed Systems TLS/API Engineer
jobs.content:
TLS SYSTEMS ENGINEER


We’re looking for talented software engineers with experience in communications security to join our team. We’re building exciting products to bring the power of our CDN to the delivery and automation of secure content. Remote workers are encouraged to apply. Pacific time zone or close to is preferred.

jobs.title: Director of Application Security
jobs.content:
DIRECTOR OF APPLICATION SECURITY


As Director of Application Security at Fastly you will manage and build Fastly’s application security team of security architects and security engineers.


We are looking for a Director of Application Security who has a track record of building a team that isresponsible for all development aspects of securing a large sophisticated system. The Director will drive application security to help protect the biggest online platforms in the world, handling massive amounts of traffic at very low latency, for customers with diverse security requirements.


This is a role with a high impact, friendly security team. In addition to contributing to industry leading security products and services, you’ll make sure our customers benefit from a service built to the highest security standards in the industry. We’re in beautiful downtown San Francisco, but for the right candidate, we’re open to considering a remote position, and we have the team and tools in place to make it work.

jobs.title: Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
SENIOR NETWORK ENGINEER


Fastly is seeking best-in-class Senior Network Engineers who can help us scale and operate one of the fastest growing networks in the world. Ideal candidates have experience with high-density, multi-vendor data center deployments, and are excited by the opportunity to build and operate a complex software-defined network. Members of Fastly's Network Engineering team must possess the ability to autonomously define and complete complex projects, automate routine tasks, manage around failure, and work across many teams for larger initiatives.

jobs.title: Security Researcher
jobs.content:
SECURITY RESEARCHER


As a Security Researcher at Fastly you will help ensure our security efforts are rooted in a deep understanding of the state of the art in web application vulnerabilities, denial of service attacks and bot mitigation techniques and methods.


We are looking for security researchers at all levels of seniority who enjoy investigating web application security threats to contribute intelligence to our security products and services. Qualified candidates will show an aptitude for discovering complex security issues that affect modern web sites. We encourage our security researchers to present at network and security conferences and participate in the security community.


This is a role with a high impact, friendly security team. In addition to contributing to industry leading security products and services, you’ll make sure our customers benefit from a service built to the highest security standards in the industry. We’re in beautiful downtown San Francisco, but for the right candidate, we’re open to considering a remote position, and we have the team and tools in place to make it work.

jobs.title: Application Security Engineer
jobs.content:
APPLICATION SECURITY ENGINEER


As an Application Security Engineer at Fastly you will help ensure we provide a secure edge for the biggest online platforms in the world, handling massive amounts of traffic at very low latency.


We are looking for versatile engineers at all levels of seniority who enjoy being deeply involved in all aspects of building and securing our platform. Qualified candidates will excel at analyzing the design of our software and implementations, and will show an aptitude for discovering complex security issues. We encourage our security engineers to present at network and security conferences and participate in the open source community.


This is a role with a high impact, friendly security team. In addition to contributing to industry leading security products and services, you’ll make sure our customers benefit from a service built to the highest security standards in the industry. We’re in beautiful downtown San Francisco, but for the right candidate, we’re open to considering a remote position, and we have the team and tools in place to make it work.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer - Core Engineering
jobs.content:
Site Reliability Engineer - Core Engineering


We are looking for talented Site Reliability Engineers to help design the next generation of Fastly’s production service platform and drive the reliability, speed, efficiency, and security of our backend systems.  You will work with engineers on many teams to tackle the challenges of building a better, more flexible CDN.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Infogroup is looking for top talent to join our fast-paced and innovative team. We are seeking a/an Sr. Software Engineer to join our Papillion, NEoffice.This position is responsible for designing, developing, testing, maintaining and/or deploying business application software or specialized utility programs. This position is also responsible for writing and maintaining code, analyzing systems, coordinating project efforts and supporting a diverse range of applications.


Essential Job Functions:


1. Review business needs to develop software solutions.


2. Work with programmers and analysts to code and test software features to provide software enhancements.


3. Analyze, develop, implement and support applications or program components. Suggest improvements for products and processes.


4. Conduct analysis of systems and programs, including performance, diagnosis and troubleshooting of problems.


5. Provide technical leadership and coaching to team members as well as solutions to complex software development problems.


6. Conduct code reviews in accordance with department standards.


7. Create and update documentation throughout the development lifecycle to aid in maintenance and code reuse.


8. Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.


9. Develop strong working relationships with managers and analysts.


10. Provide leadership in the design and implementation of an array of applications.


11. Understand and work with data in with varying degrees of complexity and scale.


12. Translate client needs into functional programs that produce desired results.


13. Provide technical guidance on usage of systems.


14. Support systems and operations as needed.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Front End
jobs.content:
• Manage fellow software engineers with specific responsibility to support the growth of their careers

  • Architect and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Take ownership of any step in the software development process, from design through maintenance

  • Deliver high quality code, which is functional, maintainable and performant, while working and communicating in a team environment

  • Extend testing capabilities by writing unit tests, creating integration tests, and assisting in basic QA testing during new feature development

  • Proactively mentor junior and mid-career engineers

  • Support and enhance the Sprout Social culture

  • Drive your project team to build in Sprout’s best interests by being cognizant of business requirements, market need, customer pains, etc.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Wallaby Financial is seeking a Front-End Engineer to develop and own cutting-edge frameworks for transforming complex data into beautiful views. We help people get the most out of their money through smart credit card usage and are looking for someone to enhance that experience by creating consumer-facing financial web applications.  


This position is located in Pasadena, California.

If you have over FIVE (5) years experience and currently live in the United States, please apply!

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Mobile
jobs.content:
In an Agile environment, you will design and develop new functionality to iRobot's mobile application that controls connected consumer robots.  Although your role will focus on iOS implementation, the ideal candidate will be able to work on both iOS and Android platforms, including cross-platform development in C++.


Essential Functions/ Job Duties:



  • Design and implement new features for iRobot's Home mobile applications that interfaces with consumer robots

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested

  • Collaborate with other engineers and participate in code reviews

jobs.title: QA Manual Tester
jobs.content:
As a QA Analyst, you will be responsible for the verification and validation of new features, functionalities, and enhancements for HBC Digital e-commerce websites, back-end and internal applications. You will work closely with QA manager/test lead in the creation of test scenarios, development and execution of test cases, analysis of test results, detection and documentation of defects, and validation of bug fixes.  You will be working in a fast paced, collaborative agile environment.


What You Will Do:



  • Perform various testing types and techniques such as exploratory, functional, black box, browser compatibility, usability, end-to-end, user acceptance and regression

  • Develop and document test cases based on business requirements, functional and technical requirements, user stories and business use cases

  • Use HP QC or similar test management applications/tools

  • Identify, document and track defects

  • Work with database queries, parse data 

  • Troubleshoot issues and read log files 

  • Provide test status updates and defect report

  • Collaborate with cross functional teams

  • Provide QA support for scheduled deployments/releases

jobs.title: Network Socket/Protocol Programmer
jobs.content: KE2 Therm Solutions, Inc. is experiencing rapid growth due to our innovations in commercial & industrial refrigeration technology.  We are looking for a Network Socket/Protocol Programmer for expansion into industry verticals with our emerging technology which integrates Industrial and Ethernet communications securely.

jobs.title: System Administrator and IT Professional
jobs.content:
We are looking for an IT professional with a diverse set of skills and the ability to respond and adapt to unique requirements. We offer a flexible and supportive work environment with the opportunity to continuously learn and develop as you provide creative technical solutions in support of our engineers and projects.


Kyrus is a small company that works with the big picture in mind, taking on projects with real significance that grow our capacity to tackle even more fascinating development problems.  We've earned a reputation for efficiency, effectiveness, and impact since our founding in 2009.


Communication is paramount in this position, and we are interested in hiring an effective team member who will actively engage with our administrative and engineering teams and work closely with our Director of IT to design and implement systems and solutions.


Responsibilities


System and network administrator in support of engineers, software developers, and administrative staff.


Participate in the design, setup, and maintenance of project-specific IT systems and solutions.


Work as a site lead and team member. Ideal candidates will be comfortable working with a  diverse set of hardware, software, and networking environments. Essential skills include administration and maintenance of VMware ESXi servers, Linux servers, Windows Servers, Active Directory, networking, and Windows, Linux, and OSX client and development systems.


Advantages of Working at Kyrus


The opportunity to work with a small team of highly-skilled individuals dedicated to solving real-world problems.


A small company with a focus on personal productivity and potential, Kyrus respects employees and trusts them to do their jobs. Kyrus provides: flexible hours, work from home when appropriate, flexible vacation and leave, personal training and business travel budgets.


Benefits


Fully paid medical and dental benefits;


Health Savings Account;


Flex savings account (FSA) for health and dependent care;


401k;


Annual training and conference budget;


Life , short-term and long-term disability insurance;


Cell phone and home internet expense reimbursement;


Unlimited paid vacation;


Flexible work schedule;


Ability to work from home when applicable;


Fitness budget.


Additional Requirements


Due to the nature of our work, applicants are required to be a US citizen with an active security clearance, or have no significant impediments to acquiring a security clearance.


Due to the nature of this position, applicants must be able to perform heavy lifting: up to 50 pounds. Must be willing and able to perform physical activities including bending, stooping, pushing, standing and kneeling for long periods of time.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Python
jobs.content:
Friendbuy is on a mission to change how businesses acquire new customers.  Our platform powers referral marketing (refer-a-friend programs) for startups, large enterprises, mobile apps and everyone in between.  If you’ve ever referred a friend to Dollar Shave Club, Warby Parker, ClassPass or Glossier, you probably used Friendbuy


Friendbuy is rapidly growing and we are expanding our technology team.  We’re hiring software engineers who are ambitious and passionate, including those who seek a path to leadership.  We provide a fantastic trajectory for advancing your career.  We’re hitting our stride with amazing clients and rapid adoption, but we’re still early stage enough for you to join as a core team member.  So if you’re motivated to influence product vision, build a cool company and make a huge impact with meaningful equity, we want to hear from you!


How We Work:


We use Scrum methodologies with two week sprint cycles. We hold regular retrospectives and aim to constantly iterate on our process to identify areas of improvement. Product development is highly collaborative and customer driven.


We have three spacious offices in a WeWork co-working space located in West Hollywood, California. Our facility includes convenient walkable lunch locations, beer on tap, tea and coffee. This location also has a spacious outdoor terrace and plenty of great areas to hang out and enjoy the Southern California weather.

jobs.title: QA Tester
jobs.content:
BASIC FUNCTION

This full-time position is primarily a technical testing role working with an integrated team of product managers and software developers.  The primary objective for this candidate will be to prepare for and execute project conformance and regression testing of merchant payment processing software for new and enhanced products and services.  Accordingly, this position requires the identification, communication and tracking of defects through successful remediation.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Support the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) through collaborative efforts during requirements, development, validation and product roll-out;
  • Analyze requirements and transform them into manual and automated test suites;
  • Perform technical testing including project conformance testing and regression (system) testing, both from a positive and negative testing perspective;
  • Research defects including technical logs, websites and databases, to yield robust defect documentation;
  • Ad hoc assignments as directed

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Review, analyze and contribute to business, functional and technical requirements definition;
  • Develop level of effort estimates;
  • Develop test plans;
  • Identify and analyze test scenarios;  
  • Develop test project conformance and regression scripts/suites;
  • Automate test scripts;
  • Test execution in both manual and automated fashion; 
  • Defect identification, research, detailed documentation and collaboration with product management and software development. Provide daily statistical and written updates of testing progress; 
  • Escalate to leadership any unresolved issues in a timely manner. Knowledge sharing to support business operations and sales efforts;
  • Provide solutions and recommendations to policies, procedures and projects in a professional manner that aligns with the departments strategies and goals;
  • Provide and discuss weekly status reports;
  • Participate in department meetings as assigned; 
  • Complete miscellaneous duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelors degree from an accredited college/university, preferably in an IT related field 2-5 years testing experience and support of a full SDLC, preferably in the Financial Services industry or testing of accounting software;
  • Develop automated test scripts/suites using SmartBear, HP or Microsoft testing tools Knowledge and prior use of SQL, XML and Java Experience with balancing reports and the use of Excel spreadsheets;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • Time management so that deadlines are met and issues escalated in a timely manner;
  • Analytics of business and system requirements;
  • Risk mitigation and issue resolution skills.

jobs.title: Software Tech Lead  - .Net - MVC - NYC
jobs.content:
When the world throws technology challenges at us, we eat them up. And then we ask for more. Welcome to life on the TMP technology team. Here, you’ll work on our scalable, evolving platform, face tremendous software challenges, and work on projects for Fortune 100 clients. You'll be part of a fiercely collaborative technology team charged with creating digital solutions that are transforming the way employers and job seekers connect. That means contributing to high-traffic websites for a broad range of high-profile companies. Developing next-generation applications and products for some of the most recognized brands in the world. And actively supporting our diverse suite of best-in-class technologies. All this in an environment that constantly challenges you to push beyond boundaries and enhance your expertise—with the support of a global team of industry experts. Sound like a fit for your talent and passion? Read on.


Responsibilities:



  • This is a hands - on .NET development position

  • Work with latest technologies such as ASP.NET MVC, Entity Framework, AngularJS, RabbitMQ, elasticsearch, Redis, MongoDB

  • Research and recommend the implementation of new technology or technical tools to improve system performance, stability, development process.

  • Make recommendations as appropriate to ensure maximum stability and minimum downtime.

  • Contribute to overall technical strategy and development direction. Provide leadership on engineering aspects including design, analysis, testing and implementation.

  • Conduct and/or participate in formal and informal, internal and external technology presentations and reviews.

  • Oversee and develop next generation web applications and products.

  • Participate in all phases of the software engineering life cycle

  • Provide technical troubleshooting and debug support.

  • Develop and implement new products and provide information and support when required.

  • Evaluate new design proposals, investigate and recommend solutions and process improvements that deliver greater efficiency or performance benefits.

  • Ensure that necessary technical documentation is maintained in an appropriate manner


To learn more about TMP Software Development and what we are working on- check out these links:


https://www.tmp.com/tmp-technology-jobs


Stack Overflow page: https://careers.stackoverflow.com/company/tmp-worldwide

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
GrapeCity is currently seeking a passionate and driven Technical Engagement Engineer to join our team!  


This position will be responsible for engaging with our internal staff and external customers to support and advocate the GrapeCity Developer Tools’ product line.  


Responsibilities:



  • Provide accurate, thorough, and timely technical support to customers via phone, and internal ticketing system

  • Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of GrapeCity Developer Tools’ product line and related business functions

  • Effectively communicating solutions, support benefits, and product value via product overviews, demonstrations, and sample applications for customers and distribution partners

  • Perform functional testing of GrapeCity products, samples, websites and documentation

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering Team.  We are a highly motivated, innovative, broad-minded and flexible team that enjoys taking on hard problems of all types.  We seek fast, flexible learners that want to apply their knowledge and experience to complex problems.  You should be adaptable and creative in the face of a highly competitive and changing social networking analysis landscape, and enthusiastic about seeking truth in the face of huge amounts of data.


We are particularly seeking engineers of diverse backgrounds, experience in fields outside of pure software development being valuable to help bring differing perspectives to the table when it comes to solving problems.


We want passionate engineers, those who feel a great deal of pride and ownership in the work that they produce.  We feel that care in testing, documentation and logging and analysis go part and parcel with the development of a complete project.


We want excellent communicators, as our engineers work closely with our product development and design teams to determine the best ways to share our data and analysis with our customers.

jobs.title: Big Data Technical Lead
jobs.content:
Have you led teams of developers in an agile environment? Do you have an insatiable curiosity to dive into unfamiliar environments and technologies and squeeze productive work out of them? Do you thrive on experimentation and learning? Are you ready to be part of an environment that cherishes these attributes?


Workstate seeks lead developers with 2+ years of experience in Hadoop ecosystem technologies, particularly Spark, Kafka and HBase. You should also have led teams of 2 or more developers on enterprise-scale, real-world projects, ideally in an iterative or agile environment.


Workstate is a company started by developers to be a great place for people that love software development (and things related) to thrive. You will work in a close-knit team based environment that promotes quality, personal development, and work-life balance above short-term profit. This is aided by a clear path for advancement that results in low turn-over for greater continuity.


This position is with our Columbus, OH office. We are located across from the North Market and close to Short North and Downtown / Arena District lunch and entertainment options. We have a team lunch every Friday where we share what we've been working on throughout the week and discuss new technology, tools and techniques that excite us.


This position is only available to US residents based in the continental US who are eligible to work for any employer without H-1B visa sponsorship or transfer.

jobs.title: PHP Engineer - Symfony
jobs.content:
Do you thrive on the exploration of new technologies? Have you found joy in diving deep into an unfamiliar environment and technology and squeezing productive work out of it? Do you like to trade knowledge with others in diverse areas of expertise? How would you like to be part of a company that values experimentation and offers the opportunity to explore dozens of technologies in your daily work?


Workstate is looking for good associate to senior level developers with a desire to learn and who have current experience with PHP and the Symfony framework. If you have a couple of mid- to large-scale Symfony web applications under your belt, you might be who we're looking for.


Workstate is a company started by developers to be a great place for people that love software development (and things related) to thrive. You will work in a close-knit team based environment that promotes quality, personal development, and work-life balance above short-term profit. This is aided by a clear path for advancement that results in low turn-over for greater continuity.


While telecommuting may be an option, this position is with our Columbus, OH office. We are located across from the North Market and close to Short North and Downtown / Arena District lunch and entertainment options. We have a team lunch every Friday where we share what we've been working on throughout the week and discuss new technology, tools and techniques that excite us.

jobs.title: Rails Developer
jobs.content:
ATOMIZED is a tool for marketing leaders to dial in their own voice and presence on each platform while staying true to the overall brand story. We provide omni-channel visual content calendars designed with creative in mind. This simple but powerful layout allows marketing teams to quickly and easily compare campaigns across all mediums. Our patent pending and cloud-based design encourages ideation, collaboration, planning, and comparing, on the go and from any device.

You must have experience working with agile software development teams and have actively contributed to a codebase in a previous role or open source project. Our success is measured by our technology teams ability to ship enterprise quality software.

  • +3 years of experience in developing RoR applications.
  • Strong familiarity with Ruby on Rails and AngularJS
  • Good with data structures, algorithms and time complexity
  • Experience in developing, releasing and maintaining large-scale applications on AWS

  • Knowledge of responsive web development is a plus.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join a dynamic team of bioinformaticians and software developers that are creating an advanced cancer diagnostics platform based on next-generation sequencing technologies. We employ the latest web-based development technologies, using primarily Python and Django, and the Agile Scrum software development framework to quickly respond to customers’ demands. The team also supports R&D activities by providing bioinformatics expertise and analysis services.


Responsibilities



  • Take design requirements and implement new algorithms for cutting-edge bioinformatics tools

  • Maintain high quality code – test, document and optimize

jobs.title: High-scale Software Engineering in Go
jobs.content: This job is a fun, high-scale use of Go on Google Cloud Platform for a fast-growing (and well-funded) startup. If you secretly thought that you loved computer science more than everybody else in your classes and wrote code for fun outside of class, then we'd love to talk to you. And you'd probably enjoy working with our engineering team. We combine serious computer science with a scrappy, self-directed engineering culture that will give you plenty of opportunities to demonstrate valor and achieve glory.

jobs.title: PHP Software Engineer
jobs.content:
DomainTools is seeking a junior level PHP Software Engineer to join our team. This position is perfect for someone who loves the challenge of designing and building products for big data. At DomainTools we process and display information about relationships between hundreds of millions of domains, IP addresses, and domain ownership records. As a PHP Software Engineer, you will help develop and improve products that encourage user discovery and experimentation with our large data sets. This is a full-time permanent position in our offices in Seattle (Belltown).


At DomainTools, you will work as part of a small but highly productive team of smart and engaged engineers. Expect to spend much of your time solving complex technical problems around delivering large-scale data and analysis to security researchers. You will work in an environment where productivity is fostered. You will spend very little time in meetings, and you won't be distracted by processes that get in the way of high-quality results.


Perks



  • Work with big data and machine learning that matters. We're not just trying to sell more ads or widgets, we're helping organizations improve their security and protect against cyber attacks and domain hijacking.

  • Whatever hardware and software you need to do your job. Multiple 30 inch monitors - no problem, fully loaded MacBook Pros - no problem. Access to more processing machines than you can shake a stick at - no problem.

  • Free lunches brought in twice a week plus a kitchen stocked with plenty of snacks and beverages.

  • An incredible Italian espresso machine.

  • A cool, open layout workplace that is blocks from Westlake and Whole Foods.

  • A ping pong table (matches held every day during lunch time) and a media/game room.

  • And for the last few years we've taken a paid company ski vacation to Whistler, BC!

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us


Appboy is an industry-leading customer relationship suite for mobile marketers. Thousands of global brands use Appboy's robust audience segmentation and advanced multi-channel messaging system to create highly personalized lifecycle marketing campaigns in every relevant channel -- from push, in-app, and web to email, wearables, and emerging technologies -- across billions of user profiles worldwide to better engage, retain, and monetize their customers.


We have a cool office and fun people.  Our benefits are great and we get lunch catered every day.


About the role


On the mobile team, our customer is the engineer. That means we build bulletproof, performant, adaptable SDKs that support any environment you throw at it.  We build SDKs that the worlds best app engineers are excited to put in their app.  The APIs must be clean and intuitive, the integration must be quick and easy, and the footprint must be minimal.


As a member of the mobile team you will be contributing to SDKs that the worlds top apps use to understand and engage their users.  Your code will run on hundreds of millions of devices and you’ll have the opportunity to work on multiple platforms.  You will be on the bleeding edge of mobile development, working with a great team and owning critical pieces of our product.

jobs.title: Software, AI, or Cybersecurity Engineer
jobs.content:
INTERESTED CANDIDATES MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN, AND ELIGIBLE TO QUALIFY FOR A SECURITY CLEARANCE.


SoarTech, developer of TacAir-Soar, the world’s most intelligent virtual pilot and the SAGE visualization for the award-winning MAGIC robotic control suite (http://tinyurl.com/42mcdav), is seeking smart, energetic Software, AI, and Cybersecurity Engineers to join us in advancing the state-of-the-art in serious games, cybersecurity, robotics, and other related fields. SoarTech provides its employees with creative high-technology work, a flexible work environment (including schedule flexibility), and an excellent employee benefits program.

We are seeking skilled problem solvers with good design and programming skills in Java or C++ (Software Engineers) and specialists with experience in artificial intelligence (AI Engineers) or cybersecurity (Cybersecurity Engineers). Additionally, expertise or knowledge in the areas of deep learning, cloud services, big data, computer vision, machine learning, natural language understanding, autonomous systems, robotics, human behavior modeling, or 3D game engines is valuable. Engineers at SoarTech participate in all phases of development and have opportunities to learn and advance ideas, technologies, and software products. Engineers must think and act responsibly to accomplish project and team goals.



Responsibilities:
Design, document, implement, debug, and test software
Understand software system specifications and recommend improvements, this includes understanding the implications of system-level decisions and how to mitigate and leverage them
Participate in integrated test sessions with industry partners, academia and customers/sponsors
AI Engineers are also expected to implement algorithms, knowledge bases, complex logic, and other AI technologies

jobs.title: Ruby Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
kohactive is looking for a Full Stack web developer with proven skills developing backends and RESTful APIs in Ruby and Ruby on Rails. kohactive is a Chicago-based company working to empower entrepreneurs by helping them build brands and businesses. kohactive is looking for talented developers who can think out of the box and deliver lovable MVPs and functional prototypes.

  • Be proud of the things you build.
  • Launch successful businesses.

Benefits


  • Competitive salary
  • Health and Dental insurance (100% coverage)
  • Lots of PTO and unlimited personal days
  • Fun and casual work environment
  • Fully stocked fridge

jobs.title: Systems Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
At Canonical it is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We believe the best way to fuel innovation is to give the innovators the technology they need.  As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) for the Information Services (IS) team you'll play a key role in driving this mission and helping to define the future of free software.


Why this job is important


IS supports and maintains all of Canonical’s production services and IS team members use real-life operational experiences to contribute to product improvements.  The IS team at Canonical runs the services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.  As an SRE you’ll be in a unique position that will allow you to provide critical feedback to developers by writing code, submitting bugs, and working with others within the company to ensure that Canonical products are as good as they can be.  You will also be able to develop and submit fixes and enhancements directly.


What you will learn at this job


SREs work closely with development teams to build and maintain the extraordinary infrastructure required to run all of Canonical and Ubuntu’s systems and services.  The scope of our responsibility combined with the overall size of our environment means that our SREs face new challenges every day.  You can expect to gain hands-on experience in the following areas:



  • Software development in Python and Go in order to automate repetitive tasks

  • Continuous integration and continuous deployment using a combination of open source and Canonical developed tools

  • Operating clouds at scale using OpenStack, Ceph, MAAS and Juju

  • Deploying, troubleshooting, and optimising services running on both private and public clouds using open source software like Ubuntu, Apache, HAProxy, PostgreSQL, and Squid.


Canonical’s IS team embraces autonomy and to that end has instituted Self Directed (SD) time. A portion of your work week is set aside to allow you to work on what you think will most benefit the IS team specifically and Canonical in general.


Key Responsibilities


SREs rotate through three roles:



  1. Maintaining all core services, networks, and infrastructure (including public and private clouds).  The ability to work under pressure and demonstrate sound problem solving skills in a fast-paced and complex environment are key here.

  2. Working directly with a variety of development teams within Canonical in a devops role to test, deploy, monitor and maintain services running on our production clouds. This will require an overlap of development and administration skills, as you help write and review code you will then use to deploy and maintain services using Canonical's cloud products.

  3. Larger project work, currently focused on large scale cloud deployments and overall process improvements.  This role gives SREs the ability to utilize development and architecting skills in a focused manner that is unique to Canonical.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HealthMEDX is looking for talented, passionate Software Engineers who can come help us build and maintain a leading-edge healthcare software suite. Our Engineers build software that creates a better quality of life for thousands of post-acute care patients. Occasionally, they help Senior Support Representatives when they get stuck on a client issue. Most importantly, they help us continue to set the bar in our industry. 


Our Software Engineers code, debug, modify and test code for a variety of complex processes in web-based applications environment. Software Engineers develop technical specifications and serve as technical experts in assigned products (Clinical, Census, Financial). They improve knowledge of internal programming languages and tools, extended healthcare industry, and relationship with other software products.  Our Software Engineers also recommend improvements to cross-functional processes and mentors/trains less experienced engineers.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for experienced developers to join our team. Need to learn Ruby? No problem. Training’s on us. Once you’re on board, you’ll jump into our three-week Ruby on Rails training program.


As a Developer at CoverMyMeds, you create solutions that make our healthcare system work more efficiently and effectively in order to help millions of patients receive their prescription medications every year.  You build products that our partners in healthcare use everyday, and innovate products that don't even exist yet.  You work on small teams with other really smart developers with endless opportunities to take on responsibility, continue learning and mentor others.


Our Tech Stack:


Ruby on Rails, Python, PHP, Backbone.js, SQL-Server, PostgreSQL, Git, Elasticsearch, Capistrano, Redis, Sidekiq, Vagrant, Puppet, Apache, RSpec, Capybara, Cucumber, Watir


 What You'll Do:



  • Design and develop web applications and APIs for the CoverMyMeds product line

  • Design and develop internal support software  for our own awesome coworkers

  • Help our world-class support team solve tough customer issues

  • Contribute to and improve revision control and deployment in our fast-paced, agile environment

jobs.title: Senior Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced systems engineer to help us scale our infrastructure for Postmark, Beanstalk, and DeployBot. It's a big role to fill and requires broad knowledge of software and infrastructure. You'll have direct impact on how we define and build our systems. We consider performance and service availability a primary feature of every product we offer. Your work will ensure that tens of thousands of developers can successfully build on top of our services with confidence and peace of mind. 


Your role on the team


We run a fully managed environment of bare metal hardware and virtualized servers hosted in one of the most advanced data centers in the midwest (with ServerCentral). Our infrastructure is made up of a variety of server configurations (mostly Supermicro and Juniper), including all SSD storage and 10GbE networking.


You will help design and maintain the infrastructure for our products. This includes capacity planning of hardware and network as well as building the infrastructure to bring up new services. This might range from designing faster ways to provision servers to improving shared services like monitoring, logging, DNS, and IPAM. 


Our application developers are heavily involved in running and understanding the systems that our products are built upon. You will work directly with the team to help automate, provision, and scale the services that support our customers. 


For example, we are currently expanding to new data centers. You would help define how we automate provisioning across each data center while keeping network, security, monitoring and services consistent. This expansion is critical to lowering latency and increasing availability for our customers.
