jobs.title: Full Stack - NodeJS + React
jobs.content:
So we're not Twitter. We get that. We're also not GreenPeace.  We get that as well.  What we are, though, is trying to do our part to better the industry that we know best: Online Video.  And if we do our jobs right then we will become greater then Twitter and (maybe) GreenPeace!


We're creating a break through platform using NodeJS + React that will transform how online video is traded and exchanged globally.  Everything from your favourite music videos to breaking news will be discovered, exchanged and reported on our platform.  


We're just at the beginning of our journey so we need the ground floor crew - people who lean into problems and have great initiative and talent.   People who take calculated risks and push boundaries.  And yes, you've heard this song and dance before, but this is the real deal.  If we can get this right then the sky is the limited.


The ideal you will be:



  • A rockstar in NodeJS and React;

  • Have envious experience in transaction based architecture;

  • Be able to work remotely and as part of a virtual team;

  • Bonus marks if you've worked with online video before (we have!)

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
We have several openings for software engineers available at our downtown Chicago office. You will contribute in a variety of areas including: Multi-tenancy, Cloud Architecture, Distributed Architecture, Real Time Market Data Feeds plus much more. Bring your enthusiasm and problem solving skills, and we will take care of the training you will need in the world of finance.


As a team member, you will be working with an exceptional group of open-minded developers on our flagship product. Our cloud based platform allows us to constantly evaluate and incorporate new technologies and methodologies with plenty of opportunities to add to your skill set. As a part of this team, you will work closely with clients and other financial institutions, giving you a close insight into the financial industry.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are a small team of software engineers passionate about creating fast, lean, and robust Python code. We use Python 3, and broadly employ modern language features/libraries such as generators, decorators, functools, itertools, and collections. We leverage high-performance libraries like Pandas, numpy, and PyTables, and use Flask for microservices and (with Javascript) web UIs. While we do not write much C, we understand Python at the C level. We have spent some time in academia, so we prefer thoughtful, reasoned approaches. We tame large datasets filled with noise and irregularity, and develop reusable approaches to data pipelining, caching, and numerical processing. We habitually test everything we write, and practice continuous integration and continuous deployment. We develop on Linux and deploy, via Ansible and Supervisor, on a fleet of internally managed VMs. We take the time to find optimal designs, and invest in building powerful, general-purpose tools when needed. All of our tools are used in-house, so we benefit from having a small and collegial set of users.

We are the core development team in Investment Management at Research Affiliates, a global leader in innovative indexing and asset allocation strategies. We build the tools that construct hundreds of different portfolios; we create and maintain an expanding network of applications for processing portfolios and financial data, from back-end reporting to front-end comparison and analysis.

We are looking for software engineers who share our interests.

jobs.title: QA Specialist, Showtime
jobs.content:
Showtime Networks Inc., is seeking a QA Specialist to assist in maintaining and improving the quality of Showtime Anytime (our TVE Everywhere service) and the SHOWTIME standalone service, available to subscribers through iTunes, Roku, Google Play and Amazon.



In this position, located in Showtime’s New York City headquarters, you will be responsible for performing positive and negative functional testing, for compatibility testing, and for assuring data integrity.  The QA specialist will also collaborate with the Product and Development teams to verify, prioritize and address technical and quality issues that aversely affect the customer experience. 

An ideal candidate will possess 3+ years directly testing and/or supporting web and mobile media applications, applications for devices such as Roku, Amazon Fire TV, and Apple TV, and smart TV applications. The candidate is expected to be extremely detail-oriented and possess the ability to think outside of the box to devise creative techniques for testing. The ability to create -- and work with or without -- test plans or test cases is critical. Experience with Jira is a plus.

Responsibilities:



  • Obtain a detailed understanding of the behavior of (and issues affecting) Showtime Anytime and the SHOWTIME standalone service across all platforms. 

  • Perform tests of new features and functionality of Showtime Anytime and the SHOWTIME standalone service. 

  • Prioritize and collaborate to resolve issues interfering with the customer experience. 

  • Write test cases and use tracking and debugging tools to file, monitor and resolve issues. 

  • Communicate clearly and frequently with all team members, stakeholders and project/product owners impacted by test and troubleshooting results.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Developer - Showtime
jobs.content:
Showtime Networks seeks an exceptional developer with primary focus on backend Java, but with interest and experience in other languages and technologies. Ideal candidates will be innovative, self-motivated, a quick study, and willing to develop new skills while constantly improving existing abilities. The candidate must also be a strong multi-tasker with exceptional time-management skills. In this position, you will build the front and back-end frameworks for our TV Everywhere service, Showtime Anytime.


Overview:


This position is for a senior backend developer with broad experience. Candidates would join a focused team of developers with a wide range of skill sets to build and support highly-available, high-performance web sites, iOS and Android apps, apps for other platforms like connected TVs and game consoles, and the associated web service platform. Showtime Anytime is available to millions of subscribers, so writing code that can scale horizontally is key. We’re building the future of television, pushing onto new platforms... And as we grow the service, we’ll get to play with some great tech.


Key Technologies:



  • Java, Groovy, Spring, Mongo, Hibernate, OSX & Linux, Maven, Git, Oracle, Redis, Bamboo, JIRA, VMWare, Puppet, etc

jobs.title: Dev Ops Engineer - Showtime
jobs.content:
As a DevOps Engineer at Showtime Networks Inc., a subsidiary of CBS Corporation, you will be part of a growing team developing and supporting our TV everywhere service, Showtime Anytime and our stand-alone streaming service, SHOWTIME.


In this role, you’ll work closely with other software engineers, supporting the operation, maintenance and evolution of a wide range of systems. A proven track record of running Linux in a multi-server environment is essential, preferably using Ubuntu. Knowledge of Java (or better yet, Groovy), Node & PHP is ideal.


Based in Showtime's NYC headquarters, this is an opportunity to ensure that DevOps is right at the heart of our development process. You’ll maintain and enhance technical infrastructure, contribute to the architecture of the software stack, and automate testing, deployment, integration and provisioning. Ultimately, you will play a key role in delivering a robust platform that is performant, scalable and secure. We focus mostly on open source technologies, and right now we’re using Groovy, MongoDB, nginx, Varnish, and Elasticsearch.


Responsibilities:


·         Directly administer a number of internal systems, just as JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, and Postgres, MongoDB & MySQL instances


·         Coordinate remote hands at our Florida and Arizona datacenters.


·         Deploy and test new technologies as well as maintaining existing infrastructure


·         Obtain a detailed understanding of the behavior of (and issues affecting) our sites and apps across all platforms.


·         Display ability to prioritize and resolve issues interfering with the Customer Experience.


·         Communicate clearly and frequently with all team members, stakeholders and project/product owners

jobs.title: Android Developer  Showtime

Showtime Networks seeks an exceptional Android Developer. Ideal candidate will be innovative, selfmotivated, a quick study, and eager to develop new skills. In this position, you will take a key role in developing our awardwinning SHOWTIME stand-alone streaming service and Showtime Anytime applications across multiple Androidbased platforms, including phone, tablet, Android TV, Fire Tablet and Amazon Fire TV.


 Overview:


This position is for an Android developer with wide experience, ideally with deep core and media knowledge, as well as understanding of the backend APIs necessary to build successful media applications. The SHOWTIME and Showtime Anytime Android applications are installed on millions of devices, and the SHOWTIME app was chosen as one of the top entertainment apps in the Google Play store, as well as being featured in the Best Apps of 2015 collection. We’re building the future of television, pushing onto new platforms... And along the way, we get to play with some great tech.


 Key Technologies:



  • Java, Android SDK, SQLite, media playback, JIRA, Bamboo, etc


 Responsibilities:


Be involved in all stages of Android development from architecture to coding to final testing



  • Work as part of an Agile team to deliver high quality applications

  • Collaborate with the product team to plan, design and execute new features

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.content:
Data Analyst (Population Health)


Position Purpose:


To provide and generate reports summarizing financial data for use by the Population Health department when making business decisions.  Under management directive, this individual may evaluate reports and make recommendations which impact business decisions.  Position will support the Director, Population Health in his/her day-to-day operations with decision support and administrative needs.




Classification:  Full-time


Salary:  Competitive, DOE.


Benefit Package: Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Disability, 401(k), FSA, Holidays, PTO, and much more. 


Essential Responsibilities:



  • Provide administrative support to the Director, Population Health.

  • Provide financial and operational reporting to the Director, Population Health.

  • Run queries and create analysis utilizing all data warehouse systems.

  • Schedule, coordinate and take minutes for the committee and other meetings as requested.

  • Attend and participate in the Architrave Data Steering Committee.

  • Assist the Director, Population Health on creating, updating and maintaining fee schedules.

  • Maintain and update databases and reports used as reference for internal staff.

  • Respond and resolve data inquiries on select subject matters in a timely manner.

  • Compile, organize and analyze data from various sources to serve as research initiatives or financial data.

  • Develop and provide complex reporting and analysis on revenue and claims data.

  • Track population and health trends for purposes of identifying target areas of utilization and case management.

  • Understand and report on state mandated metrics requirements.

  • Document process for preparing any monthly or redundant reporting.

  • Create tools, spreadsheets and systems to improve financial data analysis and reporting.

  • Perform complex financial analysis related to special projects.

  • Assist in ad hoc research projects as requested.

  • Perform complex financial analysis related to special projects.

  • Other duties assigned.

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.content:
About the Position


We are looking for a creative and endlessly inquisitive Data Analyst to join our team. You will be working hand-in-hand with our head of analytics to develop highly optimized predictive models from a large volume of regularly updated data. In addition, you will be a key resource for building out custom analytics to help our work in the political and advocacy spheres.  You will be working in a small but dedicated, detail-oriented team, who put our mission above all things. The Murmuration work environment is friendly, driven, non-corporate but professional.


The Data Analyst will: 



  • Analyze local and state political races to help drive strategic electoral decisions for our partners

  • Create predictive analytics using the latest machine learning algorithms on relatively “big” data (hundreds of features on > 100 million records)

  • Work with other education initiative national staff and partner groups to craft analytic solutions to key problems facing our industry

  • Work closely with our business analysts to draft clear and informative data visualizations

  • Help optimize our analytic work to perform well on large datasets stored in AWS Redshift

  • Never stop asking questions of our data and will always be hunting for the next insight to be gleaned from our data

jobs.title: Database Administrator
jobs.content:
About the Position


We are looking for an experienced, innovative Database Administrator/AWS professional to support a network of Amazon Web Services resources as the backend to our new product. The role calls for expertise in designing scalable database technology and developing robust data strategy. Working with Murmuration’s team of developers and top political strategists, this individual will be responsible for developing the backend data storage for mInsights from design to implementation.


The Database Administrator will: 



  • Design, budget for and provision a large, robust AWS (Redshift, EC2, S3) data ecosystem to centrally hold and process data from partners and other data sources (multiple TBs)



  • Maintain our AWS data warehouse, doing regular quality control checks



  • Establish and implement database security and access control policies



  • Manage a small data team (1-2 people) to handle the intake, matching, and cleaning of frequent updates to the data warehouse from vendors and partners



  • Make recommendations and provide strategic support regarding ways to make data and database operations more efficient and effective across Murmuration



  • Collaborate with the analysis and data teams to understand application requirements and recommend best practices for manipulating data at scale.



  • Coordinate with data vendors to ensure fidelity of data and data ingestion processes

jobs.title: Application Architect & Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Portland, Oregon based recycling company is seeking a senior application architect to lead our enterprise-wide technology development efforts. A successful candidate enjoys a fast-paced environment while demonstrating an attention to detail and a can-do attitude. This position will own all planning, coordinate all aspects of software and related hardware development and align stakeholders across the entire business to successfully deploy projects for our growing company.


Responsibilities of this role include:



  • Performing complex software application programming in C#, Microsoft .NET, Java, and web/app development to maintain, enhance existing, or build new custom applications.

  • Reviewing, analyzing and understanding business department(s) needs and goals for the purpose of incorporating into overall strategies to design, develop and implement technology solutions.

  • Providing senior management guidance on appropriate strategies regarding long-term technology direction. Ensure alignment with all business departments and technology standards.

  • Carrying on design and development duties on complex and multiple on-going projects, often involving multiple disparate technologies and/or integration of third-party systems.

  • Acting as a focal point of expertise (both within the company and our suppliers) on key technologies or skills.

  • Defining and reviewing enterprise technology architectures in order to maintain a broad view and understanding of the company’s software landscape.

  • Other projects as may be assigned by the CFO and President.


Requirements:



  • Minimum of 10 years of extensive experience working as a hands-on application developer and 5 years as an architect.

  • Detail driven with strong communication, business analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Resilient and able to work in an organization that is undergoing change due to growth.

  • Must be self-motivated, disciplined, able to work on own initiative and take responsibility for own work.

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or information systems required. Master’s degree preferred.

  • Must demonstrate ability to effectively communicate with all levels of company personnel including the CFO and President.

  • Occasional travel to work with suppliers or at company sites.


Pay and Benefits:



  • Salary: $130k+ depending on experience

  • Medical/Dental/Life STD/LTD/LTC Insurance Plans

  • 401(k) with company match

  • Paid Time Off

  • Paid Holidays


Job Type: Full-time

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer

At Columbia University, we develop solutions that bring together and support alumni, and enhance education and research through increased donations and other forms of engagement. The full-stack developer will provide best practices and tools to coordinate between all roles within the team and contributing as an integral part of our development processes.   • Prototype, design and develop applications that are responsive and flexible.

  • Develop front-end and back-end code using JavaScript, HTML5 & CSS3 techniques with a focus on MVC design.

  • Troubleshoots business and production issues

  • Translate software requirements into workable and maintainable code


Essential qualifications listed below:



  • Solid understanding of application design and programming.

jobs.title: Full-Time Research Software Engineer in Los Angeles, CA
jobs.content:
MISSION STATEMENT


You are at the forefront of pioneering technology at space150. You are passionate about software and hardware development and wish to apply your experience and wisdom to new challenges. Your peers will seek you out for answers to difficult problems, or to check the feasibility of a solution. You will be a core software engineer on projects that push the agency forward through new ways of applying technology.


ACCOUNTABILITIES



  • Stays educated on latest trends and practices across all software engineering disciplines (Web, Mobile, Interaction, Animation, Computer Vision).

  • Functions as a core developer on one or several projects at a time.  Research Software Engineers often own entire code bases for a project, or responsible for large portions of functionality in extremely large projects.

  • Collaborates and reviews code with peers to ensure projects will be maintainable and performant

  • Assists supervisor with development story writing and estimation tasks

  • Configures development and production environments (including on-site installations) for both internal and external use

  • Collaboratively audits and provides feedback for interface designs.  Ensures that designs are appropriate with current development standards and within technical scope of projects

  • Ensures that projects developed achieve a precise alignment with creative design and user experience design specifications

  • Assists in planning or responding to projects and new business opportunities that have a higher degree of technical uncertainty or pioneering aspects


BACKGROUND



  • Degree in computer science, technical education or equivalent work experience

  • 3-5 years of experience in a Senior Software Engineer (or similar) role

  • Demonstrable record of successfully launched products

  • Competency in several core languages for space150


SOFT SKILLS



  • Ability to react positively to fast changes and requests

  • Communicates effectively on project progress and across disciplines of interaction

  • Constant awareness on projects, identifies issues and proposes solutions

  • Capable of leaving their comfort zone to learn a new language, framework or hardware

  • Creates a positive attitude when working with legacy code and/or projects

  • Proactively shares relevant technical and industry information across space150


CONSIDERATIONS



  • Research Software Engineers can work out of our Venice, CA office

  • Some travel is required for on-site installation and support


BE BOLD. APPLY.


You know the drill. Send us an email at careers@space150.com

jobs.title: Machine Vision Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We're a small machine vision company in Denver, CO generally focused on industrial markets - Artemis Vision www.artemisvision.com. It's currently a very busy team of 10. We have sales offices in Charlotte, NC, Dallas, TX and Lincoln, NE. We've been in business for 6 years and counting. The business is growing and so we need another engineer to join us. Given the size of the place we all end up doing a lot of different things and you'll be handed a lot of responsibility from day one. You'll discuss solutions with clients directly, and then go about implementing them. All the solutions we build accomplish very real world goals and solve real world problems of parts on production lines.  It's a very tangible job, solving "how it's made" for our customers.  We want somebody who looks to grow a business and deliver great solutions. We want people who are able to fully focus on building the best systems and solutions, yet also pragmatic and flexible enough to work for a small company.

*What we do:

We put in machine vision solutions throughout North America. Solutions are programmed here in Denver and then installed at the client site. We also program and license machine vision software and systems other companies install. We've been working on building a portfolio of standard products.

We're looking for fellow programmers who like machine vision and building systems from the ground up to exacting levels of quality. Because machine vision often moves into industrial automation, we end up communicating with a lot of embedded devices and dealing with some robotics and motion control. Skills with PLCs are a plus as are database skills (Oracle, MS SQL, MariaDB, etc.). We're programmers ourselves so we certainly understand skills in C++ transfer to C# or Java and vice versa. Every project is very different, and we need people who enjoy challenges and seeing if a given industrial puzzle can be solved and then pursuing that solution to a solid and reliable system.

In general most projects are programmed by 1-2 people so there's generally little bureaucracy around interfaces. Typically the system will have 1-4 users at a factory and you'll know them by name so there's no guessing about what the hypothetical "user" wants. Part of the job is discussing it with them and they'll tell you what the system needs to do.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Web Applications
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) seeks an innovative team member to join our Manufacturing Application Development group in Pullman, Washington as a Software Engineer. This team develops mission critical manufacturing execution systems ranging from machine automation, to production line user interfaces, to real-time business metrics.


If you are looking for an opportunity to develop cutting edge user interfaces and applications as part of our Manufacturing Application Development group, then this position is for you!


SEL’s corporate office is located in Eastern Washington where you'll enjoy an unmatched quality of life. Enjoy the smaller town life: country space, freedom from traffic, easy access to recreational activities in nearby mountains, rivers, and forests, as well as great schools and universities.


Software Engineer – Web Applications


Responsibilities:



  • Work with Manufacturing Engineers, Management, and Assemblers on the production line to understand needs

  • Design and implement solutions to make manufacturing processes more robust and more efficient

  • Build modern user interfaces using Angular and WPF

  • Superior ability to prepare and maintain designs and test documentation.

  • Mentor Associate Engineers and Technicians.

  • Continuously understand, create, and simplify our Manufacturing processes.

  • Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:



  • B.S. in Computer Science, or equivalent

  • Fluency in Angular, JavaScript, HTML and CSS

  • 2+ years post-college experience with Object Oriented software development (preferably in C#, Java, C++ or TypeScript)

  • Strong skills with modern object oriented design approaches

  • Strong writing, documentation, and speaking skills

  • Ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities

  • Ability to work cooperatively in a team environment

  • Background check results satisfactory to SEL

  • Negative drug test result(s)


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Experience with Angular.JS 1.X

  • Experience with User Experience (UX) design

  • Experience developing single page web applications

  • Experience designing web components

  • Experience with REST interface design principles and best practices

  • Experience with code generation tools (ribosome, T4)

  • Experience with MS SQL and WPF


To Apply for This Position:


We ask all candidates to apply through our website at www.selinc.com/careers. If your qualifications and experience match any of our current openings, please submit your resume for that position so that you may be considered immediately.


SEL sends an initial e-mail response to all applicants at time of resume submittal. If you do not receive this communication, please check your SPAM filter and make sure your system is not blocking e-mails from SEL. It is important that you ensure your receipt of this e-mail as SEL may communicate future position updates via e-mail.


SEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants considered regardless of ethnicity, nationality, gender, veteran or disability status, religion, age, sexual orientation or gender identity, or other protected status.

jobs.title: QA and Test Manager
jobs.content:
Saent is looking for a hands-on and experienced QA manager. You not only understand the discipline of testing, but are also able to design, manage and implement a testing process (and keep improving on it). Ideally, you also have experience recruiting and building a test team and help us grow our QA efforts.

At Saent, weâre helping people live fulfilling lives by coaching them toward better and healthier work habits, something we call âmindful productivity.â We do this through a combination of software and hardware products, built by a completely distributed team of people all around the world (currently in Los Angeles, Providence, Berlin, Ho Chi-Minh, Beijing, Shenzhen) for customers who are also all around the globe (60+ countries).

In this role, you will be responsible for testing all our productsâ features, which includes our software and hardware products. You will be working closely together with our software and hardware development teams, as well as customer support, and our early release user groups. In the near future, you will help us build a QA team, so this role mixes hands-on tasks with managerial responsibility.

This role is not for you if youâre looking for structure and someone holding your hand all the time. We are still a very young company and the team and our processes are still being built; donât expect to arrive in a typical managerial role where your responsibilities are very narrowly defined and clear.
Saent is set for fast growth in the months and years ahead, and weâre building a solution that eventually will benefit all the worldâs 640 million knowledge workers. You will have a chance to help build the company and team, and shape our QA efforts and structure for the years and decades ahead.
In addition, we offer you the opportunity to work from anywhere you want: Saent is a fully remote team and we donât mind if youâre in San Francisco, Bangalore, or a remote island in the Pacific. A solid internet connection is the only requirement.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Build a team of QA professionals and implement appropriate testing processes throughout the organization.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our products and vision.
  • Keep testing tools and ticket tracking up to date.
  • Test all new features of both our software and hardware products.
  • Work closely together with customer support and our development team on bug tracking and resolution.
  • Coordinate early (beta) releases with our test groups.
  • Responsibility for quality of all our software and hardware releases.
  • Ensure content and structure of all testing documents / artifacts are documented and maintained.
  • Document, implement, monitor, and enforce all processes for testing as per standards defined by you and executive team.
  • Provide updates and reports on overall quality for other teams in the organization.
  • Ensure the timely delivery of testing milestones.

REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS

  • Being hands-on and not afraid to âget your hands dirty,â especially early on without any other testers on the team.
  • Experience in QA and testing of software and hardware, ideally with experience building and managing a QA team.
  • Experience in project management.
  • Excellent communication skills in English in both a written and verbal form.
  • Extremely organized with a great eye for detail.
  • Remote working experience desirable.
  • Passionate about productivity and work-life balance.
  • Computer Science or Engineering degree or equivalent work experience a strong plus.
  • Demonstrable passion for and experience with both Windows and OS X software / apps, as well as with wearables, IoT, or connected devices.
  • Experience managing and interfacing with (outsourced) teams in Asia (currently China and Vietnam), where English may be a second language.

What we offer you
  • A market-rate salary.
  • The ability to work from anywhere at anytime.
  • Unlimited vacation days.
  • A Kindle with an âall you can readâ buffet on us.

Recruitment process

Round 1: send us your CV on jobs@saent.com, including a cover letter with answers to the following five questions:

  1. What makes a great test manager in your opinion?
  2. Looking at Saent from the outside, what's something you would do differently if you were in charge?
  3. Whatâs the biggest challenge youâve ever faced and how did you overcome it?
  4. Whatâs the one reason why we should hire you (and not someone else) for this role?
  5. Whatâs the most fascinating book youâve read recently?

Round 2: follow-up questions by email.

Round 3: asynchronous interview over Slack spread out over a week with one or more Saent team members.

Round 4: Skype interview.

Round 5: paid test assignment. 

To apply: Send us your CV on jobs@saent.com, including a cover letter with answers to the following five questions:1. What makes a great test manager in your opinion?2. Looking at Saent from the outside, what's something you would do differently if you were in charge?3. Whatâs the biggest challenge youâve ever faced and how did you overcome it?4. Whatâs the one reason why we should hire you (and not someone else) for this role?5. Whatâs the most fascinating book youâve read recently?

jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Systems Software
jobs.content:
Why Pure

We’re here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We’re inspired by our belief that storage isn’t just a place to put things, it’s a powerful strength to be unleashed - a strength that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word “impossible” from tomorrow. Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance.

Our Team

Puritans come from various backgrounds and we thrive off of challenging the norm. This cross pollination of backgrounds led to numerous ground breaking ideas and has helped us build one of the most reliable and easy to use storage systems in the industry. We aim to hire the best and brightest people, who excel in a cutting edge, fast paced, collective and open environment.  We are seeking enthusiastic individuals to solve real world problems while having fun along the way.

What You Will Be Doing

Pure Storage is seeking a technical software development manager to help lead product development and grow the overall Engineering organization. You will be leading a team of software developers in the creation of our product and will need to partner with product management, QA, technical writing, and various other software teams.  You will also provide the necessary technical direction and mentoring to employees on your team and others to achieve successful project outcomes.

In this role you'll get to learn and contribute to the process of developing great technology and building a successful company.  Our open culture and transparency in both strategy and operations allows employees a deeper level of engagement in engineering and business decisions.  

What You Bring To The Team

  • BS in computer science or equivalent
  • 3 plus years of technical management experience, at multiple levels while staying hands-on in development
  • 5 plus years of systems software development experience (C/C++/Java)
  • Proven expertise in managing projects throughout the entire SDLC, delivering products to market on schedule, and ensuring feedback loops from customers into development
  • Strong customer focus
  • Experience introducing and growing an agile (Scrum) environment with short cycles
  • Solid knowledge of end-to-end quality best practices
  • Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills

Culture & Perks

Pure is a very special place. What makes and keeps us special is who we recruit to join us and how we work together. Our culture was shaped organically as our early team poured their heart and soul into Pure’s first generation product and supporting our early customers and partners. We expect each employee to approach their job at Pure with the same level of pride and care, and perpetuate the values that are making us the best storage company in history.

At the center of those values is the belief that the single most important thing we do is continue to hire the best and create a workplace where they thrive and enjoy. To reward our employees for the great work they’re doing we offer a number of perks and benefits, including:

Flexible vacation - take time off when you need it

Extraordinary medical benefits with 100% employer paid premiums

Commuter benefits for public transit and bicycle commuters

Free lunches, dinners, and fully stocked snacks & beverages

Lounge areas with ping pong, foosball, pinball, and arcade games

Company ski trips, boat parties, BBQs, happy hours, game nights... just to name a few!


#LI-AH1

jobs.title: Global HR Communications Manager
jobs.content:
Why Pure

We’re here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We’re driven by our belief that storage isn’t just a place to put things, it’s a powerful force to be unleashed - a force that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word “impossible” from tomorrow. Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

 Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance.

 Position Overview

This internal communications role will be responsible for leading strategic communication planning and execution for Pure, including enterprise-wide employee, HR and executive communications. The ideal candidate will develops and maintain ongoing communication plans that align with the company's people and culture strategies. In addition, the individual is responsible for advising the executive leadership team on best practices for the communication of strategic initiatives and programs. This role reports to HR with a strong dotted line to the VP of WW Comms.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Develop and execute strategic communication plans that support and enable the company's people and culture strategies.   
  • Craft a broad range of employee communications that align with the company's people and culture strategies, and disseminate to Pure employees, i.e. “Puritans”
  • Counsels HR and WW Communications leadership on strategies for communication within the organization.
  • Provide narrative guidance regarding change-management, enterprise strategy rollouts, company milestones, operating model and/ or organization structure changes.
  • Ensure appropriate measurement techniques are used to assess communication effectiveness and continually improve processes, policies and delivery vehicles as appropriate.
  • Play an active role in developing and contributing Pure HR and people related content  to vehicles such as the company intranet, employee publications, global employee town hall meetings, sales kickoff and more.
  • Maintains a comprehensive editorial calendar to enable strategic timing of communications.
  • Helps develop communication to support and build awareness of employee volunteerism initiatives and employee giving (Pure Good).

What You Bring To the Team

  •    Bachelor’s degree in communication, business administration or related field or equivalent.
  •    7+ years of progressive experience designing, implementing and managing employee-focused communications.
  •    Demonstrated experience developing and implementing employee communication strategies, intranet content management    and collaboration tools, including both strategic and hands on tactical deliverables.
  •    Intermediate level of knowledge of program evaluation and measurement and use of workforce information.
  •    Demonstrated experience with collaboration and communication tools such as enterprise intranet content management      systems and advanced application of standard office software such as MS Office.
  •    Effective verbal and written communication skills. Effective analytical and research skills.
  •    Flexible, quick-thinking, and able to prioritize deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Must be strategic, analytical, and detail-oriented whilst maintaining an innovative approach.

Culture & Perks

Pure is a very special place. What makes and keeps us special is who we recruit to join us and how we work together. Our culture was shaped organically as our early team poured their heart and soul into Pure’s first generation product and supporting our early customers and partners.  We expect each employee to approach their job at Pure with the same level of pride and care, and perpetuate the values that are making us the best storage company in history.

At the center of those values is the belief that the single most important thing we do is continue to hire the  best and create a workplace where they thrive and enjoy. To reward our employees for the great work they’re doing we offer a number of perks and benefits, including:

  • Flexible vacation - take time off when you need it
  • Exceptional medical benefits with 100% employer paid premiums
  • Commuter benefits for public transit and bicycle commuters
  • Free lunches, dinners, and fully stocked snacks & beverages
  • Lounge areas with ping pong, foosball, pinball, and arcade game

jobs.title: Drupal Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Raleigh, NC
URL: http://www.bluespark.com/sales-executive

Bluespark is a digital agency. We love solving tough problems—from user experience to design to code. We build enterprise web-based software for a range of clients that include Red Hat, TripAdvisor, Sport Obermeyer, Sticker Giant, UCLA, Indiana University, and the Cleveland Public Library. 

We are looking for talented Front End Web Developers who understand Drupal. We are looking for people that relish challenges and who are more interested in the right solution rather than the most innovative. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working on a multi-disciplinary team.

Where will you work?
Bluespark is a distributed company. That’s just a fancy way of saying that you can work from anywhere. The only requirement is that you be available for our standard working hours of 9 AM - 12 PM Central U.S. Time; your remaining hours are flex time. Most people work from home—wherever that may be—occasionally traveling to client sites, conferences, or trainings. The majority of our clients are based in the U.S.

Who should apply?
People who want to make a difference. People who want to be part of a community of partners. People who are interested in building a company that’s bigger than the four walls of a building—a company that spans the globe and believes that its people are at the core of the value we add to the world. People who embody curiosity, awareness, resoluteness, and empathy—who are flexible, proactive, and driven.

If this excites you, keep reading.

Accountabilities

  • Collaborating with developers and creatives.
  • Creating user interfaces that our clients and their customers love.
  • Research. Technical Planning. Prototyping.
  • Contributing to open source projects.
  • Testing and developing cross-browser and cross-device compatible UIs.​
  • Squashing bugs.
  • Providing technical insight to strategists and designers in the early stages of the project.
  • Advising clients and others on technical implementation details of a project.
  • Working with other developers to create project estimates.

Competencies  

  • Grit
  • Perpetually curious
  • Excellent communication habits
  • Superior client service skills
  • Professional and disciplined remote collaboration
  • An excellent sense of humor
  • BONUS: Interest in writing blog posts and books; interest in speaking at conferences

Desired Experience

  • Drupal 7. Ideally Drupal 8. Both site building and theme layers.
  • Responsive design and development
  • Visual design principles
  • Front end development best practices
  • Front end web performance optimization
  • JavaScript and frameworks (jQuery, Angular, etc)
  • HTML and template languages (PHPtemplate & Twig)
  • Advanced CSS and post/preprocessors (SASS, Autoprefixer, Webfonts, etc)
  • Software and UI design
  • Understanding of modern SEO techniques
  • BONUS: iOS and Android application / UI development

We are primarily a Drupal-based development shop. Experience with Drupal is virtually a necessity, and knowledge of the Drupal 7 and 8 theme layer is highly desired. However, if you lack Drupal experience, but bring other talents to the table, please apply anyway.

Compensation & Benefits

Health Insurance. We cover 100% of your health insurance and 25% of your family’s insurance.

25 Days PTO. The time does not transfer from year-to-year because we want you to take ALL of it every year. We believe that happy, well-rested people are the best people to work with.

Winter Holiday Shutdown. Bluespark completely shuts down the last week of December. It’s the end of the year, we should enjoy ourselves a bit.

Sick time as needed—does not count against your PTO.

Parental Leave. 12 weeks of maternity, paternity, and adoption leave for new parents broken up as follows: 8 weeks of 100% paid parental leave within 12 months after the birth of the child. You can extend this period with PTO. The last four weeks are a transition period where you work half-time and are paid 50% of your salary. Eligibility begins after 1 year of employment, limited to once per year.

Work from anywhere. Travel around the world or work from the comfort of your home. You just need a stable Internet connection.

Flexible schedule. Our schedules are pretty flexible. Need to run an errand in the middle of the day? Totally cool. We have people who put in their eight hours in a single shot. Others who break it up throughout the day.

Reasonable schedules. It’s sad that we even need to list this as a benefit. But we don’t expect more than 40 hours of work in a week. We don’t do “crunch times” during projects.

Autonomy. A big part of working at Bluespark is being part of a community of expert practitioners. People who actually enjoy what they're doing. Because of that, we actively nurture a culture of connected autonomy—that is, you are the expert and we trust your expertise. We have systems, methods, processes, and best practices, but these are there to help you do your job better—not be yoke that hold you back from doing great work. As such, break the rules, go off script—and tell us what you learned and what we, as a company, can do to improve.

Salary commensurate with location, role, and experience.

To apply: Apply here: http://www.bluespark.com/front-end-web-developer-application

jobs.title: Sales Executive
jobs.content:
Bluespark is a digital agency. We love solving tough problemsâfrom user experience to design to code. We build enterprise web-based software for a range of clients that include Red Hat, TripAdvisor, Sport Obermeyer, Sticker Giant, UCLA, Indiana University, and the Cleveland Public Library. We are a growing business and need a Sales Executive to help accelerate that growth. 

We are looking for someone with experience selling services and solutions (vs products) and who is invested in building relationships (vs churning through a high number of leads).

We are looking for both a planner and a doerâsomeone who enjoys planning the outreach strategy just as much as they relish executing their part of the strategy. 

We need a hunter. Someone that actively seeks out companies that can benefit from our servicesâsomeone who is creative, driven, and doesnât wait for the leads to come to them. 

Possibly most important, we want someone invested in building relationships with our prospects. As such, our ideal candidate takes the time to understand our prospectsâ needsâboth spoken and unspokenâand helps craft proposals that address all of these needs.

We also need someone who is great at guiding prospects through the sales cycle, accurately representing our processes, methods, and practices. We arenât looking for someone who âyessesâ their way to a deal. We do need someone that doesnât let the sale end with a signed contract and works with the project team to ensure a smooth transition.

We do serve a variety of markets: e-commerce, universities, libraries, public institutions, travel, and media. Specializing in one market is okay, but we are looking for someone who is willing to work leads and nurture prospects from across all industries. As such, you need to adapt sales strategies and tactics depending on who you are speaking with.

We also need someone who works well with others. We are all servant-leaders here at Bluespark. We check our egos at the door and work collaboratively to do amazing work together. Our Sales Executive will work with our Marketing Strategist, graphic designers, sales consultants, Strategists, and leadership team to define and execute the sales strategy.

Where will you work?
Bluespark is a distributed company. Thatâs just a fancy way of saying that you can work from anywhere. The only requirement is that you be available for our standard working hours of 9 AM - 12 PM Central U.S. Time; your remaining hours are flex time. Most people work from homeâwherever that may beâoccasionally traveling to client sites, conferences, or trainings. The majority of our clients are based in the U.S.

Who should apply?
People who want to make a difference. People who want to be part of a community of partners. People who are interested in building a company thatâs bigger than the four walls of a buildingâa company that spans the globe and believes that its people are at the core of the value we add to the world. People who embody curiosity, awareness, resoluteness, and empathyâwho are flexible, proactive, and driven.

If this excites you, keep reading.

Purpose
Find amazing clients with interesting projects for long-term relationships


Competencies
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and habits
  • Well organized
  • Grit
  • Professional and disciplined remote collaboration
  • Willingness to contribute outside your role
  • An excellent sense of humor

Responsibilities
  • Actively generate new leads
  • Research and identify leads and prospects and their needs
  • Identify key stakeholders and decision-makers at leads and prospects
  • Develop and execute sales and outreach strategies in conjunction with the marketing team
  • Cultivate relationships with leads and prospects
  • Become a trusted resource among prospects, leads, and clients.
  • Triage inbound requests from the Bluespark website
  • Represent Bluespark at trade-shows and conferences
  • Keep the CRM up-to-date
  • Develop an acute understanding of our services and past projects
  • Quarterback proposals to completion; understand prospect needs and ensure that the proposal addresses those needs.
  • Coordinate with the project team during transition from contract to project
  • Hit quarterly and annual sales targets

To apply: Apply online here at http://www.bluespark.com/sales-executive

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Paris, France
URL: https://www.bergamotte.com

Who we are and what we’re looking for:
Bergamotte is an online flower delivery company based in Paris. We launched in 2015, and after several successful rounds of fundraising and thousands of bouquets delivered, we have lots of exciting new projects in bloom. This means we’re looking for a creative, adventurous Senior Ruby on Rails developer to come along for the ride.

You will join a team of 4 developers and 1 U/X designer to help us fine-tune our existing app, as well as to build new features. You can either work from our spacious office in downtown Paris or from the comfort of your own home - it’s up to you. We’re looking for a developer with extensive Ruby experience, an eye for detail and an ability to put themselves in the end-user’s shoes.

Our stack :
  • Back-end: Ruby on Rails (Rails 4.X)
  • Front-end: HAML, SASS, Coffee Script, HTML5, JQuery, etc.
  • Database: PostgreSQL
  • Source control: Git + github.com
  • Code review: Code Climate
  • Monitoring: Newrelic

Requirements :
  • At least 3 years of experience working on e-commerce apps or similar projects (primarily built with Ruby)
  • Great written and spoken English skills
  • Able to work full-time
  • The ability to enter into an employment contract or to bill clients in France

To apply: If this sounds like a good fit for you, the first (and most important) step of the application process is a code test. You can access it here : https://github.com/bergamotte/rails-coding-test

jobs.title: VP Engineering, Chief Architect
jobs.content:
As Vice President of Engineering, you will lead our software engineering organization in architecting and building our mobile first consumer facing products ranging from highly responsive and engaging e-commerce web sites to custom mobile applications. You will be responsible for translating the Critical Mix product strategy into best in class application services. It is essential and required to provide career mentoring, coaching and development of a talented group of engineers, while creating and fostering the right culture to attract and retain diverse technical talent.


You will coordinate and drive the evaluation, conceptualization, design, and integration of major new capabilities into the product line, ensuring that product design and technology choices anticipate future needs, while efficiently satisfying short term customer requirements.


This is a fantastic opportunity to work with massive real-time data ingestion, pipeline, and enrichment services leveraging modern API architectures. Predictive analytics and machine learning technologies are and will be at the core of how these services are delivered at scale.


Preferred Locations, but will consider remote for the perfect candidate.


Perrysburg, OH - Dallas, TX - San Franciso or LA, CA

jobs.title: Backend/Full-stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Interested in cracking rare genetic diseases through computation? Help us grow our engineering team of two. We're an 18-person startup funded by private investments and public grants, such as a $1.5M NIH Grant for Rare Disease Drug Discovery, and an upcoming multi-million series A.


As engineers, we extract and present biological data efficiently and reliably. Our other team members include biologists, who run cell experiments in a wet lab, and data scientists, who build descriptive models from experimental data.


We're looking for strong back-end engineers, and full-stack engineers. We use Go, JavaScript, and some Python, on a myriad of cloud services from AWS and GCE.


Here are some past and upcoming projects:



  • Distribute computations that extract geometric features from cell images on EC2, every day. Computations are docker-ized, and run on up to 10,000 cores at a time.

  • Web-app to view super-imposed cell segmentation boundaries on raw cell images, with zoom, contrast, and composite functions.

  • Sync terabytes of high-resolution cellular images daily from our high-content microscope to S3.

  • Web-app to view thumbnails across related experiments using the HTML5 Canvas and AngularJS.

  • Color-composite and generate thumbnails of cellular images on AWS Lambda in real-time. We run millions of GB*sec of λ computations monthly.

  • Automatically detect contamination in experiments through image recognition.

  • Develop an in-house laboratory information management system (LIMS) that pulls IoT data from complex biological machines.

  • Build a responsive front-end for the LIMS that biologists can actually use in a lab -- a great UX challenge.

  • Write the cluster infrastructure for our deep-learning experiments.


If you're interested in coding for a meaningful purpose and building distributed systems, web apps and tools for biologists, or just have a knack for back-end coding, let us know -- you don't need a biology background.


We offer competitive compensation and our hiring process is fast.

jobs.title: Senior Cloud Developer for Machine Learning Applications
jobs.content:
The SAP Innovation Center Network is a strategic innovation entity within SAP, combining software engineering excellence with thought leadership and entrepreneurial spirit. Across various focus clusters and by building on strong teams, we pioneer game-changing solutions in close collaboration with startups, customers & partners in industry and research as well as with other SAP units. To ensure a successful go-to-market, we follow an end-to-end responsibility approach. By exploring unconventional ideas and developing inspiring proofs of concepts, we push the state-of-the-art in computer science and its applied fields to provide SAP with foresight into future trends. 



As a (Senior) Cloud Developer for machine learning solutions in SAPs Digital Core including Finance, you will work with an expert team in a startup-like environment focusing on building of new, cloud-based financial and / or logistic solutions for startups and SMEs. Your primary goal will be to build from ground up our data processing and storage infrastructure for products targeting a group of all-digital, future $1B companies. You are a self-starter, lean startup-minded, and born for life in fast paced environments. As an ideal candidate you have built cloud-based database and data stream processing systems which scale vertically and horizontally to support millions of transactions per second. You will have the chance to work free of political and technical constraints with a single purpose – to delight and amaze our users.



EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS



You will work very close together with a team of dedicated experts including frontend developers and architects with a single goal of designing beautiful and disruptive cloud-based solutions for finance and logistics. Your tasks include:



  • Build our distributed, microservices-based data processing infrastructure 

  • Provide support for both batch-based and stream-based data processing

  • Ensure responsiveness, scalability, and maintain sub-second end-to-end latency 

  • Focus on software fault-tolerance to compensate for inevitable outages in the cloud

  • Closely communicate with front developers to achieve perfect separation of concerns

  • Make and take full responsibility of strategic decisions regarding cloud software development

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Waltham or Boston, Massachusetts or Remote


Why Carbon Black?


At Carbon Black, you’ll have the opportunity to make a huge impact while working alongside a global community of passionate people who are leading the way in cutting-edge technology. Our valued employees across the world have made Carbon Black a Top Place to Work, as named by the Boston Globe for two consecutive years.


Our Engineering team is moving at lightning speed on the breaking edge of technology. You’ll be pulling things apart and tinkering, building new platforms, or playing in the cloud. Here, the engineering opportunities are endless. With this fast-paced, synergetic group, you’ll be working together and across the organization to ensure customer success all while continuing to build a product that protects their dearest assets.


What You’ll Do



  • Share responsibility for health, scalability and availability of our cloud services

  • Automate deployment of AWS infrastructure and services

  • Select, architect, and implement and maintain monitoring, alerting and reporting

  • Inject and maintain a healthy level of humor within the team

  • Ensure cloud architecture meets scalability, availability and cost requirements

  • Be a mentor to team members on good operational practices

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Hornet is the fastest growing gay social network in the world. We are a mobile location-based discovery app with social features unseen in the competition. We connect 15 Million users worldwide and are growing rapidly. 

We pride ourselves in having a reliable tech platform for guys to discover each other and connect, 24/7/365. We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to help us uphold this reputation into the future as we build out new product enhancements and features. A unique opportunity to engineer large scale systems that power an app people use every day.

What you'll do:

  • Develop tools, processes and provision environments to enable backend engineers to deploy and monitor their own systems.
  • Build and battle-test high availability infrastructure with a particular focus on Mean Time To Repair (MTTR)
  • Be involved with the software design process to provide insight and expertise for building reliable and scalable software infrastructure from the ground up.
  • Partake in an on-call rotation alongside the engineers who build our production backends.

What you'll need to have:

  • Comfort with large scale production systems and technologies, for example load balancing, monitoring, distributed systems, and configuration management.
  • A track record of designing and executing medium to large scale systems automation projects with strong autonomy.
  • Strong coding skills in at least one programming language, and a desire to pick up more. We work primarily in Ruby, with smatterings of Go and Node.js

Deep knowledge of the following platforms/tech highly preferred: 

  • Amazon Web Services (especially EC2, S3, etc.)
  • PostgreSQL
  • Cassandra
  • Linux (Red Hat / CentOS)

To apply: Send us a brief resume/CV at careers@gethornet.com, along with a brief introduction and why you think you'd be a great fit for this position.

jobs.title: Application Security Architect
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life of an Application Security Architect: 



The Application Security Architect secures enterprise information by determining security requirements, planning, implementing, testing security systems, preparing security standards, policies, and procedures.



Responsibilities: 




  • Assist software and network engineers, system and database administrators, and product managers with assessing security threats, identifying and tailoring security requirements and integrating security controls into the Product / Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Ensure the implementation of a secure build integration process; secure source code repositories practices and code escrow process

  • Ensure WAF protection and implementation are in place and responsible for maintaining rules, monitoring alerts and ensuring appropriate actions are taken.

  • Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; researching information security standards; conducting system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments; studying architecture/platform; identifying integration issues; preparing cost estimates

  • Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies; developing requirements for local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), virtual private networks (VPNs), routers, firewalls, and related security and network devices; designs public key infrastructures (PKIs), including use of certification authorities (CAs) and digital signatures as well as hardware and software; adhering to industry standards

  • Verifies security systems by developing and implementing test scripts

  • Maintain security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs

  • Upgrade security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements

  • Serves as the security architecture expert for the security functional areas across the organization and with 3rd-parties

  • Performs architecture risk analysis for existing systems, new acquisitions, identifies gaps and provides feedback for advancing enterprise security capabilities

  • Integrates security activities into projects or programs development lifecycle, ensures security activities are aligned with schedules and understands how to make win-win decisions between security and functionality

  • Lead the Security development effort to build secure applications to ensure key business and regulatory requirements are delivered.  Staying abreast of current and emerging technologies, and applying security best practices and technical expertise to create best-in-class Secure System Architecture

  • Drive secure application delivery through automated and manual application security testing

  • Implements security systems by specifying intrusion detection methodologies and equipment; directing equipment and software installation and calibration; preparing preventive and reactive measures; creating, transmitting, and maintaining keys; providing technical support; completing documentation

  • Leads or participates in setting the System Architectural strategy and defining the architecture roadmap

  • Leads or participates in the creation of application solution designs

  • Reviews work of other team members and mentor junior analysts as needed

jobs.title: Senior Linux Hadoop Administrator
jobs.content:
A Day in the life of a Senior Linux Hadoop Administrator: 



  • Establishing and maintaining a Hadoop and Big Data cluster on Linux

  • Evaluating and recommending appropriate Hadoop hardware and storage components

  • File system management, monitoring, support and maintenance for HDFS, KUDU, and HBASE

  • Assisting with data lake folder design

  • Recommending and establishing security policies and procedures for the Hadoop environment

  • Designing and implementing appropriate backup and recovery procedures

  • Assisting in the development and implementation of various strategic initiatives.

  • Develop Architecture Policies, Standards and Governance for the Hadoop and Big Data environment

  • Research and development with promising leading edge big data technologies

  • Participating in data architecture design and review processes, including planning and monitoring efforts, reviewing deliverables, and communicating to management

  • Responding to change and engaging in multiple projects simultaneously

  • Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks

jobs.title: Hadoop Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
A Day in the Life of a Hadoop Big Data Engineer: 



This is an exciting opportunity to use your varied skills and to wear many hats while helping Meridian to build out its leading edge Hadoop and big data environment.  Our goal is to leverage modern and emerging platforms to house our data for the many reporting and analytics needs that we have.  In this role you will be at the forefront of building out the environment, inventing new processes, configuring and developing components where necessary, and being an all-around Hadoop generalist.   If you enjoy being asked to do a variety of things, then this role will fill that need. 



Responsibilities: 




  • Install and configure Hadoop components and related utilities

  • Develop processes for source data ingestion, transformation, and database loading

  • Develop processes for data quality monitoring

  • Develop processes to support “Data as a Service (DaaS)”

  • File system management, monitoring, support and maintenance for HDFS, KUDU, and HBASE

  • Create scalable and high-performance web services for data tracking

  • Assisting with data lake folder design

  • Recommending and establishing security policies and procedures for the Hadoop environment

  • Assisting in the development and implementation of various strategic initiatives.

  • Contribute to development of Architecture Policies, Standards and Governance for the Hadoop and Big Data environment

  • Research and development with promising leading edge big data technologies

  • Participating in data architecture design and review processes, including planning and monitoring efforts, reviewing deliverables, and communicating to management

  • Responding to change and engaging in multiple projects simultaneously

  • Works with minimal guidance; seeks guidance on only the most complex tasks

jobs.title: Fullstack Engineer
jobs.content:
Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. The engineering team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure. Frequently engineers host sessions where a new idea or software engineering practice is discussed – this ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning. 


The Canva code base was setup to scale; from day one. This has allowed for a unique environment where engineers spend most of their time optimising performance and releasing new features rather than fixing legacy code. This also ensures that it’s just more fun working on the code base. We also have a flat structure where engineers are invited to comment on the direction their peers are taking and are paired for pair-reviewing to occur. This ensures that knowledge around the code base is shared and speed of release occurs. You can find more about our engineering practices in this blog article (https://engineering.canva.com/2015/08/25/how-we-get-things-done/).


Your role:



  • Work with product designers and founders to build a next-generation web application with a focus on an exceptional client-side experience

  • Build efficient and reusable front end abstractions and systems

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate with other team members to determine the best solutions to difficult problems

  • Identify and communicate best practices for front end engineering

  • Interact with our back end systems

  • Use a spacer.gif in our email templates every now and then

jobs.title: Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving
jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105395


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group to work as a Senior Algorithm Developer (m/f) in the field of Autonomous Driving. Your tasks will include the development of algorithms and software solutions for the environmental and driver model. In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. In your position, you will write and optimize complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification and fusing (high and low level) of objects and open spaces fit for driving and of situation interpretation, and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing and functionality throughout the overall vehicle.

You will fulfil cost-optimal functional and on functional requirements in the exciting field of reusability and resource optimisation. Your results will form the prerequisite for software development and software testing and thus significantly determine the quality of the series software. In your daily work, you will take future challenges, such as shortened product creation processes, new software standards, or new electrical/electron.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.ic architecture processes into account.

jobs.title: Senior Engineer Testing Verification
jobs.content:
TAKE A TRIP ON THE REAL SUPERHIGHWAY.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Engineer for Testing and Verification of ECU in Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105079


We are offering an exciting opportunity as Senior Engineer (m/f) for testing and verification of electronic control unit (ECU) sensors in the innovative field of autonomous driving. Your responsibilities will include systematic validation, from requirement and specification management based on model-based systems engineering (MBSE) to test case creation, execution and reporting. This will include central test tool and test infrastructure management as well as collaboration to design testing strategies and define requirements derived from the tests for architecture, design and development of components for autonomous driving. An exciting challenge will be to conceive and develop high-performance component hardware in the loop (HiL) and software in the loop (f-SiL) infrastructure to achieve a one-hundred-percent testing landscape in the verification portion of the validation chain. Your tasks will be rounded off by representation of your project contents within the team and presentation of results in specialist and management committees.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.content:

We are offering an interesting position as Senior Architect (m/f) for Vehicle Wiring where you will be responsible for the architecture of highly networked and innovative functions of autonomous driving. Your tasks will include working in an interdisciplinary team to structure interfaces on highly diverse vehicle wiring system topologies (e.g. CAN, Ethernet) across product lines. Use your expertise and comprehensive system understanding of networked functions to create robust and harmonious signal structures and ensure the stability of the electric/electronic vehicle wiring system. You will partition the modules and building blocks onto the individual electric/electronic components, based on a coordinated function network. A central task will be to take both architectural criteria such as runtime, resources and availability and aspects of industrialisation and business management into account and to guide requirements. To achieve optimal results you will work in close cooperation with the vehicle projects, specialist departments, function development, industrialisation and system integration teams. An important task will be to contribute to the quick and high-quality translation of new functions from functional ideas into solutions that can be experienced in the products.
