jobs.title: Cloud Operations Team Lead
jobs.content:
This is not your typical Cloud Operations Team Lead role; and Altus Analytics is not your typical company. Altus Analytics has set the bar high and we are the leaders in technical solutions for the CRE industry on a global scale and we want to stay at the top! At Altus Analytics we support, promote and challenge our team. We are passionate about researching and upgrading our technology and rolling out the best solutions for our clients. Joining Altus Analytics now and working out of their City Centre location in Houston is a smart career move. 


Our new products are live and running. Reporting to the Director of Development Operations, our new Cloud Operations Team Lead will be managing not one, but two SaaS applications: Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand.


Our tech, our stack.


Voyanta and ARGUS On Demand are Amazon Web Services hosted cloud-based applications using multi-tier architectures, for a SaaS environment. We use both .NET framework and Microsoft technologies as well as Linux based technologies combined with Open Source products and Citrix XenApp.


Why do we need a Cloud Operations Team Lead?


As the industry leader in CRE solutions providing solutions to thousands of end-users around the globe we need to ensure our products and platforms are accessible and fully functional as close to 100% of the time as we can get it. We need to stay ahead of the curve with cutting edge technologies and innovation methodologies. To that end, we need a Cloud Operations Team Lead who will bring processes, compliance and organization to the team, while being hands on at work.  We need someone who always has their finger on the pulse of infrastructure and networking best practices and technologies. Someone with end-to-end applications experience from cloud builds to implementation; We need a Cloud Operations Team Lead who has hands-on SaaS expertise,and implementing processes around a SaaS Cloud Operation from change requests to DevOps pipeline. Someone obsessed with networking, security, availability and efficiency. 


What does your future look like?


Altus Analytics has built a culture of professional development and career growth for team members.  This is an opportunity to invest your skills at a growing company and increase your impact within DevOps as a leader. Your career path can include opportunities as a Manager within DevOps or across into Architecture or Product Development.


Why do you want to be our Cloud Operations Team Lead?


This is the chance for an Operations expert to own and drive the next level in SAAS operations on AWS. It is an opportunity for someone who is already a lead or a manager. If you are a Senior Systems Engineer and you are ready to step up, you should also apply.


At Altus Analytics, we have some exciting challenges ahead of us. Here’s just a peek at what you’ll be doing as our new Cloud Operations Team Lead, you will:



  • Own the AWS cloud infrastructure for multiple SaaS applications. 

  • Manage, mentor, lead and coach a team of systems engineers.

  • Put in processes to ensure high availability, high security and be compliant to ISO 27001 and SOC 2 - Type 1 & 2

  • Recommend technologies - from cost estimates to timeline projections - to strengthen our infrastructure, increase security and increase availability.

  • Do it. You will apply your hands-on expertise to making proactive changes, and maintaining highly reliable infrastructure.

  • Oversee. You will oversee third-party relationships with consultants and vendors we may engage for monitoring, certification and auditing.

  • Collaborate. You will work across teams with architects and developers for both SaaS applications.

  • Manage it. You will focus all activities around making the environment highly available and secure and compliant.

  • Deploy. You will plan and oversee the deployments of our software to the infrastructure.

  • Engineer policies and processes. You will determine, define and enforce all policies and processes required to smoothly run Operations with minimal downtime.

  • Be diligent. You will ensure other Operational parts such as backup, disaster recovery, antivirus, IDS etc. are in place. 

  • Report it. You will maintain KPIs for availability and other reporting aspects as required.

  • Solve it. You will ensure timely resolutions to production issues, minimizing downtime. You will be the main point of contact for escalation of issues pertaining to SaaS Operations.

  • Meet it. You will ensure your team meets defined and negotiated SLAs.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for an experienced developer who can help us build and continue to advance Dharma, a software platform developed for collecting, sharing, and analyzing data in the most difficult settings on earth. Our platform is designed to be accessible to users with little to no technical knowledge, and we need someone who can work with us to create and code a user experience that’s simple, reliable, and fast.


Dharma has both a web portal and a cross-platform, online/offline mobile app. You’ll be working across our technology from our web and mobile user interfaces through to our data storage.


This position is on site at our office in Washington, DC. Remote candidates will not be considered. US work authorization is required.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer | Front-end
jobs.content:
About YETI Custom Shop


YETI Custom Shop is the official customization service for YETI's Rambler line of drinkware. We leverage a unique laser marking process to create an attractive and highly durable custom mark on the cup. YETI Custom Shop is growing extremely fast and and we have big plans for across the board technology development and integration from e-commerce to our manufacturing floor.


Summary


The Front-end Engineer will be part of an engineering team that will be responsible for all of the development and implementation of YETI Custom Shop's e-commerce and order-management systems. This position requires a high comfort level with front-end development using modern JavaScript frameworks. The Senior Software Engineer will be asked to work on both customer-facing e-commerce applications as well as internally-facing order management tools. This position offers an extremely rare and unique opportunity to join a highly profitable, fast growing business with a fun and agile startup culture.

jobs.title: Mobile Software Engineer - What's Your Github Profile?
jobs.content:
OUR TEAM

Joining Abbott will make you part of our diverse team of engineers and scientists doing truly cutting-edge work focused on innovation with dozens of patents granted per year in our division alone. Opportunity for growth is available in the ADC division and national Abbott divisions. We offer a competitive compensation program that includes retirement and financial benefits. PRIMARY FUNCTION •Responsible for the design and development of software under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements •Works on design, coding, and validating software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices •Exercises judgment in creating software designs and defines methods in conducting investigation activities •Develops networks with internal/external working relationships in area of expertise •Demonstrate ability to develop and deliver superior products under aggressive schedules

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES •Design and implement programs in current application and firmware programming languages (e.g., Java, Swift, ObjectiveC, C#, C, C++) •Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and detailed design specifications for implementation of software designs per Abbott design development process •Assist in the evaluation of selected designs through testing and full documentation of the results •Work on problems of diverse scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Demonstrate excellent judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions •Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management

MINIMUM TRAINING & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED •4 years relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree or 2 years with MS Solid knowledge of software engineering principals •Strong technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills •Good troubleshooting skills and experience •Good debugging technique and ability to use debug tools and techniques are required •Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards is desired

Abbott Diabetes Care 1360 South Loop Road Alameda, CA 94502

jobs.title: Senior DBA
jobs.content:
Rockstar San Diego is seeking a Sr. DBA to join our award-winning development team. Your primary role will be architecting and operating the databases that play a vital role in the support of critical platforms and services. You should have prior experience in database operations, design and architecture, administration (monitoring and proactive maintenance, tuning and backup and recovery).

The ideal candidate will have a passion for database engines and developing a deep expertise in database internals and systems integration. The DBA must possess strong ownership qualities and be service oriented. Experience in the game industry is not required, but a passion for gaming is a huge plus.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Installation, architecture, and configuration of MS SQL 2014 & 2016.

  • Proactive and reactive performance tuning.

  • Participation in ongoing SQL development projects.

  • Physical data modelling.

  • Developing SSIS and other ETL solutions to analytical platforms.

  • Issue detection and resolution.

  • Development of automation and scripts to perform proactive maintenance.

  • Participate in 24/7 operations via on call rotation schedule.

  • Backup and recovery.

  • Provide guidance to engineers, architects and additional team members.

  • Strong knowledge of deployments and source control.

  • Documentation skills for processes and procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Six or more years of current administration experience in MS SQL Server.

  • Must possess advanced SQL skills.

  • Proficiency in TSQL.

  • Expertise in storage, servers, operating systems and application interaction.

  • A sense of ownership, initiative and drive.

  • Experience in MongoDB, Hadoop, Vertica or Redis is a big plus.

  • Solid understanding and proficiency in Linux is a big plus.

  • Passion for Rockstar Games is a plus.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


DevOps Engineer maintains the overall direction of the company’s production ecommerce & WMS infrastructure by identifying system requirements; installing upgrades; monitoring system performance; Operating System/Application installation; account monitoring; security and collaborating with the DevOps engineers.  DevOps Engineer will be responsible for improving and maintaining website performance, monitoring website traffic, and be primary resource focused on new Linux/Unix initiatives.


Job Expectations:



  • Oversee and handle all design for any Linux/Unix environment, including servers and desktops

  • Oversee the sizing and infrastructure solutions for the Web & WMS environments

  • Manages company website in private cloud, hosted cloud web services (AWS, RackSpace)

  • Publishes software upgrades to company systems

  • Works directly with software development to ensure quick resolutions to software issues

  • Maintains confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored or accessed by the end-users on the network

  • Generates daily\monthly\weekly reports on different KPIs of website traffic

  • Establishes Web system specifications by analyzing access, information, and security requirements; designing system infrastructure.

  • Establishes Web system by planning and executing the selection, installation, configuration, and testing of server hardware, software, and operating and system management systems; defining system and operational policies and procedures.

  • Maintains Web system performance by performing system monitoring and analysis, and performance tuning; troubleshooting system hardware, software, and operating and system management systems; designing and running system load/stress testing; escalating application problems to vendor.

  • Secures Web system by developing system access, monitoring, control, and evaluation; establishing and testing disaster recovery policies and procedures; completing back-ups; maintaining documentation.

  • Upgrades Web system by conferring with vendors and services; developing, testing, evaluating, and installing enhancements and new software.

  • Establishes and monitors Content Delivery Network systems, monitors traffic and performance, maintains and improves performance of the website using CDN configurations.

  • Monitors website traffic worldwide using global monitoring tools and identify and diagnose website accessibility in different regions.

  • Maintains DNS servers and monitors DNS traffic.

  • Works with Webmaster tools to identify website content and SEO issues; works with development team to resolve issues.

  • Monitors and analyses website traffic through analytic tools and reports any identified issues.

  • Inspects website traffic for potential attack and breach attempts; establishes necessary systems to detect and defend DDoS attacks.

  • Updates job knowledge by tracking emerging Internet technologies; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

  • Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Required:           



  • Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix Operating Systems, including but not limited to RHEL, Ubuntu, and CentOS.

  • Working knowledge of Unix based Administration

  • Experience working Unix based Web Servers like NGINX and Apache

  • Working knowledge of applications servers like WebLogic, OAS, Tomcat

  • Experience writing shell scripts, php and other scripting languages

  • One year experience working with Microsoft SQL Server databases and running queries.

  • Strong knowledge of hardware technologies including Cisco Networking/Server and Dell Storage; and other storage technologies

  • Build and support computer and/or network systems, applications, procedures and techniques

  • Ability to identify and resolve computer system malfunctions and operations problems.

  • Skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to learn and support new systems and applications

  • Ability to work with high traffic websites, update, monitoring, and maintenance strategies.

  • Strong knowledge of IIS 7.5 services. HTTP modules and working processes.

  • Knowledge of .Net Framework 4, WCF, and MVC 3 structure

  • Strong knowledge of Domain Name System

  • Strong knowledge of website security, cyber-attacks, and defense strategies

  • Strong knowledge of HTTP protocol and IP concepts

  • Ability to analyze web traffic and identify problems and unusual trends.


Experience Requirements:



  • Experience in working with NGINX installation, configuration and maintenance

  • Experience in working with VMWare 5.0 and up

  • Experience in working with numerous storage solutions

  • Experience in working with ASP.NET/MVC websites

  • Experience in working with load balancers.

  • Experience in working with DNS servers

  • Experience in working with CDNs (e.g. Akamai)

  • Experience in developing, installing, and maintaining HTTP modules in Apache

  • Experience in mitigating DDoS attacks.


Education Requirements:


Bachelor’s Degree in computer science.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


The Sr. Software developer will be part of an agile development team, building and working on enterprise grade software systems on top of the Microsoft .NET development stack. The Sr. Software Developer develops information systems by designing, developing, and installing software solutions, that are scalable for a high transaction environment.


 Job Expectations:



  • Full lifecycle application development

  • Design, develop, enhance and support new / existing software, applications, and systems primarily using Microsoft technologies (i.e. SQL, ASP.NET, VB.NET, and C#).

  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.

  • Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis

  • Object-oriented Design and Analysis (OOA and OOD)

  • Software modeling and simulation

  • Software testing and quality assurance

  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality

  • Integrate software with existing systems

  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation

  • Project Planning and Project Management

  • Maintain standards compliance

  • Implement localization or globalization of software

  • Responsible for writing technical design specifications.

  • Design /develop systems using ASP.NET technology, including Model View Controller (MVC) and REST paradigms.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Required:



  • Communication Skills, must be able to articulate, and have a strong technical vocabulary

  • Display of initiative / self-starter

  • Understands agile environment

  • Strong knowledge of C# .net and experience with Microsoft Visual Studio

  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Microsoft SQL server

  • Experience designing building, testing and supporting applications with n-tier architecture

  • A strong understanding of .Net best practices

  • Familiar with .net remoting/WCF

  • Familiar with Windows service and API development

  • Cache management

  • Unit testing and continuous integration

  • Exposure to all aspects of the software development lifecycle

  • Analytical Skillset

  • Detail Oriented

  • MS Office Knowledge (efficient in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)



Experience Requirements:



  • Minimum of eight(8) years of experience with the Microsoft .NET platform, including C#, ASP.NET, WCF, and ADO.NET or four(4) to eight(8) years of experience within iHerb

  • A portfolio demonstrating first-hand development experience with complex applications

  • Ability to cut through ambiguity and use good organizational skills.

  • A passion for building user-centric solutions

  • A proven track-record delivering flawless defect free code.

  • Demonstrated experience of source control, defect reduction and release management


Education Requirements:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science is required



Please Note:At this time we are not offering any employer-sponsored work authorization.


iHerb Inc.is a leading online retailer of nutritional supplement and wellness products (vitamins, minerals, herbs, botanicals, bath and beauty, pet care, sports nutrition and children's health). Via its e-Commerce website, iHerb.com delivers 35,000 products from over 1,500 brands direct to the customer in more than 180 countries. iHerb carries trusted brands customers love around the world.


iHerb's growth has been recognized by Internet Retailer as a top 500 e-Commerce provider in North America and recently as a top 300 mobile commerce business in the world.  In 2013 Google bestowed iHerb with its Google Trusted Store designation having shipped over 1,000,000 orders to customers in the US market with a 98% on-time shipping and a 99.9% issue free orders

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
When it comes to modern day software development, you will have your finger on the pulse of the entire pipeline. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


DevOps is as much about communication and business relationships as it is about any of the software or tools you will use.


About Us


New Context is a rapidly growing consulting company in the heart of downtown San Francisco. We specialize in Lean Security; an approach that leads organizations to build better software thru hands-on technical and management consulting. We are a group of engineers who live and breath Agile Infrastructure, Systems Automation, Cloud Orchestration, and Information Security.


The New Context team personifies the DevOps spirit. We love a challenge and look forward to working with clients to solve their own challenges. Our teams operate with complete stack awareness of infrastructure, application and security.


Our driving methodologies are Lean Security and Humane Systems. In adopting a security first approach to infrastructure focused on people, processes and technologies, our team will have an integral part in driving the direction of these exciting new approaches.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
New Context is looking to hire a Lead Software Engineer who is both capable of writing code and steering a team of like-minded innovative developers. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


Your Role


Your role as a lead software engineer is to lead a team of engineers who collaboratively develop applications and infrastructure. You will be responsible for ensuring the team is staying on task and working towards building product which meets the customer’s business goals. As a lead, you will own the development process and interface with engineers and customers on a daily basis. Candidates should be well versed in the Agile development methodology. This position has the opportunity to have direct technical reports within the organizational structure.

jobs.title: Academic Director/Special Professional Faculty - Data Science Online M.S.
jobs.content:
Academic Director/Special Professional Faculty - Data Science Online M.S.
College of Science: Applied and Computational Mathematics and Statistics
University of Notre Dame

Location: Notre Dame, IN
Closes: Sep 30, 2016 at 11:59 PM Eastern Time (GMT-4 hours)

The University of Notre Dame, in partnership with AT&T, has launched a Data Science M.S. degree in online format. Aimed at the working professional, this degree will offer the advanced training students need to be skilled, industry-informed and creative data scientists. The curriculum blends academic preparation with hands-on collaboration with industry; the program is designed for students of all academic backgrounds. Offered by the Department of Applied and Computational Mathematics and Statistics, with the additional participation of leading Notre Dame faculty from a range of disciplines including Computer Science and Engineering, Informatics, Psychology and Management, the online MS degree will be a graduate offering of the highest quality built around a meaningful university-industry partnership.
 
Position Description
The Department of Applied and Computational Statistics and Mathematics at the University of Notre Dame seeks an experienced colleague to lead this program from its inception. The Academic Director will provide strategic vision, operational and administrative oversight, and business development; s/he will also be a liaison to other University-wide data science research and teaching initiatives. Working closely with senior leadership, departments, and faculty, the Academic Director will be central to the success of the M.S. program and will be an important voice in data science initiatives at Notre Dame. The Academic Director will have a professional faculty position within the Department of Applied and Computational Mathematics and Statistics; s/he will teach in the MS program, recruit faculty for the program, and work to ensure excellent academic and professional outcomes for the students.

QUALIFICATIONS

Key Characteristics and Qualifications of the Academic Director
The Academic Director of the MS in Data Science program will be:
Energetic, entrepreneurial, and collaborative, with demonstrated success as a team leader;
A leader with the right mixture of academic and industry/professional experience in the field of data science broadly understood;
Qualified for a Special Professional Faculty Position in the Department of Applied and Computational Mathematics and Statistics (e.g. either a PhD in a field such as statistics, computer science, informatics OR a compelling blend of managerial and technical experience alongside a graduate degree in the field);
Skilled leading business development and partnership conversations with industry;
A capable, experienced, and inspiring teacher;
A colleague with strong grasp of the affordances of online and digital learning, and an awareness of the strategic role of online and digital learning within the landscape of contemporary higher education.

Key Attributes and Responsibilities of the Position
Leading Notre Dame’s MS in Data Science Program, the Academic Director will:
Work collaboratively with participating Notre Dame faculty and staff (and as guided by the program’s Executive Committee) to implement and supervise all academic aspects of the program, including program faculty hiring, training & mentoring; curriculum planning and oversight; course design and outcomes assessment (including placement and student satisfaction); quality assurance; academic policy and program admissions;
Teach one course per semester in the program and lead one to two annual short-term (4-day) location-based immersion courses at Notre Dame, in Palo Alto, and other locations as appropriate;
Provide careful financial management and budgetary oversight, in collaboration with the Department and the Office of the Provost; develop growth strategies for the program in partnership with industry, philanthropies, and other partners;
Lead business development, marketing, student recruitment, and industry partnerships on behalf of the MS program and in partnership with supporting service providers;
Provide effective managerial oversight of the program, supervise and support professional staff, and ensure compliance with regulatory and administrative procedures;
Some travel will be required, including collaborations with Notre Dame’s new facility in Palo Alto, California;
Provide annual reports on the academic and nonacademic performance of the program to the program’s Executive Committee and senior University leadership.
Create a climate in which diversity, transparency and professional accountability is celebrated, and in which all students can thrive and succeed.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS
Apply now at http://apptrkr.com/872280

Please upload a cover letter and CV to Interfolio. Other documents relevant to this position may also be uploaded.

This appointment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.  Applicants will be asked to identify all felony convictions and/or pending felony charges.  Felony convictions do not automatically bar an individual from employment.  Each case will be examined separately to determine the appropriateness of employment in the particular position.  Failure to be forthcoming or dishonesty with respect to felony disclosures can result in the disqualification of a candidate.  The full procedure can be viewed at http://facultyhandbook.nd.edu/university-policies/background-check-procedure-for-prospective-faculty/.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT STATEMENT
The University of Notre Dame seeks to attract, develop, and retain the highest quality faculty, staff and administration.  The University is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and is committed to building a culturally diverse workplace.  We strongly encourage applications from female and minority candidates and those candidates attracted to a university with a Catholic identity.  Moreover, Notre Dame prohibits discrimination against veterans or disabled qualified individuals, and requires affirmative action by covered contractors to employ and advance veterans and qualified individuals with disabilities in compliance with 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-300.5(a).

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Overview:    


Enthought is a leading provider of python-based data analytics and scientific computing solutions.  Our software products, training solutions and consulting services are used by customers worldwide to accelerate innovation in a broad array of industries.  Our clients include the most recognized names and respected brands in technology, finance, energy, consumer products and more.  Enthought is a highly collaborative, low hierarchy place.  People that thrive at Enthought are passionate about life and work, intellectually curious, dedicated to doing quality of work, friendly and fun.  We value “really smart", "highly productive", and "dedicated” more heavily than any specific skill set or degree.  Based in Austin, Enthought also has offices in Cambridge (England) and Mumbai (India).


Position Overview:


Enthought is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer to support our global product development and consulting service teams.  The DevOps role covers a wide range of responsibilities including:



  • Deployment of all web-services:  automation and monitoring

  • Management of the cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure)

  • Process re-engineering on various projects

  • Management of the development and continuous integration of workflows for projects and products on six platforms

  • Oversees IT infrastructure and internal IT support staff

  • Team player attitude and strong communication skills to interact with teams located worldwide


This position is based in our Austin, TX headquarters.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:

Location: Portland, OR


Reports to: Sr. Manager, Software Engineering



JOB FUNCTION



The Software Engineer delivers solutions to internal and external customers. This includes the design, modification, development and implementation of software programming applications. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected, as well as an understanding of business needs and requirements.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 



  • Modifies, writes and documents software programming applications. 

  • Consults with clients to gather information about program needs, objectives, functions, features and input and output requirements.

  • Works with stakeholders to understand problem statements and suggest possible implementations.

  • Demonstrates personal ownership and takes accountability for larger assigned tasks.

  • May train end users or technical support staff to use programs.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer II
jobs.content:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer II


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance




JOB FUNCTION



The Quality Assurance Analyst will conduct thorough product testing and maintain agreed upon quality standards in order to provide the highest quality software products to both external and internal customers. The QA Analyst will work to understand the business requirements and objectives relative to the desired functionality of products and applications. Additionally this role will evaluate and test new or modified software to determine that software meets user requirements and established quality standards.

Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change.

About This Role:

The Java Web Developer role at Forrester works with team members from across the organization on a variety of projects touching web display, mobile, content management, search engine, and data analytics systems. This candidate must be able to contribute to the definition of requirements and convert them into high-performing, scalable solutions. You will collaborate with a diverse team of developers, product owners, and business owners to make these designs a reality.

jobs.title: Senior C# Developer / Team Lead
jobs.content:
We are looking for a developer who is passionate about technology and has achieved a high level of technical competence. We respect the fact that it takes time and efforts to achieve technical knowledge, and we reward handsomely for it. If you are a dedicated and energetic individual interested in a long-term career growth, then come and work with us!

We are looking for an experienced Senior C# developer to work for a growing North Dallas-based company with modern offices and fantastic SaaS Software products. Working in a team of 6-8, you will be instrumental in design and development of the Company's exciting brand-new mobile platform using RESTful API and Xamarin. You will help formulate mobile architecture using latest advancement of mobile technology.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content: Healthvana is looking to add a Senior Software Engineer to our growing team, to help us build the next generation of products for patients and medical providers to interact with each other, leading to not just improved health and lower costs but also happier people all around.  Your typical week would include writing code, writing tests, looking at others’ code and helping them make it better, deploying to production, designing future software, and communicating with other software engineers (and non-engineers) about all of the above.  Solid, readable, well-tested code is more important to us than the quickest thing you can deploy to production (though we like to move fast, too).  We use well-known technologies like Python, Django, and React.  We’re in this for the long-haul (it is healthcare, after all), so we also reflect back on how we can improve our processes and get better for the next time (and what we want to learn along the way).  Most importantly, you get to be the connection between Health IT software that doesn’t suck, and the improvement it can make in people’s everyday lives.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
The College of Arts and Sciences at The Ohio State University is looking for two Drupal Web Developers to join our team.



Responsibilities include:




  • Create user-focused websites within the College of Arts and Sciences.

  • Work with graphic designers and project manager and other members of the project team to develop websites in the Drupal Content Management System.

  • Address content management system/module issues and requests.

  • Install content management system modules.

  • Develop themes and views for modules following established coding and security guidelines and procedures.

  • Assist with design for new web page layouts and components; create wireframes, process flow descriptions, and user interface layouts.

  • Work in Acquia Cloud for the hosting and security updates.

  • Write system design specifications, process flow descriptions, user interface layouts, and technical specifications.

  • Contribute to web strategy discussions, offer solutions, and perform other tasks related to our dynamic and collaborative approach to web development.

  • Test and debug new and existing web features, services, and pages across browsers, including mobile or responsive designs.

  • Verify that programs and sites comply with current operational procedures and Ohio State policies.

  • Revise user interface and program features based on user feedback.

  • Maintain thorough documentation of all programs and procedures.

  • Stay current with web and accessibility technologies and techniques.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: Help take applications to the next level of usability and design.  Create a clean, intuitive user experience with maintainable, extensible code.  Consolidate user experience across different software platforms and devices.

jobs.title: Senior Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Senior Performance Engineers proactively look for ways to improve the overall performance of our software products.


As a member of an Agile/scrum project team, performance engineers participate in the application design, requirements and estimation process.   They create master test plans for performance/load and scalability, record/ execute scripts according to plan and record results.


While doing this they are verifying applications are coded according to the non-functional requirements.


Although duties are performed as part of a scrum team structure, you will work independently in accordance with QA procedures and methodologies to insure quality deliverables.


In this truly collaborative environment we welcome your participation in the selection of tools for the QA Team.

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content: The Vice President of Engineering reports directly to the CTO and oversees all engineering functions as well as the SDLC from inception to implementation and ongoing support and maintenance functions. Leads all development and testing teams, across multiple geographies, and partners with Product Management, Solutions, Architecture, Delivery and Technical Support teams to ensure continuous delivery of needed functionality. Develops and directs procedures and methods to ensure productivity and quality standards are met and maintained. Provides engineering expertise in the areas of tool-sets, specifications, product maintenance, coding standards, third party components and engineering protocols. Manages engineering budget. Manages product design from design to execution. Builds, develops and manages engineering team capable of carrying out needed engineering initiatives.

jobs.title: Software Enigneer Build and Deploy
jobs.content:
Overview:





In this role you will be responsible for the full automation of build and deployment processes for software products in domestic and international data centers.  Additional responsibilities entail production monitoring, capacity planning and responding to RFI from customers.


The individual should be very comfortable with continuous integration concepts and tools, and possess networking and system administration knowledge.  The individual is expected to participate in all aspects of the building and deployment of multiple .NET products in a hosted environment.  Deployment tasks will encompass getting involved with both software and hardware






Responsibilities:






  • Create and maintain fully automated CI build processes for multiple .NET products.

  • Work closely with the Development and Hosting Team to introduce deployment and application monitoring automation.

  • Work closely with the Application Architect to brainstorm, design and implement technical build and deployment solutions.

  • Work with the QA Team to test new deployment software.

  • Write build and deployment scripts.

  • Produce clear installation and deployment guides for data center personnel.

  • Establish a proactive application monitoring environment.

  • Create an environment where product upgrades can take place with a zero, or near zero, maintenance window.

  • Continual maintenance and improvement of automation.

  • Coordinate day to day operations of Infrastructure group to support production, as well as products under development.

jobs.title: Application Architect
jobs.content:
Overview:





The Technical Architect is responsible for understanding and interpreting requirements, contributing to technical architecture & design documents, coding (construction), and continuous testing of complex modules and applications in support of the TeleTracking cloud platform






Responsibilities:






  • Contribute to creation and follow Teletracking’s coding and unit testing practices to design, develop and test software across all architectural layers. 

  • Operate with a team of Enterprise and technical architects to architect and build TeleTracking solutions

  • Work closely with product management to understand business requirements/revenue contribution, innovate on solutions, and incorporate our technology strategy

  • As an agile team member, participate and conduct code reviews, design reviews, etc.

  • Utilize domain driven techniques and design patterns to build and contribute to technical design

  • Serve as a mentor and expert resource on the team

  • Develop and maintain strong knowledge of implemented requirements and detailed application behaviors.

  • Write technical architectural and design documents.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Greenhouse is looking for Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our growing tech team. We’re at a unique point in our growth where we’re big enough to offer stability, development best practices, and a variety of projects but still small enough so that every engineer makes a big impact on the product and code base. 


In the past year, we’ve started to move from a monolithic application to distributed web services, begun switching our hosting from Heroku to AWS, and built a test suite with over 8k tests covering our system; but we’re just getting started with scaling challenges. Here is a glimpse at some of the projects and architecture decisions you’d be involved with:



  • Scaling from 100M requests per month to 500M requests per month

  • Building and deploying globally distributed systems with sharding, read/write splitting, and HA

  • Improving page load time by 30%

  • Designing and implementing a unified API

  • Building Greenhouse's mobile experiences


Our engineers can expect to start contributing to feature development within their first weeks using Ruby on Rails and Javascript. You’ll also influence how the team is structured, mentor and teach your fellow engineers, and learn alongside other senior engineers in an agile environment. At Greenhouse, we believe in concrete deliverables, feedback and iteration, collaboration and transparency, and recognition for your impact and contributions.

jobs.title: Sales and Business Development Coordinator - London
jobs.content:
Axiom is seeking a Sales & Business Development Coordinator to join our London team.

Axiom
Axiom, a recognized leader in the business of law, is a new category of professional services firm and the world's largest provider of tech-enabled legal, contracts, and compliance solutions for large enterprises. We’re comprised of over 1,500 passionate Axiomites who serve over half the Fortune 100 across 16 offices and 5 centers of excellence globally (and counting). www.AxiomLaw.co.uk
The Financial Times ranked Axiom #1 in business of law, #1 in innovation in corporate strategy and #1 in innovation in law firm efficiency, while The New York Times said Axiom is “rewriting the law firm business model.” In addition, Axiom CEO Mark Harris’ accolades include recognition by the Financial Times as a "top ten agent for change," by Forbes as a "name you need to know," by the National Law Journal as one of the 100 most influential lawyers, by the ABA as a "legal rebel" and by the Aspen Institute as a 2013 Henry Crown Fellow.

Why Axiom?
We’re passionate about our company; we get a nerdy excitement from what we do. Why work with us? Here are a few reasons:
• Growth: We maintain a tremendously compelling growth trajectory, despite our age and size.
• Innovation: From professional services to SaaS solutions, we’re an award-winning innovator. Axiomites thrive on solving problems that have never been solved.
• Opportunity: We’re the market-leading disruptor within the world’s second largest services economy.
• Development: Business is never “as usual” at Axiom. That kind of environment offers unparalleled opportunities for problem solving, leadership, and professional growth.
• People/Values: Ask any Axiomite “Why Axiom?” and their answer is guaranteed to include our people and values. Over 15 years, we’ve hired not only the industry’s most talented team, but a global family sharing fundamental values.

What’s the role?
This role requires a tremendous amount of initiative and organizational skills, and a desire to work in an innovative growth environment. The Coordinator plays an integral role in supporting the business team as we develop and expand our accounts in London. Not only will the Coordinator be afforded a high degree of independence, but also the opportunity to work with an amazing group of fun and talented people.
Specifically, this role will be responsible for:
• Performing research in preparation for client meetings; developing preparation materials for Axiom attorneys prior to client interviews
• Creating and maintaining presentations for client meetings; developing case studies to support business development & building client facing collateral in response to requests by the sales teams.
• Assisting London’s General Manager and Practice Managers with presentations and client responses to RFP’s – this requires a high degree of creativity and strong presentational and powerpoint skills
• Coordinating, helping execute and tracking client marketing events.
• Supporting ongoing sales efforts by tracking and reporting on metrics associated with client development, engagement management, revenue and margins, and other key sales metrics.
• Overseeing and maintaining our lawyer and client databases including entering notes and setting up new matters.
• Assisting with planning internal office events and tracking incentive plans.
• Supporting the business development teams in building new client contacts through building client accounts, client contact lists, key account presentations, and, territory planning.

Successful Candidates
First and foremost, successful candidates must be fits for our unique operating environment and culture: high-growth, innovative, lean, and values-driven. As such, successful candidates must be highly capable in each the following dimensions (among others): adaptability, curiosity, resourcefulness, analytical thinking/problem solving, proactivity, taking initiative, teamwork, thought leadership, credibility, and operating with/through a lean team.
In this role, we are looking for someone who is eager to gain experience in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment, exhibits outstanding judgment and professionalism, and has exceptional attention to detail. It provides great opportunity for multi-layered experience within a fast paced and highly motivated team with the opportunity to advance quickly.
Successful candidates must also embody our Core Values:
• Committed: We love the company we’re building with undignified enthusiasm. We’re committed to our mission, our clients and our people. We celebrate our successes, learn from our failures and find opportunity in adversity.
• Fresh: We exist to inject new energy and new thinking into a precedent-bound profession. We combine innovation, personality and logic in a way that invigorates our clients and our colleagues.
• Irresistible: There’s a certain inevitability to Axiom and our business model, which makes it irresistible to clients. What’s more, we surround ourselves with talented people who have a contagious energy and incurable passion.
• Thoughtful: We pride ourselves on listening and relating to our colleagues and clients in a way that’s genuine, human and memorable. We take a consultative approach; work with our clients to help solve business problems. And we care about the little things.

Beyond these characteristics, here are the required skills, knowledge, capabilities, and education:
• Bachelor’s degree required.
• Eagerness to learn; ambition to take on more responsibility
• Incredibly proactive; demonstrates great initiative
• Meticulous attention to detail and adaptability
• Professional presence, business acumen, and strong communication skills
• Excellent organizational and prioritization abilities
• Solid decision-making, analytical and problem solving skills
• Strong Microsoft Office Excel and PowerPoint skills
• Thrives in both individual and team environments

jobs.title: Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
WHAT IS COOL ABOUT THIS JOB


As a Systems Engineer, you will be tasked with maintaining and monitoring a growing number of servers, writing automation scripts, and implementing best practices for configuration management. You will be relating system metrics to understand performance bottlenecks and you strive for a record number of “9s” of uptime.


THE DAY TO DAY



  • Responsible with the daily operations and support of our servers and services.

  • You’ll need to be comfortable with the Linux command prompt and well versed in running a website such as installing, configuring, and maintaining services such as DNS, Apache, MySQL, and NGINX.

  • Managing release of code from Development into Production on a regular basis.

  • Running and growing a large scale, high availability server environment (4,000+ and growing quickly).

  • Taking existing processes and automation and improving them.

  • Improving and refining our service monitoring.

  • Executing large system changes using the latest technologies.

  • Writing scripts daily, automation is key.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Independent Security Evaluators (ISE) is currently seeking a software developer to help develop secure software solutions for our clients. 


Fun things you will get to do:



  • Secure software design.

  • System implementation and deployment.

  • Source code and design analysis.

  • Prototyping solutions.

  • Analyzing requirements to help the clients figure out the best approach.

  • Project management, and product evaluation.

jobs.title: Software Engineer-Data Engineering Gemfire
jobs.content:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

jobs.title: Ninja UX Digital Product Designer (Freelance / Part-Time)
jobs.content:
Our Mission:

We are a company revolutionizing digital work-life in large traditional companies. We turn industrial dinosaurs into digital ninja's. We make dilbert companies more like Apple and Google. How? Super powers maybe :-)

Our Challenge to You as a UX Digital Design Ninja

We're seeking a ninja UX digital product designer to help us take our secrets and unleash them in the form of an entirely new agile performance and innovation management system for large Enterprise.

Your experience will include both modern Web/Mobile product design (no boring Enterprise apps here) and, *SOME* early experience and insight into Conversational UI's and ChatBots. The entire application will NOT be Conversational UI, but somje of the most innovative experiences we're designing rely on ths form of interaction. Additoinally CHAT (like Slack) will also play a HUGE role in the app.

The Current State of our Product

We are currently STUCK. That's right STUCK. We have months of conceptual wireframes and fantastic ideas. What we need next is a hard nosed, super creative, genious design problem solver to get us UN-STUCK.

What we've Acomplished So Far

We have a basic set of wireframes and user flows (not very exciting) as well as tons of fantastic, super creative conceptual Wireframes and interactions designed for Mobile.

What we Need

We someone that is uber smart, savvy, and fast at assimilating tons of ideas and previous design work who can then help us knit this all together in a compleeling, comprehensive set of user experiences that kick butt!

The Deliverables

Ultimately what we need (and fast) are both well designed and documented user flows, interactions, and ultimatley HIGH RESOLUTION wireframes / style guides for developers to use in building out our MVP.

Your Portfolio Please

Please include with your email a link to your online portfolio and a description of any recent web/mobile product design projects you're most proud of and why.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

jobs.title: Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Oakland, CA
URL: https://whiplashmerch.com

Whiplash is empowering next-generation eCommerce entrepreneurs with simple and powerfulwarehousing and fulfillment solutions. Our software translates complex retail requirements into simple,failsafe instructions for warehouse employees across the globe.

Our goal is to make life easier for our customers and partners, and to leave them with the “wow” feeling ofhaving solved logistics and fulfillment issues with ease, style and class.

We’re looking for a web developer with strong backend skills to become an experts on the Whiplash platform to help us support, scale, and add to our growing base.

We value hard work, integrity, and a strong moral compass. We were founded 6 years ago andbootstrapped to profitability (and #457 on the Inc 5,000) before accepting funding from Draper Associates(Tesla, Twitter, Skype) in 2016.

U.S. residents only, please.

To apply: Send two (2) sentences to apply@whiplashmerch.com to introduce yourself.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Software craftsmanship requires two traits—passion and discipline. Passion is the drive to study, practice, sharpen our skills, and improve ourselves. Passion is our desire to deliver an amazing software experience. Discipline is what makes us follow principles, write unit tests, and add value to our code by steadily tending the garden. Discipline is doing what is required to get the job done at its highest level, even when it is inconvenient. A software craftsman is a professional. We are looking for craftsmen and women to help us continue to provide a better reality for our clients, and to experience a better reality for themselves.


We will provide you with the best tools so you can focus on solving problems, including: Visual Studio, SQL Server, ReSharper, NCrunch, ASP.NET MVC, Twitter Bootstrap, and more. And how would you feel about working with award-winning in-house designers to make your applications both engaging and beautiful? 


We really only have two over-arching requirements for our developers: they must be smart, and they must get things done. We do have some technology constraints, namely, Envoc is a .NET shop with our main focus on C# and MVC based applications. We make extensive use of JavaScript and JavaScript based frameworks in our presentation layer. For mobile applications, our primary cross-platform development is done using Xamarin.


This position must be located in either our Baton Rouge, LA or Hammond, LA offices. 


How to Apply: It is critical that you follow the instructions in our application process. Following the process is the only way to be considered for any position at Envoc. The first step in applying is to send a one-sentence statement of interest along with your resume to apply@envoccareers.com.

jobs.title: Implementation Engineer
jobs.content:
As an Implementation Engineer in Customer Success at Rocana, you will work directly with our customers to design, deploy and support the Rocana solution in their environment. You should be someone who’s deeply technical, passionate about learning and have people skills as you will be the face of Rocana to many of our customers.


What you will be doing



  • You will work directly with the Customer to design and implement solutions based on business and technical requirements

  • Debug, troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues reported by customers

  • Partner with Sales, Product and Engineering to understand customer challenges, develop and implement creative solutions

  • Proactively work with customers to understand their needs and give them a path to achieving their goals using current versions and transitioning to new versions of the product

  • Onsite visits with customers (travel up to 50%)


All teams at Rocana care about developing customer empathy, people over technology, consensus over competition, team success over personal, allowing failure and supporting success, listening before talking, open decision making, diversity, and inclusiveness.


You:



  • Experience building, managing and troubleshooting Apache Hadoop (HDFS, Hadoop, Kafka, Solr) infrastructure environments

  • Expertise at the linux command line and able to write code and scripts

  • Have shell scripting and high-level language experience (we like java a lot)

  • Support/troubleshooting experience in enterprise storage, databases or high-end server solutions

  • Are a good listener, passionate about puzzles, and not afraid to dive into a customer problem to help solve it

  • Demonstrated time management, written and verbal skills, and are able to communicate complex technical issues effectively

  • Strong organizational skills, setting priorities, and delivering results on time with high quality

  • Ability to function in a results oriented, fast paced technical environment

  • Have a strong passion for quality and attention to detail


Bonus points if you have familiarity with:



  • Domain expertise in IT operations/DevOps, system monitoring, or log management software

  • Expertise in logging systems such as Syslog, Rsyslog, Windows Event Viewer

  • Strong software programming skills in Java or similar language


We:



  • Are a distributed company, and as such require self-driven, high output people

  • Care about creating a company, culture, product we all love

  • Focus on how to help customers be successful and on what we achieve as a team

  • Know that if you are happy and engaged, you’ll be/do your best

  • Want to help you achieve your ambitions, so we can achieve ours

  • Want you to develop skills and grow professionally, but we do not tolerate politics

  • Use titles to reflect responsibility, not status

  • Distribute authority and decisions as much as possible

jobs.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We know what you’re thinking: debt collection? Aggressive, litigious, relentless? Think again.


TrueAccord is a category-defining startup. We are building innovative technology that is disrupting the debt collection industry. Our platform not only enables tech companies, lenders and financial institutions to boost their recoveries by more than 20% but also provides those in debt with superb customer experience.


We are a small highly-productive engineering team that is passionate about technology. Our interests lie in Scala and functional programming. We appreciate clean, minimalist and elegant solutions to large and messy real-world business problems.


The technology stack you will be working with includes Scala, Akka, Play!, Spark, and Docker.


In short, it’s a great opportunity to join an engineering team of a successful fast-growing start-up that is transforming the industry.


What you’ll do



  • Build highly scalable distributed services that can process millions of events daily as our company on-boards the nation’s largest banks.

  • Design and implement new components and features in our platform.

  • Write high quality unit tested code that will run in our continuous delivery pipeline.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.


As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.


We Can Go Fast Forever.


We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.


We Court Perfection.


Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.


Get Breakfast Every Day. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.

Interested in becoming a Pivot? We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our Dearborn (Detroit) team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.


Pivotal Labs is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Vrtigo is changing the way virtual reality experiences are created. We’re building analytics tools to help VR creators monitor, optimize and improve their applications.

Our team has backgrounds in statistics, applied math and robotics, and we are passionate about building data-driven products. While we specialize in different areas, we are also generalists who aren’t afraid to get our hands dirty and work on all levels of the stack, from data visualization to cluster management.

We are small but growing extraordinarily fast with a solid investment from Samsung (today's leader in VR shipments).

As our full-stack engineer you’ll design, build, and test the user interface of our customer-facing analytics web application, as well as the backend API. You'll also help create interactive visualizations incorporating video and spatial data. Since our team is small, you'll also get a chance to work on VR components, like Unity3D, and play around with cutting edge VR software and hardware!

You should have at least two years experience developing software professionally, preferably building interactive UX using tools like React and and D3, and APIs using Node.js and PostgreSQL. The job is located in San Francisco.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
* We are currently supporting visas but only for those who are already in U.S. legally.


We are looking for a Back-End Java Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the application. A basic understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.


Responsibilities



  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developers with server side logic

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Design and Implementation of security and data protection

  • Design and implementation of data storage solutions and multithreaded Web Application (Java) utilizing web application frameworks

  • Develops applications using dependency injection and configuration driven behaviors

  • Conduct Unit tests, code review, refactoring current source code, assessment and improvement of performance.

  • Settings and improvement on CI (ex.Jenkins)

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.content:
Someone who believes that software engineering changes lives. You’re passionate about technology and see the world a little differently than your peers—everywhere you look, there’s possibility. Opportunity. Boundaries to push and challenges to solve.


That’s what we’re seeking at NCR. We’re a global tech company that makes life easier for you—-and people all over the world—-by enabling more than 450 million transactions every day. Restaurants, shops, banks and airports come to us for hardware, software and services. They know we have the best and brightest software engineers who know the world of mobile better than any other—and relish in revealing previously unknown insights. Software engineers who write code than can survive under the pressure of hundreds of thousands of requests per minute. Software engineers like you.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Farmers Labs:


We hire with purpose. We provide you with a place to grow, a place to build a career, and a place where everyone is part of the team. At Farmers, you will have the opportunity to work on today’s most innovative projects in web solutions. We recognize that our success results from the success of our employees, and we strive to create an environment that challenges and nurtures talent.



We’re Changing How Insurance Does Software:


Our day consists of pair programming to ensure we deliver the highest quality software possible. Utilizing Test Driven Development (TDD) ensures that our code is ready to deploy after every development cycle. We work on Farmer’s public facing sites so our work is used by a large audience and our successes are highly visible. Typically our day consists of 8 hours of intense coding and nothing more. We believe that the best work is done with a sustainable pace.



We’re Shaping The Future:


As critical members of the Marketing IT organization we work on all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle. Using agile methodologies we are able to bring new functionality into production shortly after inception. Our best practices are being taught to all areas of the greater Farmers IT organization. In a word we are building the next generation of the Farmers digital presence.



Are You Ready?


Want to work at a company who aspires to make state of the art technology central to business? Ready to play your part in a team that is skilled, knowledgeable and agile? Looking for that rare combination: the spirit and excitement of a startup with solid financial results? Appreciate an environment where your opinions and contributions are highly valued?

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Farmers Insurance is one of the nation top insurers and providers of financial services. Today, the Farmers Digital Transformation is a new strategic initiative that was formed to drive agility throughout our business and to respond faster to market demands. A critical part of the initiative is to build a new engineering team for mobile and the innovation labs to foster innovation and to promote more lean, agile processes while delivering products in two key areas: mobile and API platform/Big Data. A career at Farmers Insurance offers compelling ways of delivering something that is not only impactful for the organization but also for our customers.


Farmers insurance mobile and innovation team is looking for  backend engineers (junior, seasoned and senior) to help us take InsurTech to the next level.


The role:


    - Work on Farmers Mobile REST API


    - Develop new services and optimize existing ones


    - Research new technologies that will extend your skills and the value that Farmers Insurance can offer to our customers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Nulab, Inc., we are proud of ourselves for handcrafting tools that bring creativity and fun back to collaborating with others. We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer to help our Backlog product team build the next generation of tools for further collaboration.


Our Backlog app is an online project management tool that lets users promote communication and bring in “fun” to work with its features; to-do management, wiki, file sharing, version control, and charts.


Under the hood, Backlog's software stack is built on Java, JavaScript, Scala, Swift, Kotlin, MySQL and AWS. Since ten years have passed from Backlog's launch, we are planning its major update by improving and reforming software architecture and its user interface.


As a Senior Software Engineer in the Backlog team, you will face interesting and challenging tasks to take our software to the next level of scale and sustainability.


What you will do:



  • Design, implement, and comprehensively test new features in a small, agile team environment. 

  • Assist the operations team with troubleshooting operational issues.

  • Share your passion for technology, lead yourself and others, and constantly seek to improve yourself, the product, and the codebase. 


Qualifications: 



  • Java engineering expert with 3+ years of experience building full-stack web applications

  • Strong communication skills (ability to make the complex into something simple and understandable) 

  • Ability to work effectively, both in person and with a remote, distributed team.

  • You must be able to speak English


Recommended: 



  • Familiarity with modern JavaScript APIs and frameworks (e.g. jQuery,Knockout)

  • Native speaker of Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, or Taiwanese


Bonus:



  • Knowledge of Linux/Unix

  • Experience in building a server infrastructure

  • Experience with JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin, or Swift.

  • Willing to contribute actively to the open source community

  • Ability to present in a technological conference.
