jobs.title: Account Representative
jobs.content:
Position Summary

The Account Representative is responsible for successfully renewing Discovery Education products and services for assigned standard single school accounts representing aggregate annualized revenue between $1.4 and $2.0M. The Account Representative I is responsible for managing the account, maintaining customer relationships and communicating important product updates & company initiatives/events to reinforce value of Discovery Education products and services.

Responsibilities

1. Achieve quarterly and annual renewal sales goals.
2. Assist customers in resolving user import and service activation issues, responding to invoicing questions and sole source requests and addressing any other customer concerns that arise.
3. Execute strategies designed to increase usage to ensure retention.
4. Maintain customer relationships and communicate important product updates & company initiatives/events.
5. Attend internal webinars to stay abreast of latest product enhancements.
6. Drive awareness of Discovery Education resources and communicate important product updates and promote company initiatives/regional events to reinforce value of Discovery Education products and services.
7. Pass sales leads on to digital partnership teams as appropriate.
8. Generate standard list price renewal agreements for assigned accounts.
9. Create an organizational strategy to manage volume and ensure timely renewals.
10. Track individual sales progress to goal and communicate workload focus to Sr. Regional Account Manager and team on a regular basis (daily, weekly, etc).
11. Maintain accurate customer database records.
12. Other tasks as assigned.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of skills, training and experience.
 Approximately 1-2 years in customer service and/or sales experience.
Strong interpersonal, presentation, organizational and verbal/written communication skills.
Attention to detail and the ability to manage a volume-based workload.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment.
 Education experience preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office products
 Understanding of sales databases such as Salesforce and Saleslogix
* Must have the legal right to work in the United States.

jobs.title: Mobile Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Looking for your next great adventure? mHelpDesk, an operating business of HomeAdvisor/IAC is a rapidly growing startup based in Fairfax, VA, and we are looking for you! mHelpDesk is changing the way home service providers manage their business. We build products that solve real problems and focus on the experience of the end user.  We’re looking for a highly motivated, energetic, flexible, organized, and detail oriented Mobile Software Engineer to join our amazing team.


Life at mHelpDesk


mHelpDesk is not your average startup. We are a fast growing company that was recently acquired by a major internet brand. This is a great opportunity for you to get involved at an early stage.  Think of us as a startup without all the risks of working for a startup. That means no late (or missed) paychecks, no need to find your own expensive health insurance plan, no working for a tiny fraction of your market value. It also means no corporate atmosphere with strict dress code or stuffy bureaucracy to drown out your ideas.


We value every team member and if we hire you, it’s because we think you can do big things with us.


You can learn more about our work environment and product here: http://facebook.com/mhelpdesk


YOU:
– Have the competitive spirit needed to help us extend our industry lead in cloud-based field-service-management software
– Consider the customer experience in all of your work
– Embrace accountability for the entire customer solution, not just some assigned tickets
– Are well-versed in clean coding, automated test and agile practices
– Keep up with the latest developments in framework, development and deployment tools
– Enjoy solving complex problems, and have a strong bias toward action
– Enjoy collaborating with, learning from and teaching others
– Have strong communication skills
– Have the personality to thrive in a startup environment


THE JOB:
– Design and develop new features using C#, JavaScript, AngularJS, CSS and SQL
– Contribute to architecture, design, coding and refactoring projects
– Partner with our Product Management and Quality teams to deploy high-quality customer solutions on a frequent basis
– Integrate 3rd-party tools and services into the mHelpDesk ecosystem
– Enhance the mHelpDesk API used for mobile apps and partner integrations
– Master, then help us improve our development, test and deployment tools & processes

jobs.title: Scala Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the type of engineer who punches juke boxes to make the music start? Do you consider riding your motorcycle off into the a sunset a personal hobby? Is architecting a system from the ground up no big deal to you?
Well then you should apply for LeadIQ’s Lead Engineer post in our new Singapore office.


LeadIQ is one of the fastest growing sales tools in Google’s Chrome store, and we’re looking for a rock star to work closely with our front-end team to cut down our growing stack of customers' feature request.


We won’t provide you with a motorcycle or leather jacket, but we will provide you with:
- Health insurance
- Remote working
- Free gym membership
- 3 weeks PTO


We’re a tight knit group, and this hire will be a foundation to our Singapore office’s culture, as well as an extension of our values here in US.


The best applicants are eager to learn, excited to build something super cool, and are reliable facing any challenge.


If you want to continue to build your impressive technical knowledge and professional skills,contribute to multiple projects at the same time, and even help us hire more developers, send us over your resume, and any code repos. Apply now!

jobs.title: .NET Software Developer | Build Custom Web Apps | Greater Philadelphia Area
jobs.content:
Brio is looking for a well-rounded .NET developer, with a few years of experience under their belt, to join our development team. We’ve doubled our team in the last year, and are looking to do the same in 2016. We develop with the Microsoft stack and Windows-based technologies, and nearly all of the systems we build are web-based.


All of our work is done in-house, and we don’t focus on a particular industry or vertical -- we focus on the technology itself. That means the developers on our team get to work on a different projects, and that they have the ability to work in multiple layers of a single project. We support all of our applications after they go into production, and our developers have to be adept bug-squashers that can also develop new features within existing applications.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Enterprise Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The EIS (Enterprise Information Systems) team writes the software that builds rockets and powers SpaceX. We are responsible for all of the software on the factory floor, the warehouses, the financial systems, the restaurant, and even the public home page. Elon has called EIS the "nervous system" of SpaceX because we connect all of the other teams at SpaceX to ensure that the entire rocket building process runs smoothly.


SpaceX is seeking developers with demonstrable experience in: ASP.NET, C#, SQL Server, and AngularJS. We are a fast-paced, highly iterative team that has to adapt quickly as our factory grows. We need people who are comfortable tackling new problems, innovating solutions, and interacting with every facet of the company on a daily basis. Creative, motivated, able to take responsibility and support the applications you create. Help us get rockets out the door faster!

jobs.title: Sr Mobile Engineer, Android
jobs.content:
DAILY MENU


Our mobile development team knows that by helping our users we help our business, so we listen to our customers and give them features they want to use. Design and implement scalable solutions for our public- and consultant facing web sites, back-end tools, and APIs following Agile development methodologies. At Pampered Chef, you'll be working with great engineering and design team who take full ownership of their part of the platform. NET Sitecore Developer III creates technical solutions for multiple, concurrent client projects with emphasis on CMS, CRM and eCommerce applications.  This role collaborates extensively with XCentium’s team of consultants in creating cutting edge web, mobile and cloud solutions. jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer


In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with Global Application Delivery and Support to build, deploy and support our custom line of business applications. Help automate and streamline our Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and SDLC operations and processes. Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations. And troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.


The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:

  • Partner with product delivery teams and DevOps engineers to improve our Continuous Integration (CI) CI and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines and SDLC.

jobs.title: Senior Service Manager, Network Engineering
jobs.content:
Senior Service Manager, Network Engineering



The Senior Services Manager - Network Engineering role in Corporate IT is responsible for fully managing and enabling the evolution of outsourced IT services within Russell’s global technology environment for selected technologies including office and data center Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), and telephony infrastructure. This position manages the delivery of services in these and other technology areas by actively and proactively managing value from service providers, understanding best practices and current/evolving technology standards, identifying strategic opportunities and enabling processes solutions.



The responsibilities of the individual in this position include:



  • Provide for proactive management and compliance/oversight for the specific outsourced services and/or applications designated including:

    • Monitoring of service and performance metrics

    • Incident escalation facilitation

    • Service incident communication facilitation

    • Troubleshooting problem areas in collaboration with the service provider

    • Validation of monthly service allocations and charge backs

    • Service and industry trend analysis

    • Global budget and maintenance oversight

    • Global service contracts

    • Status and value proposition reporting

    • Infrastructure upgrades and new service offerings



  • Manage, tune and evolve internal IT service, change, and request management processes to facilitate clear communication and service value benchmarking, architectural compliance, technical review and overall financial tracking

  • Serve as Project Lead in the implementation of projects for new or enhanced infrastructure technologies or services. Act as a project liaison to business projects and initiatives

  • Senior level technical aptitude and ability to step into complex issues and configurations and perform necessary tasks

  • Serve as the Global IT and Operations liaison to the business unit

  • Provide detailed technical instruction to service provider technicians.

  • Remain current with industry brokered service and technology trends, costs and strategies as well as Russell business drivers.

  • Responsible for monitoring and management tools like Cisco Prime and Solarwinds.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer - Help Build Smart Cities
jobs.content:
Who we are!
Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry. Our products are used every day by commuters in the UK, Boston, New York, Los Angeles, Athens and other major cities around the world, affecting millions of journeys every year and making waiting in line for tickets a thing of the past.


Our mission is to create stress-free, frictionless journeys for passengers and help streamline operations for transport agencies. We improve daily life around the globe by simplifying the way people move around cities. We strive to make the world a better place – one ride at a time.


The Opportunity


As a member of our Hub team you will have a unique opportunity to interact with most of the systems that make up Masabi’s JustRide platform. Whether that is our retail server that allows customers to purchase tickets, or our validation devices that check if tickets are valid (like gate scanners or handheld devices), the continuous flow of data presents a number of very interesting challenges. How do we store it? How do we search it? How do we visualise it? And how can we help our customers make sense from the data and drive high value, highly visible changes to their transit networks?


If you enjoy being in the thick of it, co-operating with a multitude of very talented engineers and driving a product forward, Hub is the team for you.

When customers use our products they search, scroll, click, swipe, filter and book. They touch and feel our work; your work. jobs.title: Web Developer #40389BR
jobs.content:
Working with the Senior Programmer Analyst and reporting to the Director of Digital Communications, the Web Developer will be responsible for maintenance support of the Harvard College website, including the Admissions & Financial Aid web presences. The Harvard College website serves 3.5 million users annually and is a hub for news, resources and social media for the College and Harvard College Admissions & Financial Aid. It encompasses a variety of high profile assets for the College and Admissions & Financial Aid including: the Net Price calculator for Financial Aid, the Harvard College admitted student website, the Harvard College Admissions blog, 65+ videos, and financial aid forms and downloads. Reporting to the Director of Digital Communications, this position will be responsible for technical management, maintenance, and enhancement of the College, Admissions & Financial Aid website. The role will also perform technical oversight, continuing development, and implementation of web portals and web applications related to the admissions process and the release of undergraduate admissions decisions. This includes integration with the admitted students website, our admissions database and event registration. The role is also responsible for meeting the needs & requirements of the Harvard College digital experience for current students.S/he will also be responsible for the following:

jobs.title: Sr. ASP.NET Web Developer, Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. Web Developer


Sr Software Engineer – Web
We’re looking for a Sr. Software Engineer with solid web application development experience Utilizing ASP.NET, MVC who’s familiar with techniques for designing and building high-quality software, including experience with: developing application specifications, various object and data modeling techniques, database design, and quality assurance best-practices. This role is demanding, highly dynamic and technically challenging. The Sr. Software Engineer is an integral part of our development team with top-notch Web application programming skills.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Scala
jobs.content:
TST is an online travel shopping and booking software company. We build and grow an innovative private label solution, specifically tailored to online customers, travel agencies, and home-based travel agents. Our goal is to deliver the foremost experience for consumers and travel agents to shop for and book flights, hotels, cruises, car rentals, and trip activities. Our unsurpassed travel agent product gives agents the tools they need to help their customers find the best available deals for their travel needs.


What you are going to do


You'll be an integral part of one of our agile and autonomous teams.  Your team will include  a product owner, three to five developers, a QA automation engineer, a manual tester, and a customer support representative.


Your team’s mission is to expand and improve one of our many travel products (Agent, Air, Car, Cruise, Hotel, Trip and Vacation). With the support of designers, operations engineers, and experienced travel agents, your team will be self-sufficient and given the autonomy to make your own decisions on how best to solve problems and innovate.


How you will be doing this


Our back-end is written in Scala and we use the Play! Framework and SBT to build reactive applications. We integrate with a variety of travel providers using SOAP and REST. Our current front-end is built on Backbone.js and Twirl templates, but we have already started a migration to AngularJS and are in the process of fully separating our front-end from the back-end.


We embrace continuous delivery and prefer feature toggles to long lived branches. This allows us to deploy new releases daily. And by adding Docker to our development pipeline, we are going to simplify our local development setup, ensure that our applications run identically in all our environments and ship new features even faster.

jobs.title: IOS Software Developer integrator
jobs.content:
We need one iOS developer with test experience, to convert and deploy an iOS App and Web App for iPad, iPhone and Web App based on Linux Apache.


It is a contract position, based in Catalunya, Northern Spain.

The employer is a UK company.


The position is available for immediate start subject to comprehensive interview and technical test.


Trustportal is a technology which allows the secure sharing of data between customers and firms. We have moved from the prototyping and proof-of-concept stages with a number of large customers and now need to roll out a production-ready version of our product.


We need a capable front-end developer to help make this happen.


You will be working closely with the existing technical team, including the CTO. You will be in a position to, and be expected to, contribute to technical discussions and decision-making on architecture, implementation, testing and issue management.


We enjoy an egalitarian, collegiate working environment. The only hierarchy is ability.



If you are capable and wish to expand your skills while proving yourself in a delivery-focussed environment, this is the position for you.

All work is conducted in English, so you will be expected to be fairly fluent. However, the CTO is keen to practice his Catalan and Spanish when appropriate.


Position Details


This is a 6-month (with probationary initial period) contract for a UK-based firm.


The remuneration on offer is commensurate with proven ability and experience. It will be competitive and based on UK norms.


Location: Catalunya, Northern Spain.


Initially working at the CTO’s (large) home office in Alt Emporda (15 mins from Vilafant AVE train station).


Later, once an office has been located in Barcelona, the work will be based there.



Once competence and knowledge of the project has been demonstrated there may be opportunities to occasionally work remotely if desired. However, when explicitly asked to attend the office this is a requirement.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a Senior Front End Engineer in Austin to join our growing Technology team.

As such, the qualified candidate must be able to work in and bridge the creative with the technical across a variety of platforms and frameworks, as well as participate in business development, project planning and knowledge leadership. Ultimately, the Senior Presentation Layer Engineer is responsible for all aspects of Presentation Layer development including all project related front-end technologies.




  • Creation of all coded Presentation Layer deliverables

  • Works well as a team member and leader on large accounts, understanding how a team operates and what is expected of the various roles on the project

  • Able to shift between a creative and a technical focus depending on the project need and/or the type of project

  • Establish presentation layer requirements

  • May need to rapidly produce interim deliverables (such as style guide components, technical specifications, browser and market analysis, prototypes, proofs of concept, etc.) in addition to the final live site or application.

  • Responsible for writing detailed level technical and functional specifications documentation

  • Ability to take initiative to research and learn emerging technologies

  • Participation in the greater Presentation Layer Community and the company as Presentation Layer knowledge leader

jobs.title: Quant Developer
jobs.content:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematical software developer.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  Although we are part of a larger organisation, we're a young group with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At RPC Consulting we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark Sinclair-McGarvie at RPC Consulting.

jobs.title: Network Protocol Reverse Engineer
jobs.content:
Curious, motivated software developer wanted


Are you a developer who's hungry to solve unique problems and puzzles, make a difference, and test the potential of your own best ideas?


Kyrus is a small company that works with the big picture in mind, taking on projects with real significance that grow our capacity to tackle even more fascinating development problems.  We've earned a reputation for efficiency, effectiveness, and impact since our founding in 2009, and are recruiting teammates for our northern Virginia-based team.


We're looking for an energetic, highly-engaged DC-area developer who takes pride in their ability to create functional, robust, and intuitive software tailored to the client's needs—whether that's a customer or our internal R&D team. 


Our ideal new colleague is a lifelong learner who balances the drive to crack a puzzle independently with the awareness of when it's time to leverage our team's experience, or contribute their own diverse viewpoint to help build a team solution.  If you incorporate feedback quickly, place a high value on the quality of your work, and are interested in growing with us as we explore new challenges, we'd love to hear from you.


We offer a focused working environment dedicated to seeing every member of our team—and every good idea—reach their maximum potential.  As an employee-owned company, we actively provide the support necessary to develop and fund our staff's very best ideas into novel new capabilities. Kyrus is where products like Carbon Black was created.


Our benefits include ability to work from home, flexible work hours, quarterly professional development off-sites, a fitness budget, and unlimited paid vacation that we will actually make sure you use.


We are seeking applications from strong developers of all backgrounds and orientations but, due to the nature of our work, we require applicants to be US citizens.


Kyrus takes pride in developing innovative software applications and services that impact our customers need. To achieve this, we need team members who can create functional, robust, and intuitive software.


This position is available in either Sterling, VA or Denver, Co.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you know what Additive Manufacturing(AM), high quality 3D printing, will bring about in the next few decades?


At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.


Our mission is to print “Any (industrial) part, Anywhere” in the world.


It is about transforming the way Manufacturing is understood around the world and radically innovate the supply chain management bringing it to almost on-demand.


Our solution leads to less scrap material (waste) in the production of parts, having a significant positive impact to our environment.


Imagine the amount of parts in machines, domestic appliances, cars and everything surrounding you. This is our potential market.


By what we do, we bridge two worlds coming together: the old - traditional supply chain and ditto manufacturing; and the new - a digitized, optimized supply chain that has AM as integrated part of it.



To make it happen we need to build a ton of cool features, adopting technologies such as Machine Learning, Blockchain and a strong SOA architecture able to match the highest standards in quality, security and scalability.


What kind of professional are we looking for?


There are a few skills you should master, but don’t be afraid though. We strongly believe it is your character that determines whether you are a good fit for our team or not. Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.

jobs.title: .Net developer (C#)
jobs.content:
.Net developer (C#) bij Kampert Nauta in Oss

Ben jij net begonnen aan je carrière of toe aan een tweede stap? Wil je bij een bedrijf werken met veel vrijheid en slimme oplossingen maken voor tastbare projecten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Jouw functie
Als .Net ontwikkelaar werk je zelfstandig aan projecten in een gezellig team, waarbij je altijd een collega om hulp kunt vragen. We maken nieuwe applicaties en passen applicaties aan naar de wensen van de klant. Je programmeert al onze applicaties in ASP.NET en C# en gebruikt daarnaast Javascript. Je krijgt ook alle vrijheid om nieuwe oplossingen uit te denken of hoe je met een nieuwe code de performance nog meer kan verbeteren.

Je werkt in een mix van zeer ervaren en minder ervaren ontwikkelaars. De complexiteit aan verschillende systemen en koppelingen maakt het werk uitdagend. We hebben natuurlijk te maken met regels, maar het allerbelangrijkst is het dat de applicaties voldoen aan de verwachtingen van onze klant. Je kunt je volledig focussen op je code. Binnen het team vinden we de sfeer heel belangrijk, zo vliegt er wel eens een grapje over en weer en doen we op zijn tijd ook leuke dingen buiten werktijd. Kortom, een werkomgeving die jou zeker zal uitdagen en inspireren.

Als jij wordt uitgedaagd door bovenstaande functieomschrijving, maken we graag kennis met jou!

Jouw profiel

  • ICT-opleiding op hbo- / wo-niveau.
  • Ervaring met C# en ASP.NET (enthousiaste beginners helpen we graag).
  • Ervaring met werken volgens codestandaarden.
  • Kennis van javascript en entity frameworks (andere frameworks als MVC kan ook).
  • Flexibel, oplossingsgericht, communicatief sterk en proactief.
  • Je kunt goed in teamverband werken en bent in staat om zelfstandig je werk te kunnen doen.


Wie zijn wij?
Bij ons kunnen klanten terecht met al hun grafische vraagstukken! We drukken flyers, folders, posters, visitekaartjes en nog veel meer. Daarnaast denken we mee over slimme marketingtools. Deze worden door onze ICT-afdeling geprogrammeerd. Met onze innovatieve aanpak en intelligente oplossingen mogen we werken voor zowel (inter)nationale A-merken, als het kleinere MKB, maar ook voor consumenten bij bijvoorbeeld Hipdesign.nl. Je kunt dan vanuit huis je eigen kaart maken en zonder dat iemand van de drukkerij ook maar iets hoeft te doen belanden, via een geautomatiseerd proces, de kaartjes op hun deurmat. Onze geschiedenis gaat dan wel ruim 120 jaar terug, we blijven koploper op het snijvlak van ICT, print en media. Eigentijdse marketing en communicatie vragen om slimme, snelle en flexibele productieoplossingen.

Wij bieden

  • Flexibele werktijden en vrijheid in je werkwijze.
  • Marktconform salaris en goede secundaire voorwaarden.
  • Leuke collega’s en een werksfeer waarbij je je op je gemak zult voelen.
  • Maar bovenal: een uitdagende functie in een plezierige en unieke werkomgeving.


Solliciteren
Word jij uitgedaagd door deze functie? Solliciteer dan via het online sollicitatieformulier.

Kijk voor meer informatie op onze website kampertnauta.nl. Voor extra informatie kun je contact op nemen met Miranda van Miert, recruiter a.i., telefoon: 06-18446160 of m.vanmiert@kampertnauta.nl. (Gebruik dit e-mailadres alleen voor informatie, sollicitaties ontvangen wij graag via het online sollicitatieformulier.) 

Past de geschetste functie niet bij jou, maar ken je iemand die perfect in het geschetste profiel past? Stuur deze vacature dan door.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Travis CI is looking for an Enterprise Development and Support Engineer in US and EU timezones.

Travis CI Enterprise is one of our main products, essentially Travis CI packaged up as a Docker container. It is being installed and run inside our customer's private networks.

As a support engineer, you will work closely with our Travis CI Enterprise customers, helping them to be more successful with Travis CI over time. You'll learn about their successes and challenges, understand their interests, and share their feedback.

You will also help to solve support cases, often opened by customer system administrators, using your technical skills and coordinating responses from our infrastructure and development teams. Tickets can include investigation of network or configuration issues, debugging application errors, discussing feature requests, and others. Doing so you will work with our engineering teams to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources.

As a development engineer, you will work on our applications and integrate them to work in the context of Travis CI Enterprise. You will add new features, improve our build tooling and automation, and the overall system.

freiheit.com is seeking passionate programmers (m/f)!

You graduated with a first-class degree in computer science, physics, or mathematics. You can’t imagine life without writing programs in GNU/Linux. You are fluent in programming languages Java, C++, or Go. You are also interested in JavaScript, machine learning and functional programming languages, such as Common Lisp, Clojure, Erlang, or Haskell. You love to solve difficult problems. You are looking to work in a team with bright and witty people. At freiheit.com you will be engaged in all phases of the software engineering process: from planning over developing and testing all the way to the actual delivery. You seek to learn new things every day. Your character traits are honesty and humor. You are not looking for just any job; you are looking to change the world with your ideas and skills.

Since 1999 we are pioneers in developing major Internet systems. All of our team leaders are programmers. We are a successful company, established in the industry and extremely well organized. Still, we have not lost our startup mentality. freiheit.com has flat hierarchies with an open, easy-going and pioneering company culture. We love to solve challenges. Our fabulous office lies in the heart of Hamburg, surrounded by numerous restaurants and great food all just a stone’s throw away.

Then Appway is looking for you!

You are expected to bridge both sides of the table, and to ensure that the Appway solution meets and exceeds the requirements set by the client. Solution Architects are the glue that holds our clients and developers together; yours is the job of elucidating, educating, and developing healthy and long-lasting relationships with Appway clients.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Product Marketing Manager (Remote) 

Weâre looking for a product focused marketer, who cares deeply about understanding our customers, our product and our business and can expertly communicate our (big!) vision to the world.

QWILR
At Qwilr, we make it easy for anyone to create their documents as stunning web pages.

By combining the best of the web with the familiar ease of document creation tools, we have created a better way for businesses to communicate. Qwilr Pages are beautiful, intelligent, interactive, data rich, & secure - and they are also incredibly quick and easy to create.

Qwilr lets the world to move from the archaic 1980s paradigm of PDF, Powerpoint & Word to the power & beauty of the web - because the web can do so much more than a file can.

PRODUCT MARKETING AT QWILR

  • Work with the founders to develop positioning and messaging that helps potential customers understand the benefits and vision of Qwilr.
  • Formulate and execute go-to-market activities ranging from feature launches, case studies, templates, onboarding guides, educational materials and more to help our users & customers get the most out of Qwilr.
  • Work directly with product management, sales and engineering to increase adoption of our features; help shape demos and videos that showcase Qwilrâs capabilities.
  • Produce articles and content for our blog, and other related content opportunities.
  • Influence product development, based on market demand as well as customer feedback.
  • Manage our marketing site.

OUR TEAM ALL

  • Move fast and execute every day.
  • Love developing creative solutions in a team, as much as going solo on a challenging project from beginning to end.
  • Are eager to understand and work with our users.
  • Are across both the big picture and the devilish details.
  • Know in their bones that software and the web can make the ways that businesses build, use, share & reuse documents at least 10x better.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2+ years of experience in marketing SaaS products, platforms, or services.
  • Extremely clear communicator with great copy writing and editing skills.  

BONUS POINTS

  • You have done your own thing before - be it a blog, an adventure or a startup
  • Design skills
  • Technical Skills - especially around HTML & CSS
  • Video Skills
  • Deep knowledge of Sales & Marketing Collateral (Proposals, Quotes, Pitch Decks, etc)
  • Understand how SaaS works - CAC, LTV, Churn, ARPU, etc

PERKS

  • Competitive salary with meaningful equity
  • Work directly with the founders in a role that will impact the future of our company
  • Budget for continued learning and A+ office supplies
  • Four weeks paid leave
  • Contributions to your 401(k) or equivalent 
  • An annual trip out to Sydney, Australia to meet the team
  • An excellent team environment in a fast growing company

To apply: Send a thoughtful cover letter and your CV (or LinkedIn) to careers@qwilr.com

jobs.title: Software Developer - Windows Apps C#

We’re looking for someone with .NET development skills and proficiency in C# and C++ who’s interested in a truly collaborative experience, where you’ll work closely with designers and be both a coder and a code reviewer for your fellow developers. Propelled by Esri’s desire to incorporate the latest advances, if Microsoft introduces something new, you’ll have it in your hands, not just be reading about it online. Our apps are used by municipalities, major industries, utilities, retail businesses, defense, and the military, so what you create will make a real difference in the world. jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
ShopStorm is looking for a Customer Success Specialist to join our fully distributed team. Youâll be responsible for supporting a growing set of Shopify apps which help power thousands of online stores.

The Role

Youâll be the primary point of contact for our customers, helping them with problems, and answering questions. As part of a small team, you'll likely get your hands dirty with a little bit of everything. Here are some things you may do on a given day:

  • Serve as the key point person for ShopStormâs customers
  • Help customers by troubleshooting problems and answering questions
  • Install and modify code on customersâ Shopify stores
  • Author technical documentation and blog posts to help our customers help themselves
  • Help our engineering/product leads identify existing pain points and prioritize feature releases
  • Implement processes to improve support and customer satisfaction
  • Monitor social media channels and online forums for opportunities to enhance our brand
  • Assist with marketing and partnership efforts

About You

You have that unique combination of technical aptitude and empathy for the user. Youâre comfortable with code but prefer to be customer-facing. Youâre self-driven with a sense of urgency and draw satisfaction from going above and beyond to provide solutions. Youâre an excellent communicator and have the ability to thrive in a distributed environment. Perhaps most importantly, you have a willingness to learn.

About Us

ShopStorm is a small team focused on creating high-quality Shopify apps with exceptional customer service. All types and size of merchants, from the smallest 1-person online shop to large, multinational eCommerce powerhouses rely on our apps to help their businesses.

Our team is part of SkyVerge, an eCommerce software company that builds tools for tens of thousands of merchants across many different platforms. Weâre a distributed company with an even gender split that spans 4 US states and 5 countries. We believe in open communication, respect each otherâs diversity of thought, and often find that a well-timed GIF or emoji is the best way to communicate. ðµ

The Requirements

To succeed in this position you will have:

  • Solid understanding of HTML / CSS
  • Native-level fluency in English
  • Fantastic written communication and interpersonal skills
  • An endless curiosity for our products and our users
  • Ability to thrive in a remote environment (along with a reliable internet connection)
  • Availability for 1-2 team trips / year

The Bootcamp

This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible. We know your work will speak for itself through delighted customers and well-written documentation and blog posts. However, fit with our team and culture is important.

Every new team member completes a 60-day Bootcamp as a contractor before becoming a salaried employee. Already have a full-time position? Donât worry. Weâre flexible with hours and schedule during the bootcamp period.

The Benefits

Some of the benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary with performance incentives
  • 15 days of paid time-off per year
  • Generous holiday policy including two company holidays: SkyVerge Day in March, Founders Day in June ð
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance (reimbursements for comparable care for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • Retirement plan with company match
  • Home office or co-working allowance
  • Hardware and software allowance (we'll set you up with the tools you need to be productive)
  • Personal development allowance to help you learn and grow (e.g. books, courses, conferences)
  • A Kindle to help you keep learning!

TL, DR: Join our team and influence thousands of online stores. Excited? Us too. Apply now!

SkyVerge believes and supports workplace diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

To apply: Apply here: https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/330658

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
WebGL 3D JavaScript
jobs.content:
Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.


In this role, you'll build a web-based 3D tool that ingests LiDAR point cloud files, and allows users to draw cuboids around objects within those point clouds. Agents will be able to navigate around clouds (rotate, pan, zoom) and assign labels to the cuboids they make.


Cuboid coordinates & associated labels should be easily importable & exportable via JSON. The solution will integrate with our existing workspace tools. While you'll be the sole developer on the 3D project, you'll be able to lean on an engineering team of 6 full-time engineers for help with platform integration. Expansion of existing open source or proprietary tools is welcome - you'll need to decide & make a case for any tools before starting.


This position is ideal for a senior developer with experience in JavaScript, WebGL, (ideally) point cloud manipulation, and an interest in social good. Samasource has elevated over 30,000 underprivileged workers & their dependents out of poverty. With your help, this tool will allow us to help many more.


While we're based in San Francisco, we're very happy to consider remote applications from anyone willing to work on (roughly) US Pacific timezones.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Help us reach 1M connected devices.


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers. Pershing Square hosts a farmer's market and food trucks on a weekly basic.


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong Full-Stack Engineer eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces. Think air-traffic control for city bus fleets.

  • Delivering intuitive user interfaces used by millions of bus riders annually.

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data.

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption.


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Agile process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan w/ match, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

jobs.title: Data Scientist Risk Analytics
jobs.content:
Data Scientist Risk Analytics


Your Role:


You will have the opportunity to apply your knowledge of machine learning, statistics and your analytical skills to develop models detecting fraud patterns. You will ideate, test and deploy advanced predictive signals to improve fraud detection performance. You will collaborate with other data scientists and engineers to build data pipelines, do feature prototyping, and write production-grade code to implement analytical algorithms and flexible strategies.


Specific job duties may include: 



  • Writing or modifying data pipelines to process and mine historical data

  • Processing and analyzing data collected with research prototypes

  • Ideation, prototyping, measuring predictive features transforming data into actionable information

  • Prototyping and validating models and algorithms to boost model performance 

  • Writing production code (python, SQL, etc.) to deliver analytics content



Required Skills and Experience:



  • An advanced degree (M.S. or Ph.D) in computer science, applied mathematics, or a comparable analytical field from an accredited institution

  • Expert proficiency with an advanced data analysis toolkit (such as python/matplotlib, R, ROOT, etc.)

  • 3+ years experience in analytical team targeting fraud in online commerce, banking and finances

  • Superior SQL skills with proven experience in relational databases and data warehouses

  • 5+ years experience or demonstrated fluency with python and at least one other programming language

  • 2+ years experience with NoSQL databases and unstructured data

  • 2+ years experience setting up and using distributed/parallel processing frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Storm etc. is a big plus

  • Demonstrated ability to develop high-quality code adhering to industry best practices (i.e., code review, unit tests, Gitflow)

  • Possession of core analytics skills and expertise (as demonstrated by prior work):


    • Knowledge of applied statistics and key concepts underlying statistical inference and inductive reasoning

    • Experience designing experiments and collecting data

    • Experience developing models based on sensor data, and an understanding of error propagation and the limitations of data subject to measurement uncertainties

    • Demonstrable expertise in one or more areas: applied mathematics, predictive analytics, expert systems, ANNs/deep learning, graph theory, Markov Chain Monte Carlo, geo-informatics (GIS), language processing, risk analysis

    • Work/project history reflective of a self-motivated professional who excels when given open-ended problems and broadly-defined goals, having an innate desire to discover the patterns and relationships in data that can be leveraged to provide business value




Who We Are


Signifyd was founded on the belief that e-commerce businesses should be able to grow without fear of fraud. Signifyd solves the challenges that growing e-commerce businesses persistently face: billions of dollars lost in chargebacks, customer dissatisfaction from mistaken declines, and operational costs due to tedious, manual transaction investigation. E-Commerce Assurance, Signifyd’s financial guarantee protecting online retailers in case of chargebacks, is supported by a full-service cloud platform that automates fraud prevention allowing businesses to increase sales and open new markets while reducing risk. Signifyd is in use by multiple companies on the Fortune 1000 and Internet Retailer Top 500 list. Signifyd is headquartered in San Jose, CA.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Concur R&D
jobs.content:
As a core member of Concur’ s Minnesota R&D Center, you will be designing and building the next generation of our end-to-end solutions spanning Concur’ s  product line.  We run small teams with a purpose, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the project, including architecture, design, development, and operations.  You believe in being a team player, collaborating and communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.    You bring a result-driven focus, high enthusiasm, energy, confidence, curiosity, and a sense of fun.
Concur has a customer base of over 30 million end users and year-over-year growth exceeding 50%.  As a Software Engineer with Concur you will be working on solutions that are key to Concur’ s product delivery and aggressive growth.


In the first 12 months you will be:




    • Developing features at all levels of Concur’s technical stack:  You will be building solutions from end-to-end— for example; standing up new services, coding business logic, improving the UI, as well as taking ownership for product quality and delivery

    • Delivering features in the cloud: You will be creating and scaling features and services that utilize Concur’s cloud as well as other commercial platforms such as AWS.

    • Agile Development:  You’ll use Agile Development (Scrum, XP, etc.), Continuous Integration and DevOps concepts (automated deployments, monitoring/alerting, etc.)  You will be collaborating and working with you team members to constantly improve our development process so we can quickly respond to opportunities across our business.
      Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: As part of Concur R&D you will be contributing to architecture, design, development, and operations

jobs.title: Senior SDE - Clojure
jobs.content:
Concur (https://www.concur.com/) is a provider of integrated travel & expense solutions. With over ~100M registered users and ~35,000 enterprise customers, our SaaS stack services a large % of Fortune-500 travel & expense traffic.

We are re-platforming our stack to keep up with customer growth. We are heading towards a service architecture. We are a small team that owns the foundational services on which the new stack is being built.

Description

The Core Services team tackles Identity, Profile-Stores, Authentication, Authorization & the new API stack - all of which is being built in Clojure. Compliance with RFCs/open standards are extremely important to us. We are obsessed with performance, metrics, resiliency, failure proofing, scalability, and complete end to end ownership.

The team is split between Bangalore-India and Bellevue-WA. We are hiring full time programmers for the Bellevue office. Production experience with Clojure, or experience with any Lisp dialect is an obvious plus.

If you are a Clojure/Lisp newbie, you are welcome as long as you have a passion for programming and a willingness to learn.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Meteorcomm, a global telecommunications company that provides data communications solutions and services for the railroad industry. We are looking for a Manager of Software Engineering to support our growing team based out of the Renton, WA area.


Summary:


In this role, you will be responsible for leading, supporting, coaching, and developing personnel who support the delivery of software throughout the Software Engineering department. You will facilitate communications between team members, drive work forward, and eliminate barriers to getting the work done. 


Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for leading, supporting, coaching, and developing Software Engineering personnel that support the delivery of software. Such personnel includes Scrum Masters, Systems Architects, Quality Assurance Engineers and Build Engineers.

  • Responsible for personnel management, including employment and performance management.

  • Responsible for successfully managing a multi-million dollar budget.

  • Work cross-functionally with Product Management and other teams to ensure successful execution of the program.

  • Work collaboratively with Product and Project Managers to plan, drive, and monitor projects. 

  • Manage team development and/or reviews of product deliverables.

  • Identify opportunities to develop and implement process improvement initiatives.

  • Responsible for monitoring status, managing issues, and escalating when appropriate. 

  • Facilitate consensus building and managing issues and risks among railroad stakeholder groups.

  • Manage resources and resource conflicts as necessary to ensure work stream success.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
Meteorcomm, a global telecommunications company that provides data communications solutions and services for the railroad industry. We are looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to support our growing team based out of the Renton, WA area.


Summary:


 In this new role, you will be responsible for software ruby development activities for the Positive Train Control (PTC) Communication System (“the communication system”). This includes software application development activities including design, development, testing, and the creation of test/deployment tools and documentation. It also includes hands-on environment setup, development, issue triage and debugging tasks necessary in order to create and maintain an on-site expertise in our software application systems. The software applications and tools are mostly written in C++ and Ruby, and targeted to run on the Redhat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) platforms.


 Responsibilities:



  • Dedicates the majority of their time to the development of existing application and support of applications already in production.

  • Adherence to pre-defined programming standards set by Application Architects.

  • Develops recommendations regarding further definition of development standards and application architecture principles.

  • Performs unit testing and assists in user testing and debugging of programming modifications.

  • When scheduled, candidate is prepared to address system problems during off hours with minimal guidance from other members of the development staff as needed.

  • Mentoring other team members

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:

URL: https://bit-zesty.workable.com/jobs/271893/candidates/new

We make digital products for clients across a variety of industries – including startups, large enterprises, charities and government bodies – as well as building and maintaining our own SaaS products.

BEING A RUBY ON RAILS DEVELOPER AT BIT ZESTY

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:

Primary responsibilities include database maintenance, optimizations and managing the update of our internal tools, dashboards and API.

ABOUT FLOAT

Were a New York-based startup, with a global team delivering one of the worlds leading SaaS-based resource scheduling apps. Some of the best brands on the planet rely on us daily for their team scheduling including NASA, Google and Vice.

jobs.title: Engineering Team Manager
jobs.content:
Intalytics is seeking an Engineering Team Manager that will be responsible for the development and advancement of SiteIntel, Intalytics’ primary predictive analytics delivery platform.  With clients that open locations both domestically and internationally, Intalytics supports these efforts by deploying tools that empower organizations to make decisions as quickly and intelligently as possible.  From enabling new predictive analytics products and models to managing the core workflows of SiteIntel, the Engineering Team Manager position is an incredible opportunity to make a huge impact on Intalytics, both in terms of software development and product design.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE



  • Guiding the development and direct the evolution of the most significant delivery platform in the predictive analytics industry, SiteIntel.

  • Collaborating with seasoned real estate location and marketing experts by making their real world experience and insights come to life in the SiteIntel platform, and to ensure that SiteIntel is continuously improving.

  • Working with a broad array of clients, each of whom have unique requirements and needs with respect to the SiteIntel application.


DESIRED ATTRIBUTES


In this role, Intalytics seeks an individual that possesses a number of important attributes:



  • Fast learner. An eagerness to learn new skills and implement new applications.

  • Product sense. Beyond creating elegant code, engineers at Intalytics play a crucial role in determining what we build and how we build it.

  • Versatility. You understand how the pieces fit together (front-end, database, network layer, etc.) and how they impact the performance of your application.

  • Architecture flexibility. You build scalable applications that have relevance across our client portfolio, but can also be customized to address specific client requirements.

  • Responsibility. You feel ownership over the SiteIntel product and would never release code until it is correct, monitored, documented, and tested.

  • Collaboration. You enjoy collaboration with statistical modelers, client managers, and other members of the Intalytics team to ensure that the SiteIntel product is the most elegant and versatile predictive analytics delivery platform in the industry.  You welcome constructive feedback to ensure continuous improvement.


 SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years in software development

  • Strong expertise in Visual Studio and C# development, JavaScript application development, Google Maps JavaScript API, creating and consuming RESTful web services, building .NET libraries and Windows services, SQL and database management

  • Experience with ExtJS JavaScript framework and Sencha Architect, Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, S3), MySQL, Alteryx, Stats/predictive modeling, GIS is considered a plus.


BENEFITS



  • Generous salary commensurate with skill level and qualifications

  • 401K plan, with company match and immediate vesting

  • Medical and dental insurance, with company-funded health reimbursement account

  • Competitive vacation package

  • Bonus program designed to significantly reward performance


This position will be based in our Dallas, TX office.  All eligible candidates must be U.S. citizens and/or legally able to work in the United States.



If you are interested in this position, please visit http://intalytics.com/careers and apply online.

jobs.title: Java Development Lead
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations
• Provide clear directions and guidance on technical issues to all team members
• Write high-quality code for web-based applications, to create and improve robust high-volume production applications
• Develop and evaluate prototypes and ideas quickly
• Take the lead in code and architecture reviews
• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products
• Develop JavaScript solutions using standard frameworks including JQuery
• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse
• Assist in acceptance testing for business and technical requirements
• Improve program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance
• Work closely with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables
• Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.
• Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.


Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.

The Role:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java and application specific database tuning on Oracle.

As a senior software developer at Loblaw Digital, you will be presented with opportunities to:

• Develop complex consumer facing software using Java, Spring Framework and Hybris.
• Mentor, coach less experienced developers, through design sessions, code reviews and pair programming.
• Work through hard problems with your team and deliver consistent results.
• Think long term. Create technical roadmap for products or services your team owns.
• With your experience and judgment, influence the business on how software can enhance end user experience.
• Follow agile development principles when the situation calls for it. Use tools such as continuous integration, automated tests and automated deployments to improve product time-to-market.
• Work together with front-end developers and external development agencies.
• Organize and participate in our twice a year hackathons, where technology and business work together to create cool things.

jobs.title: SDET
jobs.content:
The Delivery Services team at INRIX is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET).  We are a small team passionate about serving the world-class traffic and driver services data to millions of devices every day.  If you are looking for a position with scope to contribute to the quality of delivering highly dynamic and customized data in various formats to a multitude of devices in an ever increasing scale using industry standard web-services across multiple continents, then look no further.

We are looking for someone who is proactive, likes to engage with the team, and drive quality regardless of role. This person should also be customer oriented and have an appreciation for the traffic flow industry and space. Being a small team driven to “getting things done”, plenty of opportunities exist to develop innovative testing strategies and tools, and to drive engineering improvements across feature teams.

Primary Responsibilities:

Testing a range of web service API testing both manually and through automation, validating data through layers of WCF based services and applications, building upon the framework which enables such testing, and working closely with Dev and PM to develop appropriate test plans and validating that the right thing is being built.



  • Test design/automation/execution, bug management

  • Driving testability and customer focus in product specifications and designs

  • Measuring/analyzing/communicating product quality and test status

  • Working on feature teams with developers and program managers

  • Ensure proper load/ performance/ scalability aspects of services

  • Perform Debugging and Root Cause Analysis of product failures

  • Develop/adopt new testing methodologies and tools

  • Sharing expertise with other team members to improve overall team effectiveness


Why you should make the move:



  • Great Benefits – We’re as good, or better than most companies our size. We even pay 100% of our employees’ medical, dental, vision, and disability premiums.

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • Open Ended Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time. Work hard; play hard, and don’t bother counting the days.

  • Lots of free food – We have free onsite snacks and drinks; Friday family style lunches, and stocked fridges with lunch items for everyday!

  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing. Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free Parking - We have free parking in our covered garage and enough of it to go around.

  • Free Bus Pass - If you don't have a car to park.

  • Free car – Well not really free... but we have a couple new test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home. We pay for the gas or electricity.

  • Electric Vehicle Charger onsite

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. The CEO even sends a handwritten card and gift to your child on their special day. How many CEO’s do that?

jobs.title: Project Scientist
jobs.content:
Project Scientist: Computational Graph Theory

Geisinger Division of Applied Research and Clinical Informatics (DARCI), Department of Data Science is seeking a project scientist with a strong background in applied mathematics or computer science, with focus in computational graph theory (specifically spectral methods) and active interest in biomedical data analysis.

In preliminary studies, we have developed graphical representations of complex heterogeneous clinical / phenotypic data including patient interactions, progression of diseases, and individual phenotypic and molecular characteristics of patients. The project scientist will perform further research and development on medical data represented as graphs, with special attention paid to class discovery and personalized predictive applications.

This position offers an opportunity for an early career mathematician/computational scientist to develop into a multidisciplinary specialist with exposure to medical data and research workflow of a healthcare organization. The position will require significant interaction with end users of the several graph-based tools that the project scientist is developing.

Duties and responsibilities:

  • Interact with subject matter experts to define the contents and metrics of proximity of graphs representing medical data
  • Write robust code for construction of graph representations of medical data
  • Implement summarization/visualization/validation on graphs.
  • Develop algorithms for clustering, coarsening/refinement, feature detection, optimization on graphs. Spectral methods will be emphasized.
  • Contribute to academic publications in medical informatics, with focus on personalized medicine and obesity studies.
  • General requirements:
  • Besides academic coursework and practical experience in computational graph theory, a qualified candidate should have general familiarity with methods and tasks of predictive analytics/machine learning, statistics and numerical optimization methods. Some direct experience with spectral methods in graph analytics is strongly preferred.

Preferred skills:

  • An interest in working collaboratively in a team of physicians, computer scientists, and programmers.
  • Positive and enthusiastic attitude.
  • Fluency writing and speaking the English language.

Software/programming requirements:

  • Experience with standard scientific computing languages: Matlab, R, Python, Sage, SPSS, etc.
  • Experience with some of the commonly used programming languages, including scripting languages: C++, Java, Ruby, Perl.

Educational requirement:

  • MS or PhD in applied mathematics, engineering, computer science, or physics is required.
  • Work status: An applicant must be approved to work in the United States; we will consider extremely qualified applicants in need of visa support.

** Does not qualify for J-1 waiver. We are an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer Women and Minorities are encouraged to Apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or their protected veteran status.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering - Software
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Oakland, CA
URL: http://siempo.co/apply

About us:
At Siempo we believe technology should be simple and mindful. We realized that we were constantly distracted and feeling over-connected by our smartphones. We couldn’t find solutions we believed in, so we decided to build something new.

Siempo is a mindful phone with a focused feature-set of calling, texting, notes, calendar and Wi-Fi tethering. The natural language UX is designed to help minimize distractions and the focus feature helps you shield against distractions and do more of what you love.

Previously known as Minium (http://minium.co), we have iterated on the product direction over the past year and are thrilled to launch our new brand and a crowdfunding campaign this fall.

We’re now looking for someone to drive our software team and deliver a beautiful, inspiring experience; someone excited about reshaping the way we interact with technology and playing a significant role in the early stages of a hardware-enabled software startup. We hope this person is you.

We’re a small team based in Oakland and Chicago who are passionate about mindfulness, work-life balance and technology. We’re focused on getting things done. Both as a company and as co-workers we value transparency and collaboration. We believe work should be fun and care as much about the culture as the product.

About you:
You speak Android OS fluently and are experienced with hardware projects. You’ve worked with independent design houses and/or ODMs, ideally in Asia. We imagine that you have brought up an OS on a new device, or developed a hardware/software product from scratch and taken it to mass market production. You know what it takes to work in a startup, you’re self-motivated and know how to lead a distributed team.

To apply: If this sounds like a fun challenge, please apply at http://siempo.co/apply You may submit any supporting files that speak to who you are as a person and why you would be a good fit for this position. Resumes/CVs are great, but we’re also interested in anything that goes beyond such as past work or projects, GitHub account, or your personal blog. We read every application and look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Application Engineer for Computational Chemistry Start-Up
jobs.content:
A full-stack, hands-on engineering role, working with a small team of engineers and users from various backgrounds. You will be expected to wear many hats, but your concentration will be on writing solid code to support our drug design applications. This will include, but is not limited to: prototyping and designing new UIs to support the scientific process; designing, developing and maintaining multi-tier web-applications that support all aspects of the drug design process; developing new services to support 3rd party analysis tools; designing and maintaining scalable storage solutions.  You will work with our internal users to develop new features, and understand and fix any issues they are seeing. We have been developing this platform for more than 10 years, so the large, complex codebase requires regular maintenance at all layers.


Our Technology Stack


At the base of our stack is a proprietary distributed computational platform, which allows us to process many millions of virtual molecules at scale. We typically host this platform on Amazon Web Services infrastructure, often parallelizing our computations across more than 10,000 cores. At the next layer of our stack are custom services and libraries, such as machine learning, cheminformatics and bioinformatics. At the very top of our stack are the analysis tools for dealing with these large spaces of data, including web applications, *NIX command line tools, and custom plugins for third party data analysis and chemistry applications.. All of the layers use various storage types (MySQL, S3, Cassandra, custom built). The code base is written in Java, Javascript, Python and some C++. All of these layers are being actively developed and improved.


Our software is used by our in-house scientists and industry and government partners. The demands on our software are very high, so we employ current best practices for development, such as continuous integration, unit and performance testing, agile/scrum methodologies and code reviews.
