  • You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem definition and solution process with a diverse group from around the company.

jobs.title: Mobile Engineer
jobs.content: As an engineer on our Client Team, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing Sharethrough’s SDK in native apps. The software you create will be used by top publishers to power their Android and mobile web applications.

jobs.title: Distributed Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in tackling the problems of building large-scale, distributed- and stream-based processing systems.  As a Distributed Systems Engineer, you’ll work on:




  • Building fault-tolerant micro-services




  • Enhancing a low-latency decisioning engine responsible for complex predictive behaviour (at thousands of requests per second)




  • A streaming data pipeline supervising millions of daily events




Let’s talk if..




  • You have experience with delivering multithreaded and/or distributed JVM-based systems.  No experience with Scala?  Come learn!




  • You have experience with Spark and/or Spark Streaming or similar stream-based processing systems.  Experience with Hadoop-based pipelines, maybe a bit of Cascading or Scalding?  That works too, come give Spark a shot.



  • What you're building is as important to you as why you're building it.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer Who Wants to Work With Satellites
jobs.content:
Do you love to solve problems & puzzles and be challenged? If yes, then read more.  


We are looking for software developers that can solve problems with difficult math and physics combined with scheduling algorithms on one/all of desktop, web, mobile, on-board satellite applications.


Candidates will work in small development teams on all aspects of the development life cycle. They will interact directly with customers and have the potential to attend domestic and international conferences. Self-motivation and the ability to work independently or as part of a team are required. They will interact internally with the VP of Software Development, Software Engineers and Systems Engineers. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated, eager to learn, and able to come up with innovative solutions to challenging problems. Orbit Logic offers a casual, friendly work environment and a competitive benefits.


Orbit Logic is  an software engineering company that creates applications related to satellites/space/aircraft for the full tech stack.  We are not keyed into a specific language, but are looking for developers who can design and build good code on a complex subject matter.

jobs.title: ASP.NET MVC Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer with strong technical and communication skills to join a team of 2 other engineers (1 lead) and help us scale our platform, our product, and process.   


As a team member, you'll be a passionate and unrelenting individual willing to brave the storm of learning. We're a company with assumptions to validate and a product to build, refine and improve. You're expertise and input is what you have to offer.


We believe innovation is a result of collaboration across teams, especially in an industry like ours. As such, this position will require flexibility, regular coordination and effective communication with the operations, compliance, technology, and marketing teams.


Our team is a diverse yet like minded group of individuals. Our educational background spans pre-med, pre-law, physics, mathematics, computer science, and computer engineering. Our technological background spans Mac, Windows, Linux, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, C#, Android, iOS, and even PHP! Our gaming background ranges from Counter-Strike and Overwatch to foosball and basketball.


The Engineering team works in a semi-private space of our office along side the Product team giving us an easy platform for collaboration and discussion. We run Agile with two-week sprints.


You can find more about the engineering team at engineering.gopangea.com. You can learn more about our tech stack at engineering.gopangea.com/stack.

jobs.title: Head of Technology
jobs.content:
The Head of Technology at the Indianapolis Museum of Art (IMA) is responsible and accountable for the strategy, planning, and execution of all information and technology resources, projects of the IMA, including the IMA Lab.


 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS include the following.



  • Develop short and long-term plans and strategy for technology at the IMA and IMA Lab in conjunction with the CFO with a focus on identifying and implementing innovative solutions for leading cultural institutions. Lead the departments in developing and achieving their strategic plans.

  • Direct supervision of the IT Operations Department including the support and planning of the IMA's network infrastructure, email systems, network storage, server applications, desktop support, gallery electronics, helpdesk, network security and disaster recovery backup and planning.

  • Direct the efforts of the IMA Lab.  This team of software developers and graphics designers is responsible for the creation and maintenance of IMA's information infrastructure including, the collection management system, digital asset management system, ticketing, membership, and retail systems, as well as the library and digital asset cataloging systems. In addition, this team develops innovative solutions for and with partner art museums, gardens, historic societies, and other cultural institutions.

  • Identify funding opportunities, including grant-based opportunities. In addition, he/she will be responsible for tracking the IMA Lab’s business development client and grant pipeline.

  • Maintain and strengthen the IMA's reputation as a leader in the cultural field in the use of technology and for promoting the IMA’s mission.

  • Develop relationships and collaborations with other leaders in the field.  These collaborations will leverage the IMA's existing efforts to take advantage of synergies and common interests between like-minded institutions.

  • Responsible for the budgeting and financial aspects of operating these departments.

  • Other projects and duties, as assigned.

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for the “Best of the Best” to help take us to the next level. The right candidate is someone that eats, drinks and sleeps agile based fast track, full stack pair-programming and wants to build cutting edge products with Rails.


Outside of being an outstanding developer, you must have strong communication skills, be extremely passionate, have the ability to manage multiple projects, and enjoy working closely with designers, producers and other developers. You'll be creating world-class digital experiences that incorporate the latest industry technologies. Additionally, you will work closely with product to innovate and push boundaries, create prototypes to support concepts, participate in code reviews, mentor developers, and pair program.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop SaaS applications and services that are configurable, extensible, scalable, and highly performant

  • Write code that is scalable, maintainable, reusable, and well-tested

  • Create APIs as a service for your team and customers

  • Optimize complex data models for understandability and performance

  • Collaborate with members of the design team – both technical as well as business owners - to identify requirements and design new products or extensions to existing products.

  • Produce application prototypes with sufficient detail to allow others in the development team to complete the development work.

  • Provide technical oversight to the development process including code reviews and mentoring of the technical team.

  • Must be able to deliver solutions end-to-end with a focus on hitting delivery milestones.

  • Experience in an agile development environment and understanding of agile/lean delivery methods is required.

  • Design and oversee unit and integration tests to ensure application logic is fully exercised for each application component

jobs.title: Backend Clojure Developer
jobs.content:
About You


We are looking for an enthusiastic developer with very strong Clojure-fu and a true dedication to writing clean and testable code. You’ll be working with our globally diverse team to help our members find love. By creating new APIs and services you’ll be helping to make the process of finding love a little easier for our millions of members across over 100 niche dating properties. 


Job Responsibilities



  • Work closely with the business, front-end developers and other Clojure developers

  • Write clean and testable code

  • Write reliable tests

  • Be up to date with current frameworks, tools and libraries

  • Possibility of being an emergency contact point for back-end related issues

jobs.title: Front-end JavaScript Architect / Developer
jobs.content:
About You


We are looking for an amazing front-end developer with experience in technologies like React.js, Redux and PostCSS. You will be working on a modern single page app to help our members to find the person of their dreams. As a part of the team you’ll be writing high performance, extremely scalable and maintainable code to melt down the barriers between our millions of members across over 100 niche dating properties. Don’t worry, you won’t be responsible for taking care of the APIs or the internal services, our amazing back-end team will be taking care of that!


Job Responsibilities



  • Work closely with the business, UI/UX designers and other developers

  • Work closely with our back-end API and services team

  • Write clean and testable code

  • Write reliable tests

  • Contribute to architecture and product definition

  • Be up to date with current frameworks, tools and libraries

  • Write optimized code to support various browsers and connection speeds

  • Emergency contact point for front-end related issues

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ZestFinance is excited to be looking for a full stack Sr. Software Engineer! If you’re excited to learn Ruby on Rails, then this is the startup for you! You will be joining a highly-skilled full stack Ruby on Rails (RoR) software engineering team where you will be able to contribute your expertise ranging from API design and development to UI / UX implementation.


At ZestFinance, we work with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy along with a social conscience and passion for leveraging data and technology to transform financial services as we know it.


Responsibilities



  • Work with Product, Marketing, and Business to design and build the next generation of ZestFinance product roadmap features.

  • Pair with full stack and front-end engineers to build and integrate APIs with rich, desktop and mobile-friendly front-end interfaces.

  • Identify and evangelize programming best practices with the full stack software engineering and product teams.

  • Work closely with DevOps and QA to ensure operational stability and performance while driving a culture of test driven development (TDD) and behavior driven development (BDD).

  • Lead and participate in design / architecture reviews, as well as code reviews and walkthroughs.

jobs.title: Web Programmer/Developer
jobs.content:
As a member of our staff, you will work with other software developers to enhance our web site presence, which includes a company intranet and secured web-based applications for insurance agents and policyholders.


The chosen candidate will design, develop, and support web-based systems using the latest web technologies, such as ASP.NET MVC, C#, SQL, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, and Microsoft SQL Server. In addition, experience and knowledge in mobile app development is a plus.


We offer a competitive compensation package along with a collaborative work atmosphere that offers the freedom to develop high quality software solutions using the latest technologies.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Who is Return Path?


Return Path is a global Data Solutions Provider that helps the world’s leading companies promote and protect their brands. Every minute of every day, our clients and partners trust our data and insights to help them build closer, safer, and smarter relationships with their customers. Our unique and proprietary data platform, SaaS products, and professional services allow our customers to generate more revenue and engagement from their marketing campaigns, protect their brands and their consumers from fraud, better understand competitors’ strategies and performance, and gain unparalleled insights into the behavior of millions of consumers.


Once you’re an employee here, this is a place where you’ll be challenged, inspired, rewarded, and transformed.


_________________________________________________________________


The Impact You’ll Have at Return Path


At Return Path, “Big Data” is a big deal! We’re swimming in data, terabytes of it, and we need a few smart, versatile software engineers to help us solve the most pressing challenges in the email industry. For example, we process data from 100+ million email messages every day, and build useful products powered by all that data. If you love solving complex problems in a simple way, have solid programming skills and are passionate about achieving meaningful business results, then you may be the right fit as a Software Engineer at Return Path.


As a Software Engineer here, you will be working alongside other dedicated and passionate engineers, product managers and data analysts, all focused on accomplishing big goals, like stopping spam and ending phishing.  While you don’t need a fancy degree to work here, you do need to embrace learning and continuous improvement, have a strong technical skill set, and favor simple solutions over complex ones. The people we hire are pragmatic, versatile, data-driven and self-directed.


We believe that different perspectives and approaches contribute to a stronger team, so even if you don’t match all of the below, if you’re curious and willing to learn, we’d still love to talk to you.

What does it take to be successful in this role?



  • Practical and professional software development experience

  • Expert in at least one modern programming language (Java, Python, PHP or Go)

  • Strong front-end experience with JavaScript

  • Strong experience building and maintaining RESTful APIs

  • Experience or strong curiosity with Docker

  • Understanding of secure coding concepts, common vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10, etc…), and how to properly mitigate them

  • Curiosity, a passion for learning and a can-do attitude!

  • You’re comfortable owning a project, working with colleagues, and drawing upon skills and teamwork to get the job done.

  • You're energized by solving real problems for real people

  • You excel working in an Agile environment


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with AngularJS, ReactJS and ECMAScript 6 and 7

  • Experience deploying to and working with Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Redshift, EMR, etc)

  • Knowledge of email technology, e.g. ARF, DKIM, MIME


In addition to the above, you must be a good fit at Return Path. To be successful here, you must demonstrate Personal/Professional Growth, Professionalism, Execution, andStrategic Thinking; have a Positive Impact and a great sense of humor.  


People First


At Return Path, we are building an extraordinary company that helps people and businesses communicate more reliably, effectively, and securely. We put people first, do the right thing, and succeed together.


We have a strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. We incorporate this philosophy into our practices and we live it every day. This means we have generous traditional benefits and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. We also strive to ensure each person in the company is in the right job, knows how his or her job contributes to the overall company mission, and has a clear sense of career growth and direction. We have great employee retention over the years because people love coming to work here and really feel like they're part of something special.


Do the Right Thing


The Return Path experience is a two-way exchange.  We expect you to give us your best every day, and you can expect the same from us. In exchange for your talent, your energy, and your unique contributions, we will strive to give you what you need to live a balanced, healthy life. This means more than competitive pay and benefits—it means offering the freedom and flexibility to create your ideal experience inside and outside the office.



For more information visit www.returnpath.com

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Motus, we are passionate about leveraging technology to make work-life better for mobile workers and their managers. Our cloud-based mobile technology streamlines administrative tasks, provides fair and accurate reimbursements, mitigates risk, and offers actionable data insights—all designed to allow the mobile workforce the freedom to allocate their time in ways that make them happiest.


The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced software engineer to join the team in the midst of some exciting expansion. The team is currently working on mobile web application projects, building new systems and supporting new lines of business all while improving the stability, security and efficiency of our production systems. Our web-based applications use Linux, PHP, Java, and PostgreSQL targeting desktop browsers, smartphones like the iPhone and Android, and other businesses through web services.


The ideal candidate for this role will be motivated and excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications as well as be a strong mentor for the rest of the software development team. Someone who has been successful at building scalable, maintainable and extensible software on a Java stack is preferred.


What You'll Do:



  • Analyze – help gather requirements and work closely with our Product Analysts to define them.

  • Design – create a workable model from the requirements.

  • Build – You’ll be writing the most complex and crucial parts of the system.

  • Teach – Mentor and guide our junior team members.

  • Improve – We’re always looking for ways to do things better, so you’ll be encouraged to take on projects that do that.

jobs.title: Experienced .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
PAAS National® is looking for an experienced web developer who can expand and maintain our growing suite of SaaS applications.  This position involves the design, development, testing, maintenance, analysis, and documentation of new and existing features of our web applications.


With PAAS National® the sky is your limit.  You will put your skills to use in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment where ideas are innovations, not nuances.  Your role is responsible for a variety of technology functions including: the continued development and maintenance of our existing websites, envisioning and creating new functionalities, operating our CRM tool; Salesforce.com, and working alongside our technology partners with which we contract.  PAAS National® is willing to invest in your future—conferences, classes, training, and seminars—for you to gain additional skills.


Salary Range:                        Top notch salary and benefits package


Required Experience:             Five years


Required Education:              Bachelor’s degree or equivalent


How to Apply:            Send cover letter, resume and list of references to PAAS National-160 Business Park Circle, Stoughton, WI 53589 Attn: Lanae Seamonson or email: lseamonson@paasnational.com

jobs.title: E-Commerce Web Developer
jobs.content:
About the Position


SparkFun is looking for a Senior Web Developer to help lead the next phase of development on it’s E-Commerce platform. This will include critical design review of current implementation and architecture as well as building additional tools for internal and customer use. The developer will work closely with the marketing team to ensure the system is flexible and extensible as well as meeting the needs of our customers. The developer will focus on creating flexible, modular solutions designed around best practices.


The ideal candidate will need to be comfortable in PHP and modern JavaScript as well as working with relational databases such as Postgres. They should be comfortable redesigning major features, helping architect new functionality and leading small teams of developers. The developer will be comfortable building out and integrating 3rd party tools through REST APIs. They will be working with internal customers, helping to deliver production code through our development life cycle.


About the Department


SparkFun’s Software Development & Information Technology department is responsible for the continuous development of all SparkFun web properties. This includes the primary ecommerce website (sparkfun.com) and the primary educational resources website (learn.sparkfun.com). Also included is Sparkle, SparkFun’s custom-built ERP system which is used to manage all content on the aforementioned web properties as well as order processing, customer management, shipping, inventory controls, manufacturing, etc. SparkFun’s latest Open Source Software project is Phant. Phant powers data.sparkfun.com which is our open source solution to Internet of Things (IoT) data hosting.


Where possible (which is most everywhere) open source languages and tools are used and where possible code developed by SparkFun IT is given back to the community as open sourced libraries.


If you like the sound of these programs and want to help modify, update and create new open source software to help power the future of the exciting space, this team is your home.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a leader in enterprise application software and eProcurement, BuyerQuest helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. We are currently seeking the best and brightest talent to join a dynamic and growing team and support our software development and client portfolio.



  • This is where YOU come in:

    • You have a solid understanding of Object Oriented principles and web application fundamentals

    • You solve problems with innovative solutions that meet business requirements with clean and well written code

    • You have experience with architecture design concepts and techniques and the ability to communicate and promote those concepts to a broad based team

    • You have the ability to triage technical issues, use your strong problem solving skills, and then drive resolution by engaging with cross functional teams

    • You have logic and priority based decision-making skills, and an understanding of where projects fit into the overall architecture strategy

    • You have excellent communication, negotiation and facilitation skills

    • You are a great team player who is able to interact effectively with people in all levels of a fun and focused organization

jobs.title: Sales Agent - $14/hr + Commission & Bonus
jobs.content:
NationRep is currently hiring Work at Home Sales Agents. You job will be to pre-qualify customers interested in solar and/or mortgage refinancing. We are looking for CLOSERS that want to make lots of money! 

We are growing and need to fill spots as soon as possible! This is an outbound cold calling position (B2C). We need dedicated, hard-working sales agents who are go-getters!

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Dial and make outbound calls to transfer to clients 
Qualify prospects and transfer them to client 
Ensure customers meet certain criteria
Input information into CRM system
Provide excellent customer service 
Add customers to DNC list as requested
Handle escalated calls 

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Energetic, tenacious, confident, persuasive sales skills
Excellent verbal and written skills
Excellent problem solving skills
Ability to learn policy and procedures
Detail-oriented
Ability to work independently without supervision
Willing to work flexible hours
Must be able to handle rejection
High school diploma 

REQUIRED EQUIPMENT:
Working Computer
High-speed cable connected internet
Wired noise cancelling headset

BENEFITS:
-Competitive compensation (hourly base plus commission and bonuses). We pay more than most call centers! $14/hr + Commission & Bonus
-Lucrative exponential commission structure
-Additional daily bonus prizes for top producers
-$200 referral bonus for person who refers new hire
-Potential supervisory positions available for top performing agents!

Full-time shifts available for immediate start: M-F 10AM-7PM PST (Pacific Standard Time)
Add on Saturday Shift 10AM-5PM PST 

Website: www.NationRep.com ;

Please submit your resume for immediate consideration.

To apply: Send a resume to recruiting@nationrep.com

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to join our little web team. This position will provide support in all phases of development for all GWP web and mobile products, which includes planning, implementation, conversion and maintenance of both current and future projects.


We'd like our new teammate to have solid experience with rapidly developing web applications, and the ability to deliver projects on time with high-quality results. Our programming is primarily Ruby on Rails. Some of the websites you would be working with include ApartmentShowcase.com and NewHomesGuide.com.

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer
jobs.content:
The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for software testing for our Wave Relay® products. This includes providing special analysis required for initial software testing, quality assurance, and regression testing. The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that our products meet customer and management requirements, as well as Persistent Systems' quality standards.


POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Testing the software development and equipment for the Wave Relay® system

  • Development and implementation if a wide range of low-level software, hardware development, and testing of application software (including device drivers, Linux kernel modules, network stack development, and other low-level programming activities)

  • Supporting in-house and in-the-field engineering activities including travel to customer sites

  • Integrating other systems, senors, and components with the Wave Relay® system

  • Writing technical proposals

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Linux Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Persistent Systems is looking for an Embedded Software Engineer with extensive experience in a Linux environment. The position involves the development and implementation of a wide range of networking software. The ideal candidate has recent, demonstrated, hands-on development expertise with Linux. The position involves a significant level of autonomy in which a self-motivated applicant will work independently to develop solutions.


POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Developing and implementing a wide range of low-level embedded software (including device driver, Linux kernel modules, network stack development, porting existing software to new embedded platforms, and other low level programming activities), hardware development, as well as the development of application software running on the Wave Relay® network

  • Supporting in-house and in-the-field engineering activities including travel to customer sites

  • Traveling to test locations, military facilities, and customer sites to directly supporting the testing, evaluation, and deployment of the Wave Relay® system

  • Integrating other systems, sensors, and components with the Wave Relay® system

  • Writing technical proposals

jobs.title: Web-based Collaborative Geographic Information Systems Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
About:


The Landscape Spatial Analytics section is part of the Habitat Science Division in the Washington Dept. of Fish & Wildlife. This group has created a successful program mapping land-cover change through a mixture of machine-learning methods, automating spatial processing and innovative user-interface optimization for accuracy assessment. Current projects seek to complement their successful remote sensing approach with crowd source data and collaborative knowledge capture tools. 


You'll work in the Habitat Science division of the Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife on developing a collaborative GIS system to help the public and professionals track multiple natural resource issues in an online dataservice. The Geospatial Land Activities Dataservice will combine the data binding magic of angularjs and d3 with custom mapping tools developed through the ESRI javascript api. You'll develop a set of tools to facilitate mapping and discussion about ecosystem restoration projects, wetlands, shoreline armoring and more that will grow to help the Dept. of Fish & Wildlife, state and federal agencies, tribal nations, NGOs and the citizens of Washington track and achieve a sustainable future for the area we have come to know and love. You'll be a key player in a small team helping craft a new set of tools to bring increased transparency and effectiveness to natural resource management in one of the nations most important estuary complexes, Puget Sound.


As a member of our team you will have the opportunity to bring your creative skills to bear on solving real world problems. As an innovative team we encourage continuous learning and you'll have access to Lynda.com and time to delve into new topics as we grow and build. You can even help us get our Joel test score up to 12!

jobs.title: SQL Server DBA
jobs.content:
NCCPA is seeking an experienced SQL Server DBA to join their IT team.


You will wear a number of different hats in this role. Primarily, you'll be responsible for the operations of NCCPA's on-prem and on-cloud SQL Server databases. That includes maintenance plans, disaster recovery, scheduled and on-demand backups, SQL Agent job scheduling and monitoring and more. In addition, you'll spend some of your time doing support work (ad-hoc reporting and analysis, data updates) and project work (data modeling, data migrations, performance tuning).


You'll work with a great IT team supporting both internally developed apps and third party apps. You'll work with SQL Server 2016, SQL Server 2012, and SQL Azure. You'll have whatever tools you need to get the job done. You'll be a key member of the team and will be involved in architectural decisions, strategy, security, vendor selection, and more.

jobs.title: .Net Developer + Architect
jobs.content:
NCCPA is seeking talented .Net developers to join their growing development team in Johns Creek, GA.


Developers at NCCPA work with a broad range of (mostly Microsoft) technologies to build web, mobile, and desktop apps. Typically, each developer owns an entire user story and sometimes an entire project. You will work in all layers from front-end to back-end. If you are proficient with full stack .Net development, you will be a valued member of the team.


You will do more than just write code though. Developers are valued for their input at all phases of a project. Be prepared to discuss requirements with project stakeholders and analysts. Enjoy showing off your work during project review meetings. Help guide the direction of the development team by mentoring other developers, introducing your favorite tools, and speaking your mind on process and architecture.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer - Angular.js
jobs.content:
Local Seattle/Bellevue area candidates please!


Our client, Microsoft, is a well-known entity in the software, hardware, and services space and they have been on the bleeding edge of innovation for many years, not just reacting to trends in technology, but driving and defining them. They are looking for a highly skilled Web (UX - UI) Full Stack Developer. If you have solid development chops, work well as a part of a fast paced, agile, and collaborative team, then this may be the role for you! Come work on this exciting cloud based initiative and make a difference!


Skills set required: • Angular.JS (#1 priority!) • JavaScript • C# and .Net • CSS • HTML5 • Knockout.JS


Nice to have: • SQL • Asp.net • Typescript • Bootstrap


Location: Seattle area
Job ID: TW321
Duration: Long term Contract


If this opportunity speaks to your interests and skills set, reply with your resume. Akvelon is Puget Sound's premier Employment Consulting Agency, voted one of Puget Sound Business Journal's fastest growing companies 5 years in a row. We are a growing company with a dynamic start up atmosphere, committed to offering our employees challenging and rewarding projects with major clients within the Northwest. To learn more about Akvelon and other opportunities, please visit our website: akvelon.com/company/current-openings.

jobs.title: SQL and .Net Developer
jobs.content:
Seattle area candidates only!

Compensation: DOE

jobs.title: Mobile Developer

Our mobile software team is small, highly efficient, and results oriented. We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment that stays focused on building great software. jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Web Development
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Web Development


HQ - San Francisco, CA


FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator.
 
Beyond our in-store experience we provide our merchants with a powerful dashboard to monitor their loyalty campaigns, make tweaks, and directly communicate with their customers. If you have strong CS fundamentals, an eye for detail, and want to build tools that thousands of small businesses use to engage their best customers, then we are looking for you! Our web development team has a wide range of roles and responsibilities including front end engineering in Angular JS, backend API work in Django, and asynchronous pipeline management using Celery and RabbitMQ.
 
Responsibilities:



  • Drive product development on our rich web applications, enabling our merchants to make better decisions and stronger connections with their customers

  • Design for scale - our data is growing exponentially and we need new solutions to keep up with that growth

  • Work with the FiveStars Design team to build out our engineering processes and speed up the Product Vision -> Design -> Implementation cycle

  • Maintain a high level of quality in our code bases through well-written automated tests and good architecture and code review practices

  • Invest in FiveStars and its culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

  • Love to pair program and do not mind reviewing code (maybe even enjoy it)

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - DevOps
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer - Dev Ops


HQ - San Francisco, CA


FiveStars is the rewards program for small businesses that’s proven to bring customers back more often. Through unique rewards and personalized service, FiveStars helps everybody be a VIP. Founded in 2011 and based in San Francisco, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. In 2015, FiveStars drove 35 million in-store visits across over 10,000 local businesses in the U.S. and Canada. Over 10 million consumers use FiveStars to have exceptional experiences with local businesses. To-date FiveStars has raised $105 million from top-tier investors including HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, and Y-Combinator.
 
As an infrastructure engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring that FiveStars has a best in class networked application backend. All of the services, protocols, and data storage systems, will be yours to own, including everything from Docker and our container management system to our data stores - Redis, Postgres, Impala, RabbitMQ, and others. Determine the technologies that we use, how we use them, and how we stay ahead of scaling a system to tens of thousands of businesses and hundreds of millions of users. Then implement your vision and ensure that it meets the requirements of the applications built on top of it.
 
Responsibilities:



  • Own the platform upon which all of our web products and mobile APIs are built

  • Maintain a high level of quality in our infrastructure systems through sound development practices including code reviews, monitoring and alerting systems, and architecture reviews

  • Invest in FiveStars and its culture - our values are something we live and breathe every day

jobs.title: Mid Level - Software Developer
jobs.content:
** Applicants Must Have Financial / Electronic Trading Experience ** Sendence is looking for a hands on software engineer. Our culture values smart people with good ideas and high energy: you are driven to solve problems, can learn concepts and skills quickly, can understand and drive business requirements, enjoy collaborating and are a strong communicator. This is a hands on role where your code skills will help grow your business knowledge. We're looking for someone who has previous financial experience but wants to expand his or her skill-set.  In this role you will go from refining customer requirements and building proof of concepts to delivering a robust final product.




Sendence is a small but fast growing company, backed with revenue. We're building a real-time data processing platform to operate at high volume, low latency, with resiliency and consistency. Our technology has many applications, including trade surveillance and regulatory. We use the best tools to analyze and react to our data. We believe in open source and strive to build on these technologies and contribute back to the projects we use. Our team is 16 people and growing. We have a lot of green field problems and the chance for each new team member to make a lasting impact on our technology and culture. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
SweetRush is looking for a RoR Developer rock star to play an important role in building, maintaining, and evolving the software, infrastructure, and technologies that drive our products and services.


(NOTE: Expertise in Ruby on Rails is required and Linux Server IT is desired.)
 
SweetRush has been operating for 14 years and continues to grow. If you’re passionate about performance and reliability, we'd love to chat!

jobs.title: Software Engineer: Network
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s software engineers develop next-generation cloud infrastructure technology that will change how millions of developers build, deploy, and scale web applications. Our mission is to simplify cloud infrastructure; this requires knowledge in many different fields including distributed systems, virtualization, software defined networking, scale-out storage, real-time data processing, and user interface design.


As a software engineer on the Network team, the software you write will run on tens of thousands of hypervisors across our global infrastructure network.  You will be responsible for building the next generation of networking on our platform: providing flexible, yet simple, primitives that our customers have come to love.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Driving the design and implementation of the overlay network that supports how droplets interact with each other and the outside world

  • Building exciting new features that will enable developers to build highly available, robust, and secure services

  • Working closely with the network engineering team to build and support a performant and flexible software network architecture

  • Maintaining and ensuring a high standard for reliability and availability across multiple datacenters

  • Evolving our existing architecture and codebases to support building flexible networking capabilities both internally and for the product


Technologies we use:



  • Open vSwitch, Go, Perl, C/C++, MySQL, Libvirt, KVM, chef, git

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Compute
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s software engineers develop next-generation cloud infrastructure technology that will change how millions of developers build, deploy, and scale web applications. Our mission is to simplify cloud infrastructure; this requires knowledge in many different fields including distributed systems, virtualization, software defined networking, scale-out storage, real-time data processing, and user interface design.


As a software engineer on the Compute team, the software you write will run on tens of thousands of hypervisors across our global infrastructure network. You will define the next generation of cloud services, making developers' lives (both inside DO and in the 'wild') easier by building new services to power the hypervisor, placement, database and event systems. This is a unique opportunity to deliver the best user-experience in the industry to millions of developers around the world.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer: Storage
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean’s Storage Team builds and runs cloud-scale distributed storage services powering internal and customer-facing services and products. We’re creating flexible and powerful storage solutions that our customers will leverage to ship their software as quickly and easily as possible. We’re looking for engineers throughout the backend, from the filesystem and networking layers to end-user API design and implementation.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • First and foremost, working as part of a team shipping powerful storage solutions

  • Evaluating and deploying distributed block and object stores

  • Building orchestration and APIs in front of petabyte-scale storage clusters

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer Developer Tools
jobs.content:
DigitalOcean is on a mission to simplify cloud infrastructure for the millions of software developers around the world. We are a small, distributed, and cohesive team. At DigitalOcean, every single engineer has a massive impact on the organization and product, and we want to keep it that way. We believe in autonomy for teams and individuals.


Ultimately, we want you to be passionate about creating products that you and your peers would love.


As a Software Engineer in our Engineering Services org, you’ll be at the heart of the engineering pipeline building software that empowers engineering teams to develop rapidly and deploy reliable and scalable products/services. You’ll have ownership of the architecture, design and implementation of our tools and infrastructure at DO that improve developer efficiency. You’ll get the opportunity to work across a broad range of technologies while solving unique challenges.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • DigitalOcean is loved by our developer and operations community. You’ll be their voice inside the company and work towards continually improving their experience

  • Build large scale testing tools, frameworks and infrastructure to enable teams make sure their work of art is battle tested

  • Innovate and continually improve our engineering pipeline with advanced CI/CD implementations.

  • Optimize how we test our products whether it’s open sourced, commercial or internal infrastructure

  • Research emerging test tools, trends and methodologies and enhance existing systems and processes

jobs.title: Frontend Developer Checkout
jobs.content:
:: ABOUT the team and the job


Our Checkout team creates the whole order and payment process in backend and frontend - from logging in to filling a wishlist up to placing orders. The team is „…just awesome“: Process oriented, handling different APIs and stakeholders, highly intercultural. In a concentrated work environment they focus on security in all data transaction processes and always have the goal to create a quick and easy checkout experience for our customers. You like to work in a multi-product-team with a very  close connection to the customer? You want to contribute your ideas and constantly improve the products and your skills through intense code reviews and feedback? Then you are the perfect support for our Check Out team who is searching for a Frontend Developer Check Out (m/f) at the moment. 


:: ABOUT what to expect



  • Development and maintenance of a frontend platform in JavaScript, HTML and CSS(SASS)

  • Applied SCRUM processes that are continuously improved by and for the team

  • Emphasis on client-side rendering and interaction with the server via REST APIs

  • Lots of space for your own ideas and creations, flat hierarchies and very short decision making process

  • A highly motivated and supportive team

  • Active internal knowledge sharing

  • What not to expect is a finished product that just needs a maintainer

jobs.title: Senior Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Vodori partners with our customers in life sciences to help improve the health and well-being of people around the world. Our software, Pepper, powers our customers’ ability to help get the right products into the hands of people who can make a difference. Pepper is an advanced content management platform that enables our customers to create, review, and approve promotional materials for use globally.


We’re looking for a Senior Product Engineer to help us deliver next-generation capabilities using the latest approaches in enterprise product architecture and design. Pepper is primarily composed of Java and JavaScript and leverages frameworks like Spring, Dojo, and Angular 2. Our newest applications run in Docker and on Kubernetes.


We’re looking for a polyglot who’s comfortable working across the entire stack, but also has deep, teaching-worthy knowledge and experience. We’re hard-working, we share a deep commitment to our customers and to one another, and we deliver iteratively through Agile sprints. Each member of the product team makes significant impact in product architecture, design, and future direction.

jobs.title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
jobs.content:
The IT Enterprise Information Management Department is currently recruiting for a Senior Business Intelligence Developer to join their team.  This role is dedicated to day to day support and enhancements to the existing Data Warehouse production environment. This Senior BI Developer will work with the various subject matter experts to maintain and implement enhancements to the current production environment of databases and applications, SQL SSIS packages, reports and cubes. 

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Design and enhance database solutions to meet the customer requirements.   Develop and document system design specifics in a "Solution-in-Detail" to assure understanding and to gain agreement by user of specific system inputs, outputs and costs. Conduct walk-throughs and develop specifications in sufficient detail to insure maximum system compliance with customer needs.

  • Design and develop limited changes to ETL solutions.

  • Design and develop reports, dashboards or other user interface solutions.

  • Performs all levels of testing (unit, integration, regression and support of user testing) to ensure code meets technical and business requirements.

  • Ensure the creation of high quality and on time deliverables.

  • Ensures standards for user access security are followed.

  • Ensure documentation and proper on-call support. Provide support and technical guidance to resolve support issues as needed.

  • Ensure that standards for change management and production control are understood and followed.

  • Maintain effective user and IT relationships in order to provide a climate receptive to systems improvement and to enhance understanding of the user’s business concerns. Participate on user project teams assisting them to leverage the data warehouse and data resources.

  • Looks for areas of improvement in processes and procedures and offers recommendations.

  • Provide guidance and direction of available data for research projects. Understand and adhere to all research data management procedures.

  • Maintain expertise in data warehouse tools and technologies and coach others on the team. Provide guidance and direction to less experienced team members.


    • Christiana Care Health System is an equal opportunity employer, firmly committed to prohibiting discrimination, whose staff is reflective of its community and considers qualified applicants for open positions without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Frontend Engineer at Airtame, you and your team will be responsible for building the simple, yet beautiful and powerful user experiences which drive our wireless streaming platform. The team is currently focused on developing a cloud-based device management system, where our users can remotely administrate large Airtame deployments. As this product is in the early development phase, you will have the opportunity to have a large impact on its direction.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Front-end code is no exception, as we give a lot of thought into the way we write our client-side JavaScript and our CSS. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer at Airtame, you and your team will be responsible for developing our cross-platform desktop application, which allows users to wirelessly mirror their desktops on Airtame-enabled displays. The application is built in NodeJS using the Electron framework, but it is not your typical Javascript project. Delivering a beautiful user experience for wireless streaming on all major platforms comes with a set of unique challenges, and as such, our engineers must be able to comfortably navigate both frontend and backend development.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.
