jobs.content:
As a Senior C/C++ Software Engineer at Airtame, you and your team will be responsible for developing the core of our wireless streaming software, which is responsible for capturing, encoding and transmitting audio and video data, then receiving, decoding and rendering the content on the Airtame device. This is low-level software which runs under CPU, memory and time constraints, requiring significant focus on performance, concurrency, and resource lifecycles.


Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
Who we are
With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms.


How we work
Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. Due to the growth our multi-team environment is scaling fast while we are adopting agile values, management and engineering practices.


Who we are looking for
You are a passionate, experienced and pragmatic iOS engineer who has proven skills in creating innovative apps with modern and elegant user interfaces. You have a strong knack for problem solving and want to change the future of language learning while working in a challenging environment. Working together with ambitious colleagues you are eager to collaborate and dive into different disciplines to broaden your knowledge in other fields of expertise as well as share your own. Contributing to a great architecture and building the base of an easily extendable and well maintainable application is something you enjoy and take pride in.


Responsibilities for the role:



  • Work in a cross-functional team

  • Deliver high-quality work from design to production

  • Implement great functionality and stunning user experience

  • Take ownership of features, working with the team and stakeholders

  • Work closely with other engineering disciplines

  • Focus on long-term stability and maintainability

jobs.title: .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
What's great about working at KL&A?


We are teams of consultants who build systems that make a real difference in government and the private sector. Our Agile development team is located in Columbus, OH where we provide an open and collaborative environment to create great things together.  Be a part of a growing branch of KL&A!


Developer tool chains vary by team, but generally include combinations of: Github (source control), Jira (Issue and Agile tools),  Slack (Team Communication) and Jenkins (Continuous Integration).


This Position


As a .NET web developer, you will be a member of a team of passionate engineers creating innovative solutions for our clients in Ohio and the rest of the country.  


Your responsibilities include:



  • Developing responsive modern web applications

  • Interacting with and designing relational databases

  • Developing backend processes and API's for large systems

  • Working with clients and stakeholders to design and implement systems.

  • Keeping up to date on new technology


Required Skills and Background



  • Bachelors Degree or higher in a related field.

  • Must be willing to work in our Columbus, OH office or relocate at own expense.

  • Must be legally authorized to work in the US without current or future need for a visa sponsorship.

  • Minimum 2 years experience building .NET MVC based applications in C#.

  • Recent experience using HTML5, CSS, Javascript, JSON or Bootstrap

  • Relational database development experience (SQL Server 2008+).

  • Must have a solid understanding of software engineering principles and Agile software development methodologies.

  • Must have a desire and drive to learn new technologies, and to continuously learn and grow as a professional and as an individual. 

  • Must have a passion for creating and delivering software that is both high quality and highly innovative. 

  • Must have excellent programming, analytical, and problem solving skills. 

  • Must be self-motivated and able to collaborate with a diverse set of people from many disciplines. 

  • Must be able to understand and appropriately respond to client needs.

  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills (English).


Benefits


At KL&A our employees are the most important asset. We believe in rewarding performance and treating all employees like professionals.



  • Three (3) weeks paid vacation (prorated for first year)

  • Unlimited sick time

  • 401K with employer match

  • Premium healthcare insurance (PPO or HSA) – including medical, dental, and vision

  • Flexible Spending Accounts for dependent care and medical care

  • Employer paid group long-term disability and group life insurance

  • Ongoing education and training reimbursement

  • Employee recruiting incentives

  • Your choice of computer (PC or Mac)

  • Company issued cell phone or personal cell phone allowance

  • Suit attire stipend

  • Awesome co-workers!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As .Net Senior Software Engineer and member of our Development scrum team, you are responsible for our innovative solutions. You help to outline new enterprise applications and think actively, in collaboration with the team, about software design and technical solutions. Furthermore, you have your own ideas about architecture and are not afraid to share your knowledge.


A fullstack Developer at FRISS is eager to grow, not afraid to take chances and thinks out-of-the-box. You combine this with excellent knowledge of C# and JavaScript, our main languages, through which you create new possibilities and advantages.


The function


By keeping an eye on the latest insights and trends, you have your own say in how products of FRISS can be optimized and used at our clients. You apply quality improvement processes like unit testing, code reviews and continuous delivery and are familiar with design patterns and architecture principles as dependency injection and Service Oriented Architecture. Moreover, you apply problem solving patterns such as reliable messaging and improve the scalability and reliability of the FRISS platform.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
As our base of customers grows, we have some exciting engineering challenges coming up and would love your help as a Senior Ruby Developer (in Berlin or remote).


You are a good fit for our team, if you 


... get excited about good quality code and engineering quests
We innovate by building a smart customer-driven backend solution. This implies exciting engineering challenges and missions. Our roadmap is not based on fixed deadlines. We start with MVP’s and iterate from there.

... think small is beautiful
Automation matters to us. We are a small, high caliber team and only want to grow if really necessary. We discovered creating value by staying small and agile.

... like to work from the place you love
We build this company to work from the place we are most productive and happy. For us office is optional. As a distributed team we use collaboration-tools to stay connected, participate in each other’s work and post cat pictures.

jobs.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

jobs.title: PhD position Computational Biology
jobs.company: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
jobs.content:
The position will be in the framework of NTNU's DrugLogics initiative and will be for a period of three years, starting before the end of 2016. Applicants must hold a Master's degree in one of the relevant research areas Biology, Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Physics. The DrugLogics project has as its main goal the development of approaches to predict the effects of drugs on cancer. These predictions require computational tools and mathematical models (e.g. Boolean models) of cancer cells, to simulate how molecular interactions drive a cancer patient’s response to medicine. These predictions subsequently need to be tested in the lab, through various experiment types: cell culture, organoids, and patient derived xenografts.


The DrugLogics project consists currently of 3 sub-projects (COLOSYS, DrugLogics and Crossover Research 2.0; see www.DrugLogics-NTNU.org), which is embedded in the Digital Life centre at NTNU, so you will be part of an interdisciplinary group of 10 newly recruited people working together on complementary tasks, involving thee NTNU departments: Department of Biology (Gløshaugen campus); Department of Cancer Research and Molecular Medicine (Øya campus); and Department of Philosophy and Religious Studies (Dragvoll campus). For the development of data analysis and modeling approaches we currently seek a talented, enthusiastic and creative young scientist who will work closely together with the other team members.

jobs.title: Conversion Copywriter
jobs.content:
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1.7 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What does the Conversion Copywriter do?

The Conversion Copywriter's task is to take web pages, emails, and other content and create copy that improves conversion rates and gets results.

Key skills include:

  • Making boring topics (like student loans and personal finance) interesting and fun.
  • Understanding psychology and human behavior and why people think and act the way they do.
  • Finding the right words to educate, inspire, and motivate users to take action.
  • Create clear and engaging copy that's honest and helpful (and not hype).
  • Ability to find weak spots in web and email copy and creating new copy to improve those weaknesses.
  • A focus on results -- you're not merely creating new copy and calling it a day. Instead, you're focused on making sure what you produce gets the desired results.

The ideal candidate for this position should have an entrepreneurial mind-set and be ready to take on and initiate new projects as he or she sees the need arise.

Whatâs it like to work on the Student Loan Hero team?

Student Loan Hero is a rapidly-growing and fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.

Since weâre literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don't worryâyou won't be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. Weâre focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.
Weâre always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.
Above all, weâre each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether itâs authoring a blogpost read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

To apply: Visit here: https://student-loan-hero.workable.com/jobs/313959 and hit "Apply for this job" at the bottom of the page.

jobs.title: PR Specialist -- Full Time, Remote
jobs.content:
Description
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1.7 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What Does The PR Specialist Do? 
Our efforts have already landed us on some awesome publications, including Lifehacker, Vice, Forbes, Mic, and CNBC. Now, we're looking to expand our outreach team by bringing on a new PR Specialist to work his or her magic on showcasing our brand to new audiences and marketing SLH as a leader in the student loan and Millennial personal finance space.
The PR Specialist will work with the community outreach team and be responsible for strategizing and executing earned media strategy for Student Loan Hero. He or she will oversee the entire process including: identifying potential story/media opportunities, developing/maintaining relationships with publishers, working internally to receive/develop outreach materials, and earning media placements.

Success in this role will require prior experience in securing top-tier placements on a regular basis as well as the ability to identify news trends and jump on these opportunities before the end of those respective new cycles. The ideal candidate will need to demonstrate both creative and strategic thinking.

What's It Like To Work For the SLH Team?
Student Loan Hero is a fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.
Since weâre literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don't worryâyou won't be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. Weâre focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.

Weâre always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.

Above all, weâre each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether itâs authoring a blog post read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

Required
  • 2+ years experience in media relations
  • Experience in securing top-tier media placements on a regular basis
  • MUST provide examples of secured media placements

Preferred
  • Experience in working for a PR firm
  • Demonstrated interest in working with startups
  • Experience in working in the personal finance space
  • Experience in securing syndication partnerships with top-tier sites
  • Bachelorâs degree in PR, communications, marketing, etc.

Benefits 
  • Competitive salary: Based on experience and location
  • Equity: 0.05â0.15% in vested company ownership
  • Vacation: Unlimited
  • Flexible hours: Work when youâre most productive
  • Work remotely: Work from wherever you want in the world (Costa Rica, anyone?)
  • New equipment: Weâll hook you up with a $2,000 technology stipend to purchase a laptop or whatever helps you work
  • Remote workspace: We'll pay up to $500/month for a remote office space (e.g., co-working space)
  • Wellness: Up to $450/month for wellness-related expenses, including health insurance and gym membership
  • Continuing education: Up to $100/month for courses, books, or anything youâd like to learn!
  • Financial contribution: Receive a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary to a retirement account, or a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary towards student loan repayment assistance.

To apply: Please apply here: https://student-loan-hero.workable.com/jobs/327117

jobs.title: iOS Software Engineer
jobs.content: As an iOS Software Engineer, you will be part of one of the most exciting teams at Flybits. You will be working closely with UX designers, project managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile solutions to pivotal iOS projects. You will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of the iOS SDK and related components, as well as for executing reliability into code, infrastructure, and process delivery.

jobs.title: Automotive Inventory Associate (PTO + Great Benefits)
jobs.content:
Overview

What Drives You?

  • Career paths with opportunities to learn vital roles and skills?
  • Meaningful work in a stable, promote-from-within organization?
  • Professional satisfaction and helping others?
  • A workspace that is dynamic, fast, fun, and challenging?

 

We Share Your Drive.

 

The Inventory Associate will be responsible for inventory operations at our vehicle inspection center. All job responsibilities listed below are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any/all incumbents, with reasonable accommodation. 

Responsibilities

  • Stock in vehicles as they arrive from Auction
  • Detail vehicles – Wash, Buffing, paint touch-up, interior etc.
  • Prepare and move vehicles around the Inspection Center for distribution to retail
  • Ensure each vehicle is inspected for cosmetic standards
  • Assist Auto Technicians in conducting a complete multi-point inspection on arriving inventory, including fuel level, safety features, drivability test and proper display of all company and state disclosures
  • Maintain positive relationships with external repair and supply vendors
  • Review processes and make recommendations as needed
  • Other projects as designated by the Inspection Center management
  • Perform Inventory Reconciliation on vehicles

All job responsibilities listed are essential to the satisfactory performance of this position by any/all incumbents, with reasonable accommodation, if necessary.  Any non-essential functions are assumed to be included in “Other related duties as assigned”. 

 

Enjoy the Rewards and Benefits.

Benefits: Outstanding medical, dental and vision plans, Paid Time Off, 11 Days your first year, 401K matching, Tuition Assistance

Schedule: Expect a consistent Monday-Friday, 40 hour week schedule. Enjoy nights and weekends off.

Future: We’re a unique, highly respected, nationwide company with a strong culture of promoting from within. This isn’t a job. It’s a career.

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or GED REQUIRED
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to interact with managers and coworkers in a professional, courteous manner.
  • PC skills using Microsoft Office is desirable.
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • In the last 3 years, employees must have no more than 2 moving violations, a DUI or reckless driving violations.

 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The Physical demands described within are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • This job position is designated as a safety sensitive position.

  • Must be able to lift up to 60 pounds independently; majority of lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.

  • Must be able to carry and transport up to 60 pounds up to 20 feet.

  • Requires standing for extended period of time with frequent stretching, reaching, walking and stooping, pushing and/or pulling in an environment that may be cold, hot, noisy, and wet and may have fumes or odors due to vehicle maintenance.

  • Requires excellent visual acuity and manual dexterity.

  • Requires use of safety equipment that may include but not limited to face shield or goggles, non-slip shoes, gloves, mask, and other protective garments and equipment.

  • Requires some driving and frequent typing.

  • Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.

     

Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a drug-free, tobacco-free workplace.

EOE

jobs.title: Product Designer University Grad (2017)
jobs.content:
Team Description: 

Our research and design team crafts delightful experiences that make people's lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by a highly iterative user-centered design process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we're discovering needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for millions of people around the world.
 

Role Description:

If you've been following Dropbox for a while, you know that we like to keep things simple. The Design team here at Dropbox has a bunch of projects in the pipeline and we're looking for awesome designers to help refine Dropbox’s simplicity and craft the way users interact, feel and love all our products. We have an ongoing cycle of revamping our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. Dropbox's San Francisco office is filled with all the tools you need, including an awesome and like-minded team.
 
Did you just graduate and are looking for your first full time gig? Perfect! The design team is looking to add a few fresh faces to the ranks and if you’re really pumped about design, technology and especially Dropbox, we hope you’ll apply. We’re looking at a lot of new problems that we’d love your help in solving :) 
 

Responsibilities: 

  • You solve for simple. You employ a systematic process for finding -- and resolving -- hidden complexities and edge cases. 
  • Produce work that encompasses the distinctive look and feel of Dropbox’s products, communications, and identity.
  • Think in terms of design systems and make rational design decisions.
  • You're actively involved in defining new product’s identities.
  • Work closely with other designers defining product strategy. 
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams such as engineering and product management.
  • Work with the team to ship design across various products
  • To improve yourself and the design team at large, you participate in team/company initiatives: design critiques, collaboration sessions. 
  • Able to effectively communicate technical ideas to non-technical (and technical) people
Requirements: 
  • Completing a bachelor's or graduate degree in December 2016 or Summer 2017
  • Interested in either interaction, visual or illustration design for products. 
  • Able to work in a variety of media (print, web, mobile), design for a variety of projects (apps, visual interfaces, marketing and communications)
  • Polishing and refining your work is important to you, you obsess over details and your work is pixel-perfect.
  • Whatever your tools of choice, you wield them with deft and speed

Please provide us with a personal email address rather than a school email address so that Dropbox can communicate effectively with you.

jobs.title: Customer Experience - Web Designer
jobs.content:
CX Overview
 
Our mission in Dropbox is to simplify the way people work together. With a user base of over 500 million, the Customer Experience team simplifies how our users and customers interact with Dropbox. We focus on understanding the customer journey, as well as where we can simplify interactions and improve the customer experience. And as we scale rapidly with our business growth, we’re hiring dedicated and enthusiastic people to help deliver compelling online support globally.
 
Role Description
 
We are looking for a creative and technically competent web designer to join our CX Self-Support team. This person is responsible for crafting a user centric design, steering the process from concept to execution across many platforms. Working with our UX/UI and Content managers, they will create delightful end-user experiences, which allow end-users to resolve support queries online and maximize their use of Dropbox in a way that amplifies our brand and values
 
Responsibilities
  • Implementing the CX Self-Support UX and UI strategy through compelling experiences for support and education
  • Building wireframes, mock-up and digital templates for self-support content channels
  • Creating engaging video, image and rich media content across desktop, tablet and mobile resources to simplify how information is shared with our users
  • Work closely with our Service Delivery, Product Expert and Decision Analytics teams to continually refine and optimize content and online design
 
Requirements:
  • Degree qualification in multimedia, interaction design, web design or related field
  • 3+ years’ experience in web/mobile design demonstrated through a strong portfolio of work
  • Proficient with industry standard design language and tools (e.g. CSS3, HTML5, Javascript, Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch)and experience with Object Oriented JavaScript and modern JavaScript libraries (e.g., Closure, jQuery, Node.)
  • Strong Customer focus
  • Knowledge of Dropbox products
  • Strong communication skills with an ability to present conceptual and design ideas to multiple stakeholders across the company

jobs.title: Workday Lead
jobs.content:
Role Description

We are looking for a Workday Lead with strong Workday experience including Core HR, Absence, Time Tracking and Integrations to lead our Workday team to deliver enhanced capability, employee experience and integrations.  The role is directly accountable for successful delivery of all Workday projects in partnership with internal and external teams running agile sprints to configure new capabilities, build/refine integrations and enable process efficiencies.  The role is within our People Team (HR) and leads an amazing team of Workday analysts supporting Dropbox’s growing global workforce. 

Responsibilities 

  • Lead workday team including Dropboxers and external partners in an agile environment developing user stories, prioritizing sprint plans, confirming solution recommendations, running user acceptance test and launch with thoughtful change management.
  • Manage HR, absence and time tracking processes globally, acting as an owner to ensure the process runs smoothly and any issues are resolved quickly and effectively.
  • Use agile and project management methodologies to successfully plan and deliver bi-weekly sprints with technology partner (onshore/offshore) raising issues/risks with mitigation plans
  • Create and maintain Workday strategic roadmap across HCM, Absence and Time Tracking and ensure demand is managed appropriately.
  • Ensure prompt triage and issue resolution of reported Workday issues via Zendesk
  • Provide a proactive interface between HR client groups and the Workday team to ensure effective coordination and delivery of Workday implementations
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with HRBPs and other stakeholders. Communicate team and Dropboxer feedback to leadership as appropriate.
  • Monitor and manage work and workload of team members, providing feedback or requesting additional resource support, as appropriate.
  • Navigate complex issues effectively which will require an understanding of our people systems architecture/workflows often against time sensitive deadlines.
  • Manage Workday releases which will including regression testing of current configurations, reports and integrations.

Requirements

  • 5-7 years of experience configuring or implementing Workday HCM including integrations
  • 7–10 years of experience designing HR processes and policies
  • Experience in global workplace operations program design and launches including customer service, operational efficiency measurement
  • Comfortable with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a rapidly evolving business landscape
  • Humble attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level strategic thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams

jobs.title: Enterprise Business Development Representative - UK
jobs.content:
Team Description 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

The Business Development team is all about generating lead volume for our enterprise teams while helping people understand the many ways in which Dropbox Business can simplify their professional lives.
 
The role of a Business Development Representative provides you with the opportunity to educate and consult to large companies on the benefits of Dropbox Business and Dropbox Enterprise. While the volume of leads the Business Development Representatives qualify are extremely important to the health of the overall business, more important is the development of the individuals qualifying those leads.
 
Dropbox’s Business Development Representatives are the training ground for our future leaders. They are the key to Dropbox’s future success and our talent pipeline.

Responsibilities 

  • Develop and qualify opportunities within large enterprises within the UK, Ireland and South African markets
  • Prospect and identify key executives at target companies and lay the foundation for a strong, long lasting relationship
  • Work closely with Account Executives to build a pipeline for the Dropbox for Business product
  • Make every potential Dropbox prospect happy with every interaction, regardless of deal size or likelihood of close
  • Manage, track, and report sales activities and results using Salesforce.com

Requirements

  • 1-4 years of experience in lead generation, sales, and/or marketing (SaaS experience a plus, but not required)
  • A highly motivated individual with a competitive personality and strong attention to detail
  • Prior experience in a lead generation, sales or marketing within the Internet or SaaS industry (preferred)
  • Demonstrated success overachieving against professional and personal goals
  • Avid Dropbox user and a vocal technology evangelist
  • Exceptional interpersonal communication skills and superior organizational skills
  • Excellent academic qualifications; Bachelor’s Degree preferred

jobs.title: Outlook Plugin Developer With RESTful API Integration Experience
jobs.content:
We're looking for a developer with experience in writing VSTO plug-ins in C# for Office 2013+ for Windows 7+. The plug-ins will interact directly with our proprietary Restful API for retrieving and storing user data in our cutting edge, Azure hosted web application.The first plug-in to be developed and the priority for this project is for Microsoft Outlook 2013 or later.

Our ideal developer will have at least 6 years of experience writing performant, efficient code in C# (4.5) that is ready for a production environment; excellent verbal and written communication is a REQUIREMENT.

This position will be the sole developer on this project and will continue development on a the plugin code that already exists but has not yet been released to the public. We will provide annotated mockups that will detail all interaction, as well as access to our API documentation and direct communication with our Chief Architect.

U.S. based candidates only, west coast preferred, ideally located in San Diego.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Exciting Opportunity in Video Games for a Server Engineer!
jobs.content:
Work with a video gaming company in Denver! We are looking for a Server Engineer who is passionate about designing, developing, and delivering scalable networked server applications supporting hundreds of thousands of concurrent players.  The ideal candidate would have experience implementing, operating, and optimizing a wide variety of applications in a distributed environment under the real-time pressure of multiple live-service games.


This position is located at our Denver studio. No recruiters, please.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Microsoft Careers: My job details


Are you looking to add cloud experience to your resume? Are you excited to be a leader in the frontier world of software as service? Then you are looking to be a part of the ASG substrate!


Office 365 is key to Microsoft’s cloud strategy and is the industry leader in hosted productivity suites that includes Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive and more. It is the fastest and more profitable business at Microsoft with more than 100 million enterprise seats and several hundred million consumer accounts. O365 Foundations Engineering team is chartered with building the substrate that drives these intelligent applications.   We run the core infrastructure for Office 365 which is hosted in multiple data centers across the globe.


Office 365 Foundation Engineering is responsible for managing all the hardware, build infrastructure, deployment, active directory, identity and provisioning, secure access, workflow management of tasks, availability monitoring and alerting, visualization and optics and extensibility. We are also responsible for security and compliance because customers trust how we handle their data which is a key differentiator for Microsoft. We build an administrator portal, handle customer support, and maintain live site operations. Teams leverage a mix of custom datacenter technologies, standard Azure technologies and open source technologies.


Office 365 Foundation Engineering is looking for Software Engineers to deliver on the big bets crucial to Office 365’s success. We are looking for software developers that are technically strong, hungry for new challenges, willing to deal with ambiguities and eager to take on larger scope and ownership. We have opportunities in everything from UI to core kernel work and anything in between.   All of our work comes with challenges of big data, large scale and continuous shipping and supporting a mission-critical live service.

jobs.title: Front-End Web Developer
jobs.content:
The University of Wisconsin-Madison’s Division of Information Technology (DoIT) is looking for a full-time front-end developer to join our team.



Your Role:


Are you excited about front-end web technologies and UI/UX?  Are you looking for an opportunity to continue learning and be part of dynamic team?  We’re looking for an experienced front-end developer to be the next member of our growing team!


The work we do is varied and challenging, so you will need the tenacity to take on our increasing list of development projects that benefit students, faculty, and staff at UW-Madison and beyond.   You’ll have an opportunity to learn while you work as part of a team to help customers to design, build, and deploy web content.  Additional responsibilities will include working on front-end development tasks associated with application development projects.


You’ll enjoy robust benefits such as the State of Wisconsin Benefits Package, a beautiful Campus Setting and a competitive salary.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Developer
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Development Manager, the Software Developer is responsible for designing and implementing new development projects as well as completing and augmenting the current solutions and services. They will collaborate with Technical Product Managers, Developers, Technical Writing and Quality Assurance throughout the development process to ensure the product is functionally complete and well-engineered. This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing innovator in a technically challenging and rewarding role. Through our training and mentoring program, you will develop deep technical expertise and gain valuable business and industry related experience.



  • Analyze, design, prototype, develop , test and support – complete software lifecycle in your hands

  • Work with clients, prospects, implementation partners, and Dayforce personnel to envision and deliver the required functionality

  • Create and enhance a scalable enterprise application

  • Assess risks and impacts on the existing system as new functions are added

jobs.title: Visual Studio Developer
jobs.content: Develop Windows PC software applications using Visual Studio toolset in a process-oriented environment, supporting machine control and automation. Author, design, develop, test and support of software test activities for product features. Develops system testing procedures, programming and documentation.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developers
jobs.content:
We're disrupting the real estate investor market by scaling out in whole new way, and are building a new platform to grow the flip and rental investment market.  We’re providing loans to home flippers at industry leading rates nationwide, growing quickly, and want to make a big web tech play in that field.


We have a small growing company that’s using leading edge tech and products and making a difference in our markets.  We’re looking for solid Ruby Developers, Senior Devs, and Lead Devs to join the team.


Compensation wise we provide PTO, medical benefits, and are offering stock ownership in the projects themselves.


In our Ruby Developer role, we’re looking for:



  • Great coders with a passion for rapid quality development

  • Demonstrates clear understanding of the field by simply explaining complex concepts

  • Multi-project experience with Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap UI, generators, etc

  • Is able to spin up a new Rails project from the ground up quickly and smoothly

  • Takes a test-first approach with a preference for their favorite tools, quality systems, etc

  • A plus for experience with: Slim, Handlebars, a wide variety of gems, open source project contributions, your own personal coding projects, Postgres, MongoDB, NodeJS, AngularJS, ReactJS, variety of REST or JSON RPC APIs,


In our Lead Devs, we’re also looking for someone to:



  • Take complete ownership over one of our project areas

  • Heading up development

  • Be the senior coding developer on the project

  • Own the IT hosting components

  • Create the feature specs (mockups, workflows, features, etc)

  • Set the technical direction and architecture

  • Be SCRUM/KanBan master, tracking team velocity, handle work items, bug triage, internal customer requests, etc

  • Sharp understanding of pros and cons of various gems, APIs, and libraries

  • Bring in the latest technologies, like AngularJS, NodeJS, ReactJS, etc

  • Experience building REST APIs, including beautiful documentation

  • Oversee the user experience and interface

  • Put into place best practices around testing and code quality

  • And potentially move into a team manager role, hiring the team, leading the team, and providing technical direction


These roles report to the VP of Development, work with the business owners to define new features (mockups, specs, user stories, etc), and make it all happen!


Do you enjoy a great map?  Like exploring Ruby voodoo but keep it sane?  Like building new sites from the ground up?  Optimizing workflow?  Enjoy bringing in the latest tech into a project?  Want to get in on a young company growing fast?  Mentor others?  Write kickass code?  Then this may be just the right role for you.


Keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, devise, cancan, heroku, postgres, mysql, angular, angularjs, node, nodejs, project management, SCRUM, agile, kanban, bootstrap, reactjs


This is a full time position at our Irving TX location at 4600 Fuller Dr 75038.  You must have clearance to work full-time without additional sponsorship needed.  And we provide the latest in tech to our team.


ManPow LLC
New Western Acquisitions, Sherman Bridge Lending, and MoneyBug
Noah Coad, VP of Development, noah.coad@manpow.com

jobs.title: Lead iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Sephora seeks a full-time Lead iOS Developer to help lead its highly successful iOS development team. In this role, you will assume team leadership of several iOS developers engaged in building a small stable of iOS apps, including Sephora’s highly recognized Sephora to Go App. You will work with Sephora’s dedicated team of API developers, back-end developers and other technical and product specialists. Sephora has a very ambitious roadmap of features to deliver in the next two years. Your role in executing is as the iOS expert, working with system architects and your own team to design and deliver on the product vision. You will also provide direction and prioritize tasks for the team.


Sephora’s mobile team is the startup inside Sephora’s mature retail engineering culture. You’ll work with the best and brightest on the most interesting projects. As such, enthusiasm, expertise and a passion for partnership and communication are a must. The Lead iOS Developer will report to the Director of Mobile Engineering. You will also enjoy Sephora’s exception portfolio of benefits, including 4 weeks of paid vacation and an unparalleled bonus program.


Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Be an expert developer of our award winning iOS applications

  • Provide insight to the team as to best software application development practices and techniques

  • Evaluate and communicate technical risk and ensure applications are deployed against a schedule with the highest quality possible 

  • Develop applications using Objective C, XCode, Interface Builder, Instruments, Cocoa Touch, and other iOS development tools 

  • Be a sound technical voice in steering projects in the roadmap

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking exceptional software engineers to join our team as we move our products and services to the next level. The Software Engineer will design and develop quality solutions using standard best practices.





  • Design and develop quality software solutions using standard best practices

  • Provide unit and automated functional tests to ensure code quality

  • Adhere to development standards and processes and work towards continuous improvement in this area

  • Mentor and assist other developers in both technology and technique

  • Investigate new technologies, processes and techniques and be prepared to recommend them to the engineering team.

  • Become a subject matter expert on RBM’s application software

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
In the present world of application development it's difficult to determine where the front-end stops and the back-end begins. While we don't feel wise enough to define where this point may be, we feel the right candidate will be adventurous enough to focus more on how to provide the strongest and cleanest user experience. We're seeking someone familiar with Rails and JavaScript who is interested in creating beautiful and functional work. Compose will lead you to opportunities to learn and grow, while providing excellent conventions (like our internal framework Megatron) to comfortably work within.


As an Application Developer with Compose, you'll make major contributions to the design, function and user experience of our product. You will join a talented and supportive team in a self-managing and open organization. We're remote first and have a diverse group of friendly people located all over the world. We'll give you the respect, freedom, and trust to contribute your talents in a way that you envision.


With great respect/freedom/trust comes great responsibility, and as such it will be crucial that you have the right intrinsic motivators to work with little direction and oversight but still collaborate and seek alternative view-points. If you love making beautiful and functional things and want to have some fun, we'd love to see what you can cook up for us.

jobs.title: Research Software Engineer
jobs.content:
RAND is seeking an experienced software engineer with particular focus on supporting our multidisciplinary modeling and simulation activities.


The position requires eliciting requirements from users, designing software products with researchers, implementing designs in actual working code, and iterating with users and researchers to ensure functional and quality requirements are always met.


Candidate will work on project teams of research staff and domain experts and will often be the sole software engineer on the project.  Some projects will involve multiple software developers so ability to work effectively with them is a plus.


Technical needs will vary by project so candidate must be a well-rounded generalist able to develop solutions in MORE THAN ONE of the following application paradigms:  desktop, web, mobile, database, modelling & simulation, machine learning, statistical analysis, and visualization.


Qualifications 


Key functions:



  • Developing entire interactive applications from the graphical user interface all the way to back end server components and databases

  • Developing partial applications and scripts to data mine, analyze, and visualize data sets

  • Briefing others on software design, software development progress, and software tool results

  • Written documentation of software and software tool results for inclusion in customer briefings and RAND publications


Technical requirements:



  • Have working knowledge of object oriented analysis and design

  • Have expertise in Java, C#, or C++

  • Have some expertise with at least one language that can be used for back end web programming such as Ruby, Python, Node, or PHP

  • Have some expertise with at least one flavor of SQL Database such as MySQL, SQL Server, or PostgreSQL

  • Experience with simulation/model development and rapid prototyping

  • Have at least tinkered with a scientific programming package like R or Matlab

  • Have actually used an MVC framework before

  • Use version control, even for your own stuff, even when you don’t have to

  • Use an IDE for refactoring your code; use an IDE for debugging (instead of print statements) when possible

  • Have explored a new technology recently on your own for no other reason than intellectual curiosity and challenge


Other requirements: Experience working in a research environment or applied R&D laboratory is preferred


Education Requirements:  BA/BS required, MS/MA preferred, preferably in Computer Science or highly related field such as Information Systems, Computer Engineering, etc.


Experience:  1 year minimum, 5 or more years preferred


Security Clearance: May be required for some positions.


Location:  Santa Monica, Pittsburgh, or Washington, DC


RAND is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
POSITION SUMMARY:


The Digital Marketing Manager owns the technical architecture and stability of digital assets supporting BCG’s Marketing function.   The role will partner closely with the Marketing function to understand business needs, provide technical guidance and deliver effective solutions to business problems.   The manager will also serve as the Service Owner for several business-critical IT services, with responsibility for the technical roadmaps, usability and total cost of ownership for those services.   This is a highly influential role, essential to delivering a digital platform that addresses marketing automation capabilities and personalized user experiences.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Responsible for Technical Program management of high profile Digital transformations, including architecture, vendor management, custom development, product evaluation, integration with new and existing systems

  • Ensure effective ongoing operations of Digital portfolio in partnership with Marketing web operations team, including monitoring, resourcing, problem resolution and enhancement management from prioritization through deployment

  • Establish and drive the systems and technology architectures across the Marketing systems/Digital portfolio, enabling future digital platform expansion



  • Deliver technical solutions in a matrix environment, partnering with stakeholders, users, project team members and external vendors across multiple worldwide locations to produce innovative solutions with predictable deliverables.



  • Manage internal Marketing IT team members (developers, project leaders, architects) and manage external vendor teams (onshore and offshore)

  • Own a set of IT services (primarily focused on serving the Marketing community), managing and measuring the effectiveness of those services and providing quarterly updates of service performance to the IT organization

  • Facilitate demand management and prioritization governance meetings with key stakeholders to ensure demand and supply are closely managed

  • Ensure program and projects are met on time, within budget, with a strong focus on operational efficiency post implementation.

  • Create concise and clear technical plans and documentation, based on analysis of business and systems requirements.

  • Work with other IT groups (Infrastructure, DBAs, Desktop Support, Security, etc.) to ensure optimal setup, operability, scalability and support of digital related applications.

  • Take a leadership role in building accurate, reliable estimates as inputs to senior executive decision making, business cases and project plans

  • Drive team and project status communications to the project team and business sponsors

  • Build and manage relationships with key stakeholders locally, regionally and globally

  • Become a trusted advisor to the Marketing team and be able to propose solutions to issues, facilitate communication and influence outcomes

jobs.title: CRM Lead Developer
jobs.content:
POSITION SUMMARY:


BCG is looking for a talented Lead Developer that has technical responsibility for application development and technical leadership of BCG’s client relationship management (CRM) platform. The role will partner closely with the Marketing function to understand business needs and deliver effective technical solutions support contact and campaign management. The Lead Developer will also work closely with Consultant Capabilities team members to optimize the platform for account and relationship management functionality. The position requires a motivated technologist who can actively work on multiple projects and support initiatives in tandem.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Perform hands-on development work to customize, configure, maintain and troubleshoot BCG’s Microsoft Dynamics CRM platform and related tools

  • Manage/maintain the codebase and architecture for CRM and CRM-related applications

  • Research, identify and implement enhancements that improve the functionality and performance of the tools or decrease costs and maintenance

  • Team with vendor partners to deliver features and functionality, with ability to influence/direct external developers in architecture principles, design, code reviews and technical improvements

  • Have primary responsibility for Level 3 support

  • Drive for continual improvement of team processes, including version control, process control, backup management, documentation, requirements gathering, etc.

  • Deliver strong technical organization and documentation

  • Ensure the technical health of the application portfolio, quality of the program code standards and operational effectiveness from a technical standpoint

  • Deliver expertise in the planning and design of application changes (including upgrades), and on delivery and deployment processes

  • Manage deployments to production and test servers

  • Triage incoming support tickets and escalate to other IT groups as needed

  • Liaison with key stakeholders to ensure timely handling of support tickets

  • Assist in configuring Dynamics CRM, data synchronization processes and other integrations

  • Build and maintain strong relationships with external vendors, both onshore and offshore

  • Work with other IT groups (Infrastructure, DBAs, Security, etc.) to ensure optimal set up and management of sites

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Applications
jobs.content:
Founded by the creator of the YOU DON'T KNOW JACK® game series, The Jellyvision Lab, Inc. creates virtual teachers, advisors, and salespeople who make online learning and decision making delightful.  In all that we do, our goal is to make complex topics simple and boring material interesting, using a combination of great design, unexpectedly funny content, and serious technology.  


Of all the virtual people Jellyvision has created, the tallest and least afraid of bears is ALEX® (www.meetalex.com). ALEX helps companies talk their employees through the tricky choices they’ll have to make, like picking a health insurance plan, deciding how much to put in the 401(k), or whether they might want extra life insurance. Our customers love ALEX because he helps their employees figure out what’s best for their personal situations, which, in turn, saves our customers a boat-load of time and money - everybody wins! As we sell more and more of ALEX, we need more and more non-virtual (i.e., real life) people to keep the virtual ones amazing. That’s where you come in.

SO WHAT'S THIS JOB ABOUT?


To be successful in this role you must be the kind of software engineer who can turn their hand to both server-side and browser-side code and understand the ins and outs of each - a person who is looking to play with some cool technology and build some great products. Whether you got your start with a Computer Science degree, attending a boot camp, or by writing code on the side, you know what it is to write code and you love doing it. 


There's a great deal of collaboration with a diverse team (which often leads to having fun) at Jellyvision. You'll be working on a bunch of different (but related) projects at any given time. Development is a team effort at Jellyvision, and all our development teams use Scrum, which means every day involves working with product owners, Scrum Masters, QA, DevOps, and the users we have right here in the building.


Jellyvision isn’t just made up of engineers—we’re also writers, project managers, producers, sales folks—you get the idea. In other words, you’ll be talking to a lot of people without a strong technical background, so you will need to demonstrate a respect for smart people who aren't engineers and are able to teach them and listen to them so we can all share our successes.


On a day-to-day basis, you'll be working on our products and on the tools that help the rest of the company build those products. You'll add features, fix bugs (what, bugs?! never!), test the stuff you built, and be involved in designing the next features and tools coming down the line.

WHAT KIND OF TECHNICAL SKILLS SHOULD I HAVE? YOU KNOW, LANGUAGES AND SUCH...


Our client-side code runs on (surprise!) JavaScript, and our server-side code uses Ruby. You'll need to have experience with one or both of these languages.



  • Javascript:We're using React and Redux most of the time, but we have a few other frameworks floating around, so if you're handy with Angular or Backbone that's fine too. What's important is that you can apply your knowledge toward writing JavaScript-based web applications.



  • Ruby: We've worked with both Rails & Grape, so we're not beholden to any particular framework. If you don't have a Ruby background but you do know PHP, Perl, Python, or Node and you've got solid fundamentals, we're pretty confident you can learn Ruby once you get here.

  • HTML & CSS: Anyone who's done some web development will have written HTML and CSS, so bonus points if you're familiar with a templating language like Mustache or Dust or a CSS preprocessor like Less or Sass.

  • Testing: You should be the kind of person who tests their code as a part of writing it, whether that's TDD-style or writing them after the fact. You should know your way around a testing suite or two.

  • Source Control: Experience developing software with Git or some other kind of source control will benefit you greatly. If you've been using SVN or Mercurial and you're ready for something new, we're open to that. Most of your teammates will be happy to show you the ropes.


"SENIOR" CAN MEAN DIFFERENT THINGS...WHAT DOES SENIOR MEAN TO JELLYVISION?

If you’re the seasoned engineer for us, you’ve got a few years under your belt, have worked on some large projects, and have guided your team through said projects.


You should have solid experience with the ecosystems of JavaScript and Ruby; modern JavaScript build pipeline, including task runners, transpilers, bundling, and so on. You’ve got examples of clean Ruby architecture and transparent data modeling, and can handle writing database queries in SQL, as well as NoSQL tools like CouchDB. You are fearless in the face of old code (Flash, PHP).


Got an eye for style or great UI/UX? Anything else relevant that you think makes you a rockstar senior? Tell us about it!

ANYTHING ELSE?


Yes.  We share a commitment to excellence and a desire to work in a comfortable, friendly atmosphere, so we hire nice, bright, funny people who are willing to work hard.  Our credo is a simple one: be helpful. And we believe we can be most helpful if our workforce is as diverse in thought, perspective, and culture as the people who use our products. We are looking to add amazing folks to our team who will bring diversity across many lines, including race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity, sex, and country of origin.


 
ARE THERE ANY PERKS? Yes, we love perks.



  • Competitive pay, stock options and benefits.  401(k) with matching.  And we pay 100% of the cost of premiums for medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance for our employees (as long as you qualify for our tobacco-free discount; if you’re a tobacco user, your medical premiums will be higher than $0).  We also cover a really nice chunk of the cost of premiums for spouse/partner/dependent medical, dental and vision insurance.

  • Casual dress and a flexible schedule.  Come in a sweatshirt, jeans, whatever, like everyone else here.

  • Creative work environment. We are lucky to work in a place that is full of intelligent, talented and innovative folks. Although most hours the place is deathly quiet (we're a focused bunch), this is punctuated with hilarious outbursts and general merriment, which makes a nice way to spend the day.

  • Free food. Every week, we stock our kitchen with free healthy snack foods, and we have a “hot lunch” catered once a week to give people a reason to hang out and eat together.

  • Easy transportation. We’re really close to the 'L' and the Halsted (#8) bus (right by the Apple Store and Mega Whole Foods too), and we have a transit FSA that allows you to dedicate pre-tax dollars to public transportation expenses. And a number of our employees like to bike to work, so we also have showers and lockers in the office.

  • Did we mention our yoga class?  We bring a pro instructor right to the office.  Fully subsidized by Jellyvision and fully optional, btw. 

  • Oh! And we have a massage chair. Not just any massage chair, my friend.  It’s the HumanTouch HT 5320 WholeBody™ Massage Chair. Feeling a little stiff? Sit down. Relax. Feel better? Good. Okay, back to work.


INTERESTED? Great, we look forward to reading your application - make sure it includes:



  • A cover letter that highlights three reasons you think you’d be great for the gig, focusing on how your past work experience has prepared you for this kind of position – or why you think you can rock the job even though you don’t have past work experience that’s perfectly aligned. Writing is key to all that we do, and we weigh cover letters heavily.

  • Your resume.


You will receive an auto-reply confirming that we've received your application.


If you decide to apply, please know that every complete application will be carefully reviewed.  Seriously!  We know it is a time commitment to prepare an application. And we respect that effort by thoughtfully reviewing every complete application and responding one way or the other. But that kind of thoughtful review means that it sometimes takes us awhile to get back to applicants, so please NO PHONE CALLS. The time we spend responding to phone calls and emails inquiring about where we are in the process is time that we could be spending actually moving the process along – so please be patient with us!
 
Thanks for your interest in Jellyvision!

jobs.title: iOS Engineer

Our development team has re-architected the system from the ground up… making it more stable, more feature-rich, and so much faster. The system is nearly built (currently being optimized), but we need a highly-skilled, highly-focused iOS engineer to make sure the end-user experience is just as good as the design and architecture.

jobs.title: Fast paced, fun startup - Full Stack Platform Developer
jobs.content:
Come work for an early stage SAAS company where you can significantly improve the process of how medical research is conducted. Complion was founded in 2013, has experienced rapid growth in the past 3 years, and is positioned to continue to add large research institutions in the next 12 months.


Complion is cultivating a fast-paced, agile development environment where creativity and teamwork are paramount. Successful candidates are individuals who thrive on collaborative teams where everyone works on everything, and everyone is encouraged to contribute ideas across all levels of the organization.  You should desire to work in a fast moving and adaptive start-up environment. We encourage developers to work on quirky side projects (such as Office Gong Robots), participate in hackathons within the greater tech community, enjoy food themed Github repos, board games, video games and pinball.


Complion’s purpose is to transform the way clinical document and workflows are maintained. Our enterprise SAAS document management platform replaces the 6-10 inch paper regulatory binders that every clinical trial is required to maintain. Our platform not only offers electronic document archiving but provides methods for research coordinators and physicians to collaborate. By eliminating the inefficient paper based processes, researchers can focus on advancements and better patient outcomes. Complion is currently the only product on the market targeted to research sites for e-Regulatory Binders that meets the FDA regulations for CFR 21 Part 11.


As a Platform Software Developer, you will use your development skills to develop applications and systems that will help researchers find the next medical breakthrough and accelerate the growth of Complion. We currently have a repository with terabytes of data and now looking to scale to millions of documents a day while working on cutting edge digital signature approaches. We are looking for a candidate to work closely with the development team and the CTO to establish and implement our software development needs.

Several key projects include proprietary stock screener, employee compensation system, building in house data warehouse, FX transaction system, and stock performance application.   • Extending existing and creating new reporting solution using SSRS

  • Interacting and communicating with department heads, department users and project managers during project lifetime

jobs.title: Microsoft Azure Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Rackspace is the global leader in hybrid cloud and founder of OpenStack®, the open-source operating system for the cloud. Hundreds of thousands of customers look to us to deliver the best-fit infrastructure for their IT needs, leveraging a product portfolio that allows workloads to run where they perform best—whether on the public cloud, private cloud, dedicated servers, or a combination of platforms.


Hiring for levels L1 - L3.   L3 Sr. levels have option to work remote


Our award-winning Fanatical Support helps customers successfully architect, deploy and run their most critical applications. Headquartered in San Antonio, Texas, we have offices in the UK, Australia, Hong Kong, Switzerland and Amsterdam with data centers on four continents. We are featured on the Sunday Times list of 100 Best Companies to Work For.


The key to our success is our people, so hiring the right individuals is absolutely key. We are constantly pushing the boundaries in an evolving tech world, creating tomorrow's solutions today.


Do you have what it takes? Do you have the passion to build Fanatical outcomes for our customers every day? Accept the challenge — JOIN US!


Rackspace is recognized as a company of experts, delivering world-class cloud service and a superior support experience on the world’s leading technology platforms. As part of our managed cloud strategy we are seeking an experienced and accomplished Microsoft Azure Engineer to fill key a position within our specialist support team.


Microsoft Azure is one of the fastest growing cloud platforms in the world, and the core mission of this role is to engage with our customers and prospects to provide on-going support for our supported workloads on the Microsoft Azure platform. In this role you will be part of the team that implements, deploys, and operates our Microsoft Azure cloud based offerings.


This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced technical professional confident in Microsoft Azure. The role is customer facing, working closely with business and technical influencers, IT Pros, and Rackspace partners. The right candidate for the role will have multiple years of experience with Microsoft Azure. You have served as a subject matter expert in designing, deploying, and managing workloads to live in the cloud.


We are looking for the top talent in the industry, highly-skilled in complex cloud deployments and adept at troubleshooting of complex cloud based workloads, and you will be skilled at multiple scripting languages.


Your engagements will see you directly working with customers and prospects as well as supporting existing solutions. Each specific customer will have specific public cloud needs, and require you to understand complex applications that may sit across a multitude of service models and technologies.


You will have confidence in knowing your skills (and limitations), you are calm and collected under pressure and always available to mentor the less experienced. Your colleagues see you as a good team player who is keen to share knowledge as well as to listen and learn from others.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Business Core
jobs.content:

Given AlphaSights’ fast growth, plus our focus on continuous improvement, your particular area of focus may evolve over time: You might be improving search capabilities to ensure our Associates connect our clients with the most ideal industry practitioners, building tools for mitigating legal and reputational risks for both ourselves and our clients, or engineering a telephone conference system capable of hosting client calls worldwide. You’ll be an integral part of the team that identifies innovative and creative ways that technology can further drive our company’s rapid growth.


As a Software Engineer at AlphaSights you will:



  • Write high quality and maintainable code primarily in Ruby and JavaScript, with the opportunity to bring in new languages that fit, and using Postgres as the main data store.

  • Build software to meet the needs of our growing business.

  • Work in a project team with two week iterations and be part of iteration planning and retros.

  • Collaborate with and understand all other functions of AlphaSights to make thoughtful and creative software decisions.

  • Influence processes/workflows, product direction, and technology decisions.

  • Pair with teammates, review PRs, help others with technical questions & share your own learnings, and be a part of growing the team.

  • Learn to master a specific part of the stack, e.g., UI/UX, microservices, DevOps, etc. with the opportunity to take on product and/or technical leadership over time.

jobs.title: Cloud Engineering - Global Rockstars!
jobs.content:
Job description


ING Bank Infra is looking for Cloud Engineers. Global top developers (“Rockstars”) who want to pioneer the frontiers of Cloud infrastructure services. 

Purpose
ING Bank Infra’s purpose is to accelerate the possible.
We are a greenfield, lean and agile global organization providing consumer-centered infrastructure services enabling ING to ensure its customers stay ahead in life and business. At Bank Infra, we are a purpose-driven organization driven to accelerate the possible in all areas of our work. We have a passion for growth and always look for opportunities to innovate. We are truly in service to our internal business consumers and have a strong focus on maintaining meaningful relationships with them to align what we do to their needs, and to actively learn from them.

We are looking for professionals who want to pioneer the frontiers of IT infrastructure services.

We want to put together an elite team of engineering rockstars, who are experimenters and shapers and whose motto is to lead by example. You have a "makers" mind-set where you believe that prototypes are there to "fall forward" and learn fast.

Job Description: 
Main responsibilities and tasks for a Top Cloud Engineer:
Work with private cloud & public cloud platforms to create new and innovative application services that enable application engineers across ING to accelerate the possible.
Work within an agile & devop environment to deliver high quality services. Take leading roles with agile teams
Explore and define the cloud brokerage space for ING through powerful portable services and intelligent policy
Take ownership top to bottom of challenging deliveries that span operational always on concerns to deeply specific application demands of our users.
Own contribution of services to the global ING cloud service catalogue
Have positive and lasting cultural impact in our way of working – be an ambassador for agile delivery, have a strong sense of ‘right’ when it comes to technical implementation
 


Your work environment
As a Cloud Engineer your role in this organization is crucial as we enable a global catalogue of services from the ING Private Cloud and future Public Cloud platforms. You will have a hand in shaping how we form as a team and define our ways of working as an engineering team. You will seed agile devop teams with influence over tool-chains, working methods, system design and technologies. You will be a cultural ambassador for ‘web speed’ delivery within the engineering team and be passionate about ‘doing things the right way’ for cloud delivery, cloud consumption and cloud service engineering.

ING cloud engineering holds the following technical principles paramount:
1. Evolvable platforms – transparent to consumers
2. Failure oriented – expect it, all of the time
3. Primitives not frameworks – enable innovation not presume it
4. Automation, always – SDx with best people on tools
5. APIs forever – they will outlive the service implementation
6. Data everywhere, enable decisions – information centric delivery
7. Security inside – not just around

Who are we looking for?
You are an experienced Software Engineer & Cloud Native who is an up-start professional who is capable of working in a global environment, who is flexible, pro-active and a team player.
You are a loyal, driven individual with great communication skills and love to work across countries. You are able to work autonomously and in collaboration with your colleagues and be across multiple activities at the same time, set priorities and integrate tasks effectively.
You care about people and their wellbeing and creating strong and long-lasting relationships with people and your team. You proactively support others and enable them to be their best. You think creatively about how to solve problems and address challenges and have a high attention to detail.

Working and thinking level:
Academic working and thinking level;
Proven agile experience, strong track record of service (SaaS/Cloud) software delivery and operations
Global orientation;
Fluently in English (verbal and written);
Deep exposure to cloud platform such as AWS, Azure, Openstack & VMWare;
Fluent in API delivery, microservices, highly available architectures & foundational services such big data platforms & cloud middleware services
Willing to travel occasionally to be part of delivery teams based in other ING countries
 


Competencies/levels:
Makes complex analysis;
Uses direct influence;
understands the political relationships within the company
Leads engineers by example;
Uses knowledge of the state of the art of technology to formulate the right approach
Addresses potential customer (consumer) requirements in proactive engagement
Thinking in strategic (future oriented) terms – understands the cloud brokerage vision
Resistance to stress – knows where energies should be expended for maximum return
Team player; Cultural influencer
 


The cloud engineer should demonstrate: 
A Customer obsession
A bias for action
Being vocally self-critical
Ability to think big & have a vision
Invent & simplify where complexity exists
Dive deep when needed
Have an opinion, but commit fully as a team
Insist on high standards
 


What do we offer? 
a very good salary
Excellent other terms
Work/Life balance #2 rated at Glassdoor
For 36 hours a week
Based in Amsterdam with travel globally
a part of one of the most impressive fintech cloud development journeys
Very strong technical colleagues & managers
Rockstar IT culture. Global Cloud awareness.
 


Interested? 
Apply directly online or contact Global IT Recruiter Rob van Elburg via rob.van.elburg@ing.nl. For more information about ING check: http://www.ing.nl/.

jobs.title: Systems Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo?
Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


As a System Performance Engineer at IMC, you:



  • Provide performance improvement ideas, solutions, and recommendations for trading strategies

  • Analyze exchange market structure to identify performance improvement opportunities

  • Be a latency detective; think Sherlock Holmes and the case of the missing microsecond

  • Understand and apply internal and external developments in technology, as well as competitor approaches that can help improve IMC’s performance

  • Build IMC’s knowledge base to ensure deep understanding of exchange infrastructure and protocols.

  • Write tools, build systems to analyze and monitor latency of critical strategies

  • Educate stakeholders (trading, risk & compliance, business development)


What makes it fun?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop. We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are developed

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology. If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all 3 regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where it has the biggest impact.

  • To get the best results we encourage everybody to gain understanding of both the trading strategy and how exchanges work on a technological level.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds. What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


Our Culture:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized as well as put into practice from anybody within our organization.
