jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Software Engineer


Change Agent (n): an individual with an unstoppable desire to make the future course of something different from what it is, or from what it would be, if left alone.


Sound like you? If so, then let’s talk.


GreenPath Financial Wellness is a non-profit that provides financial education and tools for people to lead financially healthy lives.  We provide personalized services and financial education to help people manage debt, save for the future, and make informed financial decisions.  We make a big difference in a lot of lives.  Each year, we assist more than 200,000 people.  How awesome is that?!?  Our team is made up of SCUBA divers, Biggest Losers, award-winning Hockey Coaches and future The Voice contestants. And those aren’t even our full-time jobs. Within our team of approximately 500 employees, we have many different interests, but here’s what we have in common:




  • We believe Aretha said it best… R-E-S-P-E-C-T. We respect our customers, our community, our partners, our team members and ourselves. Sock it to me.

  • We channel our inner Rocky on a daily basis. Yep, we’re talking about Mr. Balboa himself – the king of overcoming obstacles and going the distance. Our mission is to help people get back on track to financial health. In order to do that, we have to remember what it feels like to fight the daily fight, seemingly with all odds stacked against us. Our goal is to be standing on the top of the museum steps with our clients, fists in the air, “Eye of the Tiger" playing in the background, yelling “Yo, Adrian! We did it!"

  • We invest in the creation of leading-edge technology and use it to our advantage. Then we surround ourselves with really smart people with good ideas so we can do extraordinary things. 



What will you get out of working at GreenPath? In addition to a competitive compensation and benefits package, here are some of the additional perks our employees enjoy:




  • We all need some “me time" every once in a while. All full-time employees receive 19 paid days off during their first year of employment, in addition to 10 company-paid holidays per year. Use it for a fabulous vacation, to play nurse (or patient) at home, or sit on your couch watching DIY marathons on HGTV all day. We don’t care – it’s your time. Enjoy.

  • Continuous learners can get their classroom fix in a couple of different ways. GP team members are eligible for up to $2,500 in tuition reimbursement per year. In addition, GP team members can attend courses through Invest in Yourself, an in-house educational program offering training classes on a variety of topics ranging from Cash Flow Planning to Microsoft Excel to Stress Management.

  • Need to reduce your student loan debt? GreenPath is a qualified employer under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program, which means that you may be able to have a portion of your federal student loans forgiven after meeting certain eligibility requirements of the PSLF program.




The J-O-B


We’re searching for a Senior Software Engineer. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will play a key role in forging our future path, designing and implementing full-stack solutions to complex and challenging problems, leveraging the latest and greatest technologies and tools while building modular, dynamic, extensible and highly performant solutions in a truly Agile and supportive environment. 



You will need:



  • A solid understanding of implementing, enhancing and testing multi-tier architecture applications.

  • Ability to design, debug, enhance, document, and test software applications to meet business process requirements.

  • Ability to create screen layouts, graphical user interfaces, printed outputs, reports, and interfaces with other systems.

  • Ability to collaborate with process owners on the definition of requirements and the design of applications.

  • Ability to prepare technical specification documents and unit and system test plans.

  • Design and implement database objects and report distributions based on functional area priorities and needs.

  • Ability to express complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing.

  • Ability to document code and system integrations to help support team troubleshoot issues.

  • Ability to work on multiple tasks/projects simultaneously.

  • Excellent customer service and communication skills

jobs.title: Lead Engineer
jobs.content:
Panorama is on a mission to radically improve student outcomes by helping educators measure, understand, and act on data and feedback.Thousands of schools, serving millions of students, use the Panorama Platform as an important tool for improving education through data: from helping teachers hone their practice, to engaging with families, to building school culture, and beyond.


About our product and engineering challenges: Imagine you’re the guidance counselor for 500 students in a large urban high school, trying to identify which students are struggling so much that they will stop coming to school. Or, you’re a principal who wants to identify, through your data, what your best teachers are doing differently to engage their students. Or, you’re a superintendent who believes in the importance of grit, growth mindset and other character skills in addition to Math and English test scores. Or, you’re a teacher who wants a simple intervention to build better relationships with students. At Panorama, we’re building the trusted, unified tool that all educators reach for when they want to understand, reflect on, and improve their students’ outcomes. To do this, our engineers are solving hard technical challenges in K-12 education:



  • building out real-time data pipelines of a student’s important day-to-day events into our platform, including the quantifiable and qualitative elements of a student’s experience

  • measuring data across the country’s largest urban schools, including optical mark recognition over millions of paper surveys

  • designing a highly available online platform that calculates realtime analytics across billions data points

  • refining our product’s user experience so that this firehose of data is truly useful, actionable information (as opposed to yet another data dashboard)

  • integrating the latest educational research and data science tools into our platform, so that our clients have access to the best techniques that they can use to change outcomes for students


About our engineering team: As an engineering team, we value learning and challenging ourselves (one of our core values is “be humble”). From lunchtime guest talks and weekly book clubs to hackathons and open-source projects (both in the office and outside it), we are always looking to improve (just as any great student would). We emphasize team collaboration across disciplines, and we iterate with quick cycles and lots of feedback.


You will be successful here if you love to:



  • Take on a big, ambiguous product challenge, learn deeply about how we can best solve it, and collaborate with your team to meet the challenge head on.

  • Teach other engineers the tools, tricks, and techniques you’ve mastered, and be excited to learn with your teammates to master more.

  • Lead and collaborate across engineering to discover best technical practices and lessons learned from successful and unsuccessful projects.

  • Design, prototype, write, test, refactor, review, debug, deploy, monitor, and occasionally be frustrated by code every day.

jobs.title: Software Engineer for Boston Driving Technology Company
jobs.content:
Looking to work with a cutting edge technology that saves lives? Distracted driving is a leading cause of death and TrueMotion is trying to solve this challenging problem. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our small but efficient team. As a Senior Software Engineer you will design and implement server platform APIs and data processing systems. The ideal candidate would be comfortable working in all aspects of the server platform, from the network APIs down to the data storage layer; including web application frameworks; relational and non-relational databases; message queues; high throughput and low latency data processing. The successful candidate will acclimate quickly to our server platform that uses Python, PostgreSQL, and Cassandra; it runs on AWS using EC2, RDS, and S3.f you have built significant consumer and B2B systems from scratch this should be your next role -- come join us!


Your Background:



  • Expert in:

    • Python

    • Object-oriented design patterns

    • Relational (RDBMS) and non-relational (NoSQL) database systems

    • HTTP

    • Web architecture

    • Continuous delivery



  • Built consumer and B2B systems with significant user and customer adoption.

  • Built automated tests and test infrastructure.

  • Measured and optimized performance of server and data processing systems used by large user audiences.


Responsibilities:



  • Architect and implement web server and data processing systems for consumer and B2B audiences.

  • Collaborate to define implementation goals incrementally and iteratively as user scenarios evolve and mature.

  • Design server APIs.

  • Collaborate to define and implement delightful experiences for platform operations team members, web front end developers, mobile native developers, and customer systems developers.

Will work on multiple J2EE based systems (commercial, open source, and federal government) hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS) GovCloud including high performing data integration engines, web portals for data management and processing, and SQL Server based databases to support storage of structured and unstructured big data.


Existing team uses established Agile based processes and tools including daily SCRUMS, sprint management using JIRA, and Git based version control system to manage builds and releases.  Typical day will consist of heads down development (80%), interacting with project team and management of tasks in JIRA (10%), and assisting with Tier 3 operational requests (10%). 


Success criteria for this position include 1) high technical aptitude and independent problem solving skills, 2) a willingness to grow professionally through ongoing coaching and feedback, and 3) a team centric mindset to drive A++ technical delivery.

jobs.title: Angular and Node.js developer
jobs.content:
Summary
Work with the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (www.unocha.org) by joining a team of remote developers, managed from Geneva, which is developing and maintaining online web/database applications written in Javascript using the Angular framework on the front end and Node.js on the backend. These applications will be used worldwide to support humanitarian work, in particular the planning and monitoring of coordinated humanitarian responses to natural disasters or conflict, and the tracking of humanitarian funding.

* Master's degree + 5 years of experience, OR Bachelor's + 7 years of experience, OR Diploma + 9 years of experience
* Minimum two years working with Angular, Node and SQL-based databases
* Short-term contract to be extended upon satisfactory performance, and longer-term opportunities with other UN projects
* Negotiated rate based on international salary scale, within ranges determined by location and market rates

Background
Within the United Nations Office for theCoordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), the Programme Support Branch (PSB)is responsible for helping OCHA country offices and humanitarian partnersimplement the Humanitarian Programme Cycle (HPC). PSB, in partnership with OCHAâsInformation Services Branch (ISB) is currently redeveloping the suite ofinformation services which support the HPC. This includes online databaseapplications for the administration of databases such as those for theFinancial Tracking Service (FTS) and the Online Projects System (OPS), both ofwhich are being redesigned from the ground up; as well as new online systems tofacilitate the creation, management and monitoring of humanitarian responseplans (HRPs). These are being built on technologies including PostgreSQL,Node.js and AngularJS.

OCHA is seeking a talented andcreative individual to help in the technical development process of theseonline applications in conjunction with external partners, and subsequently toensure ongoing iterative development, maintenance and support.  The individual will need to have access to aMac OSX or Linux environment.

The individual would join anOCHA-wide team of developers with expertise in core technologies used byseveral different projects throughout the organization, overseen by ISB, withthe aim to foster closer structured collaboration and interchange between them.This includes an expectation to provide support and backup to other projects asand when necessary, as well as opportunities for transfer or reassignment inthe medium to longer term.

The position is home-based, andideally should be based in the same or similar time zone as Switzerlandas it requires close and continuous collaboration with the team in Geneva.Travel to Geneva may be required on an as-needs basis every few months.

Technical Work
  • Develop and maintain online web/database applications to provide HPC information services, particularly on response planning & monitoring and financial tracking.  These applications are written in Javascript using the Angular framework on the front end and Node.js on the backend.
  • Access to a computer with MAC OS X or Linux based environment for running the necessary development tools.
  • Advise on, implement and manage solutions for online database applications, including data management, user experience design and workflow management
  • Implement iterative design and technical improvements for these applications once they are launched, including scoping and development of new features
  • Design, manage and improve as necessary the underlying system and data architecture based on open-source PostgreSQL database
  • Provide technical documentation for application administrators to fully utilize features
  • Provide technical support as needed to application administrators and data managers for content creation and user/permission management

OtherDuties
  • Function as active member of wider OCHA development team, including reporting to team leader, participation in regular knowledge interchange, joint events etc.
  • As part of this team, completion of other tasks as assigned across JavaScript-based OCHA projects beyond HPC information services
  • Assist with data migrations as needed

Education
  • Advanced university degree (Masterâs degree or equivalent) in computer science, information systems, mathematics, statistics or related field. 
  • A first-level university degree in combination with additional two years, a Technical/Professional Diploma with additional four years, or a secondary school diploma with additional six years of qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.

Experience
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience is required.
  • Online database application development and implementation:
  • Minimum of 2 years developing with AngularJS or other MVC based development approaches.
  • Minimum of 2 years developing with Node.js
  • Minimum of 2 years developing with SQL-based open-source databases such as MySQL or PostgreSQL
  • Code versioning, in particular Git workflow
Development of web API services and their utilizationProficiency in standards compliant HTML (minimum of 5 years), XML and XSD.CSS and use of pre-processors such as SASS or LESSSome knowledge or experience with Grunt as a task runner to manage dependencies and build processes.Minimum 2 years experience of developing on a Linux environment.Experience of deployment and development workflow processes.Demonstrated experience in web development projects in a consulting or professional services environment, working with cross-functional teams.Experience working on projects using an agile frameworkExperience working both independently and in collaboration with remote, geographically diverse teams - must be very comfortable working via e-mail, chat, IRC, audio/video conference etc.

Additional Experience
  • Knowledge of other programming languages would be beneficial.  Some knowledge of Drupal-based websites, particularly regarding integration of database applications with Drupal front-ends, and website development in PHP would be an asset.
  • Experience with Docker would be beneficial.
  • Familiarity with working on Mac OS environment is also beneficial.
  • Some experience working with the public or not-for-profit sector would be an asset.

Language
  • A fluent level of English or above is required. Knowledge of another UN language (Spanish, Arabic, Russian, Chinese and French) is an asset.

Contract type, level and duration
Contract type: International Individual Contractor Agreement, Level 2
Contract duration: 2months (with possibility of extension pending performance evaluation)

The base salary takes into account the level of the contract and the current market rate for similar roles, as well as the cost of living and hardship at the duty station. Additionally, elements such as the degree of specialization, complexity of the tasks, education or experience in excess of the required minimum can be considered. Fees are negotiated directly with the individual contractor, taking into account these factors within the applicable fee ranges for each level.

To apply: The job is being recruited by UNOPS on behalf of UNOCHA.To apply for this job, please visit https://gprs.unops.org/pages/viewvacancy/VADetails.aspx?id=10823 and click on 'Apply Now'. You will need to create an online profile in the UNOPS recruitment system.Please make sure your application profile matches the requirements listed. Candidates who do not meet the minimum requirement will not be considered.

jobs.title: Hardware Security Engineer
jobs.content:
The Square Security team works to ensure the security of every transaction from swipe to receipt and beyond. We embed ourselves in other teams at Square to build world-class products for both customers and employees. Our ultimate goal is to ensure that every single experience with Square is simple, secure, and safe.


Hardware Security Engineers specialize in the physical, electrical, and embedded security concerns surrounding Square’s hardware products. We are looking for smart, motivated engineers who want to break, refine, and build amazing things with us. Hardware Security Engineers are hands-on engineers who will be involved in all areas of hardware development, from design through firmware development and prototyping through production manufacturing.



You will:




  • Design, implement, deploy, and maintain state of the art security architectures and countermeasures to protect and enable innovative new hardware products




  • Balance security, compliance, performance, power and cost for a diverse portfolio of embedded devices and the associated manufacturing and backend infrastructure




  • Evaluate the security of new product designs to determine vulnerability to physical tampering, side-channel attacks, glitching, fuzzing, and other attacks




  • Prototype and test countermeasures that defend against these attacks




  • Embed yourself amongst Hardware, Firmware, and Security Engineers to define and integrate security measures into a wide range of low cost, high quality, high volume products




  • Act as an internal security subject matter expert, advocating for better security practices throughout Square

jobs.title: Director of Sales
jobs.content:
At Continu weâre on a mission to build better workplaces through the development of thoughtful software that solves problems for our users. Our Learning platform has been used by some of the worldâs smartest companies to help develop their employees daily.

Weâre seeking a Director of Sales to drive growth and revenue at Continu. This person will play a critical role in building out our sales process, pipeline and team, working directly with our CEO. As our first sales hire, you will be hands on, constantly striving to grow our reach and client-base. You will be instrumental in future hiring decisions to assist in building our sales team.

Where youâll work:
Wherever you feel most creative â from home, a coffee shop or a co-working space. Weâre a completely distributed team with employees located across 7 cities and 4 countries. With the majority of our customers based in the U.S.

What Youâll Be Doing:
  • Actively generate new leads 
  • Identify key decision makers, opportunities and industries to target
  • Research and identify leads and understand their needs
  • Develop and execute sales and outreach strategies
  • Cultivate relationships with leads and prospects
  • Become a trusted resource among prospects, leads, and existing clients.
  • Cultivate inbound requests from the Continu website and build strategies to grow inbound leads
  • Develop an acute understanding of our product, roadmap and how it solves our customers problems
  • Keep the CRM (Salesforce) up-to-date in an organized manner
  • Own proposals from start to completion, clearly demonstrating an understanding of the prospects needs
  • Hit monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets

About You:
  • Meticulous about details
  • Exceptional written and verbal skills
  • A hustler that constantly strives to succeed
  • Team player 
  • Customer focused 
  • High integrity
  • Willingness to work outside of your role when needed

Requirements:
  • 2 - 3 years of experience in a similar Sales role
  • Bachelors degree is preferred
  • Experience working with Salesforce
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Proven ability to grow sales in a previous role
  • Experience working with a technology based product

Bonus Points if You Have:
  • Experience working in a remote or distributed team
  • Worked in the same industry with a similar product
  • Have experience working in a startup environment 

To apply: Please send a short cover letter, a copy of your resume and link to your LinkedIn profile to work@continu.co with the subject line "Director of Sales"

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content:
Location: Remote Work Opportunity

Department: Design

Type: Contracted to Full Time

Min. Experience: Experienced

We are a diverse team from around the world working together on a mission to make DuckDuckGo the world’s most trusted search engine, and we want your help!

Join us as a Senior Product Designer and become part of the team leading the transformation of the DuckDuckGo user experience.

As part of our small design team, you will be collaborating with team members at all levels to continually enhance the relevancy, usability, and design of our search engine. Using a full range of design skills, you will be involved in the entire design process, from ideation to execution. You will have a voice in all product decisions, both big and small.

We're a remote company built on personal autonomy within team projects. Every person at DuckDuckGo shares the responsibility to push the boundaries of what is possible in search. By joining us at this stage, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact on our product.

What you will do:

  • Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something actionable
  • Seek out creative, design-led solutions to challenging problems
  • Use qualitative and quantitative metrics to validate design decisions
  • Partner with a team of designers and engineers to explore and execute new features and products
  • Manage projects from scoping to implementation while communicating clear updates to our remote team

What we are looking for:

  • You have 7+ years of related product design experience
  • You can manage projects efficiently and effectively
  • You have strong interaction and visual design skills
  • You’re able to adapt designs across a variety of platforms and devices, and you understand the opportunities and limitations with each
  • You’re familiar with prototyping
  • You have a general understanding of front-end development and implementation
  • You have excellent communication skills and you can clearly articulate your design decisions
  • You think at a high level about creative strategy and vision, but can also execute based on provided direction
  • Can adapt quickly and seamlessly adjust focus and/or goals

Other things to know:

  • We are a small, remote team in different time zones and communicate with a variety of tools throughout the day. * Ideally, you will feel comfortable with the intricacies of this type of work situation.
  • Sometimes we meet up! You can expect to travel at least 2x a year: once for our all-hands meetup and another for a team retreat ( Each ~ 4-5 days)
  • We want to have a major impact on raising the standard of trust online. To do this we believe in a focused approach, and work on a single top priority at a time.
  • Our work philosophy is built upon empowered project management. Anyone and everyone can (and should) ask questions and offer feedback around the product and internal projects.
  • We are open to sharing ideas and challenging the status quo regardless of your internal role. We encourage you to participate in areas of interest throughout the company.
  • We try to exemplify our values (build trust, question assumptions, and validate direction) in everything we do, and hope you will too!

If you think you might thrive in this environment, we would love to hear from you using the application below.

jobs.title: Creative Director (Communication/Design)
jobs.content:
Who are you?

A self-directed communications expert, with experience conceiving and implementing brand communication and design strategy. You are passionate about digital media, peer to peer technology and information design. Your portfolio should feature strong brand and product work and showcase your ability to translate complex technical ideas into simple concepts.

You favor simplicity but surpass convention, delivering communications that stand apart while being intuitive to understand.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and execute the communication strategy for Mediachain
  • Design communication assets and products from conception to release
  • Engage internal and external feedback to validate product and design hypotheses
  • Work closely with the development team on iterations, implementations and optimizations.
  • Develop and implement a visual language that carries the Mediachain vision across various properties

You should look forward to:

  • Building a brand for an open source project
  • Helping the world understand what blockchain technology can mean for creators and developers

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience leading an iterative communciation and design process
  • Strong user experience sensibilities and appreciation for minimal interface design
  • Exceptional written, verbal and visual communication skills
  • Strong technical skills (HTML/CSS/Javascript) and ability to work closely with engineers

Position Details:

  • Location: New York City or Remote
  • Type: Consultant / Part-Time / Full-Time
  • Salary: To Be Communicated

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Andromium is looking for a passionate and experienced Android engineer. As one of the first members of the team, you'll be afforded significant autonomy, equity, and room to grow with the company. We are building a new type of computing, which stretches and seeks to define the limits of Android, all to enable productivity for the next billion internet users.

More specifically, our company makes 2 things:

  1. The Andromium app, which makes Android function as a familiar desktop operating system by just downloading an app. Try our beta in the play store.
  2. The Superbook, a plug-and-play shell that turns any Android smartphone into a laptop. We've raised well over $2M on Kickstarter recently, making it the #1 Kickstarter ever in the Technology > Hardware category.

We're looking for skilled Android engineers to take technical ownership on one of the following priorities for the company:

  1. Build out our SDK that makes it possible for Android apps to look like one interface on mobile and another on 'desktop' / Andromium
  2. Create full parity between the Andromium app experience and what people expect from a desktop OS.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Min 2 year experience working with Android development
  • Good understanding of the internal workings of the Android OS
  • The ability to dig into the Android Open Source Project code to find ways to achieve functionality not publicly documented in the SDK
  • Comfort working with Android Debug Bridge for code debugging and crash analysis.

Plusses:

  • Prior experience developing Android ROMs
  • Experience working with NDK
  • Understand Android memory management, and have experience working on memory usage optimization

Note: Given the size of the team, we prefer local candidates, but would give exception to the exceptional.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary
  • Early Employee Equity
  • Incredible Autonomy / Work Ownership
  • Unlimited Vacation

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:

Technical Experience

jobs.title: Software Engineer - AI Product
jobs.content:
Baidu Research, headquartered in Silicon Valley, is looking for software engineers with strong experience in developing software products and services. Our team's mission is to develop hard AI technologies that enable us to impact hundreds of millions of users. As a software engineer at Baidu, you will help develop new products and services that leverage the most advanced AI technologies to transform user experience. You will be working with a small team of highly talented designers, developers, researchers, and product managers. You will have the opportunity to develop creative new products and services that will directly impact hundreds of millions of users.

As a software engineer, you will be responsible for transforming core AI technologies built by our researchers to software products and services that solve real world problems for wide range of users.

Here's what you will do:

  • Learn about the latest in AI technology and create new products based on it.

  • Take ownership of software projects and be responsible for the full development cycle: design, development, testing, deployment, documentation, improvement, and maintenance of mobile and web applications and backend services.

  • Design efficient, scalable, flexible, sustainable, and secure software architecture from product requirements.

  • Create exceptional user experiences working with UI/UX designers to build usable and delightful interfaces.

  • Quickly design and build prototypes from ideas.

Here's what we'd like to see in you:

  • Strong foundation in computer science basics including data structures and algorithms.

  • Strong software engineering skills, a strong sense of how to distill product requirements into clean and testable APIs, and dedication to the craft of writing efficient and readable code.

  • Expert in one or more general purpose programming languages such as C, C++, Java, Swift, Python, Ruby, or Go.

  • Experience with developing complex mobile or web applications or backend services.

  • Ability to quickly learn new technology and willingness to work across the software stack and development tasks.

  • Bonus points for experience and skill in any of the following: embedded software, infrastructure engineering including AWS, cloud computing, Unix/Linux systems, database, mobile or web front-end design.

Culture fit:

  • Mission alignment: If you want to use AI to dramatically improve people's lives, we will give you the best possible platform to realize this mission.

  • Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you have time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

  • Hungry to learn: We are eager to teach you new skills. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

  • Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other, and go after big goals together-as a team. We are based in Silicon Valley, in Sunnyvale, California.

jobs.title: Research Scientist - Systems
jobs.content:
The Silicon Valley Artificial Intelligence Lab (SVAIL), part of Baidu Research, is looking to hire Research Scientists with strong systems backgrounds, especially in parallel computing (clusters, GPUs, HPC). Our mission is to develop hard AI technologies that will reach hundreds of millions of users. As a research scientist at ​Baidu, you will be uniquely positioned to contribute to this mission, while also becoming expert in large-scale machine learning and deep learning systems, and extending the state-of-the-art in AI.

Systems research is key to progress in AI: the rate at which we can run large-scale AI experiments directly translates into advancements in AI. As part of our AI research team, your systems expertise will drive progress by accelerating machine learning algorithms and building a platform to rapidly convert new algorithmic ideas into efficient code.

By providing great training, hardware infrastructure, and connecting you with a great AI research team we aim to maximize the significance of your systems research. We strive to invent AI technologies that will improve the lives of at least 100 million people.

Here's what you will do:

  • Work with the team to create a highly productive and efficient platform for deep learning research and AI applications.

  • Learn about high performance computing (HPC) systems. Learn about machine learning and deep learning algorithms.

  • Create software that hundreds of millions of people will care about.

  • You will be working with a growing team of highly talented engineers who are focused on advancing the AI mission.

Here's what we'd like to see in you:

1) Very strong technical skills:

  • Able to write clean, efficient code in C++ (using templates and OOP) for a Linux platform

  • Experience with some HPC technologies, e.g. GPUs, high-speed networks, FPGAs or related APIs (e.g., MPI, CUDA, OpenCL).

  • Able to reason about mapping algorithms to parallel hardware. While we appreciate the ability to analyze algorithms mathematically, it is even more crucial to know how your code interacts with hardware technologies (e.g., caches and instruction pipelines).

  • Familiarity with library design for C++, Python or other high-productivity environments.

2) Culture Fit:

  • Mission alignment: If you want to use your systems skills to advance AI, we will give you the best possible platform to do that. If you are on a different mission, then we are not a good fit.

  • Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

  • Hungry to learn: We are eager to teach you new skills. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

  • Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other, and go after big goals together---as a team.

We are based in Silicon Valley, in Sunnyvale, California.

jobs.title: Artificial Intelligence - Developer
jobs.content:
Sightengine is an Artificial Intelligence company that empowers developers and businesses. Our powerful image and video analysis technology is built on proprietary state-of-the-art Deep Learning systems and is made available through simple and clean APIs.

Looking for a great opportunity to work on state-of-the-art technologies in Computer Vision and Artificial Intelligence? Looking to solve big problems in the city of light? Wait no more!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Become a Sightengine master
  • Implement image classification and tagging solutions
  • Run model training on distributed multi-GPU hardware

REQUIREMENTS

  • you have a degree or experience related to Computer Science, Machine Learning and/or Image Processing
  • you're keen on becoming a master of Deep Neural Networks and other state-of-the-art approaches
  • you love coding and you're comfortable with Python or equivalents
  • you are familiar with Unix environments

BONUS POINTS

  • experience with Caffe, Torch, Theano or equivalents
  • previous work on large-scale projects (billions of requests per month)
  • experience working with gigantic databases and image repositories
  • you are willing to work in a great environment in the middle of Paris, France

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
For many companies, Auth0 is a core part of their application infrastructure. Our goal every day is to ensure weâre shipping Developer Joy, and one of the most important ways we internalize this is ensure we provide to a service that is highly available for our cloud-based customers.

Auth0 is looking for Infrastructure Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. An Infrastructure Engineer is a specialist in creating, deploying and running infrastructure and have a great knowledge of networking, the linux kernel and systems scaling.

We are looking for people that have a passion for building robust infrastructure components that others can reuse and have a track record of working with infrastructure at world scale.

__Responsibilities__

* Manage our infrastructure and provide alerting for teams to detect common problems
* Develop and configure a fault tolerant set of CDNs (Content Delivery Networks) to be used by other teams serving content
* Design and develop the backup and restore procedures for storage services
* Collaborate with development teams to introduce and test updated infrastructure components to be delivered as a service
* Respond to on-call pages caused by failures related to the infrastructure services they own

__Requirements__

* In-depth knowledge of Linux internals
* Salt experience (preferred, but not required if familiar with a complimentary tool)
* Python scripting expertise (our preferred language for scripts)
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills

jobs.title: Production Engineer
jobs.content:
For many companies, Auth0 is a core part of their application infrastructure. Our goal every day is to ensure weâre shipping Developer Joy, and one of the most important ways we internalize this is ensure we provide to a service that is highly available for our cloud-based customers.

Auth0 is looking for Production Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. A Production Engineer is part of a crew (or crews) and is responsible for making sure the crew's services/components work reliably.

If you are a developer or a systems engineer with deep knowledge of domains (be it networking, linux kernel, systems scaling, algorithm optimization, etc) and aim to code yourself out of a job by continually automating, then we would like to meet with you.

Responsibilities
  • Setup monitoring, build dashboards and configure alerts for the services they are responsible for
  • Participates and/or directs Incident Management activities associated with crew's services/components
  • Maintain the CI (Continuous Integration) and CD (Continuous Delivery) pipeline for the a set of services they own
  • Implement automated responses to alerts to solve detected issues without need for manual intervention
  • Troubleshoot issues in production that are causing network failures, high latency for a certain operation, etc.

Requirements
  • In-depth knowledge of Linux internals
  • Programming and debugging expertise (node.js is the primary production language)
  • Salt experience (preferred, but not required if familiar with a complimentary tool)
  • Python scripting expertise (our preferred language for scripts)
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

To apply: jobs+prodengwwr@auth0.com

jobs.title: UX Developer
jobs.content:
At Auth0 we believe that for a product to be truly great it must not only function well but also be easy to use and look beautiful. This philosophy extends into everything we do from our management portal to our documentation. We are looking for somebody who can help us continue to deliver beautiful products.

The UX Developer role will be a member the engineering team that builds our documentation site, the Support Center as well as several upcoming projects. You will be completely responsible for the UX of these sites and will work closely with the Auth0 Design team to align with our company patterns and styles.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Crafting Great Customer Experiences - You will design and implement (CSS/HTML) interfaces for some of our most important customer interaction points. The tasks will be diverse, but the goal will be the same - creating the best possible experience for the customer. You will work on everything designing better docs pages to creating entirely new experiences to help customers be effective with our product.
  • Collaborate with Core Design Team - Auth0 has a group of top notch designers. You will be a key member of that group. You will work closely with the teamâs responsible for the overall look and feel of Auth0 to ensure everything you create meets our very high standards. An example of this collaboration could be working to add new components to our styleguide or presenting your mockups to the senior UX team for review.
  • Drive the Quality of Our Teamâs Products - You will be responsible for the UX across our entire team's deliverables, but this doesn't mean you will do everything yourself. You will serve as a resource and guide for the engineers on the team to help them deliver great experiences.

Attributes we care about:
  • Detail Oriented - This is probably the most important aspect of this role. You need to care about every detail. Is that div 2 pixels off? Are the fonts spaced perfectly? Every detail matters. We believe that every mistake and every missed opportunity for improvement is an chance we lost to make a customer happy. I cannot stress this enough, if you are not a details person this is not the right role for you.
  • Motivated - You are excited to ship great products. It doesnât matter if you are building something that is used by thousands of customers or one person - you should care about doing the job right.
  • Completionist - You get things done. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.

Skills:
  • Expert level knowledge of CSS. You can make any design happen.
  • Experience working across teams to drive results. You will be working on an engineering team that collaborates with many parts of the company, you need to be able to handle ambiguity while still making things happen.
  • You are just as comfortable in an IDE as you are in Sketch/Photoshop/Illustrator (or whatever design tool you use). You are a designer and a developer.

What to Send:
  • Write a cover letter. If you donât, we probably wonât review your application.
  • Include links to your portfolio or work you have done.

To apply: Apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/c518c157-35ca-4f6b-88f1-ff49f1b3f03c/apply

jobs.title: Node + React Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you have a passion for building great user experiences? Do you like using the latest and greatest tools to ship and iterate quickly. We are looking for engineers to help us expand our customer success infrastructure team. This team builds a variety of different projects such as the software that runs our documentation site (https://auth0.com/docs) and the Auth0 support center (https://support.auth0.com).
We are looking for somebody who can help us continually improve these apps by adding new and innovative experiences that will help customers learn and use Auth0. We develop our projects using node.js, hapi, express, react, fluxible, and redux. We are Javascript heavy team and building quality features quickly is what drives us.
This role will offer you a lot of freedom. We like engineers who can come up with innovative and creative solutions to problems. This might mean anything from improving the performance or maintainability of some code or to tweaking some UI to give the customer a better experience.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Building Great Customer Experiences - Everything our team builds is used every day by Auth0 customers. You will be responsible for shipping enhancements to our documentation site. This could be simple things like implementing a redesign of a page or changing some navigation or something more complicated like building an interactive tutorial experience (this is something we want to do).
  • Support Content Contributors - As our team grows we are publishing more and more content. Making improvements to the content publishing process can have a direct impact on our customer's experience. You will work to give our writers and contributors more and better tools to help them create better content. This might mean adding new UI components (via a markdown extension) or writing tests to catch mistakes before they go public.
  • Make Data Driven Improvements - At Auth0 we like to measure everything. You should have a mind for instrumenting code and measuring outcomes. This means testing different UI to see which leads to more desired outcomes and making frequent improvements based on the data. We are always striving to be better and you will drive that in your apps.

Attributes we care about:
  • Motivated - You are excited to build new software. It doesnât matter if it is front-end, backend, tests, or even maybe a build script. You get it done and you do your job well. You like learning new skills and applying your existing skills to make things happen.
  • Completionist - You ship code. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.
  • Detail Oriented - Details matter at Auth0. You will be writing code and building experiences that our customers use every day. You should care about making sure a job is done right and done well.

Technical Skills:
  • Experience with Node.js (hapi/express)
  • Experience building complex web applications - we use React for many projects right now, you donât necessarily have to know React, but you should understand the web and have experience with some framework like Angular, etc.
  • UX skills - we don't expect you to be an expert designer (we have those), but you should be able to use our styleguide (https://styleguide.auth0.com) and create something that looks great. You need to be able to use CSS effectively to implement a nice experience.

To apply: Apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/28144879-ee27-41bc-ae30-fd3cba1f309a/applyInclude a cover letter (enter it in the textbox) to get noticed. Explain why you want to work at Auth0 and what makes you right for this job.

jobs.title: Front-end Web Developer
jobs.content:
Position Overview

Crossfield Digital, a FanVision Entertainment Company, and part of the RSE Ventures family of companies, is a fast-growing digital agency based in the Flat Iron area of New York City that designs and develops amazing digital products for the sports and entertainment industry. We’re seeking an experienced front-end web developer to become the newest member of our team. Crossfield Digital has experienced explosive growth since it made a strategic pivot from a mobile gaming studio called PrePlay to full-service digital agency over the course of the past 10 months and this position has been created to support the dramatic increase in business.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3-5 years experience developing high quality responsive websites using the following technologies:

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Javascript

Preferred Qualifications

  • React experience
  • Experience developing multiple projects in an agency setting
  • Passion for sports
  • Computer Science degree
  • Design background
  • Demonstrated contributions to the open source community
  • Any experience using back end technologies

We’re Developer Friendly

We pride ourselves on using innovative technology to solve interesting and complex problems. We’ve built a team of high-throughput, independent developers, each capable of owning a project on his or her own. You’ll have the unique opportunity to play a significant role in further crafting our dev culture for the long term.

Do you love working at night? No problem. At home? In a cafe? Be our guest. Though we’re based in NYC and are open to you working out of our corporate headquarters, Crossfield also supports remote work.

This level of autonomy isn’t just for anyone. We are looking for a progressive developer, for whom being responsible is a life’s principle. You must be motivated enough to never get stuck with an unanswered question. You’d have to be able to discuss things asynchronously, push forward in developing complex features, apply common sense as needed, keep your work visible (via tickets, commits, etc), and be open to friendly code-related discussions (you are not your code). It would be your responsibility to see the bigger picture and take care of meeting reasonable deadlines that we all try to set for ourselves.

jobs.title: Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
In the past year our operations team has built the infrastructure needed to operate a secure, high availability, high volume certificate authority. There are high standards for the work that we do and the world is watching.

A candidate for sysadmin at Letâs Encrypt should have a solid background in 24/7 production operations and have experience with all the components of a modern datacenter environment. You should have experience with security and stability monitoring, virtualization, firewalls, configuration management, database management, rapid provisioning and systemd.

Collaborating effectively with ISRG developers and the community is critical. Youâll be working with both fellow employees and our open-source community. ISRG staff live in various places in the U.S. and Canada, and we do the vast majority of our collaboration online.

__Key Qualifications:__

* Experience working with highly-available, internet-facing sites
* Solid understanding of PKI
* Configuration management experience (SaltStack, Ansible, Puppet, Chef)
* Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with development team
* Hardware SAN experience
* Scripting and coding experience
* Networking management experience (firewalls and switches)
* Experience implementing monitoring, security, and logging systems
* Database troubleshooting and HA maintenance experience
* Ability to use and manage security tools such as FIM, IDM, SIEM, vulnerability scanner
* Experience in regulated and high-security environments
* Hardware Security Module (HSM) experience is a plus

jobs.title: Design Lead
jobs.content:
This is a unique role at Duarte because it takes a blend of skills to fill. This role requires the ability to be able to oversee the work of others to ensure high-quality output, be able to do incredible work within a client’s brand and work directly with clients when required to do so. The ability to balance creative project ownership with the leadership skills required to guide a team production resources is a rare skill and if you have it, we want you!. You’ll be joining an agency that has been dedicated to being the leader of the presentation space for 25 years, helping speakers and executive teams from industries as diverse as tech, consumer goods, entertainment, media, and financial services. We dissect complex stories, digest technical information and make effective and compelling visuals for audiences around the world to see. This position requires someone who thrives on efficiency and who loves all presentations; whether they are everyday presentation or the main stage. Attention to detail is a must, as you’ll be called upon as a brand advocate, following brand standards ensuring consistency and quality, while focusing on speed and being resilient when faced with high volume

You’d be a great candidate if you hit many of these traits below:

  • Strong communicator who can hand projects off to other internal and contracted designers.
  • Highly skilled in PowerPoint and/or Keynote
  • Your design portfolio reflects strong design and thinking skills
  • Visual problem solver—you dissect complex information to simplify and abstract it for easier audience digestion and are able to visualize key concepts
  • Able to look at projects holistically and delegate, valuing and utilizing the strengths of the team
  • Strong communicator: leading client meetings, listening and understanding stakeholder needs to make the project successful
  • Asks questions until the next steps are absolutely clear in their mind’s eye
  • Process thinker—addresses design challenges and can clearly articulate a step-by-step approach for coming up with a solution to team members
  • You love finding ways to complete projects efficiently and live for efficiency by thinking of more effective ways to solve problems
  • You are proactive and seek solutions to challenges without waiting or asking for permission first
  • Independently motivated and able to make well thought out autonomous creative decisions that best serve client needs
  • Nimble and adept at shifting gears, balancing projects and juggling priorities in a fast-paced environmentMaintains a positive outlook, even when faced with design obstacles and constraints. Always keeps client objectives in mind.
  • Able to grasp many brands, recognizing situations where creative can be pushed and when to strictly uphold standards
  • Confident as the creative lead on projects and consider teaching/mentoring personal strengths
  • You never hesitate to jump in to get a project done to make a client happy
  • Well-versed in Illustrator and Photoshop and uses a streamlined workflow between presentation and Creative Suite apps
  • You have a strong sense of personal accountability and work with others to do right, with transparency and honest intent
  • Professional, diplomatic and approachable by teammates
  • View design as communication rather than fine art, understanding the importance of budgets and timelines
  • Are innately curious and continuously striving to add to your tool belt
  • 4-6 years professional experience

jobs.title: Open Source Community Representative
jobs.content:
Code Climate is the world's largest static analysis platform, helping over 50,000 developers improve the health of their codebases. We work hard to provide clear, timely, and actionable insights derived from source code. Our customers include Fortune 500s, public and private companies, large and small, with a range of technical sophistication and exposure to static analysis.

Code Climate is, and always will be, free for open source. We currently support over 80,000 open source projects with tools and analysis that make it easier to both maintain and contribute.

As an Open Source Community Representative you’ll be part of our Community team, helping open source maintainers and contributors create healthy, sustainable, projects that benefit our entire industry.

We're looking for someone who is invested in the success of our open source partners, and demonstrates our values well by putting customers first and executing rigorously. We welcome diverse applicants with a love of technology.

Examples of problems you'll be solving:

  • Becoming an active and positive collaborator in a project’s mission to improve their contribution process by learning about their unique goals, successes and challenges.
  • Finding new and creative ways to rapidly increase the use of Code Climate among open source projects.
  • Educating community members about the best way to use Code Climate in their project.

  • Concierge onboarding – including tool selection and configuration, style guide specification, and more – for projects with large numbers of contributors to ensure smooth integration of Code Climate into their process.

  • Educating open source community members about the best way to use Code Climate in their project to ensure their continued success.

You're awesome because...

  • You empathize with issues faced by open source projects and are compelled to solve them.
  • You communicate clearly, concisely and honestly. People trust you.
  • You’re able to work quickly, reliably, and independently.
  • You continually advocate internally on behalf of the open source community, and can keep track of the problems that the biggest projects face.
  • You're never afraid to strike up a conversation with someone new, online or in person.
  • You’re comfortable having discussions with the maintainers of open source projects
  • You're technologically curious and always learning.

Working at Code Climate

  • Join a small team of around fifteen full-time people who love what they do.
  • Competitive compensation and meaningful stock options.
  • Flexible and generous paid time off including an open vacation policy and maternity/paternity leave.
  • Health, dental and vision insurance. We cover 100% of employee and 50% of dependent EPO premiums, as well as a portion of PPO premiums for employees and dependents. Dental and vision premiums are covered at 100% for employees and 50% for dependents.
  • Company retreats twice a year. So far we've gone to Bali and San Diego.
  • Opportunities to continue your professional development, including attending tech conferences.
  • Dog-friendly office stocked with snacks, drinks and cold-brew iced coffee.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer GEO
jobs.content:
Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow our Infrastructure team, this time with a focus in services that support all things geo.


The Infrastructure Team


We're software developers that love deployment. We are the first users of Elastic's products. We contribute all over engineering, touching many different projects, to build infrastructure with minimal red tape. We continuously integrate.  We build large clusters of Elasticsearch. We build dashboards and monitoring. We build distributed system tests. Not only do we use our products, we deploy them multiple ways with different versions running side-by-side. We try out new technology to use what we like and better our own products. We push configuration management to its limits. We mimic what users do, hoping to hit problems before they do.


We also support systems that our community, internal and external, relies on, like our Download Service, Benchmark Service, and our extensive distributed build farm.  Most recently we've deployed our Elastic Tile Service.  This position would have the opportunity to improve and expand on that service.


What would I do?



  • Design and develop infrastructure supporting the Elastic Tile Service and other geo-focused business goals, tying together requirements from our various product teams, and training fellow team members to help support.

  • Join in the normal operation of the Infra team's daily tasks: supporting users and building tools

jobs.title: Customer Support Champion
jobs.content:
You probably havenât run into a company like Olark before.

We are 42 people distributed around the globe working together to fundamentally change the way people communicate with businesses. We care deeply about customer service which is reflected in our All Hands Support model. Our passion and dedication for our over 10,000 customers is a direct result of our people centric org model.

Are you fanatical about providing great customer support and have meticulous attention to detail? We are looking for a new member to join our support team!

You will play a pivotal role in helping define our customer support culture by contributing to our positive organization and fulfilling our company goals to provide the best possible experience to our customers. We do this by building user-facing web applications and infrastructure to help thousands of people build stronger connections with their customers via real-time web chat.

*Please note this position is based within the United States or Canada.*

Your primary responsibilities will be:
  • Frontline support: interacting with existing and potential customers, primarily via Olark chat and email, and occasionally over the phone, Skype or social media.
  • This position is a full-time role and the typical hours will be weekdays Monday-Friday between 7am-4pm PST.

What we expect of you:
  • 1-3 years of public facing customer support experience. Aptitude to learn technologies and tools like chat, email and CRM software.
  • Ideally, you are located in the Mountain or Pacific time zones. This is preferred in order to provide our customers with adequate support across all regions.
  • Excellent written and spoken English-language proficiency; proficiency in other languages is icing on the cake!
  • You need to LOVE chatting with people and solving problems.
  • You have mad skills at communicating technical issues to both engineers and to new users of all skill levels.
  • You have demonstrated experience providing amazing customer service and making people happy.
  • Experience with, or willingness to try, working remotely.

You can expect a lot from us:
First off, make sure to read about our team culture at olark.com/jobs, and our values at olark.com/values. You can also get a sense of our history at olark.com/10000. Beyond what you see there, as a member of our support team you can expect:
  • A great remote culture and team: Even though weâre geographically dispersed, our team makes the effort to connect to one another and we provide in person opportunities to further enhance that bond. We genuinely like each other.  
  • A life outside of work: Olarkers generally work 40 hour weeks. Work is a marathon, not a sprint. We are building a company for the long haul.
  • We value your time to do focused work: We have one weekly required customer support meeting and a team wide sync. We appreciate and take advantage of the time we have to get in sync, but we also deeply value and respect our time to think and do focused work.

Olark is committed to diversity in its workforce. Olark is an equal employment opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, veteran or disability status.

To apply: Please apply at https://olark.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06lvw

jobs.title: .Net Developer
jobs.content: Ideal candidates will have a proven track record of successfully delivering software solutions utilizing the ASP.Net platform. Nearly all work will involve creating new functionality and candidates hired for this position will be full time coders. As a leader in emergency response software development, our senior team members will need excellent written and oral communication skills to be able to communicate with clients and mentor younger developers, while junior developer will be able to learn the latest technologies from experienced developers in a fast paced collaborative office.  Our agile environment insures our projects are well managed, on time, and on budget.

jobs.title: Web Developer (One Year Position)
jobs.content: A full-time temporary position is available in the Digital Media department for a full stack web developer. The Digital Media department is responsible for creative direction, content strategy, implem...

jobs.title: Product Engineer (Python + JS)
jobs.content: We're looking for a talented engineer to join us in building a communications product for salespeople, recruiters, and marketers. We have a stable and growing base of customers. We're unlocking some real opportunity with this, and we need help. We make it possible for companies to build websites  (using a sitebuilder)  that serve as resources in their conversations with people -- "Squarespace for business teams".  The technology tools we use to build our site include AWS, Python (Pyramids, Celery), Backbone.js, React.js, LESS, and others. For collaboration and workflow we use Vagrant, Gulp, CircleCI, Slack, Email, Asana, and other tools as needed. You would be our 3rd engineer, so you would have a big effect on both the engineering culture and the product we make. Thanks!

jobs.title: Director, Demand Generation
jobs.content:
Director, Demand Generation

The Director of Demand Generation owns and manages the three components of our acquisition program - data, automation systems and processes, and metrics reporting. This person is responsible for leading the creation, optimization, and execution of Axial’s member acquisition strategy through all relevant channels - both for paying and free members. Culture and fit are also very important for success at Axial - the ideal candidate has proven growth / acquisition chops, is culturally very well-aligned to how we work at Axial, and can become passionate about our mission and vision.  

The Director of Demand Generation will have to get to know all our member types - to leverage available messaging, outline needed assets and build compelling campaigns - in the service of building the network and generating revenue.

Success Metrics: Leads across all member types, monthly and quarterly growth goals (revenue, member growth, self-signups, etc.), achieving outlined targets within budget, and positive, qualitative feedback on personal work products and cross-team leadership.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect, develop and optimize a member acquisition engine that drives growth in our target markets. In partnership with all relevant go-to-market organizations, ensure the measures funnel effectiveness and predictability
  • Build, own, and clean Axial’s expanding database
  • Apply deep understanding of the Company’s buyer personas and influencers through outlining and distributing needed persona-based content
  • Define and monitor the role of automation and enablement in the full sales cycle, along with Sales Marketing and Operations
  • Define and execute targeted and measurable campaigns, tradeshows and other lead generation and nurturing programs that build pipeline, driving MQLs to the SDR team. Experiment, measure, and determine an optimal mix of inbound and outbound programs
  • Build the processes to adapt and syndicate the demand generation strategy across all target markets; in close collaboration with sales and marketing teams, define the impact of demand creation activities on sales pipeline, revenue and sales cycle length
  • Own and optimize the end-to-end lead management process in conjunction with Sales Operations; institute a discipline for lead nurturing, lead scoring and lead development.
  • Set strategy to allocate budgets, determine the tactical mix, design calls to action, and define/refine individual program goals. Manage Axial.net conversion along with Sales Marketing
  • Deploy, own and drive adoption of maximal utility of the chosen marketing automation system
  • Build relationships across the organization to identify initiatives, share results, and be a role model for excellence in execution and commitment to our values and culture

Minimum qualifications:

  • Technology marketing experience
    • 7+ years of technology demand marketing/lead generation experience
    • Analytically inclined, understanding what data means and how to apply it to identify opportunities and solve problems
    • Experience creating, implementing, and measuring proven successful seeding, demand creation, lead nurturing and pipeline acceleration programs
    • Intuitive understanding of traffic drivers. Solid understanding of SEO, social media strategies, and communication delivery practices to drive awareness and engagement. Experience testing strategies to enhance the demand creation process, including response and conversion rates and multivariate testing
    • Resourcefulness to leverage tools and partners to enhance marketing strategies. Proficiency with marketing and sales automation, web content management, web analytics and reporting
    • Working knowledge of SEM, SEO and PPC
  • Customer focus
    • Interest in or experience in financial technology and / or corporate finance
    • High attention to detail and focus on quality output
  • Management and leadership
    • Commitment to achieving impeccable and persuasive communication both internally and externally
    • Cross-functional management ability, including proven experience interfacing effectively with go-to-market teams, revenue operations, product marketing, and content creation teams
    • Process-oriented; adept in creating and implementing process in an agile organization
    • Experience developing and overseeing junior team members
    • Experience managing and consistently communicating around marketing budgets, project P&Ls, and campaign analyses

jobs.title: Software Engineer, API
jobs.content:
At TubeMogul, our people are our greatest asset and we are all driven by a core set of values. We are builders, dreamers, thinkers, designers, and doers. We work hard, we work together and we work towards a common goal. Of course, we also have fun.

We build software - sophisticated, powerful, game-changing software - and we are leading the charge in one of the hottest sectors around: ad technology. Specifically, we build software for brand advertising. Our software is used around the world by the largest brands and agencies to plan, buy, measure and optimize their video ad campaigns from a single dashboard.

We are seeking a Software Engineer to help build out TubeMogul's next generation of microservices. The role will require hands-on experience across the stack- from MySQL query optimization to microservices logic.

Candidates will be familiar with the technologies we are using but may have not necessarily had the ability to work on them in their current job setting.  That's generally OK.  However, you should have true passion for technology that is apparent through your previous work experience.  Further, the best candidates are excellent team players, as one of the benefits of working at TubeMogul is coming to work with people you can rely on. 

Responsibilities: 

  • Collaborate closely with product managers and application developers
  • Ship new features and bug fixes every week
  • Optimize microservice's performance and responsiveness
  • Pro-actively look to retain TubeMogul’s edge as a world-class product

Requirements:

  • 2+ years of hands on Java programming experience 
  • Familiarity with RDBMS and writing MySQL queries
  • Experience working with UNIX/LINUX
  • Knowledge of object oriented paradigms
  • Familiarity with HTTP testing to simulate device user agents

Compensation and Benefits:

You'll appreciate a competitive compensation package and excellent benefits. You'll love a challenging work environment, exceptional colleagues, strong business momentum, clear objectives and the ability to make a difference. 

About TubeMogul:

TubeMogul is the global leader in software used by brands and agencies to plan, buy and measure their brand advertising. By reducing complexity, improving transparency and leveraging real-time data, our platform enables marketers to gain greater control of their video advertising spend.

TubeMogul is founder-led and we strive to hire people who have a high “Do:Say” ratio - these are the people that excel at TubeMogul. We were recently ranked as the #5 Best Place to Work in the Small/Mid-Sized category by Glassdoor and our core value of ‘Getting Stuff Done’ defines our hard-charging culture where accountability is valued above all else.

TubeMogul was founded in 2007 and is a public company listed on the NASDAQ Stock Exchange under the symbol “TUBE”. We are based in Emeryville, California with offices in New York, London, Singapore, Tokyo, Sydney, Toronto and across the United States.

How to Apply:

Please submit a cover letter with your resume explaining why you are an ideal candidate for this role. Please use the link provided to apply. This opportunity is full-time only.  No contractors, consultancies or recruiters will be considered.

jobs.title: Human Resources Intern
jobs.content:
Do you want to spend your summer in San Francisco at a hot mobile gaming company? This summer you have the chance to be part of Kabam's Internship Program! As an intern at Kabam, you will be matched up with an experienced mentor. You’ll work in a collaborative, open environment and get meaningful work. Learn more about our Intern Program by visiting our website http://careers.kabam.com/university/.

About the team
The HR team in San Francisco provides corporate shared services support to the organization through its Talent Acquisition, Talent Management, Compensation & Benefits, and HRIS teams. They also support the organization through strategic business partnering and employee relation management. The team functions in a fast-paced environment where change is constant and ambiguity and nuance reign. Collaborative autonomy and creativity are critical components to success.

During your internship expect to:

  • Communicate and execute key administrative tasks including processing new hires, terminations, compliance audits, and record maintenance
  • Use key HR software like Workday and Jobvite to effectively support employees
  • Provide data entry support and audit system information
  • Prepare Word, Excel, and PowerPoint documents; and proofread HR documents including policies, training presentations, and external and internal communication
  • Provide assistance to employees and deliver quality solutions, if able, or escalate the request to a more senior team member
  • Work proactively and openly share new ideas and information with other team members
  • Prioritize activities for the best interest of the team when working on joint projects
  • Support the recruitment process from job posting to onboarding
  • May be responsible for making meeting and travel arrangements

Requirements:

  • College junior or senior, graduating December 2016 – June 2019
  • At least one year working in an office environment experience preferred
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive data and information
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Open to learning in a team environment and willing to take on responsibility for your own projects
  • Superior organizational skills; results-focus with superb execution and follow-through; highly detail-oriented
  • Efficient, highly productive multi-tasker; self-motivated and flexible

How have past interns impacted Kabam?

  • Delivered the values and organizational chart to new hires during orientation
  • Created and executed an intern professional development workshop on personal branding
  • First point of contact with candidates; responsible for scheduling interviews and greeting them during onsite interviews
  • Designed a global survey to evaluate new hire onboarding experiences
  • Learned the back-end of the University Program through meetings with business leads, planning internship related events, and updating intern job descriptions

Career Progression
Interns who excel have the opportunity to continue working part-time during their senior year and/or receive a full-time offer to join Kabam after graduation.

Benefits:

  • Competitive paid internship
  • Daily catered lunches and dinners
  • Free snacks and beverages
  • Commuter, 401k, and medical insurance
  • Educational speaker sessions with industry leaders
  • Network within the company
  • Be apart of a fun group of interns!
  • Team building and social events: welcome event, scavenger hunt, and baseball game

Relocation not provided
Interns must be able to work in our San Francisco office. The intern is responsible for own relocation and housing.

Timeline
Applications Accepted:             September 2016 – November 2016
Interviews:                                 November 2016 – January 2017
Offers:                                       January 2017 – March 2017
Internship Program:                  On or around June 1, 2017 – August 25, 2017


About Kabam:
Kabam, Inc. (“Kabam”) creates, develops, and publishes massively multiplayer games that are available to a global audience on mobile devices via its own dedicated channel in the Apple App Store, Google Play, and the Amazon Appstore. The company is valued at more than $1 billion and has been profitable since 2012. Kabam has created six titles that have grossed more than $100 million each in their life. Kabam has more than 700 employees around the world, with corporate headquarters in San Francisco. The company's investors include Alibaba, Canaan Partners, Google, MGM, Intel, Pinnacle Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Warner Bros. and others. More information about Kabam can be found at www.kabam.com. 

USA ONLY:
Kabam is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer
**Successful applicants will be asked to show proof that they can legally work in the U.S.**

jobs.title: Senior Search Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:

  • As a Senior Search Platform Engineer, you will be responsible for building the innovative search platform used to power Shutterstock’s best-in-class image and video search engine.
  • You will provide technical mentorship to other members of the team, and leverage your experiences to vocalize best practices and ensure proper sustainable engineering standards are followed.
  • You will strive to continually improve and simplify the search infrastructure, and will apply your love of tackling challenging problems to innovate on core search areas such as indexing, query execution, metrics tracking, maintaining 5 9s of uptime, and scaling for the future.
  • You will design and code massively scalable services to provide a continually improving search experience, and your work will be seen by millions of customers daily.

Requirements:

  • Passionate about writing and maintaining high-quality software that solves real-world meaningful problems at scale.
  • Passionate about helping your teammates grow, and continually expanding the team’s tech knowledge
  • Experience writing large scalable applications
  • Experience deep diving and solving complex issues in a distributed system.
  • Enjoy optimizing system performance of a large distributed system.
  • Able to shepherd projects from prototype stage into production
  • Fluent in a few programming languages, dynamic and static
  • Experience with JVM languages like Java or Scala
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of development experience
  • 2+ years of experience as a technical lead

Bonus skills:

  • Experience with Hadoop, Pig, HBase, Hive or related technologies a plus
  • Experience with Solr/ElasticSearch and Lucene a plus.
